hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I stayed at the corner room with king size bed in the past (twice). This time around, I got a room half the size. When I called the reception, I was told only certain floors are available. They don't open the floors where nurses stay at during COVID19.It makes no sense to me that I paid a few hundred bucks to stay at smaller room with no other options. I am grateful that the city is offering free hotels for healthcare professionals especially since I am a healthcare provider myself in NYC, but I regret choosing to pay to stay at this hotel. Do not book for another month or two (FYI, my room is bigger than the hotel room).

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed here as my husband was attending a working group at The UN.The proximity is fabulous. Right across the road from The UN. We stayed in a King Corner suite with sensational views in one corner to The Chrysler and Empire State buildings and the other to the East River. I never tired of the view!Beds VERY comfortable and great amenities in the room, including a desk.6 minute walk to closest subway entrance (Grand Central and 42nd street). Cross town Buses less than 50m away.Unfortunately we arrived the day before Memorial Day and we had to wait almost 2 hours for our room to be ready. After a long flight it was very tough to stay awake! Only staff we really remembered was Robert, the front door man. The rest very polite and would always greet you when passing.Great security with beautiful K9 puppies and handlers who checked all luggage (due to proximity to UN)We didn’t get breakfast at the hotel due to the exorbitant charge but visited John’s cafe (about 100 metres away) daily.We’d certainly stay again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Lovely hotel in midtown NYC, nicely fitted out room with a beautiful view of the Hudson river and NYC. I received perfect hospitality during my stay here. The price was fair not too expensive given the great location. I would definately recommed staying here if you're on a business trip or a couple.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel is in an excellent location for walking to most attractions in a quieter part of town by the UN building well equipped gym and even an indoor tennis court.This is our 2nd stay.The breakfast has an excellent choice of hot and cold selection cooked fresh from the grill this isn’t worth having and sets you up for the day.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stay there for 7 Nights for vacation & Birthday at NYC. Although the challenging time due to the corona virus situation the team do all he can for give us a good stay!We must mention Patrick Goad for his affords to give us a memorable stay! Actually this was my third visit this year and each time I enjoyed my stay but this time was a real "stay to remember" Patrick do all he can for us and all the others, in front desk and restaurant during breakfast give us a perfect feeling - we absolutely will be back!! also we should mention very good hot breakfast large rooms and nice Jim.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Terrific experience at the Millennum HiltonThe location is so convenient, the staff are terrific and UNIONIZed so I could feel good about being there (knowing the staff were paid reasonably well). and the service was great.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Location close to work. Staff were very attentive and made the stay awesome. Executive lounge had a nice view of the city and staff in there takes good care of visitors. Rooms were clean, and large for NYC. Front desk staff and bell staff were pleasant and helpful. Restaurant Ambassador Grill was good food and good value. Staff were great.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This was our first time in NY. We were given a room on the 33rd floor with a view you would never forget. The room cleaners were friendly and helpful as were the conceirge. The security with the dog are friendly and the dog is adorable. Some people may not like being checked before entering but this wasnt a problem for us as it made us feel more safe. This is less than 10 mins walk to Times Square/grand central so good location without all the noise! We would stay here again.
user_name:
loughmyster
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Hotel is situated just a 5-10 minute walk from Grand Central station so good location. After a day walking round NY however still seems quite a way!! The rooms are nice and well equipped with great views over the river however the actual beds are tiny! We had a room for 3 people which was meant to have 2 king size beds in but in reality they weren't even standard doubles! We did ask to change rooms but no luck there and they were a little rude at the time as well! The porter staff however were helpful and friendly at all times. Do not have a drink in the bar unless you have won the lottery!! 1 gin and tonic was 20 dollars!!! We didn't have breakfast at hotel but there were some great cafes just at top of street, also a good supermarket a couple of blocks away that sold everything you could need.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed here several times. Dated executive lounge but with extremely friendly and serviceminded staff. Functional and clean hotel rooms. Front desk staff overall on the verge of being rude or not serviceminded. When visiting in February the executive lounge was shut down after 2pm daily due to "repairs" but no signs of that when visiting it. Also no prior info that it would have limited business hours. This hotel needs to work on its business behaviour.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The station is right in front of hotel. So convenient to get subway to anywhere. Bathroom is old and need rennovation or maintain better. Got a junior suite with pull-out sofa but sofa has broken spring. Carpet is old and smell.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: It was a great stay. The hotel is in a great location and good staff overall. If you are a diamond member you are treat great. The only issue I had was the late checkout I did a triple check but still it was an issue. Always verify with the staff and make sure the notes are in the system. It was a headache especially on the last day. This would have been a 5 star rating otherwise. But I would recommend and will come back if in the NYC area.
user_name:
dloback
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Next door to the United Nations is a wonderful Hilton Hotel waiting to treat you with Diplomat level service. My room had a great view of the East River and I could walk next door to the United Nations. The room was spacious and beautifully decorated with a lounge sofa and King Sized bed. The front desk and bell service was top notch and I just loved being in my room after a hard days work. Superb!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: First the good; hotel is well located, great views (we had a city facing room in the West tower), very limited street noise, beds are comfortable and the rooms are a very decent size for NYC. Renovated bathrooms stocked with tons of towels and toiletries. Staff we encountered were all very helpful and friendly, especially the sniffer dog. Club floor breakfast is quite good for a 4 star Hilton; pastries, yogurts, cold boiled eggs, toast and bagels with peanut butter and cream cheese, jams, juices and cereals, hot tea and coffee that your could take to go. Really nice fruit! Strawberries, pineapple, blueberries, melon.Now the bad; the walls are paper thin! We could verbatim hear our neighbours conversations, tv and snoring through the walls.Would stay hear again in a heartbeat but for that one rather significant negative. Even the blackout curtain sheets were good, if only they had better insulation!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: What a fabulous hotel. I booked this hotel for my Wife's 50th & Daughters 18th Birthday treat. I emailed the hotel and asked if they could get a nice room with a view and what a response. Patrick the Reservations Manager picked out his favourite room with a view and he nailed it. Amazing views of the Manhattan skyline and even better at night. The hotel was immaculate and all the staff extra friendly. Hotel is central to all the main attractions and most within walking distance. i would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I dont usually do reviews on sites such as Tripadvisor unlessi am either massively impressed by something or really disappointed- in this case im afraid it was the latter.Due to no fault of the hotel we had a massive delay in JFK airport (i think it was Presidents day when we arrived so very slow!) but when we got out we were so tired and really looking forward to getting to the hotel, having a nice shower and hitting the road to see what NY had to offer.On arrival at the hotel, things didnt seem to bad. There was no porter, which you would expect at a large hotel but there was a nice security guard who welcomed us with his dog. No front of house staff, so myself and our wife has no interaction with anyone other then the security guard. I wish this continued.....We went to reception to check in like 2 excited kids (first time in NY) and greeted the reception staff how we would have been expected to be greeted- the response was a lift of a head (from her phone) and a short, not warm- “checking in”. We let that pass, however not a good impression.Me and my wife are celebrating our 5th wedding anniversary- so as you cheekily do, requested a new view, maybe an upgrade if possible- the response was “your room is allocated, and i can do anything about this”- which completely contradicts the other reviews from guests who have? Anyway, again let this slide.We went down a dark dingy corridor behind reception and got in our lift to our room. We got to our room and it wasnt too bad, the view not great but nice and it seemed cleaned. How wrong were we? Pubic hair in the sink, really dirty cups in the room, no water (would have been a nice touch)- i could continue but i hope you all get my drift! At this point we thought dont worry, have a shower and crack on- the pressure in the shower is basically non existent- quiet possibly the worst shower we have ever used!!! Determined to not let this get in the way off us enjoying the rest off our holiday, we got ready and went to reception to see if they had any tips on the whats around, how to get around town etc. We avoided the extremely rude receptionist we spoke to initially (who was still on her phone) and went to speak the other one. Her response “Google it”- i mean for god sakes! Just appalling service.We are not 2 nights into a 4 night stay and honestly the staff have been nothing but rude, unfriendly and unhelpful. Note to management- if you want to represent your brand in the right way, employ individuals that have the same care for customers and experience as you advertise. The guys you have working here honestly dont!!Never will i return to this hotel and as someone who regularly uses the Hilton group i will be avoiding you going forwards.We are still staying in the hotel for another couple of nights so if anything does happen to change my opinion i will happily consider updating this review but as it stands- STAY AWAY! Actually considering checking in somewhere else if this gets worse and will be complaining to British Airways also (we booked a package deal through them!)- sometimes money just is not everything!Positive: bed is comfy but hotel needs an update in general!Awful awful experience from a very unhappy customers!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Doormen were friendly, front desk check in and check out was friendly great experience. Room is dated (looks like reno's happening though) but comfortable. Executive Lounge wasn't open during my stay but had great breakfast and drinks at the Ambassador Grill.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My boyfriend surprised me with a hotel night stay at this hotel.... was able to book a room in 2019, upgraded with our Hilton Rewards. The corner rooms are absolutely gorgeous with the complimentary robes. Came back for 2020 Valentine's day. This time stayed in the regular king room. Still absolutely gorgeous views and stunning accommodations. The room was very clean except for one critique, the air vents had some slight dust. There is no room service until after lunch time but there are so many many restaurants and bars within one block walking distance.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: 20 min walk to Times Square, gorgeous view of the river, clean room!Currently being renovated, so some minor stuff, but overall, it's a gorgeous hotel!The coffee shop in the lobby comes in handy in a pinch, and the restaurant is decent, as well!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Amazing experience! Love the views and I actually slept great in that Governor's Suite. More than enough space and the suite was quiet. October in New York is perfect and the weekend I was there offered the perfect Fall weather. Views from this place are amazing!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The Millenium Hilton at One UN Plaza is top tier. Staff was great and exhibited excellent hospitality throughout our weekend stay. Room service was fast and decent. Breakfast at the Ambassador restaurant was great. If you have business at the UN, this location can’t be beat. If you’re in New York for fun, you’d only be three blocks from Grand Central station and the chance to hook up with the tour buses. Northwest Corner rooms on high floors have commanding views of both midtown and the east river. So far, my favorite location in NYC.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: What an amazing hotel from arriving to leaving the staff were so attentive and friendly. There is a fantastic coffee shop on the premises with lovely fresh pastries and cakes. The room we had on the 40th floor was jaw dropping gorgeous with stunning views.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The service is good. The hotel itself seems outdated and definitely feels like needs a renovation. It’s in a good location if you don’t wanna be in the middle of the city. But it definitely needs some attention when it comes to upgrading the building. Feels old and crusty.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Brandon and his Manager Patrick were absolutely amazing and so generous! They both went above and beyond without hesitation and both have the most welcoming personalities. Writing reviews aren’t really my thing but they both definitely deserve the recognition! Thank you gentlemen so much for a smooth experience with the most amazing views!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Brandon & Patrick were nothing less then amazing !! Their customer service was impeccable and they are very welcoming, personable and informative. The cleanliness of the hotel is Outstanding as well!!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We had booked a room for 5 nights in October 2019. Because this was a special trip that I was goona to propose to my girlfriend, I asked for a room upgrade. My expectations were very low, as this is a rather expensive hotel and thought that they would not pay attention. But I was SO wrong!!! Patrick, the reservations manager replied to me the same day that he upgraded our room to a suit! In addition, a very nice of red wine was waiting for us. That made our stay so beautiful and we felt like royals :D The only negative I can say, is the breakfast which was nothing special and very expensive. But all in all, we will definitely visit Millenium Hilton again! They won our hearts.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: we stayed here 4 nights in February 2020 in a king size room. I have a gold status and stay regularly at Hilton/Conrad/Waldorf, etc. though, the service that I experiences is by far the worst that I have seen in the last couple of years. they simply dont care about your well being. nobody helps you with luggage when you arrive. then they check you in the wrong room, then you have to go back down and up in another one - obviously carrying your luggage. the 2nd day you find your room, not cleaned/tidied up and the only explanation you get from the manager is: we dont know why - the housekeeping said they had done it. then they want to make up for it with a free coffee downstairs and the next colleague attacks you that you cannot have the cappuccino but only the filter coffee, and the Cheese cake is a desert and not pastry so you have to pay extra - this 'make up' experience converts into another service frustration. on the day of our check-out (depite gold status late check out) - the house keeping lady knocks three times on our door to 'check' what time we d leave. at 10, 10.45 and 12h. (even though her colleagues granted us 13h check out). Another issue was the noise the hotel personal would do in the morning between 7-9AM when joking and running in the hallway. on the check out, they simply show you a copy of the bill that has been depited to your credit card without checking. It obviously charged us a breakfast that was initially complementary. and last but not least, the executive lounge is only open in the morning with a miserable breakfast buffet and broken instant coffee machine. the regular buffet in the restaurant is decent but the blue berries were moisy and I found some hairs in my omlette..... all these things are just not acceptable for a hilton in that category. To leave on a positive note, if you come to work for the UN/meet someone around the UN building, the location is perfect. Though, I ll certainly will stay at a different hotel during my next visit.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: A great place to stay for a visit to new York. Located in a peaceful and tranquil setting opposite the world trade centre and memorial gardens. Easy access to all attractions and places. Jump on the subway right out side the door central park about 15 minute ride. Walk to wall street and the financial centre of New York. Plenty to see and do.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Fantastic views of the city; Like I’m saying one of the best views of a hotel I’ve ever had. Skyline breakfast was fantastic. Staff are extremely friendly from start to finish; gorgeous property! Loved my visit.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Three night stay.Warm welcome and thanks for being a diamond member. Upgraded room on 37th floor.Explained about the exec lounge lounge only open to 2pm and handed $25 per day vouchers to use in the restaurant.Room was spotless and great views of Empire State and Chrysler Building.WiFi worked really well.Used the gym daily which is in the other tower and on 27th floor. Had all I needed and is spread across two sections on the floor with views of the UN and River.The exec lounge had a continental offering but the restaurant had all the usual fare. Was warmly greeted daily when there.Chef made omelette as requested and Nabil served fresh juice and coffee and made sure the glass was topped up.Thanks a lot to Ticia at reception who helped me print off my ticket to the Knicks game when having issues. She was brilliant every time I saw her on duty.Walking distance you can find supermarkets, pizza outlets and more with about a 15 min walk to 5th Avenue and little less to Grand Central. Had a meeting at UN and it’s literally to the left and across the road.Only reason why 5 star rating was the exec lounge although Mohammad and other staff were welcoming was the timings and when I arrived from the airport the colleague saw me coming into the revolving door - he walked through it and left it spinning - and wandered off. All in all a very good stay and some really good staff around and accommodation.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel was quiet and peaceful. Slept really well. Only complaint was that the vanity set was not replaced and the water was cold in the shower on 2 out of 3 days. Also the bed side clock was not working. However I would try it again

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel mixes the best of everything NY has to offer. It is just a few blocks away from Grand Central and is tucked away in midtown. It is a very quiet location, but you are close to everything. The rooms are a good size and the views are amazing!What really makes this hotel special, is the staff. If Frank or Robert are on duty as the bellmen or Diana, Dorca, Silvia, Avery are at the desk, you are in good hands. Also, make sure you visit the lobby cafe and have Jesus make you the best Latte you have ever experienced. This team makes sure you have a concierge experience no matter what room or how often you visit. I travel to NY for business frequently and will talk to Patrick, who oversees reservations, if there is not a room available. I was never a fan of the Hilton chain until I went to this hotel! Now I choose it over Westin, Marriott or any other hotel in NY when I visit, which is frequently!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I visited this hotel in January 2020 and in March 2019. My overall impression is that the hotel is very nice, however, they are very bad at communicating.On my last visit, I was given a different room to the one I had paid for. Originally I booked the 2 Story Loft Suite with King bed. I emailed the Diamond desk to request that I was allocated the exact room booked as it was a surprise for my partner. They forwarded my request to the hotel directly. After a few weeks with no reply, I then emailed the hotel directly to see if they can could confirm my request, again no reply.I hoped that if they didn't reply they would at least have actioned my request. Upon arriving at the hotel check-in desk very little was said and I assumed that I would be allocated the correct room, I couldn't ask if this was going to be the case as it would have ruined my partners surprise. Unfortunately, when getting to the room it wasn't as expected. There were two bedrooms and only one floor, the original room was supposed to be 1000 sq ft but the allocated room was 100 sq ft smaller with additional wasted space in the form of the second bedroom.After returning home I complained that the room wasn't what it should have been and I got the reply 'the hotel has contacted you directly'. They hadn't, I even included in my complaint that the hotel has never contacted me. Customer services went quiet once more, even after chasing multiple times.Finally, I raised the issue on Twitter where customer services were very quick to assist and informed me that the 'hotel is having renovations at the moment' and this is why I was not allocated the correct room. It would have been nice to inform me of this before we arrived or even at the front desk.From experience Hilton Hotels that are having renovations clearly state this on the hotel website, so I am unsure if this was true or if I have been fobbed off. I was given 30k points, but this really doesn't cover the fact that I wasn't allocated the room I booked and the Executive lounge was closed the entire stay after breakfast, supposedly for the same reason of being renovated. Though there were no signs of any work being done.I would consider another Hilton on my next return to New York.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The staff at this hotel make it great, in addition to the location. Rooms are well equipped, nicely furnished and comfortable. Views are beautiful over the East River. Being able to open the window, even a crack, was a treat for a welcome bit of fresh air.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We had the most memorable and amazing holiday made all the more special by the fabulous room/suite we had on the 31st floor which Patrick specifically chose for us. The room was wonderful and the views of the city and river were amazing. The room had everything we needed and was perfect place for us to relax and unwind after a busy day sightseeing. The location is perfect for exploring New York, so close to Grand Central Station and a Hop on Hop off Bus Stop outside hotel.Patrick arranged a bottle of wine and cakes on our arrival to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary and my 50th Birthday. The room was spotless and cleaned daily and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We would recommend this hotel to others looking to visit.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I’m a Hilton Diamond. I will never stay here again! Awful! Upon arrival, employee in my room. Scared me to death!No coffee or condiments and both coffee cups dirty. One cup had a tea bag in it. WiFi didn’t work. Executive Loung is a joke. Hotel loung is a black HOLE!Don’t stay here.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This is the 5th time I have stayed at the Millennium this past year. The staff goes out of their way to be helpful regardless of the position. The front desk are very accommodating, Igor in the executive lounge is friendly and helpful and Patrick is always available to assist (even on vacation). I always request a high room with a view as the view across the river to Brooklyn and Roosevelt Island are spectacular.It is my go to hotel in Manhattan, it should be yours as well.MHH

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Pro: Very attentive and engaging contact for the booking; attentive staff at the Executive Lounge; good breakfast quality (although slightly limited variety in comparison to other Hilton hotels); great views from both towers; large rooms; only 5 min. to Grand Central;Con: Limited insulation of the windows caused a pretty cool room if you want to sleep without A/C; staff attentiveness at the breakfast in the restaurant varied; omelette were only served in the basement restaurant without windows; a cappuccino was only served for free at the Executive Lounge which also provides a great view; ongoing refurbishment in the East tower;Major drawback: Neither during booking nor at the check-in nor with a sign at the elevators we were informed that the Executive Lounge was closed in the evenings, so we went down the East tower, crossed the lobby, went up the West tower only to realise that the Lounge was closed for "refurbishment". You could see that there were no maintenance works in the evening going on and as the Lounge was open some hours later for breakfast, the reason for the shut down was more likely to be missing staff or other things. In addition there was no compensation. In other Hilton hotels - in case there is no availability for an upgrade or something's going wrong - you get a voucher for the bar. If we were told before we'd have the option to book another Hilton hotel in NYC.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Hotel is just in the right location. Just walking distance to the office. Room is very clean and spacious. Hotel staff are very attentive, friendly and helpful. Breakfast is very sumptuous and the staff at the ambassador grill gave excellent service.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed at the Millennium Hilton over the weekend. Had an amazing experience. Hotel was very attractive and inviting. Rooms were beautiful and the staff were very helpful. Planning my next visit at this location.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I have stayed at the Millennium every month for the last six months. The location is perfect for me. The rooms are comfortable and many have great views of the East River and Brooklyn waterfront. The concierge staff is always friendly and helpful. The experience has been consistently good and I will continue to stay at the Millenium for work or leisure travel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I enjoyed the stay. Staff is super friendly. Request a high floor room w. City views if available. Only reason it’s not 5 stars is I felt the room could’ve been cleaner. It was NOT dirty but didn’t have a clean feel. Bed was comfy pillows felt like gelMemory foam. The bathroom was nice did have to wait for hot water to shower around 11pm. I would stay again.
user_name:
AriMommy
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Myself and my family stayed in the Millennium Hilton at One UN Plaza in December in the run up to Christmas. We hadn't stayed in the hotel previously however we enjoyed it so much we've already booked to stay again.From the staff to the rooms to the spectacular views the hotel is excellent and has a really good location, which although at first may seem out of the way, is actually really accessible. I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone looking for somewhere to stay and we are all looking forward to returning in December.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Our stay at Millennium hilton was superlative.We booked a corner room, n. 3140, 31 floor, we hoped to have a higher one but as we entered the room and we saw the view we were definetly shocked by that beauty. Go! Book it!Moreover, since we forgot some medicines in the fridge, We contacted the reception, and Liz called a taxi for bringing the medicines to the airport. A special thanks to Liz! Also, the rooms were perfectly clean, this is too important for us.Great service, confortable bed, strategic position, warm lights in the room, TV with Netflix, large room, can we add anythingelse? If you want to experience a great luxury vacation in NYC, this is the right place.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I first want to say this hotel is located in an amazing location. Blocks away from Grand Central and the Empire State Building. Amazing views of the City and River. The hotel room was clean and looked nice. However the overall hotel experience was lacking...Upon check in they way over authorized and charged my card. When my friend and I got up to the front desk, we told them we wanted to equally split Room and Tax (RT) between us and they ended up authorizing my card for the full amount of RT and also charging me for my half of RT as well. So almost all my funds I've saved up for my vacation got tied up into the hotel. When I looked at my bank account and noticed this, I had to speak with multiple people just to get this problem resolved. I didn't get my authorization back until days later. Causing the first few days of my vacation very stressful.. I also had an issue with the TV in my room. When we turned it on the screen would be bright and normal then almost immediately start to dim and turn so dark it was hard to see what was happening on screen. I had to call for an engineer multiple times to get this problem resolved. They canceled my consecutive reservation and when I got the email and when I went to speak with them about this, they blamed me for the canceled reservation and I had to book my room again at a higher rate than what I originally had for my consecutive stay... they also tried to charge me $89 for breakfast even though I'm a gold member. That did get resolved quickly though, which I'm grateful for. Overall the hotel is beautiful and in a great location, but the experience was greatly lacking. I don't think I would be staying at this place again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I stayed Jan 3 - 6, and had a great experience. The hotel was a 20 - 30 minute walk from the Times Square/Central Park/Broadway things we wanted to do, and there were a couple of great inexpensive restaurants (Slice, John's, and a bodega that I didn't get the name of) and a pharmacy less than a 5 minute walk away. I arrived from Newark and took the Newark Airport Express, which was very easy, and a ~10 minute walk between the Grand Central stop and the hotel. The room had a fantastic view, was very quiet and comfortable, and I thought the price was quite reasonable. I would certainly stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel, was clean, safe and quiet for my family of 6 staying at this property. The staff was very kind and accommodating. Breakfast was hot and service was excellent. The executive lounge was just ok. The food was minimal and when items ran out well before the end of the reception, they were not replenished (bread, cheese, fruit, egg rolls, etc). I probably wouldn't stay here again, just because the location was a hike to public transit and the "perks" of the hotel (free breakfast and executive lounge access) were not worth the sacrifice in location.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Our stay began with a less than stellar experience with the bell staff. A younger man started by taking our claim ticket (we had dropped off bags earlier), and then looking rather irritated, began looking for the bags. Once he found them he asked, as if hoping the answer would be "no," "do you need help taking your bags up?" When we replied that we did, he asked the older gentleman behind the desk who was engrossed with something on his phone, "is it your turn or mine?" Discovering it was his turn he again looked none to pleased and said he would meet us at our room. We had booked what we thought would be a nice suite that turned out to have two floors. When the bellman arrived we asked him to bring the bags to the entry on the second floor, 29M. He then got lost apparently going to the 30th floor and knocking there for a while before calling our room and sorting out there was a sub-floor.The room itself was in questionable repair for a "suite." Cracked paint everywhere, the showerhead in the main floor bathroom was only partially functioning, a very loud fan in the main floor bathroom never shutoff, reader lamps on the master bed were burned out, the TVs were laughably small, and the master bedroom TV seemed to be stuck noticeably dimmer than the living room TV.On departure, we once again had the "pleasure" of engaging with the bell staff. The morning bellman asked me to help him roll the bags into the small storage room. Once we were alone he started by bad-mouthing his colleague, insinuating he was an idiot for not having a pen. Then, to make sure our interaction was sufficiently awkward, he informed me that, "we don't charge for storing bags but we do appreciate tips." I let him know I didn't have any cash on me and would try to bring some back later when I picked up the bags. To which he replied, rather disappointedly, that he might not be around later to receive the tip.The bellman on duty when we departed, a tall, grey-haired gentleman, was probably the only good interaction we had. He was cheerful and seemed happy to help. He let us know the yellow cabs would probably be a little cheaper than Uber for our trip to JFK and secured us one large enough to fit our 4 bags.Overall the majority of staff interactions were terrible. Most seemed less than excited to be at their jobs and not afraid to let you know that you were inconveniencing them. The value of the "suite" was sub-par and we would have liked to have seen what was supposed to be a hig

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This is a great hotel. We had an easy check in and out, the rooms were lovely, clean and had an excellent view. The staff were helpful and friendly and the hotel was in a good location. Would definatley return and recommend.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We have always booked with Hilton Hotels. However, our stay at Millennium Hilton NY - One UN Plaza was exceptional. Patrick Goad went above and beyond to ensure our visit was memorable. He and his team provided the best customer service. Our family was extremely happy and comfortable during our Christmas 2019 vacation. Thanks again Patrick, Cristina and Justin from Orlanfo

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Staff were always very friendly, welcoming, and helpful. Stayed in a king room with corner view on top floor and the views both day & night were incredible! We were able to drop off luggage until check-in time so we could start exploring the city as well as leave our luggage after checkout since we scheduled our flight later at night. Close to subway. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I am writing a review from the UK - This is my third visit to NYC. Stay 1 - Hilton Times Square, Stay 2 - Hilton London NYC, Stay 3 - Millennium Hilton UN Plaza.Without contest, The Millennium wins hands down.First of all, thank you for responding to all my emails, and facebook messages prior to our visit, promptly and efficiently.We booked a corner king room, a friend of mine who works for Hilton kindly asked the hotel if they could do anything for me (i am a member of HH), they made sure we had the best view possible on floor 40, and access to the lounge. This was already prior arranged and assigned and i could not wait to get there!The check in process was easy, quick, friendly, hassle free basically. The room they assigned me was given to me, as well as instructions for the lounge access. Entering the room had a wow factor. My previous view from the stay at the Hilton Times Square took some beating!! But this beat it!! My corner room was clean, cosy, new, and the views were amazing (see pictures). We had an issue with the TV (it simply didn’t work), being in NYC i didn’t even get round to reporting it until day 3, however when i did it was promptly fixed by maintenance.The lounge was just perfect for us at Breakfast, nothing to heavy but enough to set us up for day, free coffee and soft drinks all day long, and they did let me stock up our mini fridge with waters and diet coke (without taking advantage too much!). Again the view from the lounge while having breakfast was great, however the windows need to cleaned.Having been to NYC 3 times, the location of this hotel was perfect. Its within 15-20mins walking to main attractions, 5 mins walk to Grand Central that takes you anywhere you want to go in the city, we enjoyed the experience of the Subway. There is also a lot of little bars, shops and food places locally (not silly money like times square either) if you like a Guinness like we do :-) we found a great Irish bar called Mondoons.We had a fantastic time at Millennium Hilton Plaza, and i would like to thank you personally for making our NYC trip so amazing. When (not if) we return to New York there is only one place i will be staying at - The Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza.Thank you Again!!!Jez & Chelsi

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Fantastic from arrival to departure location easy midtown East. Exceptional views from floor 30 upwards. Suite amazing. Coffee shop at lobby quality illy and assorted pastries etc 44th street is at the heart of the city with an easy 3 to 5 block walk

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We had two rooms at the Hilton millennium UN for my family and our guests. Excellent value overall. Nice perks for Diamond members, such as you would expect: room upgrades, executive lounge with great views. We had young kids and we walked to Times Square and beyond and then took a taxi back. The extra distance away from the crowded areas was nice = no shady folks wandering around, no crowds however grocery store, restaurants and bars are within two blocks. I will go back and I will recommend.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Hotel is in a great location, close to everything NY has to offer but not quite in the middle of the craziness. I booked a 1 bedroom suite with a half bath and pull out sofa. I booked this room type, so that my son wouldn’t have to go in and out of the master bedroom to use the bathroom at night. When checking in, my rate was incorrect. The front desk rep suggested that is was due to the taxes not being included in my online booking, I showed her that the taxes were included. She asked me to email my booking confirmation to the manager so that this could be corrected (this is the second time at a Hilton this has happened to me, so check your rates). She wouldn’t provide her name though, so I could jot down who I spoke to. Not a huge deal, the manager corrected this immediately, I just thought it was odd. The room didn’t contain the half bath, but instead it had a kitchenette area that contained a sink, coffee maker and what appeared to be an old in room bar/snack refrigerator. Only the bottom shelf could be used for keeping anything cool since it was designed to sell snacks and not as a true refrigerator. Upon inquiring about the room, the manager comped me 7k points since there wasn’t a room that had both a sofa bed and half bath. The complimentary breakfast was pretty good, no complaints there. I had to dispute 1 days charge for breakfast since I was charged for 1 breakfast, that was corrected at checkout. The complimentary Skyline bar, charged me $8.00 for the “complimentary” drink which was a lukewarm beer. I emailed the hotel and it was corrected. I ordered room service for my son my first night, since he was sick and we couldn’t take him out. It was basically an adult burger cut in half and overcooked so 30 plus dollars wasted. The view in the room was lovely, we were on floor 31. Overall, the hotel is fair at best.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel is truly exceptional! We did digital advance check-in and selected our room. What a great choice! Our corner king room was spacious, wonderfully equipped, and the view was absolutely stunning!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This is a renovated property and they did an excellent job. I thought the prices were very reasonable and the staff was excellent. I did not use the restaurant, but the fitness area was adequate to get in a decent workout in. a 10-15 minute walk to shopping on Madison or 6th Avenue. Very nice suites....could not have been more pleased.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Our flight arrived very early so we were at the hotel prior to 10. We asked about the possibility of checking in our luggage so we could take advantage of NYC right away. Mr. Barry, who helped us, not only worked magic to get us in a room so we could freshen up some first, he provided us tips on where to go and how to best get there, even the best order to do things. He was amazing! As a single mom and school teacher traveling with my two girls on their dream trip to NYC but on a budget, his advice and kindness was so appreciated. One of the girls' favorite part of their trip was checking in with Mr. Barry each morning to tell him about the prior day's events and to get tips for the new one. I had to laugh when they described him as "kinda like a grandfather but way cooler"! Our room had two double beds; it was simple and clean and the shower had great water pressure and plenty of hot water. Being a Hilton member gave us free wi-fi which was an added savings. The entire staff was kind and helpful, from bringing us a microwave, to housekeeping providing extra cups so girls could enjoy hot coco and popcorn in room. When we spoke with Patrick Goad, the reservation manager, about how kind everyone was, he genuinely listened and appreciated our feedback. It was nice to find people who cared and were personal yet professional.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel went above and beyond during my stay at NYFW! Not only was the whole hotel sold out but as a complimentary upgrade, due to the limited spacing, we ended up with a penthouse suite on one of the top floors! My friend and I each had our own bathroom and bedROOMS. Yes-rooms!!! Was so spacious for a NYC hotel. The water was hot and pressure was never an issue. We could see the river and the NYC skyline (Empire State & Chrysler buildings), and the sunrise and sunset every day!!! The breakfast was also worth going to. The fruit was fresh and had more berries than fillers. Even if you don't stay--forget the local Starbucks and go see Wendy in the lobby cafe for a mocha latte made with illy coffee ! She's so incredibly nice, tried to get one every day from her before we ventured out :) The gym is also great if you don't want to run outside and they have a full-size indoor tennis court. I definitely recommend this hotel and would totally stay there again!! Patrick sent up champagne and macaroons as a cherry on top of a wonderful stay since I briefly mentioned it was my first time in NYC for Fashion Week! Never met more thoughtful hotel staff!! Seriously, thank you!!!
user_name:
curvygirldc
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Our stay at this hotel was over the Christmas holiday and we had hoped that a warm Christmas atmosphere would have been the least we could have expected at this time of year, nothing could have been further from this!Location of hotel perfect, away from the noise but within sort walk of central manhattan. Nice building, clean and good size rooms, some damage to fittings and fixtures, the fridge was too small, not even enough room to chill a bottle of wine. Charging for internet connection in the room is unacceptable in this day and age - 14.95 USD per day. Reception staff not very friendly, or polite and offered no assistance with bags, similar for bell staff. Also bell staff couldn't find bags when left with them at check out, indeed they were very impolite.Restaurant and lounge bar was closed during the day, and the main restaurant area was closed off throughout our 8 day stay, very disappointing.The Coffee Shop staff were the exception, they we very nice, alway friendly, and always chatted with us.If all you need is a bed and clean room central to manhattan then this hotel is for you. if you like something a little more then look elsewhere.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed for a week from 21st to 28th December. It was for my husband's 60th birthday year celebrations. I asked for a nice view if possible and we got it. Views of the Chrysler Building and Empire State. Patrick also organised a little treat for my husband of wine and cakes. The only downside is the cost of drinks at the bar. At $12 a beer it was a bit rich for our pockets. Shame not more affordable or some specials. We would have visited more than once. Also bar man was not very welcoming. Overall a great experience.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Our usual family holiday plans upended by an unexpected surgery, we had to make it work for young grandchild and parents to join the grands for a NYC "staycation" instead of Christmas at home several states away. Our biggest concern was how to protect a youngster's belief in Santa while keeping stress level to a minimum. Enter the brilliant guest-centered and creative Res Manager, Patrick Goad who understood everything immediately. We settled on a (gorgeous) 1 bedroom suite for grands and kid, plus another room for the parents. AND, so Santa could do his work in the suite without a child looking on, one add'l room for Christmas eve. All very close together. NYers for more than 3 decades, we have never experienced such spectacular views from wall to ceiling windows looking east, west and south from the suite and rooms. We had ample space for a Christmas tree, dining table, family of 5 lounging and very comfortable sofa for grandkid. We saw Empire State Bldg's light show, Chrysler etc skyscrapers in their nighttime glory, sunrise, sunset and the spectacular working East River with water taxis, barges, tugboats, yachts etc. Beds were heavenly. Coffee/tea in room much appreciated.Patrick went all out as our "Hilton UN Christmas coordinator" to reassure a young boy that his liaison at the North Pole had already contacted him to get the room numbers of kids staying at the Hilton instead of at home. The milk and cookies on arrival and his explanatory note sealed the deal. Santa arrived and all was wonderful.The hotel is very well located between 1st and 2nd Avenues, with buses and subways within a few blocks that can take you anywhere. Ambassador Grill in the lobby and Skyline lounge made everything easier. The UN/Grand Central neighborhood is not the jumping hot spot of the Village or SoHo. It's more reserved and business oriented. We had a worried child, harried parents and one member recovering from major surgery. The hotel staff from friendly security dogs to bellmen, to front desk (Patrick, Brendan, Nina, Teicia et al) to housekeeping--especially lovely Victoria--to restaurant and lounge staff treated us all as VIPs. Almost without exception, they all went above and beyond. Not only to give expected good service, but to reassure and understand the intangible needs of our family in somewhat stressful circumstances.This is Hilton service at its very best. Any minor deficiencies or older property issues mentioned in some (unnecessarily churlish) reviews pale in importance when the STAFF treats their GUESTS as our family was. We were so comfortable, the grandparents stayed over in the suite another day to decompress and enjoy those WINDOWS.We will definitely recommend the Millennium Hilton UN to visiting friends and family.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I visit NYC at least 4 times a year for work and have stayed at several properties! I must say that this is THE BEST HOTEL I've ever stayed at - exceptional service! Thank you very much Patrick for making our stay extra special and the surprises (WOW) to celebrate my daughter's special occasion more amazing! Love your staff! We were greeted with beautiful smiles of Sylvia at the Front Desk and Frank at the Bell Desk Station. The hostess at Ambassador grill was so nice and greeted me every morning. Babu at the lounge made sure that I had enough appetizers and drinks. The lobby had a beautiful Christmas tree and so festive! The view from our room was breathtaking and our room was very clean.I finally got to meet Patrick to personally thank him for making our stay unforgettable. Patrick was so hospitable, kind and warm. Hilton is very lucky to have him. His energy is infectious and you just feel his positive attitude, love for work and zest for life - LOVE Patrick!I also love their location. Within walking distance to Grand Central, Times Square, Broadway, Rockefeller Center, 5th Ave and Central Park. Thank you very much Patrick, Sylvia, Frank, Babu, Hostess at the Ambassador Lounge (sorry I forgot your name) for making our extraordinary and exceptional! Hilton is very lucky to have you as part of their staff. Happy Holidays and Happy New Year!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: For my Christmas four-day stay, my room was stifling hot because the AC unit was disabled. Yes $139 seems like a great deal, but from there on lodgers are subject to pay a premium for anything else. Maybe the stars were misaligned, but as a frequent NYC traveler, this neighbourhood lacked character.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My family and I just spent 5 days thru Christmas at the Hilton UN Plaza. We had 3 rooms.3 college age children, my wife and I.The hotel is worn out.The rugs in the hallway are stained.The bathrooms showers did not work properly. Toilet paper holders fell off the walls.The air conditioning did not work. Our rooms were between 73 and 77 degrees.The bedding has been washed so many times it stiff.Staff was not attentive.They did not hold doors or greet you.The breakfast buffet was over priced and average at best. You would be better off not eating there.This hotel is not what you would expect from Hilton.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: On arrival, a very abrupt and rude receptionist claimed that our package holiday had not paid them (British Airways) and we could either pay $1000 immediately or have to leave. They refused to call BA. They refused to give us a number for BA. They refused to confirm this in writing.Checking Google reviews I found this is s common problem - they say that the reservation wasn't paid (it was paid months in advance) and demand full price, saying "claim it back off [BA] later".When we eventually managed to get hold of BA, they confirmed everything was paid, rang the hotel for us and it was sorted - no apology from them though.The stress this caused at the start of the holiday was indescribable. We were even calling our insurance company at one point trying to arrange fights back rather than sleep on the streets as we couldn't afford that $1000.Seriously, this is New York - there are lots of hotels, all of excellent quality and most others don't have numerous reviews of this nature - save the risk of this happening to you like it did to us, and seems to to many others and book somewhere else.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This review is long overdue. Apologies to the phenomenal staff, specifically Matthew and Jacqueline for making our 4 year anniversary an incredible one! Spent one night, upgraded to the Presidential Suite after booking the two bedroom suite. The views were spectacular, the suite was more of a luxury apartment with the added benefits of room service, a lovely executive lounge, and every detail perfect...even complimentary champagne and delicious pumpkin cheesecakes. I did not want to leave! We were so impressed that we spent more time taking in the views and enjoying the theater, living area, and every other luxurious aspect of the room than we did venturing around the city. I have stayed at this property before and loved it, especially the views, location, and lounge. The bathtub was magnificent, the closet space and changing area, the office, additional bathroom. I would live here if I could. Marble floors, sculptures, pictures will never do it justice. I will certainly be back very soon. As always, one of the reasons I am a Hilton Diamond Member, enthusiast, and loyal to the brand. Thank you to everyone who made this happen. Will be posting photos and review on @johnwhotravelswell instagram as well!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel was listed as a 4 star hotel with a city view. My wife’s & I’s room certainly was not. The room had an odd layout, there were stains & rips on the floor, and dust on appliances, also I felt like something was going to fall on me from the ceiling. They did not provide any in room water or on floor ice. There wasn’t a sundry shop as well when I needed Tylenol or a soda. Also the concierge at the desk was misinformed (intentional?) about the prices of shoes. She quoted prices considerably above ones we found elsewhere online. I have stayed in NYC many times before & have never had a bad room until now. Not worth the price in my opinion.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights checking out on Dec 22. Check in was easy, room had a great view from the 38th floor. Bellman were first class. There is a lot of noise because of the elevators going up and down. I mean a really deep roar you can hear while lying in bed. Hotel rooms are starting to show a lot of wear and tear. Housekeeping missed our room and it was not cleaned until Friday. We called and emailed the hotel to let them know. No response from the email which I discovered in other reviews is normal. Biggest disappointment is how they gouge you on food. A simple breakfast buffet is $35 per person. They have a little store that sells food in the morning as well. A single yogurt is $4.50, for example. We learned quick and found several close diners with great breakfast food for regular, fair prices. While the views were great, I would not stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Our room had a horrible smell. The front desk reps were very rude and made no attempt to move us or try to get the smell out. I called them multiple times regarding this and it was never addressed. It wasn't a great way to spend my anniversary.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We celebrated my inlaws 60th Anniversary with a show on Broadway and a stay at this beautiful hotel.Besides a great location to get in and out of the city we loved the views at night from the rooms. The staff was more than generous and welcoming. We had special needs and requested a fridge which came to our room in 20 minutes. The beds are very comfortable as was the entire room. We had a wonderful breakfast in their restaurant the buffet was beyond belief. When it came time for the theatre we didn’t need Uber since there were a fleet of cabs parked at the door. Shout out to the bellmen who were very friendly and accommodating. If your staying in NYC this is the place to be. A big bonus is the huge selection of resturants in the area in walking distance.
user_name:
Brooklyntommy
Glen Spey, NY, United States

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Can’t say enough about this hotel. The view from our room was amazing. But more importantly the staff and amenities were outstanding. Everything from the thanksgiving brunch to the skyline lounge to the breakfast buffet was perfect. Thank you for a wonderful family experience. Can’t wait to return.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed at the hotel for five nights and was impressed by both the hotel itself but also the friendliness and capability of the staff. As a Diamond member got and upgrade and access to the lounge. Lounge was a great place at night we found with good views and comfortable surroundings.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Have stayed in many nyc hotels. We live here haha- Got a clean spacious corner king room. Amazing views of the water(just what i asked for) great house keeping, extra security at the door since its UN hotel. Everyone was very helpful. Price was right! Bed was so comfy we took a ‘nap’ for 6 hrs lol

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We have stayed at the Millennium Hilton about 4 times in the past two years, and love it. Every room has an absolutely gorgeous view - truly unbeatable. The suites are huge and all of the rooms we stayed in were up to date and very clean. Whether we had a double room or suite, we always had enough room for our family, which is rare for NYC hotels. The staff is so friendly and very welcoming. We love the convenience of the location - it's a comfortable walk to a lot of restaurants and activities. The food in the restaurant keeps getting better - I recently had a gnocci dish that was so yummy, and their breakfast buffet is really good. Overall, we would definitely recommend this hotel and plan to come back ourselves.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My family and I had a wonderful time at the UN Hilton. Friendly and helpful bell staff. Excellent club room breakfast and snacks. Restaurant fish entree was delicious. Location is great for views of East River and NY marathon. Excellent baked goods selection in lobby cafe. Pro Tip: solid NY pizza slices on at the corner joint one block north.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: If you like to walk and aren't going to spend much time at the property this can be a good option in NYC. What drew me here w/ family was the availability of suites w/ bedrooms, but it really disappointed me.Location:Lots within a 15 minute walk, but not near the subway, which is a bummer in NYC.Staff was super friendly but hard a hard time getting the front desk to even answer the phone from the room. This is unacceptable from a 4 star. WAY under staffed.Stayed here since I thought it was renovated in 2017, but it does NOT look like it. Food in the ambassador lounge is TERRIBLE. Don't go for the $20 burger special combo advertised in the elevator - dry, overcooked, and worse than fast food :(Breakfast for gold/platinum members is abysmal. The exec lounge breakfast not even worth going to. Hard boiled eggs and cereal.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I held my companies executive team holiday dinner here and they made it perfect! The service from start to finish was impeccable, and the food (from the restaurant in the hotel called Narcissa) was top notch. Fitz, Maya, Teresa, Kira, Heather and literally everyone were fantastic! If you are in NYC and looking for a place to hold your events, do yourself a favor and check out The Standard East Village!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I have had relatives stay here before and they are always very happy with the Millennium HIlton NY One UN Plaza. The staff is unusally kind to my son and the views are amazing. The restaurant is also very good. I had a very good experience working with Mr Goad recently. Thank you Mr. Goad for your compassion. I hope to have more family and friends stay at your hotel when they are visiting.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Rooms were clean. Beds are more of a larger twin version than full. Beds were clean and comfortable for a good nights sleep. Front desk was accommodating due to room not being ready when we arrived. Location is close enough for walking distances. We walked to Rockefeller Center, Saks on 5th and Macy’s one evening and back. Plenty of eats around. View was amazing from out room
user_name:
Socorios2019
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Hotel is on Midtown East, just across the UN [uBer & Lyft usually drop you on 45th]. Hotel is your typical Hilton, nothing fancy. The lobby is always busy because people have meetings on the side. The rooms are semi outdated [compare it to the Marriott / Hyatt], but the hotel is nice. You defiantly feel safe because it's across the UN. The hotel staff is really nice. Being a diamond member [the manager is sweet I got an amazing view of the city] you get the typical perks like lounge etc. The breakfast at the lounge is better then the restaurant [staff is rude]. Gym is small but busy.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I recently returned from my first trip to New York where I stopped in the millennium hilton Hotel.The hotel is lovely and clean, everyone was beyond nice. I actually liked the fact that there is extra security including a sniffer dog. The room was big and very clean with fantastic views of the river. Lots of space for clothes and shoes. I love the fact that there is a safe in the room. The best thing about this hotel is the fact that you do not pay any resort tax.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I stayed at this hotel this weekend for a birthday getaway. By mistake, instead of turning the sign outside to do not disturb, it was turned to the side we needed service. When housekeeping tried to get in my room and I was not dressed, I quickly said that I was in there and could they please come back. With that, right at the door, she started to mimick me and laughing with another housekeeper. I went to the door undressed and told her I could hear her. She repeated that the sign was turned the wrong way then. I was adressing her rude comment to me, not the sign. For over $400 we paid, I will never return to such ill trained staff. The hotel should train them that if they have nothing nice to say, keep your rude mouth shut. Will be following up on this.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Unfriendly and rude staffDirty roomsRequests had to b repeated more than once with a min 30 min waitTom service items left in corridor for days on end without being cleared upComplaints were brushed off

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This was our 3rd time staying at this hotel. Each time we’ve stayed there we have enjoyed it. We received a great discount with Hilton Honors & friends & family. The suite on 36th floor has unbeatable views. Highly recommend this hotel. The staff is very pleasant & professional. We always feel secure there with security for UN on premises.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I stayed here for 3 months. The staff was fantastic to get to know me, fulfill requests, and accommodate every need. From the bellman to the front desk to the restaurant staff, and hotel managers, everyone offered great service. The rooms are large with fantastic views. I felt safe in this location. It was also convenient to restaurants, midtown activities, and the subway.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Absolutely an amazing stay. From the greeting of Robert the doorman to the front desk you couldn’t find great customer service. I was given an upgrade and it was beautiful. The breakfast for Diamond members is top notch. Overall 5 star hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Enjoyed my stay. Rooms are well appointed and renovated. You cannot beat the fantastic views. The window opened a few inches which was wonderful in the overly warm room on the 37th floor. The illy espresso machine in the room was a wonderful surprise and helped me to start my day off right. This is a large hotel room for Manhatten- luxuriate in the space!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My family were so disappointed with this hotel. Despite emailing 11 months in advance asking for a city view we got a river view. They changed room but the room we got a dirty room, had a carpet that was very worn and stained, a chair that the leather had split and was literally crumbling through rot, the bathroom stank of urine, the coffee machine was gross and there was a partial ceiling collapse. Raised this all with the hotel who cut away the worn carpet and made a half arsed attempt to clean the large stain.We paid £1,160 for a 2 double bed room, but they only put tea/coffee out for 2 peoplw each day even though there were 3 people staying. Was really not made to feel welcome.We got one night "complimentary" and some breakfast vouchers but this was nowhere near good enough. As a family we are still deciding whether or not to sue/initiate a chargeback for the full amount.Avoid this hotel. Overpriced, tatty, disappointing.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: On my last stay the hotel did everything they could to make my vacation both enjoyable and not stressful. I can not stress how amazing the view was from my room of the entire sky line. From the moment I checked in the hotel staff greeted me like I was the most important person checking in to the time I checked out. Every time I passed by the lobby I felt like they always said hi or enjoy your day. As far as location goes it is less than a 5 minute walk to Grand Central which makes getting around via Subway or train very easy. Will definitely rebook with them!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I usually stay at the New York Hilton Midtown but decided to give this hotel a try. I loved the location, just in front of the UN Plaza, within walking distance of all the main midtown attractions. The person handling my check-in was very nice and even though I arrived hours before the usual check-in time, my room was ready. I was given a room on the 36th floor which was very large for NY standards and comfortable, with a good sized bed, a great chaise longue and desk. It had a walk-in closet which I loved, as I could chuck all of my shopping in there keeping the room tidy. The bathroom was also a decent size, with the usual Hilton ammenities. All in all, it was a great experience and I might adopt it as my go-to hotel in NY.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This is a good hotel, convenient to many attractions. We stayed in a room with city view. The bathroom was clean and nice an bed comfortable. Carper needs to be replaced but overall a good hotel. Their gym was in the other tower but was nice.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Gorgeous views of East River. Pleasant hotel. Comfortable beds. Clean. Very lovely staff. We got a good rate during Thanksgiving holiday. Neighborhood has lots of coffee shops and other reasonably priced services available.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Fantastic Hotel,Staff and everyone we came into contact with in this Hotel. We checked in was so easy the gentleman who checked was friendly and very happy, the room was very clean and great views.The food and drink was slightly expensive but I suppose that's expected in the city.Taxi were easy to come by and the sights where only a short drive away. All in all we had a fantastic time with great service. Thank you to all the staff who made our stay great.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: When we travel to NYC this is where we ALWAYS stay. Rooms are clean, staff is friendly, and the view is great. It's right by the UN so it's a relatively quiet area which suits us. There are great restaurants sprinkled around the area as well.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Just returned from a trip at this fantastic hotel.It was my husbands 40th birthday and we were allocated a corner suite which has spectacular views of the Chrysler building and Empire State.All the staff are a credit to the Hilton brand they were so lovelyThank you for another memorable stay we shall definately return.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Pleasantly surprised by the large size of the rooms at this place. We had a double and there was tons of space. The bathroom is functional but small. The location is amazing- between 1st and buzzing 2nd avenue. The staff was helpful and the breakfast offered with the room was also very good value for money.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Good hotel, clean rooms, nice view, convenient location. Good place to get around by walking as well as via taxis. One hour from the JFK airport via taxi. The receptionist were not that helpful when asked for anywhere to eat for dinner. They seemed to not know anywhere to recommend. The concierge did recommend a very nice place breakfast which was better than the hotels breakfast. It is called johns and is just down the road. Two minutes walk. Room large, with a large tv and not much noice. Nice view from my window. Would recommend and stay again. Decor in lobby a bit odd but the rooms are nicer and neutral.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This was my first time in New York in about 13 years. I hadn’t stayed in the city previously, just visited twice. The experience in the hotel was excellent from start to finish. Staff are efficient and friendly, rooms are spacious and cleaned daily. We had a beautiful view of the river and the room is large enough to feel like you have your own space. We did not use most of the hotel facilities as we were out from early morning until late evening daily. The hotel is 5-10 minutes from Grand Central Station. In this respect you are connected to the entire city and beyond. We purchased a metro card for 1 week - costing $33. Walking to Times Square takes 20-25 mins - it does not feel tedious as you take in the sights and lights of the city. Most of our holiday was very active, we walked mainly everywhere or to the subway when tired. I would stay here again and recommend anyone to stay. A shuttle can be organised to the airport as well as private transport. The only negative of the stay was check out. Check out is at 11am (extremely early), when your flight home is 8pm, late check out can be purchased but we declined this. Overall I was very pleased with the hotel!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great location near UN. Staff super kind and easy to work with. Room service was expensive, if you call down to the restaurant and grab it yourself you will save money. Rooms were clean and the view was amazing from the tower I was in.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I am not a fussy traveler. Do not need a whole lot of flash or prim. Nice firm bed and pillows, clean and safe to explore NYC. Just need a room to sleep. That being said the Millennium Hilton New York UN Plaza is a outstanding hotel if for no other reason than there phenomenal great staff. Everyone was professional and friendly. They actually seem to really care about the people staying at the hotel. Of special note was a young Black woman who was working in the UNCAFE on Sunday morning between the hours of 9 am and 11 am. Such a pleasant, professional beaming person. Should be made the face of the hotel and hotel chain for her wonderful being. Although the hotel is on the far east side of Manhattan just a short (less than $10) cab ride to he Broadway theater section. Directly across from the UN. In walking distance(two minutes) to various stores and restaurants.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We surprised our daughter and brought her to NYC to celebrate her 13th birthday. We could not have been more pleased with our stay at this hotel! We were on the 32nd floor and our views were amazing! The staff was very friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. The lobby is beautiful and location was great for walking or catching the subway. (Picture is from our room at night)

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed in this hotel for a UN program. It is the closest hotel near the UN. The view is beautiful from the river view room. But the service is not up to the mark. The carpet is stained in the hallway. Lift button was electrified and giving a shock on the 13th floor. Front desk people are gossiping each other when you are waiting to get service.The breakfast was good though. the bed is comfy. Toilet and room were clean. Not a pleasant stay but ok.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed In this hotel last week. Firstly, the views were amazing! I’ve stayed in other New York hotels for similar prices and they do not live up to this hotel! We only paid for a standard room and weren’t expecting it to be that big or spacious either. The hotel itself is pretty central to everything so no need to travel ages to get places. Lovely helpful staff, clean and modern hotel. This hotel is definitely worth the money. If I were to go back to New York I would 100% stay here again. Thank you!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed in a King Corner room with spectacular views over the East River, Roosevelt Island and Midtown Manhattan. All the amenities are provided so no worries here. We stayed at the 37th floor and the views are breathtaking! The elevators are very quick and we never experienced any trouble. The hotel itself is located a little bit away from the Times Square but thanks to that it's very quiet up there. A perfect place to wind down after a long day of sight-seeing. The bed was insanely comfortable and the breakfast that followed our good night's sleep was divine. The orange juice is delicious, so are bagels and croissants - truly exquisite. We were only slightly surprised that there is no complimentary wi-fi available in the rooms, it's available in the lobby only so it might be troublesome for travellers with no mobile data to spare.The staff deserves a special mention - everyone at the hotel is very hospitable, especially front desk clerks. We were greeted by Sylvia who was amazingly calm and helped us since we had a bit of problem with our credit card. The staff at the breakfast, the housekeepers and concierge did all amazing work to make us feel welcome. Everyone just went out of their way to ensure that our stay was perfect. Top-quality service at its best!Given the price, service, room standard and the views... it's the best hotel you can get in Midtown Manhattan.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This trip was meant to have fun in couples and friends and explore New York City as a whole during the day and also enjoy the night life different areas in the city have to offer. I was absolutely satisfied with my stay and I plan on returning. The service was great, the staff was helpful and the view from the room was perfect.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The view from the hotel was spectacular. The staff in the Skyline executive center helped me with the computers in the business center, explained the buildings I was looking at through the windows, and the food was fresh and delicious. Best part of my stay. I wish the bed was more comfortable. Just used to the cushiness of my bed at home.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Had the best stay in NY and I’ve stayed all over the city. Got to stay a night in the presidential suite on the 28th floor for a birthday get together and I gotta say it was the best experience. Hotel staff were awesome in every way including accommodating it after my initial reserved 2 bedroom suite was sold out. Check in was seamless. Its a close walk to 42nd grand central station. Tons of food options around as well. The stay was overall perfect. I’ll definitely stay here again even if not in the presidential suite. Room details:-Huge master bathroom with dual sinks, rain shower, high tech toilet with water and bidet. -Additional half bath. -Huge Master bedroom with own tv, king bed, couch and views-Tons of closet space-Long walkway from the door-Dinning table that could seat 8 with room-living area with tons of couches and another TV-The views are the best part of the suite. Floor to ceiling windows allll over the suite with views of midtown, Chrysler building, freedom tower, and river. -Connects to double bed room if more bedding is needed.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This was our first visit to this property. We were not disappointed. We had a nice room on the 38th floor w/ a lovely view north. There are many excellent restaurants in the area.
