The location is w/in walking distance of Grand Central where you can find all sorts of transportation options. The staff is very personable and accommodating. We will return. Good internet service - nicely appointed room - comfortable sleeping.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: It is my first time to stay at this hotel, but I am sure I want to stay here again for its great views, exceptional services, convenient location and most importantly, people.The view of East River is breath-taking. The corner rooms have huge ceiling-to-floor windows, giving guests unblocked views of UN and the East River. One of the windows can be opened a little bit that you can take nice pictures of peaceful sunrise and sleepless skyscrapers in NY.Sky Lounge is also a great place to view the city. The top of the Chrysler building is just in front of you. It feels that you can touch it.The interior design of the hotel is very artistic. At the lobby, look up to enjoy the skylight and the unique design that leads your eye to the sky. Throughout the lobby and restaurants, the hotel is very creative to use glass to extend views, to present extraordinary views from good views.Hotel service teams are great, warm and helpful. They are not the typical New Yorkers, who might be too efficient to care. Guests staying here are also nice to each other by greeting strangers a good morning.I didn’t realize that how close it is to Central Park, Grand Station, the fifth Ave, Chrysler Building and of course UN. It is within walking distance!The very rare thing is there are security dogs in the hotel. At first I thought they are just hotel doggy hosts like some of the Canadian hotels do. In fact, they are security dogs to keep dangerous luggages away from the hotel. There are a dozen of them. All of them are Labradors. They are very playful, letting you pad them and rubbing their bellies. There is a sky lounge on the 30th Floor exclusively for HH Diamond members only. It is a great and quite place to have breakfast, which starts at 6:30 pm. The Ambassador’s Grill also offers free breakfast to Diamond members. Between these two places for breakfast, the basic food items are the same, but Ambassador’s Grill offers made to order omelets and more hot items. So if you want to eat a big breakfast, join the crowd at Ambassador’s Grill. If you prefer a more exclusive service and a nice view, go up to the Lounge. The gentleman managing the Lounge is amazing, cheerful.The Sky Lounge also has food, snacks, drinks in the evening.My only wish is the windows of the Sky Lounge were cleaner so that nice, sharp pictures of the city can be taken.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Wonderful Hotel The lady upgrade me to king executive with the lounge access very appreciate! The hotels is fabulous new and elegant The views for the the city is fantastic I definitely back so far is the best hilton in Manhattan

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel is a must stay!! The reservation manager Patrick is awesome. He made special accommodations which made my stay a memorable one. The staff was great! The corner rooms are breath taking! This experience exceeded my expectations! I was looking for a simple get away and instead got a luxury staycation.LK

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We booked the Millennium for my early 21st celebrations and we were not disappointed. This is up there with one of the best hotel experiences I’ve ever had, made even more special by the fantastic team of staff. A mention to Tyera and the rest of the team for making my stay so special, they even surprised me with Prosecco, cheesecake and a mattress with a bday card in our room which was just fantastic! The room itself featured comfortable accommodation and amenities, however the feature that stood out to us was the spectacular view of Manhattan and the Empire State Building. I listened to music most nights with the bright lights of the city in total view which was literally the dream. I couldn’t believe how amazing our experience was for our first trip to NYC and we will definitely book to stay here again when we get the chance to come back to NY again.
user_name:
Sam D
Holmes Chapel, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: ALL aspects of the hotel is GREAT from location to staff to comfort of rooms! It's a large hotel that has an intimate feel to it! The staff is truly focused on their guests. Surprisingly, the attention and focus on the guests is apparent from the moment we set foot in the hotel!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: In my experience, the Hilton Millenium UN plaza hotel differs from other hotels in one major way - they really look after Elite members with regards to complimentary upgrade. On our recent stay, we were upgraded to a very very nice modern suite, with sweeping views of the East River (many thanks to Matthew Waller and Oskarina Reeves). The room was luxurious, quiet and very comfortable with large TV screen. The Hotel is conveniently located within walking distance (10min) to the Grand Central station, which provides easy travel around Manhattan. It is right next to the United Nation which I recommend a visit if time permits (book tour online in advance - highly recommended). Elite members have access to the Concierge Lounge (Skylounge) offering breakfast and evening canapes, and drinks/snacks/fruit. Being Diamond members, we were also offered complimentary full buffet breakfast at the Ambassador Grill, which was nice. We feel very safe in the hotel due to the special security.We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel, and would recommend this hotel (and especially if you are Elite members - thanks Matthew!!).
user_name:
albertf940
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel is centrally located. It has a 'boutique' feel to it even though it's a large hotel. The entire staff is laser focused on their guests. We were greeted and acknowledged the moment we set foot on the hotel property! The rooms are contemporary styled and our bed was super comfortable! The Executive Lounge is great. The view of the NYC skyline was beautiful and the amenities and food was great!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I got upgraded to a suite which was fabulous. Did have some drama late a night with all of the fire alarms going off and had to evacuate the building. Would have been helpful if the staff had made an announcement with instructions or something. The sky club on the 30th floor was great.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Amazing! Brandon was so helpful and kind. The service was great and the staff were very responsive. The room was clean. Everything about my stay was great and I would definitely come back and stay here.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This was our second hotel in New York having stayed at the Conrad Downton for three nights, we spent two nights at the Millennium - and so glad we did! After sharing a room with the kids for a few nights even in a luxurious room, we were so happy to move on to stay in the best room we could have arranged. We booked the two bedroom, two bathroom suite with a huge lounge and fantastic views of the New York skyline - including the Empire State building and the Chrysler Building. We were allocated a corner suite on the top floor, so could see West,south and east and it couldn't have been better to round off our city experience. The breakfast buffet (included because of my Hilton Rewards Diamond membership) was great - not quite as good as the weekend buffet at the Conrad, but still enabled us to set up for the day exploring the sights. Would highly recommend staying there, and if we go back will definitely be staying there again ourselves even though it costs a little more, it certainly left a good impression on all of us.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Upon our arrival the staff were very friendly, it was my wife’s 40th birthday surprise which they knew about and had 2 small bottles of champagne on ice for us in the room with a card from the hotel. The room was clean with a lovely view. The desk staff everyday were smart, very friendly and helpful. Barry was amazing. Also felt very safe as they had great security due to being part of the UN building. Thank you so much to you all that made our stay so special.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Just completed a lovely anniversary weekend here. Staff were extremely generous and gracious, sending us a bottle of wine and cake. Our room on the 38th floor had a most magnificent view of the Chrysler Building and Empire State Building. Picture postcard perfect! Things I’d improve: Skylounge (food/decor was subpar and less-than-fresh food led to GI problems); stairway to tennis court on top floor (unsightly); restaurant/bar - needs refreshing.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Loved our stay at this hotel. Great location, fantastic staff and spectacular views from the hotel room. Would like to mention Racquell and Paul who made our stay especially memorable after a poor start to our holiday.Will definitely stay here on future visits to New York

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: If you need to be on the eastside, this is a great choice. The rooms are updated and well appointed, very clean and a good size for a Manhattan hotel. It is very quiet and the staff was most accommodating.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Hotel is nicely located for my needs. Super easy for Ubers to find and access.The staff was fantastic and they took great care of me especially when I needed to switch rooms because of an unexpected issue with my reserved room. They definitely accommodated me as a diamond member. Some of the interior space is a little dated in the hallways and spaces in the west tower.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The four of us spent the night after coming to NYC to see the premiere of my niece's play. Last time I'd been in the building was for a UN-related conference in the 70's, and everything has changed. The hotel has gone from dingy to almost deluxe and it's been taken over by the Jilton chain. The rooms are clean and functional. The views if you're in a South-facing room are spectacular (see photos). And the staff -- including the "Welcome Waggin'' bomb-sniffing dogs when you first enter the building-- are friendly. Fine location convenient to mid-Manhattan.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Well, I can’t rate my experience so far high enough. On arrival after a tiresome journey, Ticia, and Adina got myself and the other people in my party checked in quickly and with a smile. They made helpful suggestions on what to do and where to go and listened to what we were looking for from our room. We got an amazing room over the Hudson River and the Empire State Building on the other side. The team have been exceptional and the location is perfect for using as a base with high quality accommodation to rest in, at exceptionally good prices. If you want quality, this is the place to go. Patrick the reservation manager told us all about the Transit Museum which we are going to try out today. Thanks guys, you’ve made a great impression on our first day here. Good job Millennium Hilton!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Firstly this is a good base to explore NYC from - it is located less than 10 min walk from Times Square and you can easily walk to TImes Sq, Central Park, Rockerfeller, Chrysler, Empire State, 5th Avenue, etc from here.Check In was slow (ie queues) and we had to wait for our room to be ready. In fairness they do say check-in after 4pm, but I had hoped at 3.15 it would have been ready. Alas not and queuing up twice was necessary.When we did get to our rooms we noted the trash can hadn't been emptied and neither had they replenished the shampoo, soap, shower gel, conditioner etc. After a call to Housekeeping this was corrected, but it shouldn't have happened in the first place.Room was of a good size and very quiet and comfortable. Nice view of the East River from the 34th floor.We didn't use any of the hotels facilities, but also we noted that we actually hadn't been told about any of them either.For a hotel of this standard, I would have expected bottled water to be provided, but this was not the case.In comparison to other hotels in NYC, this was fairly priced and I would stay again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights over the weekend and found the hotel to be an oasis in all the madness of New York. Location was perfect for sightseeing and eating out as we were in walking distance of subway and Times Square.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Prior to the visit we had contact the the reservation manager mr. Goad, how helped to arranged a nice room etc. From check in to check out we only felt polite, warm and friendly staff, which made is feel like home. Location is excellent, short walk from attractions but still far enough away to avoid the crowds and 24/7 noise. We will for sure come back! Thanks all in Hilton One UN plaza :-)

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I’m going to start with the positives of this hotel and that has to be the view from our room, it was so nice to see when we arrived in our room at night! I was traveling alone with my 13yr old son. Also I would rate this as a great location, not far from Grand Central station where you can easily catch the subway. Its also within easy walking distance to the Rockefeller centre and central park. I would say its a quieter location rather than times square and if you walk along you can find cheaper supermarkets and restaurants. Ok the negatives, its sooooooooo expensive, don’t buy food or drinks here. I bought a cappuccino and it cost over $5 When we arrived it was late and we had been traveling a very long time due to delays, my son was really hungry so we ordered a pizza, it was $29 and was not very nice, I’m sure it was a frozen pizza and not fresh. Be careful of prices because the tax is added on after.When we arrived the lady on reception was not very friendly at all or welcoming! Basically got handed my room key, asked me to pay $250 and that was it, no information about the hotel or anything, we were the only people checking in at the time so she wasn’t busy. When we got to our room I had to call to ask about wifi etc, no information about the hotel facilities in the room either. The cleaning isn’t up to scratch, the dust in our room was awful! I went to make a coffee and both the cups were dirty. Felt like it needed a really good hoover and clean. When I bought my one cappuccino there was a lovely friendly member of staff on in the cafe in the lobby, unfortunately I didn’t catch his name. If I was to go to New York again I probably wouldn’t go back here in all honesty even though the location and view was pretty good.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I didn't have high hopes of this Hilton, but I was surprised by the quality of rooms, customer service, and breakfast. The hotel is centrally located - close to the UN but only a short walk from Grand Central station and Lexington Avenue shops. My room had a stunning view to midtown Manhattan and it was well furnished with a large comfortable bed, tea and coffee making facilities and a modern bathroom. The breakfast was well stocked with a made to order omelette station. Overall, I would stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Spent six nights at this beautiful hotel situated opposite the United Nations. Had stunning views over Manhattan, including being able to see the Empire State Building. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Great Executive Lounge, first-class service, excellent selection of food. Located about 10 minutes' walk from Grand Central Station. A tour of the UN is highly recommended! Would definitely stay at Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza when next in NYC.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed on business at this Hilton for 2 nights. I arrived very late on the first night but used digital check in to my room (3333) so literally walked in, used the lift and in my room under a minute. So easy.The room was very spacious for a Manhattan hotel and was spotlessly clean and well appointed. Throughout the stay everything was exactly as it should be and on the 33rd floor it was also quiet all night long. Really good views out across midtown Manhattan too.The location near to Grand Central is helpful and I like the residential nature of this part of town - so much more relaxed than around Times Square.I used the lounge on the 30th once and it was one of the better I have used - light, great views and well stocked.Staff were welcoming and helpful at every opportunity.If I could make one small change it would be to have creamer or milk supplied with the excellent coffee machine.I will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 2 days in the middle of october, and it was a wonderful stay. The hotel lobby was very elegantly decorated and everyone was very friendly. The valet was the only off putting person; he was very nice but waited for a tip [and the valet which was the only parking option was very expensive being $80usd per day]. The older gentlemen at the bell desk was AMAZING, i wish i remembered his name, he gave us the "nickel and dime tour" as he called it of NYC as it was our first visit to the city. Our room was a deluxe room with 2 double beds.The room was spotless, the bed linens and towels very also very plush and clean. The view from our room was of the United Nations Headquarters and of the water and Queens, fantastic view!!! The bathroom was also a very good size, quite spacious infact and the shower was massive!! The room overall was quite a good size! The hotel felt safe, and was well maintained. It also wasn't too far from Times Square being about a 10 minute Uber or taxi ride!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Fantastic hotel, however the service overall was poor.When checking in we were given no information about the available airport transfer which would have been very helpful to us.We weren't given any information about where gym facilities were or anything about breakfast/dinner timings.I made a request for room decorations as this was our honeymoon. I was told this would be done, however when arriving to the room, this was not completed.Small issues, however when you spend over $600 for two nights stay, you deserve and expect better.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: A very good 4 day visit during a family trip to NYC for a wedding. The hotel management are really attentive and helpful at all times. The room views are great, the rooms in good condition. Executive Lounge in west tower on 30th floor is a bit dated and the offer limited compared to other hotels with executive lounges but still great to have such a facility in an NYC hotel. Abu and Nabil (breakfast waiters) were particularly nice.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: It was a quick birthday trip, and our first to NYC, so, we had little expectations regarding location and "value". I called ahead asking for a bottle of champagne in the room for my boyfriends birthday. The guy on the phone was very nice and funny, and assured me he would do so, and asked extra personal questions about the birthday, making me feel like the Hilton would be extra special.... Never happened. Pretty bummed regardless. The room was clean, nice, big, the beds and pillows very comfy. The room was legit. I appreciated this home away from home. Location is hard to say, as we were not native NYC, and wouldn't know a good location, as it is very dependent on your trip. I will say we were 2 easy blocks from Grand Central Station, and easy to get a cab at any time. DO NOT BUY ANYTHING FROM THE COFFEE SHOP UNLESS YOU ARE WILLING TO SELL YOUR CHILD FOR IT. 2 REGULAR SODAS, A MINI CHEESECAKE, AND MINI CHAMPAGNE OF NO LABEL WERE 57 DOLLARS!2 LATTES AND 2 EGG SANDWICHES WERE 45 DOLLARS. Yes, we were dumb to pay this but we did it separately, without telling each other, because we were very embarrassed at our idiocy.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: So this Hilton is situated in a very nice location— UN Plaza and 45th St. ( for those unfamiliar with the City it is Mid-town East side) The lobby is very nice. The room is rather generous given that you are in Manhattan. I did not like the corridors at all. The carpet was gray and burnt orange squares and the walls were prison gray- Very depressing. I also wasn’t very impressed with the Ambassador Grill. The people at the desk and other staff were great. Rooms - clean. So it was all in all a good place, just don’t know what the fuss was about as far as decor...totally not impressed.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Very easy to get to by subway or car. Across the road from the UN. Close to great places to eat. Check in and check out was seamless. Extremely clean room and great service. I recommend it to anyone looking to stay near midtown.
user_name:
AlexInGeorgetown
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I stayed for a week. It was a wonderful experience. Close to so many things. I really loved the room and the view was spectacular. I realized how non sound proof the walls were when I heard my neighbor but luckily, for the most part, everyone was thoughtful and quiet. The bell staff took very good care of me on my last day when I had a big project to finish and needed their assistance finding boxes from Fed Ex and getting them to me ASAP in the morning as well as carrying everything down. There were some time constraints and they helped it run smoothly. They got me off to the airport in time. The coffee and pastry shop staff was wonderful as well. Wonderful cappuccino and an easy grab and go breakfast or lunch!Housekeeping was spot on- not one thing out of place. Front desk was helpful and accommodating too. Thank you, Hilton UN Millennium!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stay here 3+ times per month on business. Lots to like including spacious rooms with a view of the Chrysler Building or East river. Front Desk staff is pleasant and efficient as is the Honors lounge staff. Breakfast in Honors Lounge (30th fl) is cold buffet. Cereal and fresh fruit + hard boiled egg and pastry + coffee is fine. Hot breakfast is in Ambassador restaurant off lobby is very good if you have a little more time. My only suggestion is to up their game on the evening Honors Lounge fare. It has been cheese and fruit platter + veggie platter + chicken wings and empanadas for months and months. The view is great and the staff super nice. A little imagination with the appetizers would be nice and very much appreciated by your loyal Hilton honors guests.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This Hotel is updated and in a great location for my stay in New York. The staff is amazing from the front desk staff, house keeping, and the Concierge service. They have security dogs at the entrance 24/7. It is easy to obtain a Taxi as well if needed.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The Millenium Hilton is a luxury property located near the United Nations Building, & a short walk to Grand Central Station and many other subway stops.We were visiting our son in NY, and had a 3 day stay here.Having booked a corner room with a view of the river, we were shown to our charming room, with great views.Only when we had unpacked, did we start to notice some problems.Dust on the table pedestal & window sills, children's finger prints on the window glass, luke warm shower water, the bathroom sink would not drain, some bulbs were burnt out, the bedside clock was broken and the TV was very dark & unwatchable at night.All of these faults are fairly minor, but when added together became more serious!A sign at the Reception says that they will make right any problems.We reported the various problems to Susan at reception, & found her to be most helpful and empathetic.All we wanted was for the problems in our room to be fixed, but instead we were given the remaining 2 nights in a 2-level suite.She did try to "make things right"The suite was very tired, with old brown carpeting, and there were cigarette burns on both bedside tables.There were 2 small bathrooms, 1 with a shower, & the other with a bath tub.Both had a single sink, & modern square fixtures.Unfortunately there was no full length mirror, & no coffee cups beside the coffee maker. It was small details like these that made us think that no supervisors were giving final approval before guests were moved in to each room.In both rooms the beds were super comfortable, although there was no night time turn down service. Different pillow types are available.Security too was excellent. To gain access to any floor, the room key had to be swiped, & WIFI is free.Some rooms are newly renovated, but many are not!Our feeling was that this potential 5* hotel was being managed in a 'Hit & Miss' fashion, & didn't deserve a higher rating at this time.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: business trip to nyc convenient location on east side. maintenance needed on facade. staff are fabulous and rooms are very clean. tech is spotty at times (wifi and cable service). fitness center recently updated.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Since they transitioned to Hilton I have stayed at the Millennium Hotel a number of times and the experience has always been consistent. In addition to having a great location, view, and amenities – their staff is the best in New York. They go above and beyond their duties as a hospitality team and make you feel like family. Sylvia L. represents all the qualities of their incredible front desk team. Always welcoming, always willing to help, and always brightening our day. Frank, Ozzie, Aimsley (sp?),Paul, Vince, Robert, Joey, and the rest of the Bell Desk are guaranteed to make your stay as easy and pleasant as possible. Their collective personalities make this hotel SPECIAL. I've never been to a hotel where the General Manager is so closely aligned with their guests. Stefan does not hide out in his office, but regularly engages people staying at the hotel to make sure they are completely taken care of. Imagine hosting all of the World Leaders, their staff, and security personnel for an entire week every year during UNGA. These guys are battle tested and the best in the business. Can't forget to shoutout the Executive Lounge and Cafe staff either.
user_name:
Pau L
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Solid hotel with large rooms and great views. The East tower seems more dated than the West tower but both offer decently large rooms that are clean. One caution about rooms in the east tower: the mini refrigerator is in the middle of a wall, across from a mirror, and has a bright LED light that is always on (thus illuminating the room). I unplugged mine to turn the light off. The beds are comfortable and the bathrooms, for the most part, are updated and clean. The tv selection is quite good (hbo go is a huge plus). The fitness center isn’t huge for the size of the hotel but has great equipment. The lounge in the west tower has the best views in the city—you can see all of Midtown/downtown, LIC, UN, bridges, etc. The food is extremely boring but the staff is so, so friendly and attentive. The lobby can be understaffed at peak times. Staff is somewhat friendly but not particularly warm. Elevators can be very messed up (I can’t tell you the number of times I’ve stepped into an elevator on the west side to have the doors close and the elevator not move). Overall this hotel is solid and not a bad choice.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Wow.......I travelled with my 2 daughters to celebrate 21st and 18th birthdays, and to go to Elsie fest in Central park. We booked a two bed suite. On arrival to the suite, we were blown away by the space and the view, the room on the 38th floor was stunning and we could have sat there all day in the lounge area looking at the city view from one side of the room and the un plaza and the river from the other side! Laying in bed in the smaller bedroom next to the floor to ceiling windows almost felt like you were flying over Manhattan. A lovely gesture of wine, cards and cakes as well for my girls’ birthdays - thank you Hilton. As a travel agent I will certainly be recommending this hotel to my clients wishing to have a hotel in a great location, just a few minutes walk to grand central station made it so easy to get around.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This was my second stay at Millennium Hilton UN Plaza and I had an amazing time! The room was huge, modern and luxurious, with a super comfy bed and nice bathroom. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is just a 10 minute walk from Grand Central Station, so it’s easy to get around the city. The best part is the views! Stunning views of midtown, especially at night! The Empire State Building, Chrysler Building its just beautiful. I will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Underwhelmed by this place. Best part? The bellman taking our bags before check-in. Super enthusiastic, hospitable, and remembered us 6 hours later. Cons: Lobby is small and underwhelming. Was walked in on unannounced, no knock, by cleaning staff. Received two spam calls meant for "hotel staff" at odd hours. No complimentary bottle of water or room service menu. Yet, when I said I didn't have a menu and wanted an alcoholic beverage, i wasn't given a price and felt grossly overcharged afterward. Nothing BAD, but just inferior service for a Hilton.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My wife and I recently stayed at the Millennium Hilton UN Plaza while in New York for business. The hotel confirmed beforehand that they offered valet parking services for a reasonable fixed daily rate; more on this later in the review. While we were acknowledged by reception as being Diamond Members, it was only after requested that a room upgrade was offered. Unfortunately, this lack of acknowledging Diamond program benefits at check-in seems to be fast becoming the norm across Hilton properties.The upgraded higher floor room was incredible. In comparison to the size of a typical New York City hotel room, this was more than double the space. The floor to ceiling window view from the room of the nearby Chrysler Building was amazing and truly memorable. Furnishings in the room were modern and comfortable, and the touchscreen electronic lighting and air conditioner controls were quite impressive. One strange note to the room was that it had absolutely no overhead or lamp lighting near the oversized desk. The bathroom was huge with a fully tiled and glass walk-in shower.Our visit to the Executive Lounge was truly uninspiring. The lounge was open for evening refreshments and lite food for another 30 minutes when we got there on a Saturday night only to be greeted with a warning of the closing time. A minimal selection of alcoholic beverages is available for a charge, with only soda, coffee and tea being complimentary. The food selection was truly spartan as most of the serving trays were empty. We questioned the lounge staff and were once again reminded that they were closing in 25 minutes. I am sorry but you are either open or closed and we were left to feel like we were imposing on the staff. After a few crackers and celery sticks, we left in disgust.The next morning was a spectacular contrast to the night before. Breakfast in the restaurant downstairs was top shelf. The many selections on the buffet were fresh and well-stocked. My wife ordered an egg white vegetable omelette that looked and tasted outstanding. The service was extremely professional and our table was very well attended to.Now getting back to the valet parking. At checkout, I was informed that there would be an extra $24 fee for oversized vehicle added to my bill. I informed the front desk that my vehicle was actually a 'compact SUV' and in no way oversized. After some back and forth between the front desk, the third party parking service and myself, they removed the charge and printed my receipt.The following day my credit card was alerted to a single charge of $24 from Hilton which initiated over a week and a half of back and forth attempts at resolution with the local Hilton staff who offered no more than an acknowledgement of the charge.Now for the happy ending. I was finally able to get my issue escalated beyond the billing department and spoke with Patrick the Reservations Manage at Millenium Hilton UN. Patrick immediately acknowledged my Diamond loyalty to Hilton and listened to the series of events leading to the call. Patrick saw my experience as a training opportunity for some of the local staff and offered to refund the parking charges in full. Customer satisfaction is sometimes a difficult task and you never get a second chance at a first impression. Patrick was instrumental in turning my experience at Millenium Hilton UN from a strong negative to a positive. I am now looking forward to staying at the Millenium Hilton UN on my next trip to the city.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Arrived this past Friday at noon and was curtly told my room wouldn’t be ready until 4:00. Killed some time by taking a walk, which wasn’t easy since I have issues with my ankle. The front desk told me they’d call me on my cell when the room was ready. No one did. At 3:45, I approached the desk and asked if it was ready and it was. I had booked a king corner room and the view was spectacular: East River, Freedom Tower, Chrysler Building and Empire State Building, which was lit up orange and blue for the New York Islanders home opener. Really didn’t want to leave the room...totally worth the wait! I did take off one point for the indifference of the staff; they weren’t very friendly at all.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I visited New York for five days, together with a friend. The location of the Milennium Hilton we found to be very nice! It's in close proximity to Fifth Avenue, Central Park and Grand Central Station. Also, it's just a 10 minute walk to the closest boat stop on East River (East 34th Street); this is practical if you want to go to Brooklyn or Williamsburg. We got a room on the 32nd floor. (It seems like the hotel floors start from floor 28). This means that you - most likely - will get a room with a view. We had a room facing south, with a magnificent view of East River and Manhattan. From my bed, I had a clear view of Empire State Building, which is quite a sight during night! The beds were very good, as were the bathroom facilities. Housekeeping always left our room tidy and well cleaned. On the minus side:Reception staff treated us a bit indifferent on arrival. So, the welcome was not the best. (However, this seems to be the norm at many hotels in New York City.)The playlist at the hotel bar downstairs was totally out of place, taken into consideration that you are at a hotel next to the UN. The music made us feel that we were at a bad 90s party. On the plus side: -good beds-marvellous views!-nice bathroom -good housekeeping!-very welcoming and friendly bell boys! (Compensated for the sourly welcome)All in all, I'd stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: When arriving at the property we were met by Barry at the Front Desk. He was extremely welcoming and friendly. He made the check-in experience quick and easy. From there every employee we encountered was polite and greeted us with a genuine smile. Our room had an incredible view and was in great condition. We only experienced amazing things during our stay

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I really enjoyed my stay. The rooms are spacious with amazing views. The breakfast is heavenly. My favorite spot was the coffee shop. This is by far my favorite coffee shop in Midtown East. The coffee is so good and the staff their are very professional and friendly, especially Wendy and Tatiana. This Coffee shop makes the stay at the hotel just perfect. Its also ideal for meetings. Just get your coffee from there and sit at the lobby or at the stools in the shop.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: nice hotel right next to the wtc so good place to stay if you are wanting to do things up in that area. room was clean, fair sized, staff was nice. hotel needs to work on a few of the little things that guest need, first the business center at least in the early morning was difficult to work with, computers were very slow or did not work at all and as it has an indoor pool and I am one who enjoys swimming and the reason we booked it, as they provide staff when pool is open to be a "lifeguard" they need to make sure they have this person there on time! over our weekend stay when they open later at 7, for us that are early risers and then need to get on with our days activities this is important, unfortunately this did not happen even after multiple calls to the desk and being assured there would be someone there in 5 minutes or so and several people waiting to get in by 735 I finally gave up and proceeded with my days activities. it may not seem like a large thing with all of the hustle and bustle but for the customers using your hotel they are important details

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel was amazing!! Close proximity to everything and to top it off the room was huge! We visited our families rooms in other hotels and there’s were tiny in comparison! Great value for money and our trip was amazing!!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I am a regular visitor to NYC and the Millennium Hotel at the UN truly stands out as exceptional. The level of service is outstanding and every interaction is one that continues to exceed expectations. Sylvia, at the Front Desk, is especially impressive. Her constant willingness to go above and beyond truly makes me think of the Millennium as my home away from home. I give the hotel my strongest approval and recommend it to anyone needing a room at or near the United Nations in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I had a wonderful stay at the Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza. The welcoming staff (Shane, Liam, Brian and Sylvia) were very professional and helpful. Llany was exceptional at the Skyline. He made me feel special.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I am so very glad I stayed here. Upon check in late Friday 9/20, I was greeted by Raquel. She was very efficient checking me in. I requested a room with a view if possible and she delivered. Views are spectacular here! They were so good, I left the blinds open so I could catch the sunrise. The room was spacious for NYC accommodations and very nicely decorated. I loved all the lighting options available as well, esp for putting on my makeup. The person who worked overnight was able to point us in the direction of wine a block away (thank you). All around, the staff is what will make me return to this hotel. They were all very nice- housekeeping, front desk, the bell men, the Reservations Manager. All a big thank you. It was also super cool to hear that I was staying at the safest hotel in the World due to the UNs General Assembly. Being a manager at a hotel myself, I knew what to look for and I found it all here.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed in this hotel in August 2019 for four nights. Our room was on 30th floor with the panoramic view on United Nations building, lower Manhattan as well as Chrysler and Empire Buildings. We booked two double beds room for four guests.All was okay: big room, cleanliness, good bathroom, even toilet bowl with heating and automatic control. The only disadvantage was the size of two beds in the room. The width of each of them was only 120 cm that is 1.5 size bed instead of double bed which were declared.For this reason it was very uncomfortable to sleep on beds. We were very tired sleeping during nights.It is necessary to take into account for travellers when booking rooms with two double beds for three and more people.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed here for 6 nights. very spacious, beyond comfortable, exceptionally clean, perfectly quiet, fantastic views of the East river. Great location. Less than 5 minutes walk to grand central,(subway-which we recommend the use of.$33 for 7 days) Friendly staff.Couldn't fault it whatsoever.We would highly recommended.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: An extraordinary hotel as location and services. Quick access to Time Sqare, Central Park and Empire and many other tourist attractions. It was an amazing holiday for us and I am sure we will return to New York and here again. Thank you Hilton!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: An extraordinary hotel with an amazing view on the Hudson river! The accommodation and hotel staff were of the highest quality . In my opinion the best hotel in Manhattan! I would definitely recommend!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great hotel with great views of the Hudson. Nice quiet area with good local shops and easy access to Grand Cebtral Station just a few blocks away. Coffee shop in the lobby is handy but a bit expensive

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Vintage, super friendly classic New York Manhattan but without all the hustle and bustle. Coffee shop is amazing. River view rooms are incredible- view of Long island Roosevelt Island and the UN building and grounds. Gym is top notch- overlooking the river. I’ve stayed in many hotels for work in NYC and keep coming back to this one because of its charm!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The Hotel is located close to the UN HQ and at the same time you're almost in the middle of Manhattan. The Hotel is really recommendable and the service is excellent and customer related. The lounge is very narrow but the rooms are comfortable and very clean. The overnight price is compare to other places a bit too high.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: As a Hilton Honors Gold Member I stay in Hilton Hotels all over the world. We had been really looking forward to our NY stay and given the price we paid we were expecting top quality. Unfortunately this hotel is decidedly average through and through. The lobby area has an unwelcoming environment and the reception staff always seemed disinterested and bored, never looking up to say hello or greet guests. Our room on the 35th floor was fine but it was the supporting amenities that disappointed. We had access to the Skyline Club lounge on the 30th floor but the lounge was very poor. Breakfast was served in there daily but again this was of limited quality and choice. The air temperature was always very cold in there too so it wasn't exactly a comfortable, relaxing environment. I doubt I'd consider staying in a Millennium Hilton branded hotel again in future.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Overall a well maintained mature hotel ideally located for UN business. In fact it very much has the feel of a business hotel which is reflected in the prices (I paid over £600/$750 with a weekend discount)for three nights to get a perspective...note it's a 15 minute walk to the nearest subway,which is Grand Central.This was a vacation trip with my son. We are both diamond members, but that cuts little ice at the Millennium UN -Check in : less than warm. No early check in.Room: clean with great tv, Inc Netflix but the room felt dated and the beds were not comfortable.. Worst of all was the room faced the other wing of the hotel directly opposite other guest bedrooms. There were however side views of the Hudson.Lounge : Friendly staff. However only coffee and tea are free with limited snacks. The worst part was charging $8 for a beer ! Underwhelming and disappointing.Breakfast: below average in quality, fresh fruit not replaced . We kept being presented with a bill for $86 for two people, then being told it was our job to remind staff breakfast is comp. 15% gratuity included 'for our convenience did feel injected some humour into the whole experience. Bear in mind this is a buffet breakfast..!Check out : late check out is 1pm for diamonds and you can get 3pm for $75 otherwise full price .Without status you will be out by 11am and be looking at a very expensive breakfast.Hilton like to talk about the Hilton family. This place was all about the business and if you are on expenses and working nearby it's a viable option. I will be looking elsewhere next trip..

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Unequaled, unprecedented service by any hotel staff that made the Ultimate Stay for our friends and for my wife and me!!Special thanks to Patrick, the Reservations Manager, for going overboard to make accommodations set for royalty, totally unexpected!My wife and I stayed here during Christmas and was treated wonderfully along with great accommodations, so when we decided to bring our friends for their first NYC visit there was only one choice, The Millennium Hilton 1 UN Plaza Hotel.We made our reservations early and asked for rooms near each other with great views and higher floors. City views, especially the Chrysler Building are very important to us.As arrival time neared I contacted the hotel staff several times and was treated with so much courtesy and respect, just more confirmation we chose the best hotel.We arrived a day ahead of our friends and again contacted Patrick, who so graciously went way beyond hopes or expectations by accommodating our friends in a corner suite, which had the best city and East River views. Patrick’s hard work and magic made our friends’ stay extra special. In fact, they are planning their next trip because of their special accommodations and exceptional service. I want to recognize Patrick and EVERY staff member with whom we came in contact! Everyone displayed genuine interest and concern for our needs and desires!Thank you! Thank you!I encourage everyone who plans a trip to New York to make the Millennium Hilton 1 UN Plaza their hotel for their stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Had a very pleasant stay here. Great location, located across the street from UN Plaza. The rooms were spacious. Great view from the hotel room (side note, this would be a great hotel to watch fireworks). Friendly staff, especially the cute bomb sniffling dog employed by the hotel. The lounge has good food and a nice refuge for drinks and afternoon snacks. Highly recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: If you are going to New York and want to be near the UN then the Millennium Hilton New York UN Plaza is the place to stay. Since the guest rooms are only on upper floors there are great views. The rooms are clean and laid out very efficiently, and the staff was helpful. Also, there is an inviting lobby to use as a meeting area.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I am staying at the hotel for a week and had pre registered the night before as my flight was getting in at 0700 and wanted access to my room. Arrived to be told as I didn’t confirm before 2am they sold it! Even though I was on a 19 hour flight! Poorly handled by the reception who told me to “wait to speak to the manager and he couldn’t get the guests out of the rooms any earlier!” And worse - maybe I could get some compensation!! 3 hours later I finally get to my room. You can do better than this Hilton! Very disappointing start and poor service attitude. Let’s hope the week gets better!Tried to send message on Hilton honours website but it doesn’t recognise you if you’re not from the USA!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We arrived at the hotel at 8.30pm after a long flight. We went to check in, told the lady on check in we had 2 rooms booked, she told us we only had 1 so I got my booking confirmation out and handed it to her. She then disappeared out the back with no explanation, we waited over 10 minutes and I did ask the man on reception what the problem was, he was very rude replying she is sorting it and carried on looking at his computer screen! Do feel after waiting so long he could have gone to find out what was going on! Lady eventually came back and gave us 4 key cards, 2 for each room no explanation or apology. Despite this the rest of the staff were excellent, very helpful and friendly. Hotel in a good location, rooms were pleasant and the small shop was great for a quick breakfast snack. Hilton, teach your reception staff some manners please! they are one of the first point of contacts and are letting the rest of your team down.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Lovely hotel, the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast unless you pre book with room or have Hilton Honors is quite expensive at $40 per head. ButThey do have a small shop that sells coffee and pastries etc if you want a quick bite. The only reason I dis not give an excellent score was we used the hotel bar on a couple of occasions and one of the bar staff made my husband and I uncomfortable, he was just very unapproachable, not what you expect of a bar person.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great trip! Loved the location and all of the amenities. The breakfast spot had great quick morning fare and excellent coffee. The restaurant was incredible, great wine selection, terrific food and a killer breakfast buffet!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Wonderful! Location was incredible and the staff were all top notch. We would absolutely stay again and hope to in the near future. Really liked the sky lounge (forget the exact name). Views were great!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed here last night and had a great stay. We were upgraded to a king suite, room 3131. The room was beautiful. View of the UN, downtown, Chrysler and Empire State Buildings. Was a nice touch as a Diamond member to get a full buffet breakfast with an omelette station . Check in and check out was easy and the team members were very nice. Highly recommend

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel has a perfect location opposite to UNICEF offices and the UN Plaza. Walking distance from the hotel, there good Restaurants. This is a perfect choice in Manhattan if you are there on business.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I have been a frequent visitor for over 25 years to this hotel, which is by far my favourite when staying in NY. My almost entirely positive feelings towards this establishment were confirmed on my most recent stay. Due to circumstances beyond my control I had to postpone by two days my arrival in the city. Even though the booking was non-refundable and I was quite happy to accept this, the reservations manager at the hotel changed my booking and informed me that as the hotel was fully booked they could benefit from having a room freed up for two nights and so they would waive the charge for the two nights in question. I mention this example because the Hilton would have been justified to have charged me but staff used their discretion to treat me as a guest not just a source of revenue. Obviously, in the long run satisfied and happy customers will bring far more benefit for the hotel than the two nights they could have charged. Sadly in my experience too many hotels do not play it in this honourable way and focus solely only on the short term.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The front and location of this hotel is 5 stars, super close to the WTC and the R Metro line, great for going to the upper town, Korea Town and others. 10 minutes to the Fulton Station for JFK airport. Inside is kind of old and not maintained. Even we had cleaners visited everyday but very dusty on the furniture. Shower water pressure is terrible and they have the smallest shower head I have never seen at a Hilton hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We booked this hotel for our visit to New York due to its fantastic price and location. The hotel was approximately 10 minutes walk from Grand Central Terminal and the hotel has lots of amenities around.The hotel was excellent and the whole experience of the hotel was great.The check in to the hotel was easy, and the staff were extremely friendly and helped with any questions we had regarding our stay.The room itself was spacious, the bed comfy and the view (corner king room) was incredible and worth the extra cost to experience the skyline's sun rise. The facilities provided were as expected for the hotel, which including an iron, safe, ironing board and a hair dryer. The housekeeping team did an excellent job in keeping the room extremely clean and changed the linen on a daily basis.Upon check out, the hotel stored our bags due to the time of our flight, and this was extremely helpful, as having to carry the bags round New York would not have been great. Once we had collected our bags, a member of staff helpfully flagged down a taxi for us to take us to JFK for the flight back.We would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My fiancée and I have just returned to England after staying at the Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza and absolutely loved our stay. When we arrived we was greeted so warmly by Nicole on the front desk who was so accommodating and was genuinely excited when she noticed my partners ‘Bride’ box which contained her wedding dress. She was really funny and when we was given a room upgrade it was the most perfect gift to us.When we first walked into the corner suite which we had been upgraded to the view was absolutely amazing, and it made our stay with you extra special. We called down to room service for some champagne flutes for our big day, and when they were brought to the room we was given two gorgeous chocolate puddings and a bottle of Prosecco which was so lovely and we were once again so appreciative that your staff had gone above and beyond to make our stay perfect.Neither of us could say one bad word about our stay, every single member of staff we encountered were fantastic and always smiling. Again, the room was extraordinary and was spotless every day!Brilliant hotel, great location and we cannot thank you enough for making our special occasion even more perfect than we’d ever imagined that it could’ve been.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I love this hotel and stay as often as possible when visiting NYC. The location is perfect with close access to the subway to go anywhere in the city! The views of the city and river are beautiful. The staff is so attentive and kind, and the rooms are more spacious than most other city hotels.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I’ve been there for a short weekend in New York.I checked-in very early and the room was not ready. I can’t complaint about that, since staff assigned me a room as soon as they could. Location I really nice. Rooms have amazing view over UN building, the Hudson river and the midtown as well.Rooms are mid-size, quite well furnished with a king size bed and a chaise-longue to enjoy the view from the window. Said that, windows are quite narrow and I did expect something more. Bathroom is pretty small, very average, nothing to talk about. Toiletries from Evelyne and Crab. Service is pretty anonymous. Staff does its job without any interest in you. None of them is really dedicated to you, neither tries to anticipate your needs. As a gold member, while I got the benefits related to the tier, no one really recognized my status or made me feel really welcome. This is an area where the management should work hard. Club Lounge is old, and I mean old: it stinks, spaces are narrow and all the things saw better times. Breakfast In the lounge is just sub-par. Nothing you’d fancy of when you think of Hilton. But breakfast in the restaurant (which – by the way – costs 10$ for the upgrade as gold member) is not that better: located in the basement, while staff is ok, food selection is quite limited and could be definitely better in terms of quality. As a final note, on my folio I discovered I was mistakenly charged 2 times for the breakfast. As none gave me the receipt on check -out (they send it to you via e-mail), when I read it on my mobile I was surprised. I know mistakes may occur, so I promptly email them about the matter. Luckily they were more than professional in fixing it. It’s a pity, because the hotel is ideally located and has some very good things, but all this made my stay very mediocre and I don’t think I will stay there again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: If you have any reason whatsoever to stay in NYC, the only place worthy of staying is the Millennium Hilton here at One UN Plaza. Personally, I was taking the weekend away to celebrate achieving some goals of mine; the Millennium Hilton made this celebration one to remember. Upon arrival which was late in the evening, the front desk agent Adina was very friendly, warm and welcoming to me; she saw that I was waiting in line and even though she must have just begun her shift and was logging in, she called me over to her desk and helped check me in. The overnight front office manager Stanley was also at the desk and greeted me kindly and enthusiastically. Come to find out, the reservations manager Patrick had upgraded my room to the Hemstead Suite - I guess he saw that I listed “celebration” as the reason for my stay when booking my queen room and really wanted me to have a celebratory experience! The Suite was immaculate and exquisite from the moment I entered the door. Two floors connected by staircase in the room with a gorgeous chandelier, double master baths each with extra large showers, spacious living room area, and the king bed on the room’s second floor with nearly floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking southern Manhattan and the East River, with direct sight of Freedom Tower/One World Trade. An amenity of wine and a handwritten card from Patrick were waiting for me in the suite wishing me a great celebratory stay; Patrick and his team went above and beyond servicing me as a guest and making sure my time in the city was enjoyable. Access to the lounge was also a part of the surprise upgrade, and I loved all of the options available. I went with the continental breakfast, but even so, the selection of muffins, pastries, beverages and other items was wide ranging and nothing was lacking. Eating breakfast in the lounge with a great view down 44th Street has its perks too.Again, this hotel is really where you want to stay if you have any reason to be in NYC. It’s within the UN complex, and with that brings a level of stature and presence that conveys “I’m here, I’m important, and I’m going to have a great stay”. Transit access is easy - just a 10 minute walk straight down 44th Street leads you directly to Grand Central Terminal, complete with subway access to virtually all points around the city (4/5/6 give you Bronx and Brooklyn via the east side of Manhattan; 7 gives you crosstown Manhattan via the newest hotspot Hudson Yards and Queens; the S shuttle takes you to Times Square where you’ll find the 1/2/3 with access to Bronx and Brooklyn via the west side of Manhattan, the N/Q/R/W with access to Brooklyn and Coney Island via Barclays Center and Queens, and the A/C/E with access to JFK on the A, downtown/World Trade Center on the E, Central Park on the C, and Penn Station on the 1/2/3/A/C/E). You can get EVERYWHERE. I never felt isolated by staying at the Hilton; rather, I felt the whole city was my playground to explore.The entire team of staff does an amazing job of making sure each guest is well taken care of. Each day of my stay, my room was serviced promptly by housekeeping with keen attention to detail. While I relaxed in the lounge, staff were always eager to make sure I was enjoying my time and always offered assistance should I need anything. Even as I was checking out and leaving the hotel, Suzy at the front desk was warm and attentive, making sure that every part of my stay had gone smoothly and that all of the billing was correct. My experience with the Millennium Hilton left me feeling refreshed and glad I had chosen to stay there for my celebration. If you are looking for wonderful comfort, with wonderful amenities and a wonderful, top-notch staff while staying in NYC, you are guaranteed to find all of that here at the Millennium Hilton One UN Plaza.
user_name:
terpswag
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Beautiful hotel and extremely clean. The bed was very comfortable. Our view was gorgeous. You could see the whole city and easy to plan out your day. A lot of security on site. We felt very secure and safe.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Amazing views, stayed on 28th floor with a view of the city, was gorgeous. Staff was friendly from moment we checked in. We felt as if we were VIP's when indeed we were just regular guests. Rooms were nice. Bathroom was nice and spacious. Very clean in and around hotel!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Nice room while i was working in NewYork.Fully stocked fridge and a cracking view of the Hudson.Breakfast was brill but room service was a bit ropy with the pizza.Needed to get suits dry cleaned and hotel did not have a 24 hour option, so we had to go downtown To get suits cleaned. Easy to run security operations from the 48th floor and my client was very happy.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Bad executive lounge good breakfast! There is basically nothing in the lounge during evening hours. They charge wine for $5 per glass. No upgrade as a diamond member. Everybody is so friendly at the property and their breakfast at the ambassador grill was good!
user_name:
dannnleee
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel has the nicest people working there. As soon as we checked in, the gentleman behind the desk made us feel so welcomed and comfortable. I wish I had gotten his name, but we can't say enough about him. The gentlemen who held our bags the day we checked out was also incredibly nice. Lovely people!Our room was absolutely perfect and we had a great time. I ended up recommending this hotel to a friend and she said it was exactly what she was looking for. Thank you for a great stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: nice rooms. great staff. valet team is great. There is plenty to wald to as far as meals or just a quick cocktail. east side is quiet and easier to get to where I need to be in the mornings. Park and stay is a good deal too.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I want to compliment the reservations manager of this hotel, PATRICK GOAD, for excellent customer service. We made a reservation at this hotel through Trip Advisor, However when I was asked for payment, the company that actually made the reservation was a company called Cancelon. After I made the reservation, I immediately called and cancelled because I booked the wrong Hiton Hotel. Even though I cancelled within minutes, Cancelon charged me a $186 cancellation fee. I disputed this charge through Trip Advisor, Cancelon and American Express. But my disputes were denied. However when I contacted Patrick Goad at the hotel, he called Cancelon and got them to refund my $186. Thanks Patrick We ended up staying at the Hilton Garden Inn on 54th which was great.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I was stuck at Laguardia airport after a combination of errors and weather ended up causing my flight to cancel. Our company travel service found a room for me at the Millennium Hilton at the UN plaza. I checked in late after a long day and was happy to find out the kitchen was still serving. I had a nice chopped salad with chicken that satisfied my hunger. The bartender was cordial and provided good service. My room was on the 35th floor and had nice views of the city. The room was clean and quiet and I woke up rested.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: When traveling for business, being close to meeting locations is prime concern. Next comes a comfortable place with all the services needed. This hotel ticks all the boxes and more. Rooms were comfortable and had everything needed, including a human-sized bath which is getting harder to find. Coffee service in the Lobby did end too early. Otherwise, everything was Just what was needed.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We booked this hotel because it was well priced for NY and is a short walking distance from Grand Central. We knew the area a little.On arrival we were met with a long queue at reception and both the staff on reception seemed less that aware of the build up and were generally pampering to a large group who were basically being difficult. Check-in took AGES! On check out there was no pleasantries and they didn’t even ask about our stay.The hotel public spaces and the room was well presented, clean and very nice. The room was quite spacious for NY and can’t really be faulted. No noise and the air con was very effective.There is no pool and the gym is not worth trying. Just a weights section plus a few machines that nobody ever uses in a gym. No bikes accept for a single large crank spinner. The view from the gym was good though, right over the UN grounds and the East River.We had a late check out on our last day, but someone came to our room at least every half hour to check one thing or another. It was very irritating.We would stay again but be aware of its faults.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This will be my staple hotel when visiting NYC. The hotel room was spacious, clean and we'll appointed. The view of the water was amazing! Front desk attendees were friendly! The on site cafe had great options that didn't break the bank!
user_name:
msmith959464
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The Hotel is on a quiet street, but plenty of shops in the area. It took us 10 mins to walk to Grand central Terminal and 25 minutes to walk to Time Square...taxi to time Square cost around $10. The hotel is clean and rooms large, however our beds (2) for 3 people sharing, were only queen size and a tight fit for 2 people to share (booked through BA), I'd definitely recommend checking you have a room with 2 'full bed' if there are more than 2 people sharing. Check in was a little stressful as at 4pm our rooms were not available and we had to wait another 45 minutes until they were ready. We also had to pay $200 per room on a card to cover any breakage or bar Bill's....(we did get it put back on our card when we checked out)...would we stay again ..yeah it was a nice hotel and the views from the rooms were amazing.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: If you are looking for a hotel to stay at in New York, this is the place. Amazing views, great staff, and even better service. This hotel is extremely clean & the lounge is a great place to relax after all the walking and site seeing the city has to offer. This hotel is great locations to all fun things in NY.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This is a hotel situated across the road from the United Nations Building on 44th street.Hotel is quite big and our room had a great view of the Empire State Building and the East River.Hotel is situated not to far from Grand Central Station and the Chrysler Building. Please be aware there is no pool and hasn’t been for a while. Taxis park outside so ther is no problem if you want to get one got the sights. We eWalked a lot to 59th street for the main shops and Central Park. All in all a very nice hotel and I would book here again if we ventured back to New York

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Amazing views from this hotel! We stayed in a corner room that had views from both sides. We enjoyed amazing wine, room service, and food from the sky lounge. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. I can’t wait to return!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Comfy beds! Great views! Wonderful staff! Very impressive service and attention to detail. The continental breakfast was yummy and certainly enough to make it to lunch! Can’t say enough about the staff and how friendly and helpful they were.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We had the most amazing view of the city from the 38th floor! The bed was comfy. It's always a toss up if I am going to be able to sleep at a hotel, but I slept so well. The water pressure in the shower was awesome. The bathroom was really nice! The hair dryer was powerful. The clock had a phone charger. The staff was all wonderful. Very happy with our stay!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: A modern hotel recently remodeled just steps away from the UN. The lobby, coffee shop, gym are top notch (the gym has exceptional views of the river).Service is very attentive. Lots of good restaurants in the area. Ambassador Grill in the hotel itself has a very nice breakfast buffet but is meh at best for dinner.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This is my third stay here and the hotel staff have been really nice. Helpful and friendly! I arrived late and was quickly checked in after a transatlantic flight. The room was really nice with views over the river. The exec lounge is on the 30th floor and has great views over manhattan! By NY standards the price was also reasonable!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We had a double upper apartment!! Wow wow wow views staff food breakfast!!! Can’t complain very central will be back love it !!! Stayed for a week ... I would ask for a upper level for the view of the Hudson River , also very close to shopping and all other attractions

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Excellent location for UN. Service very good and rooms quiet. Porters and security staff very friendly. Expensive as expected for location. Conference facilities good but air con needs work. Reception staff outstanding.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: If you are a Diamond Club member, you have it made. We got a lovely suite on top. The service was great (though the pull out mattress was lumpy). Unfortunately, the lobby could use a re-design, in my opinion. Lots of wasted black space and the seating area is kind of lacking.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed at this location for a weekend. When my friends and I arrived we were told we weren’t able to check in until 4:30 (hence the 4:00pm check in time displayed on the website and confirmation email). This hotel is very overpriced especially for what you get which is mediocre rooms and service. When we were checking out my friend payed for parking she later checked her account a few hours later that day and seen that she was charged an extra $50. The individual who was working the front desk at the time did not tell her that she would be charged that extra fee. She has called multiple times for this to be resolved but this location has not been able to rectify the situation. Which is terrible. Futhermore! another friend was charged an extra $555 this location was stating that it was a hold on her account However, that amount was taken out the same day we checked out. This is ridiculous she needs her money back ASAP.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Poor service at front desk, no stocked mini bar, limited room service, overpriced wifi. Hugely overpriced hotel. Central location. Clean. But would definitely not stay here again on account of service

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I booked this hotel based on my experience of Hilton hotels in the UK and Europe, as well as traveller reviews. It was not a cheap option either. One of the two rooms booked did not have a safe or a fridge and the amenities in both rooms were poor. The coffee machine was limited and only creamer was provided. There were no drawers, only wardrobe space and a kettle cost $13.On our second visit to the hotel bar at 11.45 pm we were served a drink but told the bar was closed. We were then asked to leave the bar at 12.10am. I have never experienced this issue before in a Hilton and was very surprised - so much for New York being a 24 hour city!In conclusion, I would say that this hotel falls below the standard expected of a Hilton.
user_name:
Tracey H
Wimborne Minster, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: As a Hilton Honors member, we love visiting all the Hilton Brands. Our first visit to the Millennium--we were shocked by how large the hotel room was. And the large windows! This is very unique in NYC. EXTREMELY cool to see Empire State and Chrysler Buildings from your room! Obviously great location to tour United Nations, but perfect base for us to explore all of NYC. Grand Central Station a few blocks walk--and that opens up all of Manhattan for you. Little Italy, Main Line, Yankee Stadium, Broadway--all very easily accessible from this hotel. We did not take advantage of any of the hotel amenities--as we enjoy exploring NYC. But the room made our vacation. Front desk and bell staff were very helpful & friendly.
user_name:
theodorec487
Fort Walton Beach, United States

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The location was great, nice view, nice room, friendly staffs, and great food. Our family enjoyed and loved to stay at Millennium HIlton One UN Plaza. We sad because we were not stay long enough. For sure, we will be back soon. I would recommend friend and family to stay here.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This Hotel is one of the Best Hotels i have ever stayed at. The Location is great, the staff of the Hotel are friendly and helpful and the views from the rooms are awesome. A number of fantastic restaurants just around the corner in each direction on Second Ave

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Walking distance from everything Manhattan, St. Pat’s Cathedral, fifth avenue, Times Square, restaurant row, Grand Central Station, Broadway plays, everything you need in New York, or want to do, is accessible from this Hotel, absolutely worth it!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Firstly location and views from this hotel are without doubt for the price range the best in my opinion you will get in Manhattan .I had a corner room 3218 and the views are all that and more .I had to wait a good while after check in time started for my room but hey it was worth it to get the room I wanted .Staff were polite and professional.cleanliness of the room and a few minor issues escalating over my stay lead me to voice them to Silvia on front desk , she was very approachable and couldn’t do enough to try and correct these for me , for this Silvia many thanks , eventually Jessica the DM , came and upgraded me to a suite for the last night of my stay . Which was a nice touch and appreciated.Minor issues could be addressed within the hotel and this would be the perfect stay .I would definitely return to this hotel the next time I’m in the city

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This is not a family friendly restaurant, although it is the only place to eat on the property. One night we were not feeling well so decided to eat there and brought a 2 1/2 year-old, very well behaved child with us. The waiter acted mad and rude from the get go. We had to argue with him to get silverware and a plate for the child! There is no kids menu, and he didn’t seem to want to help with smaller portions or any adjustments for children’s food, despite being the only hotel in the restaurant. That was fine, we were willing to pay full price if we could have just got some service! The waiter never refilled our glasses or came back and asked how our food tasted, among other things. My order was not correct, but I had to eat it anyway as I could not get anyone’s attention, let alone our waiter. The restaurant was not busy that night. When I complained at the end of the meal, (which was the only time our waiter came back) about the service and the food all he said was “I’ll give you a free dessert“. The next day I went to the front desk and spoke to the very personable and nice front desk manager. He took notes and told me he would have the restaurant manager call when he came into work that day or when we got home the next day. I never got a phone call but I did get the full price of the meal refunded. That was nice but it tells me that they’re not very interested in the way the restaurant is run.This Hilton has an absolutely wonderful breakfast buffet with more items than I’ve ever seen! Everything is fresh and delicious and the service is amazing. We ate there every morning and no one at breakfast seemed to have a problem with the 2 1/2-year-old! She got silverware, drink and a chair without having to ask. Everything was refilled promptly and dirty dishes were taken away quickly. The difference between the morning service in the evening service was unbelievable!We had a beautiful room and very good maid service, but the rooms had a smell that seem to be coming from the carpet.
