It smelled to us like urine. I called the front desk once about it and talk to the maid another time but nothing seemed to be done. The rooms need a maintenance person to go and check them, as there are nice amenities but a lot of them don’t work. Also seems as though the upholstery and the carpet need to be cleaned.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great stay. Wonderful room, terrific breakfast. The only thing I didn’t like was all the creepy U.N. folks hanging around. Because basically, the U.N. sucks. But loved the hotel. Service folks were great. Loved the dogs all over the place to protect the creepy U.N. folks.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: First, I will say that we found the service at the Millennium Hilton UN to be exceptional. From the doorman to the front desk, they were all pleasant and wonderful. From the first time I called this hotel to research info about the area, I spoke with Linda and she was awesome. Speaking with Linda was like talking to an old, dear friend. Because we share the same birthday and she wanted our first time in New York to be special, Linda had champagne, chocolate cake, and strawberries delivered to our room. How sweet is this? Thank you so much, Linda, and the wonderful staff at the Millennium UN. Your service was seamless and exceptional! That being said, I'm very disappointed to share my family's experience in regards to the accommodations at this hotel. With such a great staff there, I believe this location is in need of a renovation. The building has somewhat of a musty odor, along with worn and stained carpet throughout. The lobby furniture appears to be dated and stained as well. Our room was on the 28th floor. While we appreciated the view of New York, we were not fond of the spiral staircase, as the staircase was rather tall and steep. The carpet on the stairs was not clean as well as areas in the room. Having teenagers who hated the stairs because of how steep they were can be very telling. One of my daughters said the stairs gave her anxiety and this was her least favorite hotel to stay at. And while the kids had their own bathroom downstairs, they had to climb the stairs each night to shower (there isn't a shower downstairs). In addition, rooms at this hotel are not equipped with a microwave and they do not have ice machines like traditional hotels. Also, there is no option to receive a complimentary breakfast like other traditional hotels. However, we knew about the breakfast option going in. Lastly, (IF) I could rate the customer service at this hotel alone, I'd give this location a 5-star rating. However, by a family vote, I'm giving this Hilton property a 3-star rating (and not because of the staff!)Hilton, you can do better than this!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We were lucky enough to have a beautiful corner suite in this lovely hotel to celebrate my daughter's 21st birthday. The staff could not have been more welcoming and went out of their way to insure my daughter's birthday was truly special from the balloons they left her to surprise her in the room, to a complimentary bottle of prosecco waiting for us when we returned from the theater. All in all, this is a beautiful hotel with lovely views and a truly caring staff. It will continue to be our "home away from home" when we visit NYC.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: After traveling for 14h to this hotel and walking to a receptionist with no customers online I was told: "Dont come here, before I ask you to". What a nice greeting. I felt the front desk were very entitled about their mediocre hotel. After waiting for 15minutes she notioned that I was allowed to come. Before this, we had booked and paid for the hotel in Finland, my manager sent several emails and driver license pictures to the front desk person for me to avoid having to use my own credit card upon arrival. Despite this, the front desk refused to give us our room so we were forced to pay for the entire stay with my credit card (including a 200dollar deposit).What followed was about 20 emails, 4 phone calls from Finland to confirm the old credit card, about 4 front desk workers, and none of them helped me get my charge back. Finally I contacted my bank, and they said I would get it back the next day, after showing the receipt for the hotel. This was 2 weeks later.We stayed in a suite around on the 31st floor and the view was great. However, the room was fully carpeted and very dusty. The furnitures were worn out. There was a noodle (piece of food) in the minifridge, which I complained about twice and it never disappeared. There was splashes of liquid stains on the walls, and they didnt disappear even though I complained about the dirtiness of the suite. I took a piece of paper and water and tested if they can come off, which was possible, so it was just due to laziness. The bed was fine and I slept ok.The suite did not have a very large room height. It felt like around 6'6feet or 2 meters in many places, a bit claustrophobic even for a 5'8 foot/170cm guy.The bathroom shower handle was loose. The windows were semi-dirty, which ruined the view a bit, which was otherwise nice.The coffee machine had an absolute gross, green water holder, which I complained about, but which never got cleaned. And so I never used the coffee machine.The breakfast was good buffet-style, and the chef made good omelettes.The hotel had 3 elevators from which 2 broke down, and it took us a 10minute wait to get downstairs to eat break fast.The TV was sufficient, but they had an automatic log-out every day at 11am. And when it was thundering outside we were watching a movie from netflix and it got shut and logged out at 11, and we had to input our login credentials again to continue, which was frustrating. ( I know, 1st world problems, but not expected from a 400dollar/night room).I do not recommend this hotel.
user_name:
NikHreviews
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel, the staff, and the room were all exceptional. We had an amazing meal in the restaurant and the staff were simply wonderful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to NYC. Front desk and housekeeping staff were all friendly and welcoming.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Be careful handing over your credit card here...Despite pre-paying, this hotel charged another $1000 on to my credit card, and despite numerous phone calls (where no-one seemed to have the authority to do anything, they just suggested I call my bank...) it took 12 days for the charge to be reversed. Thanks so much! It's the second time a Hilton hotel has done this to me, but it won't be happening again!!! There are plenty of other hotels in New York....

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Thank you to Stefan, Patrick and Gerry for making our celebratory stay at your beautiful hotel truly memorable for all of the right reasons. We had a superb room with amazing views of pretty much everything south of 44th Street – even including part of the Hudson River. We dined in the restaurant on the evening of our 15th anniversary and the meal was beautiful and the staff were brilliant. This is definitely our new favourite hotel in New York. We can’t wait to return. Thank you all so so much for making it truly wonderful.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I stayed here 5 nights. I enjoyed my stay. My room on the 39th floor has amazing views of NYC skylines. My room, king size bed, was spacious and very clean. The products in the bathroom were very good. The service was also very good, all the staff were very friendly and helpful. The small minus; I missed a bathrobe as well as slippers in my room. The gym feels quite old, the machine are out dated ( and are not functioning well) and I missed a gym mat. I worked across the street, the hotel is otherwise a bit off ( if you are visiting New York for vacation).The price is good, though. So if you want an affordable 4-star hotel and will be willing to take transportation plus walk , than the hotel is recommendable!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Excellent location, friendly and professional service and wonderful view over mid and downtown. Can recommend to stay there anytime. Breakfast buffet is also worthwhile visiting. Applies also to the gym.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The upgraded room had a lingering vomit smell and red wine stains in the carpet. I called the Front Desk but only to be told there is nothing they could do at that time and I should talk to the Front Desk when I check out .

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My husband and I started staying here because the location is convenient. Now we don’t want to stay anywhere else. Views of the city and East River are breathtaking. Rooms are spotless and comfy. Staff is courteous and accommodating.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We booked a suite as we were travelling with our teenagers and wow, what a suite. We travel extensively but this really was incredible and the nearest comparison was an apartment in Sydney. Fantastic views of the NY skyline in multiple directions, great amenities over 2 floors which provided that rockstar feel. The hotel is impressive, staff very courteous and attentive but as we weren’t really high rollers they weren’t in our faces. Given the price for our 3 night stay for 4 people it was really good value. Location is great; a couple of blocks from Grand Central Station and a shirt walk from the 34th Street waterways terminal, providing plenty access to all parts of greater New York.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Overall, this was a great hotel. Very clean and wonderful air conditioning! Everyone was very friendly and helpful. We had breakfast included with our room and the food was good. They were accommodating with anything I needed. This was the first time that the breakfast servers remembered us! Most places don't seem to. The room had everything we needed. I loved the espresso machine! The only reason I am giving this a 4 instead of a 5 is the fridge in the room is a little pointless. It could at least have been a dorm fridge. You can't even fit a bottle of water in it. So that is a much needed upgrade. If you don't plan on using the fridge then it is really worth the 5 stars. The only other complaint I had, not against the hotel, was that it was further than I thought to Times Square. It made for a very long walk when we wanted to see that area of the city. But excellent hotel and we would stay there again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed here for the first time. We loved the hotel, staff and amenities were first rate.Our room was gorgeous with wonderful views over the East River.It was a pleasure staying on this side of Manhattan, quiet and peaceful, and bustransportation was excellent to all parts of the city.Wonderful restaurants close at hand particularly Japanese ones.Would definitely recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Comfortable hotel very well located. Rooms are quite well appointed but the standard rooms are a little dark due to small windows. Most of the guests at the hotel are affiliated somehow with the UN - there is high turnover of guests - the staff deal with hundreds of people every day and it kind of shows - they are friendly but matter-of-fact. On one occasion I called room service during peak evening rush - the phone operator was so rude and abrupt that I guess his wife had just left him. So yeah, its a functional business hotel but it won't break your heart.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel is a hidden gem. Formerly run by Hyatt International the staff is fantastic and welcoming. We ate at the bar and shared a laugh with the bartender. The Gold lounge is terrific. Can’t say enough.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: When writing a review about a property in New York City one always needs to keep in it context that it’s in New York City. On the good side it is a very nice property that is well maintained and clean. On the downside we found the front desk staff and some of the restaurant staff to be less than helpful. For example, as a gold member we were supposed to get free Wi-Fi. Twice I asked how we can do this, and both times the instructions they gave us did not help.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My Complete Family after travelling around then States ended up at this Hilton Chain in New York.Already used to the High Standards of Personnel in this Chain But was Pleasantly surprised by the High Standard of Hospitality displayed by the staff esp the Front Desk Ambassador AVERY. He gave us an Embellishment that will be remembered for a long time to come.Mr Avery is an Asset to the Hotel and I do hope he is recognised for his Warm work ethics Overall experience...A Pretry Awesome Stay.Tq Hilton.The Sarnas of Malaysia...

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Our recent stay at the Millennium Hotel was the most pleasant experience. We enjoy making personal connections with hotel staff and Patrick in particular gave us such a wonderful impression of his hotel and the city in general. Our room was wonderful and the view was amazing!! You cannot go wrong staying in this hotel. Happy Planning!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I've been staying at this hotel for years when I have business at the United Nations and it's like a home away from home. The staff are all excellent from the doormen to housekeeping. I don't want to name names as I'll probably leave someone out but my special thanks to Avery, Suzzie and Dorka at the front desk, Robert, Frank, Ansley, and Ozzie at the front door, Dorna in the kitchen, and Stefan and Thom in the front office. I look forward to my next work trip there.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I traveled 23 hours to be at a United Nations workshop. With only 10 hours from touchdown at JFK to my event, I opted to stay at the UN Plaza for proximity and to optimize on sleep. I hoped to use the morning for extra sleep or breakfast, rather than on flagging a cab during NYC rush hour and commuting from another hotel. After a long journey, all I wanted at midnight was a hot shower. But no, that simple requirement was too much. I filled the (small) bath but got tepid water. Shivering, I tried the shower. No better. I let the water run, I tried running the tap in the sink too (hoping to kickstart heating somewhere, while feeling guilty about wasting water!). Nothing. When I called housekeeping, I got the operator who said he’d send someone “to show me how to use the shower”!! That was patronising and deflected fault from them to me, which is ridiculous. As a middle-aged frequent traveler, I’ve handled hotels and showers across 50+ countries: “it’s not me it’s you”. Someone checked it out, agreed it was cold, thought it might have been wrongly installed, yet said there was nothing he could do and would let the front desk know. They called and sent someone else, who tried his best and managed to reset it by 10 degrees, to a temperature still less than the minimum temperature required by NY regulations for landlords. All this while, I’d been browsing for other hotel rooms because in addition to this issue, the room was freezing even after switching off the air conditioning. When all you want is a hot shower and sleep, and can’t get that at a hotel you paid almost $500 for, you’d even consider moving at 1am after a very long journey! I was too exhausted, and finally opted to settle for the slight improvement rather than wander NY at that hour. Having wasted so much time, I thought I’d order breakfast through room service as a “wake up call” to ensure I didn’t miss my meeting. Guess what? No room service menu in the room, no breakfast card to hang on the door. I tried calling room service, no response to several calls. I then tried checking the TV for a menu, and they only had options for dinner (5-11pm) and nothing else. No late night service, no breakfast options. This is a hotel whose main reason for existence is the United Nations next door, with diplomats and international travelers arriving and departing round the clock, and they don’t cater outside of 5-11pm?? This makes no sense. Other issues: there was a cavity where a fridge/mini bar should been, and a “potential door” propped up behind it (images attached). There’s tea/coffee sachets, no kettle, no spoons, no creamers or sugar, no bottles of water. No bathrobe, no slippers, no stationery, nothing. This is the room time forgot. There’s a sign on the 37th floor saying it’s under renovation. You only see this when you exit the elevator. Nothing in the lobby, no mention at check in, and certainly nothing on the website, let alone a reasonable price to compensate. Yet, so many of these issues stem from neglect rather than a botched/incomplete renovation effort.I’ve never stayed in a hotel this expensive, yet got so little. I’ve stayed at Travelodges and cheap motels during sold out conferences like SXSW and got better amenities and service. This is a cruel, cruel joke. Except it isn’t remotely funny. I will never use the Hilton again, anywhere, on principle. This is unacceptable. I need to stay another night after all, but I’m glad I didn’t extend till I got here. I’ll give my business to absolutely anywhere rather than this. I now have 5 hours before my UN meeting, so that’s shot too. Thanks, Hilton!! You can have 2* for the location that I needed, but it was a fail on every other count. Shocking.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Our room was not available or clean until hours after check in. Staff was generally unfriendly and unaccommodating. Check in is a slow process and staff at the ambassador lounge were both unprofessional and incompetent than.That said, the rooms were clean and nice with great views.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I was a solo female traveler. I stayed at this hotel because I had a transit in NYC in the middle of a long trip. I hate to say this but the bellmen at this Millennium Hilton hotel were all worst than any of the Uber or cab drivers that helped me along the way. The front desk was also no better.I arrived late afternoon, and after I got off my Uber, a bellman saw me but pretended he didn't see me. I had to wave at him to get him to help me with my suitcases. I had four suitcases. He asked me "you need help?" Well yes obviously! He then walked to me very slowly with his cart with an unhappy face. Afterwards, he slammed my suitcases onto the cart, with wheels down. He pushed the cart into the lobby (literally 10m distance). While I was checking in, he interrupted me and told me his job is done, that someone else would help me take everything to my room if I needed it. I thanked him, but he didn't walk away. He continued standing there. At that moment, the front desk associate helping me check him said to me, "Robert has helped you, and his job is only until here". I nodded and turned my head to thank the bellman again. He still wouldn't leave. The front desk associate then said, "he helped you, so..." This was when I realized that both of them were expecting me to tip the bellman. I really did not want to tip anything because I didn't like the service, but I was obligated to do so! I took out a $1 note and gave it to him, and he frowned and still didn't move. I ignored him completely from then on and he finally left. I asked the front desk if any upgrades were available as I am a Hilton Honors Gold member, he just shucked his head without even checking the screen. I am very sure there are still available rooms for an upgrade because I booked my room on the day (only a couple hours before my arrival) and I saw all sorts of rooms still available for booking. Even if everything is really sold out, I would expect the associate to look into possibilities first before relentlessly turning me down. Furthermore, I did call the hotel right after I made the booking (so around midday) to ask if they could upgrade me, and the person who answered the phone said they will, and that I will get it during check in. The person I spoke to on the line was also a lot more polite than the person helping me at the front desk. The next morning as I was leaving, I brought all four pieces of luggage down to the ground level. This hotel has two wings and the wing I stayed at is a short distance away from the concierge. Three bellmen walked past me and no one offered to help me with my luggages. All in all, I couldn't understand why all the staff working at this hotel seemed very unhappy. Every Uber driver that I came across during the trip would voluntarily leave their car seats to help me load and unload luggages, with a big smile on their faces. I felt very sad that I booked a Hilton property and felt less welcomed by the staff there than the Uber drivers. The front desk even pressured me to tip when he clearly did not know what kind of service I had experienced. I will not stay at this hotel again, and I do not recommend anyone who cares about service and hospitality to come here.
user_name:
Lin D
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We reserved a city view, corner unit with a king-sized bed on the 33rd floor. The room was clean with a pleasant interior. The view was stunning! This added even more flavor to our travel experience. Breakfast was hearty and tasty. Hotel service was excellent! The hotel is within walking distance to the most well-known attractions.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Was below average, I had a better experience in Hilton Toronto. The room had hair and lipstick marks on window and sofa had a weird smell. I expected better with the amount it cost me for the corner room.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite on the 37th floor of the hotel and the views were stunning ! Although frequently in NY, this is the best views i ever experienced in an hotel - I could have spent hours starring though the windows at different time of days ! The 4 rather than a 5 rating reflect the room being a bit tired - carpet was threading in a view place and the decor overall is very 80’s.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Excellent stay!!! Staff was very professional and extremely helpful including Patrick who we met at the front entry. He had a warm smile and asked how he could help us. Turns out he books the rooms and had put us in the presidential suite! I just had to give him a hug to say thanks. Views were incredible! Thanks Hilton staff for allowing us to have a pleasant stay in a luxurious hotel. I travel frequently and stay at different Hilton properties. This is the best one yet!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The good: nice location, good coffee shop and fitness center. The fitness center has good and new machines, cooler, towels and everything you need. The coffee shop had good variety of pastries and coffee. (I've drunk there the best cappuccino ever). They handled a plumbing situation they had with our room not bad. The bad: The lobby is small and less than average looking. Hotel staff: especially in the reception/front desk most of the staff aren't very nice. Some treated us as we were customers in a supermarket. Breakfast is outrageously expensive and the quality of food they serve doesn't justify the high price. Pillows have pillowcases. Blankets don't have a cover. That was disgusting and not hygienic. The staff couldn't help us with info about transportation from the hotel to the airport. They said the guy who can help works at specific times but we didn't get the chance to see him/her before leaving, so we had to dig the internet to find ways to go to the airport.Also, be prepared to get your baggages sniffed by dogs before you enter the building and without notice. That's how guests are welcomed in this hotel. Humiliating and shocking I'd say.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: As a Hilton Diamond Member, who goes out of her way to stay at Hilton properties when I travel for business or pleasure, I was very disappointed with my stay here. I was assigned an upgraded room which was CLEARLY available on both the Hilton website and the hotel’s own website for he length of my stay. I confirmed my upgraded room on my way from the airport to the hotel. However, when I got to the hotel, the front desk took one look at my reservation, refused to check me into the hotel room I had been assigned and confirmed to and MOVED me to a different room!!! This was AFTER I showed her my app indicating the room I had already been assigned and confirmed to! She proceeded to tell me the hotel was booked, and when I went online to show her that Tre hotel was still showing rooms, including the one that she moved me out of, she proceeded to tell me that the website was wrong!! She then put me in a different room that was not really nice at all, and continued to insist that the hotel was completely sold out even when there were rooms available to book online, including the room she had removed me from! To appease me, she gave me coupons for a free hot breakfast, which was completely pathetic!! The fruits were not fresh and the offerings were very limited. I will NEVER stay here again!! I should have known this the last time I stayed here and was treated rudely at the Executive Lounge that this was NOT the Hilton to stay at!! In fact, I’ve already cancelled my next reservation and opted to stay someplace else!! Totally not worth the money or the aggravation. If you are Hilton Diamond, find someplace else, or consider switching your loyalty to a different hotel chain!!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Don’t stay here as a diamond member. You’ll get an ugly room. Don’t even think about getting an upgrade. You will be charged for an ugly breakfast. Nobody told us that breakfast is not free as usual in the main restaurant... You will be charged for internet. Nobody gave us the information that we can’t log in with our room details as usual... And so on. This hotel is cheating you from the beginning. As nobody is answering my calls I’d need help from Amex now to cancel the credit card transaction they took fraudulently from my card. Treat your members better than this and don’t come out here with a silly reply. This is absolutely not acceptable.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Room clean and housekeeping excellent, felt check in could have been more friendlier. Great location and lots of great places for breakfast nearby. Amazing views of the Hudson River from room. Prices for food in hotel overpriced was $80 for 2 chicken wings starter and one portion of fries with 2 beers and a coke! Doormen were lovely very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: What an absolutely amazing hotel. From the minute we arrived, I knew we had picked the right one. It's close enough to walk to everything but far enough away from the hustle and bustle. Every member of staff we met were so friendly & helpful. The room was so much bigger than I expected but the highlight is THAT VIEW it's out of this world. I woke up to the sight of The Empire State building without lifting my head off the pillow, just breathtaking. I can't wait to return to NYC and I will without a doubt book this hotel again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I couldn’t decide if I wanted to stay in Times Square of off the path a bit. Glad I decided to stay here. It didn’t have all the tourist traffic and the staff was amazing. Robert the doorman provided incredible restaurant suggestions and knew us by name after the first interaction. I had planned to stay at another hotel at the end of my trip to check out a different part of the city but we liked it so much we decided to stay. Will definitely return.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: You can not get a better location right by the east river next to United Nations a few minutes walk from attractions Central Park Times Square grand central terminal.When I first read about the hotel it said it was built in the early 70s but you would never think that as it looks modern and up to date. Well worth a visit and I look forward to revisiting soon.
user_name:
stevegG428AN
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I first visited this landmark skyscraper hotel 35 years ago when it was sparkling and new (before Hilton). While the views are still spectacular, the property itself has not aged very well. The now historic glass and mirror lobby, seemingly untouched, still gives the impression that you have entered a 1980's discotheque (not that this is necessarily a bad thing!). It was disappointing to see lackadaisical maintenance in public areas, e.g., lobby and hallway carpeting was extensively stained. The narrow room corridors, festooned in charcoal gray wallpaper, had a somewhat foreboding, prison-like quality. And, room service trays, carts and random glasses and dishes scattered throughout the hallways did not help. My tastefully renovated room on the 32nd floor, decent size by New York standards, was clean but very basic and mostly unremarkable. It took quite awhile for the room to cool down. The bed was comfortable yet unadorned. The tight bathroom was not at all luxurious with a compact toilet and bathtub. The illuminated makeup mirror was a nice touch.Service was merely adequate. I arrived before I could check-in so I left my small suitcase with the bellman. When I tried to retrieve it later, the bell staff was first unable to find it. Needless to say, I began to panic. They even asked me to help them look for it in the storage closet! Finally, after several nerve wracking minutes, it was located behind several other bags.The Millennium Hilton One UN Plaza has a wonderful location that's far enough from the midtown hustle and bustle but still close enough to everything. If you can snag a good room rate and your expectations are modest, this hotel is a good value. And, of course, you are guaranteed to get those great views. Now, if they'd only clean those windows once in a while, this might become a great hotel again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Wow! Fantastic experience! The views from Millenium Hilton are absolutely spectacular! Amazing location right next to United Nations we got City Views bus tour and they dropped us off right in front of hotel! Thank you for the hospitality Millenium Hilton!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Terrible experience. Upgraded me as diamond to a room with one bed instead of two. Needed two beds so had to wait and call 5x to ask for a new room. They took forever even though i said I had to leave for my birthday dinner at 6:30pm. Couldn't unpack or get ready. They said the key to the new room was being sent up so I waited and waited. Finally asked to talk to a manager who was so rude. Said I reserved a one bed room which she later realized was not on the reservation and instead of apologizing and fixing it she moved me to an even smaller room after waiting an hour with two small beds almost touching. I had no time to even complain bc I was already half an hour late to my own birthday party. She also didn't come out when i stopped by on my way out and asked to speak to her. She had them say she was busy though i could see her sitting in the back. In all my years as diamond and staying at hundreds of Hilton's this was the worst experience I've ever had. Cannot believe the managers attitude after the mistake was the hotels. Oh well. Never returning.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The room was perfect and comfortable, the view amazing and the hotel very clean and in a very nice location. Quiet but not too far from the center.We definitely recommend it for families or couples! Can’t wait to be back!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: When in New York and you are in midtown, you want a facility that has an excellent location, restaurant and service. The Millennium is located directly across from the United Nations. The restaurant and bar is excellent with great service. The rooms are up to date, comfortable and clean. Service is excellent. The staff are attentive, professional and responsive. If you want a great view stay one of the upper floors and you can see midtown New York.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We are a family of four and have just come back from a 5-night stay in New York. The Millennium Hilton is perfectly placed at the quiet end of 44th street and 1st Avenue. We booked a very competitive deal with BA, which is much much cheaper than booking flights and hotel separately. I had phoned the hotel a couple of days ahead to specifically ask for rooms with a view over Manhattan. Unfortunately, upon our arrival late on Sunday we were given two rooms with a side view of the East River (which was lovely), but also a full view of a building site! Disappointed, as we were visiting New York on a special occasion (our silver wedding anniversary), I went back to the lobby and spoke to Taricia (I think that was her name). She was super helpful and got us a much larger room in the front building facing the New York skyline. What a treat!All in all everyone of the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Here are a few tips to make your stay even better:Get a Hilton’s Honours membership (very easy to set up via your mobile). You get lots of perks, like free WiFi in your room, late check out (1pm) etc. The breakfast in the hotel is too expensive (even for New York standards). However, they have a coffee shop downstairs in the lobby which is open from six every morning and offers delicious pastries and coffee to take away (or to our room to have breakfast in bed every morning!) Marvellous! If you fancy a more substantial breakfast or want to experience a proper New York Diner, visit John’s Diner on the corner of 44th street and 2nd Ave. Their special omelette with home fried potatoes or their granola with Greek Yoghurt and fresh fruit are amazing!If you have a late flight home like us, don’t bother getting a late checkout, which can set you back $100 to keep your room until 4pm. The reception will store your luggage for you and will give you a key to the restrooms to freshen up or get changed. We definitely would stay at the Millennium Hilton One UN Plaza again! Thank you to all the staff who made our stay so special!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Generally the hotel experience was good. It's location is superb and in close proximity to almost every place in Manhattan. You can actually walk to most places. Staff were generally friendly and helpful with information. Breakfast was good.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: As a loyal Hilton member, I was curious how the Millenium would fare for a recent business trip. The hotel did not disappoint! I was very pleased with my room. I stayed on the 29th floor in a standard king room. The room was super clean and modern. I thoroughly enjoyed the large bathroom along with the automated toilet. The views from this room of the river and the skyline were great. There was a huge walk-in closet with a safe. The floor was quiet and afforded me good sleep quality.The hotel neighborhood with the proximity of the UN was very convenient, and there were many restaurants and access to Grand Central. The coffee shop was handy as well. The lobby area was a little sparse, and there was no lobby bar. I would easily stay at this hotel again for its overall value. I've stayed in other hotels in and around the city, and this one is by far the best.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My wife and I just spent the weekend at the Millennium Hilton-New York. Situated right across the street from the United Nations, it is a perfect location to enjoy all that the city has to offer. The room, provided a beautiful view of the East River; the staff were welcoming and attentive; and the restaurant offered a variety of fine food [especially the duck). Close to city buses and taxis; just 4 blocks from Grand Central Station for the subway.A nice choice if you want to splurge and spend a really special weekend in "The Big Apple".

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I stay at this hotel every time I am in NYC and it is the best! I stay at Hilton branded hotels all around the country for work and pleasure and this one has by far the best customer service and experience. Everyone I come into contact with when I stay there is always friendly. It starts with Racquell who is incredible at the front desk, she is always there to greet me with a smile and make the check-in process perfect. Dorca helped me check in last week and she as awesome also! Racquell even remembered that it was my mom's birthday and treated her extra special! I always come back because of Racquell and the rest of the crew that make me experience great! The rooms are awesome too, they are spacious and offer beautiful views of NYC. The location is great too, a quick an easy walk to Grand Central. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in NYC!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Very good location, nice accommodation with wonderfull view.I was disapointed with the service of reception desk, otherwise the service was ok. Just a note : maids nocked on our door quite early in the morning, in order to make-up the room.Wi-fi was free everywhere in the hotel and quite satisfactory and quick.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Do not valet your car. $85 per night. Very difficult to valet your car. Impossible to retrieve your car. Find a lot or Park in the street. 2nd day my car was delivered smelly and seat heaters were on like someone sleeping in it. Same day on return no valet. Waiting for a while then I noticed a guy in uniform talking to 2 girls for 10 minutes. He finally came over and told me he was the valet. 20 minutes later I went downstairs to eat. My car was still parked with the alarm sounding. I went to investigate when a different employee was running to the car with the keys to turn off the alarm. I entered. Th e lobby & the same valet was joking with the desk crew how he activated the alarm by mistake. Next day waited 20 minutes. Car arrived with seat heaters on again. Next day at 6:35am called for my car to be delivered. I arrived at 6:45 and my car was curbside & no keys or valet. Several times the desk clerk said he was coming. At 7:05 the valet showed up and apologized saying he just went on duty. So the valet went off duty without waiting for me or his relief. I entered the car and the seat heaters were on again and I was lower on gas methane when I parked it.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great stay with my husband at this hotel. The location was great and an easy 10 minute walk to Grand Central and about 20 minutes to Times Square. All the staff were always very welcoming and friendly and it was a great location to explore the city from. Housekeeping were great and our room was spotless each day!! We had a fabulous trip and would certainly recommend this property again. Thank you!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Very happy with this hotel choice for a stay in midtown. It's surrounded by a decent few streets and quite close to Grand Central for access to subway. Breakfast is an amazing buffet but a little pricey in my opinion, even for Manhattan. Only other suggestion is the room service could put more creamer or milk and a few more tea bags in rooms as you don't get much.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed for one night, late check-in with no problems, friendly welcome at reception on a cold wet night after an afternoon of flight delays. Room: Bed super comfortable, lovely view of the river. Convenient that outlets were available everywhere to charge all my devices. Got a special rate that came with complimentary in-room wifi which was a nice surprise, no problems with connection or speed. Quiet despite having room close to the elevators - maybe due to the professional-types who stay here? Not complaining, in any case.Restaurant: Had breakfast at the restaurant downstairs. Choice of the breakfast buffet (stupid expensive, huge choice of hot and cold items but a normal person can't possibly eat that much to be worth the cost) or à la carte (still overpriced, for food that tries to be fancy but still tastes like cardboard). Slow, indifferent service. Didn't help that the woman beside me was watching videos on her phone at high volume, and the staff didn't tell her to stop disturbing other clients even though they were around. Recommend you skip and find somewhere else to eat, especially if you're in a hurry.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great staff and location. Extremely hospitable team. Hotel a bit dated but very safe. Nice facilities and executive lounge. Fun to see everyone coming and going from so many different countries. Felt like family.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Awesome!! Great beds,pillows and staff... nothing better than these views. Excellent staff and location, modern amenities and very clean. Cafe on lobby level great for morning espressos and baked goods. All in all a 5 star rating from us.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The views, the service, the restaurant for dinner... a perfect NYC stay! Better views than any other NYC hotel. From my room I could see Empire State Building and Chrysler Building! Can’t wait to come back.
user_name:
Ltren22
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This was probably one of the best hotels I’ve stayed at. From arrival to departure, the entire team of hotel staff was extremely gracious and made my friends and me feel very welcome. The views from the rooms are phenomenal. As a Hilton Honors member, we were able to take advantage of the Skyline loving and enjoyed complimentary breakfast. The hotel is very clean. It’s centrally located. I’d highly recommend this hotel to anybody taking a business or pleasure trip.
user_location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
user_name:
739AngelaC
Washington, District of Columbia, United States

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We had an amazing night in this hotel in the two story king loft. It's one of the most gorgeous spaces I have ever stayed in. Increeibly spacious, with a great view of Manhattan from basically every area of the room. The bed was super comfortable as well. The room looked even more gorgeous than on the official pictures provided by the hotel's page and booking. Just amazing suite!!!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Avoid. Serious facility and service issues. There are surely much better choices. Tiny rooms, 1970’s decor, non traditional Hilton Honors application (free breakfast for diamonds isn’t free), maintenance issues. I didn’t leave angry, I just left shocked. I will say the bell staff were top notch.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The property and the staff are very nice and the location can't be beat. The arrangements for a business breakfast, however, were bungled, the room I had reserved was not available when I checked in, and my efforts to resolve an inaccurate charge has yet to be addressed satisfactorily.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: 4 stars for the room2 stars for the staffCheck-In/Check-OutChecking In was pretty standard and check out was as easy as A B C. No problems!The RoomThe room was comfortable with plenty of sunlight coming in. We got a room that has the empire state building, it was pretty nice. Standard TV and the bed was firm. The BathroomThe bathroom got a bathtub and it was clean. Big mirrors and overall it was a nice clean bathroom. Restaurant/EntertainmentThere is a cafe on site where you can get coffee and light pastries. Hotel Service/AmenitiesStaff was not friendly at all. We are staying at Hilton and more than ever it was right next to the UN Plaza, you would expect the staff was friendly but oh boy that was not the case. Wifi was not free in the room but free in public areas. Although, if you are a Hilton member you can get free wifi in the room. This is where the staff was unfriendly, so I called the concierge and told him that I am a member and I would like to know how to get the free wifi service in room. The concierge was talking really fast but I understand him perfectly. I was telling him that it didn't work and then he asked for my membership number and etc, in the end, he was just telling me to call the customer service to rectify my account (ridiculous just for wifi) Then my husband called again and the same thing happened to him. He was not happy so he went down instead to prove that we are members and this should be an easy process, if not what's the point of being a member? So the staff was telling him reasons why and then we said what's the point of being a member if your system doesn't recognize our membership? then the guy was maybe fed up and he just gave the code but he didn't look happy. I found this very unprofessional. I used to work in the hotel industry and I do deal with annoying customers but If I was in the staff shoes that were not acceptable both the concierge and whoever my husband spoke to. Furthermore, we were there during Christmas week, where tourist are everywhere and the staff were unfriendly at all. OverallIt was a great location to stay at if you're looking to stay away from the crowd and had a business trip to the UN. It is a 10-minute walk to Grand Central, 2 long blocks from the hotel. Duane Reade was nearby. Overall, I enjoyed the room but not the staff.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The check in here was fast and efficient although no help getting into the hotel, bellman hung outt into the hotel and the first one to greet us was securitty with the dog.Room was on high floor but located conveniently by the elevators. Layout of the room a bit bad for my husband who had to work and not desk in the room as tv ttook it up. Would be better if they hung the TTV on the wall so thatt the desk surface could be used. Had tto look for maid service daily. Requested them to clean room by calling as well as by asking the maid staff on the floor to no avail. Have to ask for water and coffee supplies daily. Service is rather lackadaisical here and not sure if they care about you. Although guest services was great at setting up hair appt. room Maintenance needs service as coffee area arborite is unglued and coffee all over the place. Bath tub is very shallow and very basic.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I've stayed at this hotel twice and remain incredibly impressed by the entire experience: clean rooms, stunning views of the city, and professional, responsive, friendly staff. They immediately resolved every small problem I ran into, from running extra coffee up to the room to helping me check in smoothly.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Wonderful experience at the Hilton located at One UN Plaza. All hospitality members were very professional and polite. The room was clean and fresh. The rooms are huge by NYC standard. Large comfortable bed, fine linens and comfortable pillows. Plus a desk, large TV and a chaise long. The bathroom was expansive and pleasantly fitted with quality towels and hygiene products. There was even a storage/wardrobe/safe room.Great location if you are interested in checking out the Roosevelt Tramway and Roosevelt Island, the UN and the Chrysler Building. Located an awesome Chinese take away called The East Palace at 819 2nd Ave. Hot, fresh, inexpensive food.FYI location was fine for us. We utilized the crosstown bus to transport ourselves to the Manhattan Port for a cruise. The bus cost $3.00 each. A huge savings from taking a taxi.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: On arrival three of the four elevators were not working in a crowded reception area.There was no hot water in the morning, the bathroom tiles were loose, the shower flooded the bathroom and the shower head could not be retained in the socket provided. Light bulbs were not working in the bedroom and our complaints were met witrh indifference. Even by New York Standards, which I have visited over the past 50 years, this was A NEW LOW! Do not stay in this hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This review is overdue, as my husband and I stayed at the Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza twice last year - in July for a pre-wedding weekend of fun, and again in November for the actual wedding. We cannot say enough good things about our stay here. Some of the highlights:- Both rooms we stayed in, though in different parts of the hotel, had killer views. Photo attached is the sunrise view looking over the river.- The beds are incredibly comfortable, the bathrooms spacious and luxurious, and the amenities excellent. The rooms are modern yet cozy. The bridal suites on the 29th floor were incredible, everyone in the bridal party could not stop raving about them. Two floor suites, 360 degree views and every comfort you could want. Perfect for getting ready. - The showstopper was the Landmark Room where we had a cocktail party, and then took photos before the wedding ceremony. Again, jawdropping views - but also incredible service by the staff and an impressive buffet spread of delicious hors d'oeuvres. - Also should mention that everyone we encountered who worked at the hotel - from valet, to reception, to dining - was incredibly accommodating and couldn't have been nicer.Perfect city wedding destination! Thank you for a fantastic stay, and can't wait to return.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Just opposite the UN building so not difficult to locate but way east of Manhattan means there is some walking around if you want to get to mid town or Broadway, the amenities in the room and bathroom are new and touch screen enabled (lights and air con) however the carpeting shows some sign of wear but otherwise it does the job, my room was on 34 floor and got some fantastic views of the city , WIFI is good speed and check in staff was pleasant, overall it's a decent hotel to stay but if you are looking at exploring more vibrant bits of Manhattan i would recommend more mid town options , room is of good size.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great rooms with excellent views. Rooms also well furnished and nice and modern. It just seemed to lack a heart to the place. Not the most welcoming when you walk in nor felt as though a place to relax in the evening. Good location though for all of Manhattan.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed in an upgraded room on the fortieth floor with a gorgeous view of the river.Skyline Executive Lounge on 30th floor with spectacular views of the river and Tutor City Penthouses one one side and midtown on the other panarama.Manager Stanley was very gracious to me as a Diamond member.Ambassader Grill breakfast was an add on with Diamond status and included a hot breakfast that was out of this world. The cold/ continental breakfast was included in the Skyline Lounge for Diamond members. The lounge also hosts appetizers with wine, cheese, chicken wings, and fresh fruit at 5 pm for Diamond members.Thanks so much Stanley-

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I planned a dream trip to New York with my sister and picked this hotel based on reviews and rates. Absolutely no regrets! OMG All of the staff were SO FRIENDLY, room was perfect, the bed was comfy, the views were stunning! While we didn't stay in the room long (who sleeps in the city that doesn't sleep - on their first ever trip??), I absolutely would book this hotel again in a heartbeat!! Definitely recommend!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Staff was very pleasant and helpful and allowed us to check in early. The rooms are spacious and clean, not overly stylish, but nice and the bed was very comfortable. The area is very walkable and interesting

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Nice views from most of the rooms. Larger rooms than the average rooms in NYC. Very good shading and black-out in curtains if you cannot sleep well with daylight. It is not recently refurbished and some furniture seem overused. We didn't have breakfast as it was $50/day/person!!!!Helpful personnel. Good and convenient location avoiding the noise of more central spots. I would choose it again in the next NYC trip.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great hotel located across the UN. The rooms are spacious which is rare for NYC and the views are impeccable. I got a room where I could see my favorite view (Chrysler and Empire State buildings) and the river. Phenomenal. The staff went above and beyond and provided extra treats. I was there for a UN meeting and stayed for 10 days.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Huge rooms by NYC standardsAll the features desired in a business hotel.Close to subway, ferry, and restaurant choicesPurchased room thru Cancelon and got a great rate.Easy to use consolidatorI'll use them again

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: While the view is extraordinary, everything else was substandard at the Millenium Hilton New York One UN Plaza. I probably would have saved 1/2 the amount at a competing hotel, which is a block or two from this hotel and probably would have gotten better service. Refrigerator model/holding dry and wet goods is totally inadequate, which is the first time I saw that. Towels are not soft and fluffy as one would expect at a Hilton. There is no access to ice for cold beverages. And the closet that houses the microwave is problematic and does not allow for easy access. The entire design of the kitchen and dining room area is user unfriendly. The light over the dining room table is low enough to cause physical injury, which was experienced by one of our companions. My experience at this Hilton property has diminished my expectations of receiving a high caliber of service of the Hilton brand. Extremely disappointing!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Hotel in a good location near Chrysler building and Grand Central staition, The hotel staff very friendly and the hotel is very clean. We had a fantastic time in New York and this hotel was a great base.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: As a Hilton Diamond member who travels to New York City approx 2X each month, I’ve likely stayed at every Hilton property in the city. First and foremost - I was thrilled with the front desk service by Brandon. Efficient, empathetic, and exactly the quality of engagement and good dude in my corner vibe we all desire in a fine hotel experience but rarely encounter. Kudos Brandon for proactively seeking to match my needs to the best room for me, and for the effort - given I booked less than an hour prior to arrival.Despite Brandon’s downplay and eagerness to do more next time with more notice - The room was fantastic. Large, modern, very clean, and vastly superior to many of the other Hilton brand options I usually choose.Super happy with the executive lounge service, security, quality, and overall experience.New go to property in NYC. For sure.Nice job team Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Greeted by a bomb-stiffing mutt euphemistically referred to as "The Welcome Wagging". While the canine performed its assigned tasks with greater ease and grace than its rather dower handler, our encounters with the bell staff could not have been more helpful and cordial. Check-in occurred in a manner so quick, pleasant and efficient I hardly recall the event.But the toilet roll dispenser fell apart during our short stay and 35 minutes before checkout deadline the power went out in our room. Speculation as to whether ‘lights out’ was a hint that our welcome was about to expire was only a fleeting thought. Fortunately, daylight saved the day and we able to promptly retreat to the hallway and vacate the room. For me breakfast is a perfunctory event meant to provide only the needed sustenance and introspective moments to shake off the last vestiges of disrupted sleep. Hilton recognizes breakfast as the perfect opportunity to save its guests from starvation, even if its prices bankrupt them in the process. But I’m just a simple ham and eggs kind-a-guy better able to enjoy a sit down meal delivered with the warmth and congeniality of a New York waitress in the greasy spoon café around the corner. "Well, what'll it be?”

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed for two night.Over all good experience. Clean room. good view. Unfortunately windows are small so you have to work to see the view.Exercise floor is is good with great view made me exercise more. That had big windows. they had no Microwave which they need to put in room. Now it is pretty much standard.only two elevator goes to Gym but nothing there to tell customer about it caused lot of confusion.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I travel to NY for business a couple times per month, and this hotel is a favorite. Due to its proximity to the U.N., it's not unusual for a working dog to need to check your bag before entry. Check in is typically efficient, and check out is always a breeze. There's one particular staff member who works the front desk who remembers me and makes a special point to make me feel welcome each time he sees me. Rooms are modern and spacious with good views. Bathrooms are great with excellent towels and bath products. TVs are great with plenty of outlets. Location is good with great proximity to restaurants. It is Manhattan after all. Definitely a great place to stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Warm, friendly clean hotel away from Time Square hustle and bustle but within easy walking distance from Grand Central. Good choice of diners close by for breakfast and alike if you don't want to eat at the hotel.Would reccomend.
user_name:
Seaside19688585614
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I stayed here from April 13-16 with my husband and our 2 kids. Originally the reservation was only for my husband and I but due to some last minute changes we had to bring the kids along. I emailed the hotel to find out if they could add the kids on to our existing reservation without us having to cancel and rebook and they did it with no problems. When we arrived we were greeted by one of the bellmen and he was very nice. Asked us where we were from and even joked with my husband telling him that he looked like one of the famous basketball players. The bomb sniffing dog was a treat too. I forgot his name but we were allowed to pet him. He was so adorable. We arrived at the hotel a little before 2 and even though I knew check in was at 4 I decided to go up to the desk to see if any rooms were available. To my surprise they did have a room ready and we were able to go directly upstairs. We were on the 28th floor and the view was absolutely amazing. I had requested an upgrade for a 2 bedroom but it wasn’t available. That didn’t even matter because our king suite was just like a 2 bedroom in my eyes. The living room had a pullout sofa bed, an awesome view for the kids and they even had their own bathroom and closet space. There was also a mini fridge in there. The master bed room had a good view as well with our own bathroom and closet. Omg and the heated toilet seats...never thought I would say this but they were so much fun lol! Clearly we don’t get out much because it was our first time seeing heated toilet seats with all the other great features and even had a remote for it. I believe the next day was when I got a knock at the door and someone brought up a tray with a small bottle of wine, some macaroons, and a card that said happy birthday. Absolutely blown away by this. Even though my birthday wasn’t until the 25th. It shows they took the time to acknowledge that and send up a treat. Hilton hotels are the only hotels I stay at and I’ve never gotten this before even when I told them I came to celebrate a special occasion. This hotel gets my stamp of approval. Lovely people throughout the hotel. Not a complaint to say and I will be returning here next year. Thank you all for an amazing visit!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We went for a 5 night break. The hotel is right by the UN and a great spot to explore Manhattan. We were able to walk everywhere from here which we love to do and there are good bars and restaurants close by.On arrival we had an issue with our room which was sorted out quickly and brilliantly. With breakfast vouchers thrown in by way of apology. That set the tone for our experience of the service, which was friendly, quick and helpful.The room was a good size with a stunning view of the skyline. Breakfast was excellent, with lots of choice and good service.For Hilton Honours members there is a lounge but other than the view I think it is disappointing. In need of refurbishment and only offering a limited treat ( discounted rather than free drinks). We benefited from a discounted rate that the Hilton offer because we had seen a better rate on a website, so the Hilton matched the price and then took 25% off. It made this trip great value for money.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We spend 4 days during Easter and used this hotel as bases. In my view not the Hilton quality you see in Europe. Plus we got robbed already in the first 5 min after arriving. 3 bottles of still water and a coke for $20. In a supermarket close by I paid 7 $7 for 16 bottles of water. Also ridiculous price for breakfast. I travel every week for almost 30 years and never paid this amount of money for breakfast. Not even in Monaco.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Excellent deal booked with BA flight. Right next to UN so probably very busy and expensive when UN is in session. Location gives superb views from south facing rooms and a sense of space as it is along side the East River. This does mean it is 5 blocks from the Times Square hub of activities. 12USD Taxi, or get on the Hop on-off Bus outside the UN, or walk. Never felt unsafe walking anywhere in Manhattan, although we were back before midnight. 55min walk to the Met Museum alongside Central Park gives an idea of scale to first time visitors. If using Yellow Cabs, do not expect any conversation with drivers, the attitude is generally that they are doing you a favour, you will also need the street number and nearest avenue number/name where you want to be dropped. Beds were large and very comfortable, housekeeping efficient. Decent, but very expensive breakfast available, we just grabbed a coffee and pastry from the good coffee bar in the (small) lounge most days, cost around 10USD. You might want to find another place to stock up with water or juice as the pricing was comical, ( 4USD for small water). Reception and room service was no problem, but watch out for the clown in the top hat and cape who “allocates” you a taxi after check out, he REALLY wants his tip. Overall a worthy 5 stars, probably 4 if you had a north facing room.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I travelled with my husband and a toddler. This hotel was in an excellent location (about 10 minutes walk from Grand Central). We had a spacious room with a great view. My toddler loved looking out the window at the Empire State Building!! The room was good value for money compared to other hotels we looked at.Our only complaints are on arrival and departure - On arrival, after a long flight from London, we had to wait for half an hour at 10pm for a crib to be delivered to our room. I had called ahead and asked for this to be there when we arrived. Secondly, when we left, we were packing up the stroller and got hassled by the concierge that we were 2 minutes late. We then had to ask the bell boy to help us with our bags and he was incredibly rude to us in doing so. This made us leave stressed and unhappy. The staff on duty on Monday 19th April around 5pm did not give us the service we would have expected.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel is located right opposite the UN building and next door to Unicef, a couple of blocks takes you to grand central and 42nd street. It is also pretty close to Times Square.Before my flight left the UK I checked in using the Hilton App and requested the digital key. By the time I landed at JFK I had a notification advising my room number and that it was ready, not bad for midday considering check in is at 4pm. It seems to pay using the app.I went straight to my room on 34th floor which was a good size, with a great view over Manhattan. Comfortable bed with lovely clean bed linen, large TV and illy coffee maker. The bathroom was large with plenty of amenities and towels, again good quality and not thread bare.Indulged in the buffet breakfast in the hotel restaurant which was really good but seriously in all my travels I have never paid $45 for breakfast, in my opinion overpriced, there are loads of places a few minutes walk away where you can get breakfast.Overall the hotel is great.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: First time in NYC, stayed at Millennium Hilton, excellent Hotel and location, short walk to Times Square, quiet location was a plus!! staff was great and helpful, will always stay here when we visit NYC

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: In a convenient spot with decent sized rooms and clean. Only had coffee there which was lovely and staff were helpful. Decor a bit dated and dark but generally okay place. Probably wouldn’t stay again as more to choose in NY but a decent Hilton

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We arrived in the hotel having travelled several hours including two hours trying to get through US Customs and a delayed car pick up. Arrived at the hotel tired and looking forward to getting into the suite which we had had confirmation of an upgrade to. However, when we checked into our room it was a king room. We needed a room with two beds or a separate sleeping / living area. I went downstairs to reception to get this sorted. Not particularly friendly reception staff. However, I then met Patrick who had dealt with my reservation. He showed me the original "double double" room I had booked and clearly it did not have the view or the amenities of the room we had been allocated with its view of the Chrysler Building or Empire State Building. The suite was not available, however we had a lovely room with a pull out sofa which housekeeping made up for us each day. We were also given complimentary access to the Executive Lounge where we had continental breakfast and drinks / canapes in the evening. This was ideal for us as it was next door to our room and we could go in for a drink or a coffee at any time during the day. POSITIVES: Super bathroom (no bathtub, but walk in shower); Illly coffeemaker - but take your own milk or cream and store in the fridge; spotlessly clean; staff in the lounge area and housekeeping were friendly and helpful; location - very quiet even being next to lifts we heard no noise from outside or in the hotel.NEGATIVES: The hotel is a bit dated with very strange decor colours, unless brown/grey/orange is your thing. This is NOT a new hotel and maybe some upgrading is due again.On balance, I would stay here again as the positives definitely outweighed any negatives. Star of the show was Patrick Goad who arranged for fizz and desserts to be sent to the room on our first evening as a welcome to my daughter for her special birthday.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: For a recent weekend trip in March I wanted to give us a special treat and booked a double-floor suite (in doing so I was really guided by the online foto of the hotels own website next to the `offer` of 350$ per night.Arriving at 12:30 pm we were informed that the room is "not yet ready" and we should try again at 14:00. We walked the nighbourhod (UN; 10 mins walk to Grand Central terminal etc) amd returned at 14:00 - to be told that check-in time for this hotel is 16:00. We changed our day-plan (and finally checked in late afternoon). Watch-out: the official check-ou time of this hotel is 11:00 am!We were quite surprised that we got a junior suite upon check-in - nothing of that two-floor room with its nice warm colours and the view I had booked. That room was `not available` but this one was presented as an "equivalent" - it did have a separate sitting room and a `kitchenette` built into a wardrobe. Unfortunately it didn't have the view I was hoping for - the view from the bedroom was straight against the façade of the hotel`s other wing ("UN DC 1") . Now, from THAT one there IS a view of the UN, its gardens, the East River and Queens as you can see from the hotel`s gym which is in the UN DC1 wing. When you book and want a view, ask for the UN 1 wing.The mentioned `gym`: friends of mine who stayed here before told me ahead that their nice pool (with a view!) was closed for good, so I went for the gym. There is no other connection between the wings than through the (dark) lobby, which can be a bit of a nuisance but `ok`, except that when you return you do so pitch-wet and sweaty after a full work-out, as that gym has no showers - whatsoever. Incredible! What is also quite surprising: the gym has just 7 cardio-equipments (3 treadmills, 2 bikes and 2 elliptical walkers) and a few weightlifting items) and is rater small for a hotel this huge of a size, but it has a stunning 149 lockers in the male changing room only. I suppose another 150-or-so in the female locker as well, and I wonder why so many as all cardio-equipments were already full on a Saturday morning at 09:00. My `take` is that the gym is open to hotel-external non-guests as well, and I don't dare to imagine a busy Thursday after-office time in-there.Skip the breakfast in the windowless "Ambassador Grill" - not worth the price (of 39++). In summary: it is kind-of `ok-ish` if you don't expect too much, but you should ask for a definite view in the DC one-building ahead of time.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Cannot fault this hotel! Everything was amazing from the staff to the room and the service. We will definitely be staying here when we come back to New York! The location was great, we managed to walk everywhere with no problems except down to Battery Park as it’s quite far away to walk. Cannot thank the hotel enough for making our stay so enjoyable!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This property has the potential to be so much better. With the great location on E44, over looking the Hudson, handy enough to most places. The Hilton team were all friendly and courteous. However, it’s all of the small things that just add up....asking for the shower handle to be fixed and coming back to find that it still falls off. Forgetting to replenish the amenities such as the body wash, charging $5 for a glass of wine in the Hilton Honours Lounge-I’ve stayed at a number of Hilton Hotels and have never come across that before across Asia, Europe and more recently Mexico.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed at this well located hotel in mid town NYC.Well located near grand central station and 20 min walk to Time Square. I highly recommend this hotel for tourists as it is clean and fab location near all big attractions.It is more catered for business travellers however suited us.It was clean,quiet and staff were very helpful.NYC was beautiful at this time of the year but need warm clothes.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Best bang for the buck if you are looking for a family suite for vacation or events. The location is perfectly central and the views are spectacular. The hotel staff is delightful, especially housekeeping, and the accommodations were perfect for our needs.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We arrived late at night from Scotland for the Tartan Parade. It was my wife’s birthday on the 9th so I wanted a special experience for her. Wow did your team deliver. A bit of advance planning with great help from your starman Gerry Mercado’s. He was the consummate professional ensuring she had a surprise champagne breakfast in the grill. We had super help from Dorca in getting our accommodation sorted and she moved heaven and earth for us. Well assisted by Patrick Goad. Can’t thank Dorca enough for her choice of one bedroomed suite. Superb.The waiting team were efficient and slick at breakfast. In the evening your starmen in the grill were the amiable and entertains Jeff Gould and Ed Valle. They looked after us sublimely. Food was great too so I’m writing in the foyer before our pick up to JFK feeling blessed you guys were the best I’ve encountered in donkeys years of travelling the globe. You gave us a perfect New York experience that ensures when we come back we will feel like we are coming home to you. I can not recommend you highly enough. Brilliant, pure brilliant. A thousand thanks.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel is less than a block from the UN buildings, a block from the Chrysler building and a short walk to great pubs and restaurants and the iconic New York sights. The hotel is beautiful and clean with amazing views of the Hudson River and Long Island. Rooms are large and spacious.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Travel Agent Review:Walk into a nice lobby, staff are really helpful. I was on the 34th floor (room 308). Had a stunning view out over the east river, the room was a nice size, big comfy bed, TV/aircon all worked fine. If I'm being REALLY picky the bath tub was a little small, but fine for a few nights. You have to pay extra for WiFi in the room which is a bit of a joke these days, however if you sign up to a free hilton membership thing, they take the charge off your room. If you are a smoker, the whole road outside the hotel is non-smoking, so you have to walk about 100m to have a cigarette. Not the end of the world, but a bit of a pain if you're popping out for a quick one from your room. Location is pretty good if you dont mind doing a bit of walking. I walked from the hotel to central park, then right down to the One World Trade Centre, and back again, so it is doable but incredibly long. You're roughly about 10 minutes away from Grand Central station, probably 15-20 minutes to Times Square. I didnt try any of the food at the hotel, so can't comment.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed for 5 nights in March and the room at lovely views over towards the UN building and the East River with views south over Manhattan where you could see the Empire State Building, Chrysler Building and with the new tower down by the 9/11 museum in the distance . The views were lovely during the day but at night they were spectacular.The facilities in the room were great with a very large TV, small fridge and one of the most comfortable beds I've slept in when staying in a hotel. The staff in the hotel were very friendly and extremely helpful, with the staff at check in making the process very quick which was great after a long flight.Had tea and coffee making facilities in the room and this was replenished each day as were the toiletries which my wife loved.It is within easy walking distance of many of the attractions like the empire state building, grand Central Terminal, Central Park and times Square all within a out 15 to 25 mins walk.Would be happy to return for another stay and we've already begun to plan this.
user_name:
Fraser W
Glasgow, Scotland, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Clean room and bathroom.Reception desk staff warm and welcoming Good lighting in bathroom and bedroom Nice view especially at night Tv good size I like walk in closet Decent room size Nice having a coffee shop on site WiFi okHas Grill restaurant serves nice food Complimentary coffee n tea But why don’t NY hotels don’t give complimentary water?Hotel busy hiwevwr not too loud Business centre guy friendly Gym two parts weight training and Cardio and the cardio section too warm with no way to regulate, gym not busy machines ok.... My only negatives which are Under the bed was like many hotels; a bit neglected and was dusty and dirty.plus seating area in foyer/reception area smelt a bit musty

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Hotel accidentally put a bottle of wine in my room, I called, explained and they told me to enjoy it courtesy of the front desk.The room was modern, clean and easy to access; corner king 30th floor. Struggled with HH app for Wi-Fi though.The lobby was large with plenty of seating and the staff were able to deal with all requests. Baggage, transfers, toilets after checkout ext.The view from our room was excellent, a real highlight for the trip.Will stay again, particularly for the welcome dogs. Nice work guys.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Just back from a very nice stay at Millennium Hilton. We got a room in the 37th floor and the view was amazing. Big picture window as well. We had views of the east river, Brooklyn Bridge, Empire State and Chrysler Building. Couldn’t have asked for better. Room was very comfortable and bathroom looked brand new. The staff we came across were all very welcoming and helpful. Defo go back.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
