The room had a small fridge which was very handy to store drinks and snacks in. Room was very spacious also! The gym is on floor 27 with fantastic views as well! All that’s missing here is a pool! The lobby was modern and always busy with the small shop there, bar/restaurant was lovely with modern decor also. Large tv with good selection of channels and option to use Netflix. Bed was massive and very comfortable. Window only opens a tiny bit but aircon and heating facilities in room. Next time we travel to New York we will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Booked this hotel like nearly one Year before arrival & it was worth it! Booked a room on the corner of the building & we had an awesome view over Manhattan with direct view on Crysler and Empire State building and also on the River.It was very clean and the housekeeping did our room daily. Also it has a little Café where we bought our breakfast Daily.Highly recommend it!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My room on 17 floors made my stay perfect. As a diamond member, I was upgraded to a suite with an office room (where I was able to work) and a separate bedroom. 2 bathrooms are spacious and overall comfort is high. The only observation is about breakfast at the restaurant not included, as a diamond I was granted lounge access where is breakfast is good but basic choice. Thank you to the GM Stefan for ensuring a great experience

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We struggled between staying here or Times Square. We made a good choice. It was easy to get to Grand Central Station and thus the city was our Oyster. The rooms were clean and spacious. We had a fantastic corner room with great views. The only negative there were slack of drawers to put our clothes in. Had to use the closest shelf. The bed and pillows were up to Hilton standard.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We were just here in October. The area is nice and quiet (so glad that we didn't stay in the Times Square area - way too many people and this was in October). Walking distance to many restaurants, convenient stores and banks. We frequented the local store at the end of the block. They were open 24-hrs and had a cook ready to make whatever was on the menu above. If where we wanted to go was about mile, we walked (flat and easy walk), otherwise we took a cheap Uber/Lyft. I know...we didn't do the metro...but we've done it in a few countries overseas so it's gotta be the same, right? Our room was good size, clean and had a great view. I slept with the shades opened because of the view. (I joked with my husband to 'turn off the night light because it was too bright'). The staff was great and the pastry shop downstairs was good. I'd stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Let me begin with a disclaimer: I worked in the hotel and restaurant industry prior to becoming an O&G accountant. Plus, I’m a neat freak and very picky especially when it comes to lodging. The exterior was nice but kind of inconspicuous although it’s near the UN. Check in was quick. There is a little breakfast shop that had Ily coffee and various pastries that I’d rate a 10. The highlight of the room, however, was the corner room views of the river and the bathroom. I brought a black light (no critters, thank God!). But there were a lot of stains on the window settee (I didn’t touch it), dust on the nightstands, and no extra blankets on the bed. The bed was reasonably comfortable. There were stains on the carpet by desk that looked really questionable. I stayed without complaint because of the view and it was only a weekend trip. I did get a bit perturbed when I asked for a bucket of ice from restaurant services 10 minutes before closing and they said they were closed already. A front desk agent did get a bell man to bring it up and I was grateful. I got a pretty good rate for the location but I probably won’t return. A carpet upgrade, nice blankets for the beds, and better housekeeping would help.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Room: I had a very lovely room facing the Chrysler Building and an stunning view! Shower was amazing! Bed super comfy!Staff: the guys in the lounge for gold/ diamond members are stars! Really! The best staff in the hotel! Always smiling, politely greeting us. I’d definitely stay again!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great stay, as always. Great views. Good size room.The staff at the Millennium Hilton are helpful and friendly. We were thoroughly looked after from the moment we arrived until the moment we left. The bed was very comfy. Really enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My wife and I visited the hotel between 3-6 October. The rooms have amazing views, and the deluxe room we had was very spacious. All the staff we encountered were friendly and especially the bell boys, who helped plan our sight seeing. Situated about 10 mins from Grand Central Station makes it an ideal base for sight seeing.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This one is just adjoining to UN headquarter and it is highly secured area. however the rooms and the service is one of the best in the area. If you want to stay near time-square or central park, this is just 20 min walk away, the grand central station is just 2 blocks away. So if you want a better area to stay still close to timesquare this is one of the recommended hotel. You can walk everything.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I wen to NY for a short time, but Hilton is as usual providing me the best hospitality experience. As soon as I entered my room, I was as amazed by the furniture and fixtures in the room but also the cleanliness. Whenever I travel, for business or pleasure Hilton will be my first choice

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Modern, clean, great location and service! I was able to walk to my appointments and it was convenient to my Client's office. Dinner and drinks at the bar were very good and reasonably priced. Meeting space worked out well. I will definitely return to this hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel passes from Millennium to Hilton management and it remained a perfect, tuned base point to meet at UN and other locations in the surroundings. Complete and good breakfast. Great room with two problems: too much light from the door profiles...it is disturbing a nice sleep. Small volume for the wardrobe no drawers. Enjoy!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We had a lovely stay at this hotel from 29 Sept - 04 Oct. Very large room with superb view. The door/bell men were all very warm, helpful and friendly. A real shame I didn't feel the same warmth and friendliness from the front desk staff hence reason for not giving 5 stars.It would also be useful if the rooms were soundproofed. We were on the 33rd floor and the noise from the street was noticeable. Luckily I had earplugs.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: When visiting New York we searched lots of hotels however we decided that the room was only for us to sleep in-so didn't need top notch. This hotel was perfect- spacious, clean and easy to locate. Tourist places are all in walking distance so again ideal. There is a deposit to pay when you arrive but this is to cover room service etc.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Problem with the City is finding a good hotel for an acceptable price. Although far on the East Side (UN Plaza), this hotel is a top tier Hilton and very affordable with a magnificent view of the East River. Well worth the extra distance to popular Manhattan destinations.
user_name:
Perry P
New York City, United States

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We came to New York to see the 911 museum among other things, and used this hotel as our base camp for four days of adventuring around Manhattan. The staff is professional and courteous and very helpful. The property is clean and conveniently located in lower Manhattan. Across the street from the Oculus the 911 museum and adjacent to the financial district it served our needs well. I would recommend this property to anyone looking for a quality hotel that is reasonably priced!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The overall service was excellent - lovely room with a wonderful view, friendly and helpful staff. I was booked to stay at the hotel for two weeks. After the first week, I was notified of an upgrade of the room for the rest of my stay at the hotel; and guess what? I was upgraded to a Suite!Although the change was quite swift, I totally loved it. The bellman who was sent up to help move my things was super helpful! The suite had very beautiful views and I enjoyed and the entire room was equally beautiful. I very much enjoyed my stay at the hotel

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great Property, everyone I encountered were friendly and welcoming. Great location, within walking distance to lots of places, I used room service a lot and the food was delicious, menu was great. Thx!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The lobby is very throw back to the 80's! The rooms are very nice, clearly recently renovated. Nothing special but clean and modern. Everything was in good working order. The staff on check in was friendly and the lobby staff (for bag check, etc) was very friendly and helpful.The location cannot be beat if you are attending anything at the UN and there are several good eating places within an easy walk. I enjoyed my short stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The Millennium hotel group was neither fish nor fowl -at their rare best its properties could prove decent business hotels. Hilton used to aim higher, but is not yet delivering well at all several months after taking over management of the property. Some assets: nearly all rooms have great New York skyline views. The rooms, while charmless, are serviceable. Recent renovations have been successful, on balance. And for those doing business at the UN, the location is unbeatable.The weak point: the staff - deplorable by what used to be Hilton standards. And the hotel is so nakedly revenue-driven as to chase away any sense of actual service or customer loyalty. The restaurant serves an over-priced, altogether synthetic and unoriginal, breakfast.Whatever happened to Hilton? It used to be a terrific business brand, its international properties often genuinely luxurious and stylish. The Conrad collection or the sprawling Hilton brand now aspires (without much success) to those laurels internationally, but Hilton itself, domestically in the US, is increasingly pedestrian. In my lifetime, I have rarely seen a proud brand degrade itself so thoroughly. It now aims only to serve its share-holders rather than customers, who are treated anonymously. A disappointment.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We are currently still staying at this Hotel and the first impression is just awful. A few days later I can say it still is. Our American Express concierge service booked a room for us in this Hotel and the confirmation clearly stated ‚King bed room w/ city view‘. Arriving at this Hotel, the rude lady at the front desk just told us, that we also cannot get an upgrade although we have the Hilton Honors Gold Status. She said the hotel was fully booked, which was clearly a lie, since there were still plenty rooms available at booking.com. What she didn‘t tell us, is that she only gave us a queen bed room, which we first saw when arriving at the room. So we tried to change to the correct room category, that we already paid for, but the rude lady at the front desk refused to help us again. Since I was too tired after a long-haul flight to discuss this with the manager, we had to sleep the first night in an uncomfortable queen bed, which is way too small for two people! View is awful, since we are just looking onto another building, that is right in front of the window. Customer service at this hotel is simply non-existent and I wouldn‘t recommend this to anyone! There are road-side motels, that have a better Standard than this Hilton... Beware! If you have the Hilton Honors Gold Status: That won‘t get you anywhere in this hotel. No late check-out, no upgrades, nothing. The only positive thing was the friendly staff at the executive lounge and the cleaning staff also did a good job, although the furniture is rather worn out.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Found this hotel on booking. com stayed 2 nights.On my way called hotel was running late to let them know.Arrived at hotel great directions easy to find check in was a breeze went up to room the room was dirty stuff on walls and floor told lady at desk was given another room the beds were comfortable nice size room hotel had a lounge area and gym, restaurant . Very nice and clean The hotel was close to the subway station in walking distance of shopping the hotel staff was very helpful with directions I liked that hotel held your luggage while we shopped or picked up our car great experience would stay again my next time in New York

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: excellent staff and very hospitable to our needs. location was very convientent. the prperty is super clean.you must try this place if you are in the eastern part of Manhattan. In a quitter part of NYC but close to everything, specially all kinds of restaurants.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I stay at this property all the time because of the value you get for the money. The property is pretty centrally located as well. Its about 10 minutes from Time Square, a four minute walk to the train stations, as well as great food all around. The staff is super friendly and know what they are doing. After talking to them some of them have been with the property between 15 and 20 years.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I recommend to all! Excellent Hotel! Perfect location, gorgeous views, very clean rooms, comfortable beds and so so friendly staff! Special THANK YOU, Masha Kirr! You are very positive, unrealistically clever, amazing, unique and absolutely fantastic person! The next stay in New York will be only in this hotel!!!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I highly recommend this Hotel !!!! I have nothing negative to say about this hotel , the hotel has spectacular views, staff very friendly and helpful, the incredible location (if you like walking you can walk to many parts) is very close to the grand central, Central Park , Times Square , etc . You have many options of bars, restaurants, supermarkets , coffee shops etc. the area is very safe because is near to the building of the un , there is even a dog 24 hours as part of the security team ....

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Most amazing view of the city, would definitely recommend this hotel. Staff were friendly, although I did have to wait at least 30 minutes in a queue to check in after an 8 hour flight!Very friendly gentleman in the cafe, who makes a mean vanilla latte. Very comfortable beds and overall a lovely room to fall in love with the city that never sleeps.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed in this hotel for our last three nights in the us before we headed home . On the morning of our check out we thought we would use the hotel service to arrange a transfer to airport. We approached the tall blond guy standing at the small desk with a sign transport/airport/Theater booking he was looking down.I stood across the desk about a foot from his face he did not acknowledge me I gave him 2 -3 minutes ( thinking he was probably looking at a screen that I cannot see or writing something) when I noticed that his eyes and hands weren’t moving I said Hi ! He gave me an resentful lookWithout answering so I asked him how much would it. It’s to arrange a transfer to JFK airport He replied When? I said 0130 he asked louder when?! I thought he meant where so I said JFK airport so he yelled WHEN??? WHAT DAY??I was shocked what kind of a hotel service is this who gave him the job? Couldn’t he just ask polity “is it for today?” Or clarify nicely “I meant to ask what day?” I know this is not the Four Seasons hotel but does it mean you have abuse your guests because they don’t pay as much as those of a 5* hotel?!English is not my first language but I lived in an English speaking country long enough to know that if I say I have an appointment at 3 it’s 99.9% I am talking about today unless I specifically mention the name of the day.Or Did I have to tip him first as I approach him to get a smile and respect ? Sadly this experience left a bitter taste in my mouth after an otherwise pleasant stay at this hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel is very close to the UN and clean. It has a nice view, especially if you're staying in the east side. There is a relatively new incoming mail policy which is very expensive if not absurd. I've had a bad experience with the staff

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel is slightly away from the centre, but we found that to be a plus point as less hustle and bustle, but only a 10minute walk to Grand Central Central, also lots of nearby bars and restaurants without having to go into the centre of the city. All the staff were very polite and friendly and professional. Our room was amazing with views over the Chrysler Building and Empire State - we loved keeping the curtains open at night to enjoy the views as it was better than watching the tv! The beds were very comfortable, and toiletries were by Crabtree & Evelyn. The whole hotel was kept spotless. We felt very safe there, and security was high with the United Nations building next door. Will be very happy to recommend to friends and family.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We were upgraded to a suite with Hilton Honors status which we appreciate. We took a nap immediately after check-in, but the noise in the hall way were not tolerable. Surprisingly, it was not rude customers but house keeping staff!!! Overall a fine experience but some details really were below what Hilton's mission is.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We (2 couples) stayed here for 4 nights in August to celebrate my best friend's 50th birthday. We were treated so well, with upgrades to lovely suites with great views. I wish I could remember the name of the receptionist who checked us in (Dania?) because she was lovely and found us rooms at 9 am (we'd just arrived from Vancouver) which we really appreciated. My husband is a Diamond Hilton member and never have I been so glad!The hotel itself is located really well, as it's only about 4 blocks to Grand Central station, walking distance to loads of places as well. The Executive lounge works on an honesty bar, which is fine, and there was a good choice of wine (not always the case). Breakfast was also good, with lovely fresh fruit. We had to be moved due to some weird rumblings as the aircon couldn't cope with the ridiculously hot weather.All of the staff we came across were professional and friendly and we would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Excellent views and a spotless hotel.Staff polite, informative and relaxed.Hotel views of the Empire State, Chrysler Building, Times Square. Hotel is situated near to the United Nations buildings a little too far to walk to most ‘tourist sights’ but a cab is a quick and relatively cheap ride just outside the hotel. Request a room facing the Chrysler Building we stayed in room 38 on the 32nd floor. Would highly recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: These rooms are enormous by New York City standards. Spacious and modern bathroom, comfortable beds, nice seating areas, and a refrigerator/coffee maker made our stay very comfortable. We had fantastic views and the housekeeping staff was really responsive to our requests. The rooms were very well sound-proofed. Area is pretty quiet, but you’re only a block away from tons of places to eat and public transportation. Will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel is literally across the street from the UN building. Most of the rooms have a view of the Hudson River. The rooms are large, with good-sized closets and safe, and are comfortable. The alarm clock is easy to use. The workspace is large, with a couple of extra outlets (USB and regular) on the side of the desk. The wifi and cable TV work well. Lighting is good for working at the desk. The fitness room has a superb view of the river. Unfortunately the cardio machines are placed in the part of the room with the worst view, but the overall experience is much more pleasant than most gyms. The service is good, especially the doormen. The check-in staff are friendly and helpful. Check-in time is 4pm(!) but I was able to get in my room at 2pm and could use the locker room in the fitness area to change and freshen up in the meantime. I recommend bringing a padlock if you plan to use the locker room lockers. The cleaning staff are efficient, though when I ran out of shampoo after the first day (the bottles are small!) they were not replenished. At peak hours the check-in area gets crowded and the wait can be long. The hotel should bring in an additional staff member to help with surge.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I recently stayed a long weekend at the Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza. It was lovely - I stayed on the 30th floor, had an amazing view, a most comfortable King bed AND a heated toilet seat! The location was perfect - across the street from the United Nations, with coffee shops close by, as well as the famous Patsy's one block away.And while it was a long 8 blocks to Time Square, it was totally manageable. I did it twice during my stay. The staff couldn't have been kinder and more helpful. Would easily stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: If you are staying in New York for a weekend or over night - Millennium is a great place to stay. The rooms are clean, comfortable, updated. With easy check-in and check-out. The front desk personnel are pleasant and efficient during the stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Just checked out. They charged me full rate, though the 3rd night had a promo. Impossible to reach the front desk as they don’t pick up the phone. The lounge is boring, same exact thing every morning and evening. What a great customer service for a diamond member.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My wife and I stayed at this hotel to celebrate our anniversary.This was the perfect location for our New York stay being a gentle 8-10 minute stroll from Grand Central Station.The staff were both delightful and helpful,and the rooms were spacious with incredible views.Highly recommended..

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights to celebrate our 20th Wedding anniversary.Upon request we were allocated a room with stunning views of the Chrysler building, Empire State and Freedom Tower - just stunning day and night! When you arrive outside the hotel your bag will be 'sniffed' by a friendly sniffer-dog - this is just standard procedure due to the close proximity to the United Nations and just an extra security measure I guess but it really didn't bother us at all. In fact we felt very safe here.When we entered the lovely lobby, we were warmly greeted and given a coffee/pastry whilst we waited for our room to be ready (we had arrived early from the UK!)The reception staff, concierge and cafe staff were very friendly and helpful and made us feel very welcome.A lovely touch was complimentary chocolate dipped strawberries and Prosecco in our room to celebrate our anniversary - how kind!We found the location of the hotel very convenient and it was just a short walk from Central Station - from which you can catch the subway to other parts of Manhattan and further afield.I would recommend this hotel to friends/family or anyone else visiting New York.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Well not what I was expecting from the Hilton hotel. Altogether it was a very pleasant stay. The hotel is at great location, staff very friendly and rooms comfortable. The negative side was that I didn’t have WiFi in the room (although I got the passcode), which was a big hustle. Had to go down to the lobby to check my emails. There was no fridge in the room and complementary water (maybe that’s not the thing in NY). Had to ask for the disposable toothpaste and toothbrush (which I got right away by the friendly staff member). Was expecting five star experience from the world renown brand like Hilton, but got a bit disappointed.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Staff were very helpful & friendly, Barry on reception was a real gent. Would stay there again. The location is great, just a few blocks away from the real hustle & bustle of New York. I rarely give 5 stars but i'm willing to do so on this occasion given the helpful staff on site. The room was quite good as well.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This was our kids first time in NY. This hotel is clean good size rooms, for being in NY. The King Corner room very very spacious. They have breakfast at the restaurant grill inside the hotel, along with dinner and a little cafe also. The views from our rooms were phenomenal. You couldn't ask for more. The hotel is also close to Grand Central Station about 5 blocks.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I rarely give 5 stars to hotels, but this one deserves it for its spotlessness and comfort as well as its breathtaking views. There is no free wi-wi, unfortunately. You have to pay $10 for it. There is a restaurant and a cafe at the hotel, but we went out to eat. Check out La Vera for delicious pizza, that place was awesome for dinner.Our room was a standard queen room, but the bed seemed larger somehow so we slept through the night perfectly without disturbing each other, and we are used to California King. We stayed in the 37th flooor. The hotel is in a quiet neighborhood so noise is reduced.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I arrived early for a 2 night stay. I had already checked-in online and selected a room and it was ready for me despite my early arrival. Maybe I'm not New York City material, but being asked to put an extra $100 deposit on hold from my credit card took me aback a bit. Not my first surprise while in the city though. The room wasn't far from the elevators and had a very nice view from the window onto the East River and directly down onto the United Nations. The room I was in was larger than most, mainly due to its location - it was about 1.5x larger than what you would expect as you can likely see in the pictures I'm posting with the review. The long window along the wall gave a great view during the day and even moreso at night. Things I liked about the room included the flooring in the bathroom which was never cold even when I had the A/C turned up. Things I didn't like? The Illy Coffee-Espresso maker in the room. It was terrible and wouldn't make a complete Espresso or coffee unless you played with it and pushed the buttons repeatedly. Filling it with water was a bit tricky as well as the reservoir didn't want to come off and I worried I was going to break it (and buy it!). The plug in the bathroom sink wouldn't come completely up either, so I could only run water there slowly as the sink wouldn't drain as fast as water filled it. It took quite a while for the water to turn hot enough to shave as well, especially at a trickle. Speaking of hot water - there are very nice bags of tea available to you on the coffee bar, but no way to boil water for them...unless you want to trickle hot water in the sink for about 20 minutes or so first. The TV was first rate and I liked that extra streaming channels like Crackle were included; Netflix is also there but you have to sign into your own personal account to view anything. The bed was comfortable, no complaints there and ultimately that is the point of a hotel - to have somewhere to sleep. The alarm clock provided was an iHome brand oriented towards Apple products, but if you have a USB cord you can connect other devices to it as well. With the location of the hotel and the branding, I expected much more than I found here. It was still a comfortable stay and if in town again for business in the same area I would book again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great rooms for the value. Best views in the city. The friendliest staff, always willing to help. Perfect location, right in the middle of the city. Always stay here when I'm in the city and always will.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel has an excellent location. 8 minutes to Grand Central, 20 minutes to Times Square. The view of Manhattan amazing. As a diamond member I got an upgrade to the suite, which was very nice. A room with two bedrooms and two bathrooms overlooking the East River and Manhattan. The room is corner which makes the views are perfect. Room very well cleaned. The air conditioning was quite loud. Staff at the hotel were not very interested in the guests. Breakfast in the executive louge very poor: bagels, 2 pastas, jams and two cheeses, fruit, yogurt. Little space. It happened that there was no place to sit. Even worse is the executive lounge during happy hours. Every day for a week were served wings and carrots, peppers, cucumbers and all that. There was beer and wine but extra pay: 5 $ for a beer and 5 $ for a glass of wine. This is the first time I have experienced such a situation, I have stayed in many Hilton hotels around the world and you do not have to pay for beer and wine anywhere. Very weak. Great location, very good rooms, poor service and a terrible executive lounge.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The facilities were well maintained. The staff was nice and helpful as our flight arrived early and we were allowed early check in. The view from our corner bedroom was beautiful!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Have just returned from this hotel and love everything about this hotel, our room was amazing and the views were out of this world definitely the best hotel I have ever stayed in was traveling with my wife and 2 children who loved the room, the room was cleaned to a very high standard everyday and the staff were very friendly, breakfast in the hotel was also fantastic great choice, hotel very central 20 min walk to Times Square and only 2 blocks to grand central, this hotel has made our holiday in New York one to remember, And would 100 percent recommend it, will definitely be back Thanks again

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The city , river and UN views were some of the best we have ever had. Even the gym has a panoramic view of river and UN. Great front desk and luggage staff, Kevin? Busy place, lobby was busy and outside front is busy. In the heart of UN related business.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Brilliant hotel, friendly staff at reception and in particular at the executive lounge. Housekeeping also friendly and efficient Was upgraded to a king suite at check in as a diamond member, which was very welcome.Exec lounge facilities are good, working PCs, printer, good coffee and decent breakfast spread.WiFi very fast - only problem is it drops out quite frequently. Netflix accessible on TV which is very convenientWould definitely recommend for those wanting a quiet hotel in a good location with great views

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Was here with my family for 4 days. Had rooms with a brilliant view of NY, 2 days with a view of the New York skyline fromt he 34th floor and 2 days with a majestic view of Queens Bridge and Long Island. Rooms were clean and nice toiletries in bathroom, however several fixtures may need to be spruced up a bit as cupboards etc were slightly damaged. Breakfast was amazing with brilliant food and excellent table service, a special shout out to Abu who looked after us so well.Location a bit out of the way, but 10 minute walk to Central Station and perhaps 15 minute walk to Times Square, some shops 5 minutes away that sell groceries and offer laundry and other such services. One gripe, I had 2 children with me that did make some noise, but was not impressed to betoldby security at 7.30 am that neighbours had complained, we then moved room as we felt a little uncomfortable and again the same issue occured again. Not sure if my kids were making too much noise or that the walls were paper thin, both times we were in interconnected rooms and this is clearly not a good idea with kids when your neighbour wants to have a lie in etc.. hotel tried to rectify problem, so did we, but kind of dampened our mood, having to tell our kids to always not make noise....when they were just being kids and when I have not had that problem before in any other hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We drove from Washington DC in the pouring rain. We were so grateful to be back at The Millennium Hilton! We had called on our way to NYC to confirm our suite. We were told that the room was ours and that the manager, Titia?, had checked us in herself. We were assured the room was ready and waiting. When were arrived the doorman loaded our bags on the luggage rack then stood waiting for a tip. We gave him one and know we will need to produce another tip for the bellman because the doorman only helps to the lobby! We got to our suite and the key didn’t work. We hear the tv and knock. Another guest answers!! WTH!! Now my son, tired from driving, has to stand at the desk and wait for this issue to be resolved!! Hilton you have fallen so far from the grand hotels of the past. Way to ruin the end of our trip! Never again!!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We were in New York for a dance convention. We stayed here because it was centrally located to Times Square . Hotel is very nice and the rooms are pretty good size when you consider you were in New York. The only downside was $90 to park our vehicle. Other than that, it was a good hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel is very clean, the staff is extremely kind and reactive to any request (even at very late hour when we have faced a problem due to a noise coming from somewhere in the ventilation system), great location and view!!!!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Wonderful room on the 38th floor with amazing views of the river and midtown. The only issue with the room is that it's impossible to charge your laptop at the desk because there's no room in between the desk and plug. Not a huge problem, but very odd.I don't really expect much from hotel staff, but a greeting from the doormen and the lobby staff is always a nice touch. Don't expect that here. However, the housekeepers are very friendly and good at their jobs.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed here during a business trip to New York. Stayed in a king room with city view. Rooms were very clean on arrival. Housekeeping over the following days wasn’t great. Bits of rubbish left on floor were never hoovered or cleaned. Location is good however everything was expensive around the hotel. Water 1l in the newsagent across the hotel cost $3. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Had the buffet Breakfast at hotel which cost $35 per person. Breakfast had a large selection of food items. Will recommend a stay if in New York for a business or short trip.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel was really nice. All of our rooms were comfortable and clean. However, I went to grab a towel from the rack and it had been used. (so advise to the housekeeping staff, check or replace all towel when cleaning the bathrooms) The bathrooms were clean, one nice feature is the bathrooms have heated mirrors that will not fog while taking a shower. The Check-in and out process was easy! All the staff we encountered were all friendly and helpful. I tend to be a brand hotel snob but I wasn't responsible for the planning of this trip, however, I was very pleased! Will stay again and recommend.
user_name:
Perry6153
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Recently stayed at the Millennium Hilton UN Plaza for three nights, and loved everything about our stay. Upon entering the Lobby area, we were warmly greeted by several staff members. A special "thank-you" is extended to Frank, one of the Bellmen, who could not have been nicer. The view from our corner king room was spectacular...an unobstructed view of the UN, and the East River, and we could see the Empire State Building, the Chrysler Building, and the Freedom Tower from the other window. This hotel has a good location, and there are several excellent restaurants within walking distance. Taxis are always available immediately as you exit the Lobby, and the subway and buses are close by, as well. I highly recommend this hotel to others.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed for 5 nights start of August, arrived after 10pm to a very helpful woman on reception who checked us in quickly. Room was nice and bed was comfy. Cleaned everyday by housekeeping. Hotel is in a good location, quiet area but 15/20 min walk to time square etc. Taxis readily available right outside hotel. Couldn’t fault our stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My wife and myself had the absolutely pleasure of staying at the Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza from July 31st-Aug 2nd 2018. We came to NYC for our anniversary as well as my wife's birthday.For our stay we were located in room 3131 which was a gorgeous and spacious two bedroom suite. I would have to say that one of the many highlight of this particular suite was the sweeping views of not only the East River but Midtown Manhattan as well, especially the One World Trade Center and Chrysler/Empire State buildings. Besides the vies, this suite was extremely spacious and main living area consisted of a large circular dining table, built-in coffee/mini bar area, a desk and chair, lounging chair with ottoman, wall-mounted t.v., two chaise loungers a coffee table and more. The main living area also had a wall mounted digital/touchscreen unit which controlled not only the HVAC for the main area and bedroom but as well as the lighting for the whole well which was divided into zones. The master bedroom was equally large and had flanking wardrobes at the entrance with ample pull-out shelving and hangers, a king-size bed as well as a bench at the foot of the bed. The views from the bedroom were just as great as the main living area. The master ensuite was luxurious to say the least - large soaker tub and glass enclosed walk-in shower with multiple shower heads including a rain shower head. The ensuite also had a dressing/makeup table and of course a single vanity. The Skyline Club which was located on the 30th floor, was where continental breakfast and evening snacks were served. Breakfast consisted of cubed cheese, bagels and breads, an assortment of pastries, yogurt, cereal, granola, jams/spreads, juice, coffee, milk and fruit. In the evening, the lounge offered small bites such as cheese, bread, pretzels, veggies and dips and some warm items such as chicken wings and crispy deep friend beans. The selection of food items change daily so the aforementioned menu was what we encountered during our 3 night stay. The lounge also offered wine and beer for an additional cost. The other option for breakfast would be to visit the Ambassador Grill restaurant on the main lobby level of the hotel. This is a full buffet spread with just about anything you can imagine. There is a fee for this breakfast option. Similarly, there is also Un Cafe on the main level as well which serves snacks, sandwiches and salads as well as crafted coffee beverages.Location wise, you're Midtown East area and within walking distance to Central Park, Empire and Chrysler Building, Times Square as well as the iconic Grand Central Terminal. All in all, we loved our stay at the Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza and will definitely stay again when we return. The staff we had contact with was amazing - super friendly, always willing to help out and above all, very hospitable. The suite was probably one of the nicest rooms I've ever come across at a Hilton property and I'd highly recommend it if you are looking for a bit (lot) of extra space.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I was expecting a better quality globally; I had to way tw0 hours to finally make the ceckin; room not perfect and needing better accuracy in its preparation. global quality lower than other similar experiences in other countries

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Very nice and professional staff. Great location to walk to various points of interest. Beautiful views! The staff treat you as an individual and make sure you are taken care of. The hotel has a very welcoming atmosphere the minute you walk in the door.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel was our second in the area and was a good location for walking to most area mid town. Rooms were spotless and the service was good. We didn’t use the restaurant as it was shockingly expensive, as was the shop in the foyer for basic things like water. It was a pleasant stay and would go back. We stayed in a family room with four of us.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My daughter and I had a short break in this hotel and stayed in a deluxe double on the 40th floor. The view from our bedroom was incredible - the Chrysler Building and the Empire State Building both felt within touching distance. Other than that, the room itself was the largest I've had in a New York hotel, was clean and well appointed and the bed was very comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful - particularly when I had to run back 2 blocks after checking out to retrieve our passports from the safe! The cafe in the lobby is expensive - but then practically everything in this city is - and the quality was good. The hotel is also really well located (hence the view) and the nearest subway at Grand Central Station is an easy 10 min walk. Definitely recommended!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: It was a good visit. Everyone was courteous and we were upgraded for free. It was hard to figure out the elevator but we got it in the end. The room and the view was great. Had a brilliant electronic toilet. Need on in my house now. They didn’t have any coffee but the manager gave us complimentary drinks to compensate which was really nice

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: A great, but a "has been" hotel. I stayed in this hotel several times whenever I go to New York. I can see that things are slowly getting detoriated.The Lobby remains impersonal, dark, gloomy. No place to sit comfortably upon.A rigid reception desk which is cold, uncaring, without any empathy, not interested in clients and even arrogant. What some people such as Barry are doing behind a reception desk?Poor internet connectivity over-charged at high cost.The only good thing about this hotel are the bellboys: They are as usual courteous, nice and provide a quality client service.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed in theRoosevelt suite which has a separate bedroom, 2 full bathrooms, a full kitchen, 3 closets, 2 entry doors and a large living and dining room. The view was spectacular. The sky lounge for diamond members was nice and has a great view but the food could have been better and alcoholic drinks should have been complimentary. The pool was closed for renovation and we weren’t aware of when we booked it. Pix is view fm our suite.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: At absolutely fabulous hotel, our first trip to New York with our children 15 and 13 years old. Very spacious clean, private and a little way from the huddle and bustle but within walking distance of all the sites. Everyone we spoke to from reception, house keeping and restaurant everyone was extremely welcoming, helpful and polite. We all felt very safe comfortable and secure after very busy days seeing all the sites. We have been to many Hilton hotels throughout the world and this one of our favourites. A special thank you to Thomas and Erica whom made our stay extra special. Would I recommend absolutely enjoy.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I stayed in this place for a business trip, and it was comfortable, clean, and the staff was super friendly. I would recommend a little renovation to the lobby as it feels quite dated in contrast with the modern and tastefully decorated rooms. It was a great stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I stayed with my daughter for 5 nights a the beginning of June. Loved being greeted by the sniffer dog - staying there at the same time as Kim Jong Un's deputy made it quite interesting. As a Hilton Honors we were offered an upgrade at reduced cost for a 2 bdrm suite on the 39th floor. Originally said no but changed our mind and when we got back down the suite was gone. But the check in guy was super helpful, got us another one with just a couple hours wait housekeeping so we went out for dinner. The suite was perfect. Spacious, clean and comfortable and the view was an amazing 280 degree view around the city. We looked forward coming back each day, in fact a couple of nights chose to eat in so we could enjoy the suite. Location was great as well, just a few blocks from Grand Central. The only disappointment was the restaurant / bar. Seemed super dated and not attractive to go to. But a very memorable stay. I dont think I'll be able to splurge like that for some time again but it was so worth it.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed on the 34th floor with a view of the east River, NYC and the UN Plaza. Memorable! Especially at night when it was like another world. The Bell staff were very helpful. Parking is very expensive - 79$ / night with NO in / out privileges. You can park around the corner for 20$ cheaper.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed this week with our young daughter. The staff could not have been nicer. Sylvia on the front desk is a treat. She had our daughter smiling ear to ear. The room was incredible with towering views of Manhattan- the Chrysler and Empire State in full view. The room was large and really well appointed with a neat coffee dock and basin which made it convenient for cleaning the babies bottle. The bathroom was really modern and with a great shower. The doormen were courteous and when we got in the elevator the maintenance man was really nice too. Highly recommend this place!!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: So first I would like to thank Ty and Monique front desk managers. They went above and beyond to make my and my husbands stay beautiful and romantic. We checked in Friday 7/27 I wanted to get an upgrade from the king corner room to a bigger suite the hotel was completely booked. The next day I was speaking Monique she asked me how my stay was going...I told her my wishes and she made them come true “ like In a fairy tale” My husband and I were upgraded to a beautiful Two Bedroom TwoBath queen/King corner Suite! Let me just say I carry a blacklight with me to hotels both rooms past my famous black test.. Very Clean!Service was great! One Sad thing about our stay is that we couldn’t order breakfast in bed.. they had stopped doing it for some unknown reason.. and the pool was under construction. 4 Star rating for this hotel. I posted videos of both rooms on my YouTube channel AngelPrettyEyes

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great location and a beautiful hotel. The only disappointment was there was no pool in working order. The in-room service food was excellent. The store downstairs could've been open an hour or 2 more and provided milk. All in all a nice hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel is located in the city center, but a 10-minute walk to the underground station.The rooms are large even in Manhattan standards.The staff was professional and the check-in process was quick and efficient.And most importantly - they have Netflix on TV!I really had great 5 nights stay at the hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed at the Millennium Hilton UN Plaza on our recent trip to New York for 3 nights. The Staff at the front desk was excellent and incredibly helpful. We were able to check into our room early because they had one ready, but they were also willing to have our luggage held and delivered to our room if we had needed it. Unfortunately, we had less than stellar service from others. We called three mornings to have ice delivered to the room (they do not have self-service ice machines or vending machines available). We only got the ice one morning in a reasonable time. One morning it had not come after 45 minutes and I called to cancel because we were leaving. The other morning is took nearly as long, but I had learned my lesson and called really early. THe location is definitely great for the UN or business travel. It is also great if a view is what you are looking for while in your room. It was our first trip to New York, so we knew we wanted a nice room with a view. We got a corner room and out one window we could see the Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building. Out the other window was the River and grounds of the UN. Definitely no complaints about the view. It was a bit of a trek to the nearest subway, basically you had to go to Grand Central Terminal to get anywhere. There was another line a little north, but no matter what it was a half mile or more walk.The room was comfortably sized and in good shape. The bathroom was very nice. The main issue we had was rowdy neighbors. You could hear every word they said and especially when they had been drinking a while. The other main issue was smell from their cologne made its way into our room and lingered for a while, which was very annoying.Overall, I think this makes a better business hotel than family or romantic hotel. The view can be incredible with the right category of room, but that is the main thing going for the hotel. We will likely choose another property when we return to New York.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I stayed four nights at this Midtown Hilton hotel in New York City. It was a great experience as the hotel seems really modern in the common areas and the service at the front desk was nice and efficient.No problems checking in on a Saturday afternoon. The lobby seemed a little quiet but I guess it comes from the hotel being a business hotel. A little music would have brought a little life to the lobby. The lobby was being restored, however.The hallways and elevators were perfectly remodeled, too. But the rooms could have used a hand. Loved the view from the 32nd floor but I had a weird room with 70% unusable hallway. And I realized that the evacuation plan had not been updated since the hotel was renovated. Minor detail but still kind of important.Thanks to the front office staff for providing adjoining rooms with my travel partners. And thanks for doing a great job in general.The area surrounding the hotel is not very interesting. As mentioned this is a business hotel but it will probably mean that great rates are available during the weekend. THe UN is around the corner. And it takes less than five minutes to walk to Second Ave.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed at hotel with a group visiting the UN and NYC. Hotel was very convenient to UN and area. Very clean rooms and well appointed. Breakfast was excellent, and service staff were friendly and very focused on making my stay enjoyable and memorable.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Was upgraded to suite 3007 that was created from a combo of two rooms, which clearly showed it was not designed as a suite. The bedroom is too small. The 2 bathrooms were either down the hall or across the living room. Both bathrooms were too small for a regular room, much less a suite. But at least it has been renovated with stone like finish and a walk-in shower in one bathroom. There was no robe or slippers in the room. There was a small kitchen in the suite but the walls of the suite were bare. The view was ok, not great.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We wanted to try a high-rise hotel and decided on the Millennium UN. We were very happy with the choice.First, the location is great right by the UN and the East River. With just a short walk (10-15 minutes) to Grand Central Station and lots of restaurants and shops, we found the spot to be a perfect starting point for sightseeing anywhere in the city. The area seems a lot more laid back than Times Square or downtown, and it feels safe and clean too.The hotel rooms are large and comfortable, especially compared to many others in the city, with plenty of room for luggage and spreading out for a family of 4. The rooms are on the higher floors of the building, so most all have some kind of city or river view.Overall, I would recommend this hotel if you like a spacious, clean room in a more calm and convenient area of town.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I stayed here for 3 nights for various meetings at the UN. The room was spacious and the service was good. There is even a quick place to get coffee and pastries in the lobby separate from their restaurant.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I stayed at the Millennium for two nights for a business trip. This is my go to hotel when in NY for business or leisure. The rooms are completely renovated and large. The service is excellent and the staff goes above and beyond to assist. The midtown location is ideal within easy walking distance of 5th Avenue and Central Park. The rates are better than any other comparable hotel in the area. You won’t be disappointed!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I have stayed at the Millennium Hilton a few times over the past few months for business trips to New York City. The rooms have been updated and are generally nice. The staff is also generally friendly. I have been disappointment in the Executive Lounge for Diamond Members. First the appearance is poor as it has not been updated like many of the rooms and more importantly the breakfast food has been downgraded over the last couple of months. The lounge now only offers bagels, fruit and cheese in the Executive Lounge as management has removed all hot food choices for breakfast. I have pointed this out to management, but no action has been taken which was a bit disappointing. Diamond/Gold members who use the lounge should be aware of this change. This property has the potential to be great and hopefully management will take the steps needed to take it the next level.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: great rooms and views- but Diamond members beware. no help after 8 PM . no eggs or bacon - lounge never open much . closes at 8 opens at 5 the manager seems clueless when you need somethingservice is veneer

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed for nearly a fortnight in this hotel, and found it to be a really comfortable, clean and relaxed place. The location was great for getting around Manhattan, being in midtown and was about 10 minutes walk from Grand Central subway. The rooms were good, we stayed in two and there was a noticeable difference in quality of finish in them, so maybe the hotel are periodically updating their rooms. We also had access to the 'executive' lounge which provided a light breakfast of fruit, cereals, pastries and bagels. It was a nice start to the morning. In the evening light snacks and soft drinks were available however they were not of a great quality and were not replenished over the 4 hours the lounge was open. I think they could up their game with this offering as it was nowhere near as good as other Hilton's lounge offerings. Finally the hotel could do with some things to do, even a lobby bar, a pool, spa facilities. It was very boring with little to do in the close vicinity. Just to note, the staff were almost all excellent, so friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I was traveling with a friend and her son from Scotland. I reside in Boston and we took Amtrak to NYC for a NYC overnight. I'd booked 5 months in advance and got a Fabulous rate. Our train arrived at 1230pm and check in was not until 4. I'd phoned ahead to inquire about the possibility of the desk holding our luggage so we could tour the city more easily. They were so gracious and allowed us to check in right away! We had a wonderful room with a marvelous view of the Chrysler building! We only stayed one night, but were thrilled with the view, extreme kindness and the quiet. For a Bostonian, I can honestly say..."I love New York..." (due to my experience with the Millennium!Many thanks!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I cannot say enough about the friendly and attentive staff at this hotel. They went above and beyond in an effort to make our two-week stay comfortable and flawless. Our room was spotless, quiet, and our views of the East River were incredible. This was one of the best hotel experiences I've had.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I took my 12 year old grandson to NYC for the first time in his life and we stayed at the Millennium Hilton Hotel across from the United Nations. It is a great location although there's a bit of a walk to the nearest subway stop. Our train from upstate NY got us to the hotel a bit before 2 o'clock. It is a huge hotel but there were only 2 people working the front desk, so we waited nearly half an hour before we finally got taken care of, only to be told that we could only access our room at 4 pm. We had another wait for the bell boy where we left some of our luggage so we could start visiting New York City. It's a bit outrageous to have only two people manning the front desk at a hotel this size. Later when we returned, it was the same situation, so we again had to wait to get our keys. It's also outrageous to let people in no sooner than 4 pm when most hotels in NYC will let you in before 3 pm. One other complaint is that you can only get free WiFi if you agree to join Hilton Honors (which is free), otherwise it is $9.95. This said, our room, on the 29th floor, was stupendous! Very clean and spacious with a gorgeous view of the East River. Because it was so high, it was very quiet and the street noise did not reach us. The bathroom had a Japanese toilet, very much fun. The a/c worked very well and was very quiet. We were really awed by the room.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We booked the suites for 4 days: 2 floors, 2 rooms, 3 bathrooms, 1 living room.Great view of the East river, excellent location.Good quality amenities.Very clean rooms and excellent service.Water pressure and temperature were well adjusted.Towels were always changed and beds were perfectly made everyday.The size of the rooms were superb.Unfortunately the pool was under reconstruction so couldn't use it,had some troubles with the WiFi at first but got solved immediately.Would book again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We very much enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The views from our very large 33rd floor room were superb. The bed was king sized and extremely comfortable and thanks to Paul at the bellhop desk, we were able to secure a late checkout which was very much appreciated. There is a coffee shop in the lobby area which was convenient and lots of restaurants in the area. Grand Central is only about 4 blocks away and the UN is across the street making this a great location.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We decided on a short family break in New York and booked the Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza.Booked mainly for its location, being close enough but equally not dead centre and it was a really great location and our rooms on the 31st floor had a view straight up the street to Times Square and you could also see the Chrysler & Empire State buildings. The view looked particularly stunning at night and the wall to ceiling windows made the most of such a great view.Equally impressive were the views from the, well equipped and clean, gym out over the East River and UN building.The room was clean, tidy and well furnished and was the perfect base for pretty much everything to be within walking distance (we don't mind a decent stomp though).On one day we arrived back in the afternoon to see the entrance and surrounding area taped off by police with a media scrum, which did worry us temporarily...turns out that the North Korean politicians were staying there as part of the lead up to Trump's visit to North Korea...so we are now considering that we were clearly part of the peace process and the de-nuclearisation of North Korea!Good base and great views...don't make the mistake of buying two Buds from the shop in the hotel though $$$$!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights with the family to discover Manhattan. The hotel is conveniently located in the middle part of town towards the east end (opposite the UN building). It's a lot quieter than staying at Time Square, at the same time the hotel is about a 20 minutes walk from Time Square which is reasonable.The hotel seems to have a lot of UN related guests, which makes it probably the quiet location that it is (no noisy guests in any case). The issues that we had were rectified, however without those issues probably I would have rated the hotel excellent (so let's see a next time if the issues will not happen again).Also, the fitness center should have more cardio equipment, there is plenty of space that can be used for more equipment, in the morning lines form to get on the equipment.The executive lounge is great, the first 3 days Igor took really good care of his, and so did his colleague the 2 days after that. Great service oriented mentality.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We greatly enjoyed our stay here as the hotel is quiet with easy access to the metro and walking distance to key city centre locations. We stayed on the 33rd floor I think and had an great view to the Empire State Building. There are breakfast options within minutes. Go to Johns diner at least once. We did not use the restaurant or bar while there. Our room was good with a comfy bed. We would definitely choose to stay here again if we ever return.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed here recently in a 2 room king suite/adjacent double room to get a view of the 4th of July fireworks. Linda was absolutely fantastic in helping us figure out accommodations that would work for my husband, 2 kids, and in-laws and deserves kudos for her outstanding customer service. Sheldon was a huge help in getting the rooms booked. Abu, in the Ambassador Grill during the buffet breakfast, was great with my son.First the good: We were in a corner suite facing the East river and downtown Manhattan, and the views were absolutely stunning. We had a very good view of the fireworks, especially the first few minutes before things got a little smokey. The suite was spacious with 2 bathrooms, a pull-out queen sofa-bed in the living room, and both a king bed and large ottomon in the bedroom. The location of the hotel is also nice, about 10-15 minute walk to Grand Central. Housekeeping was great, and the Illy espresso in the hotel coffee shop was tasty. They let us check out an hour late so we got to enjoy one last quick trip up to Rockefeller Center before catching a cab to the airport.The bad: There were so many small annoying things that they quickly added up to an overall "meh" stay for us in an otherwise nice suite in a good location. 1) Even though the website advertises refrigerators in the rooms, there was no fridge in our suite. This was extremely problematic for us as our son takes an injection medicine that needs to be refrigerated. The gentleman in housekeeping told me all the fridges were "sold out" and then proceeded to argue with me about what was stated on the website regarding the availability of fridges. After I showed the representative at the front desk the webpage and explained our situation, they managed to find us a fridge in "another location" in the hotel. Unfortunately, that fridge stopped working after a day and a half and the hunt was on for a replacement. I asked for a bucket of ice to be sent up to keep my son's medicine cold since there are no ice machines on the floor but was told after waiting 20 minutes that they were also out of ice buckets and were trying to find a suitable container. The replacement fridge didn't seem to be working either, but it turned out the outlet the fridge was plugged into was faulty, the 2nd bad outlet we found in the room. 2) Elevators are extremely slow. One time we got in an elevator to go downstairs, only to discover the light for the lobby wouldn't light up; it took us to a floor below the lobby and then back up to the 33rd floor, where we had to get out and wait another 5-10 minutes for another elevator.3) The phone in our suites stopped working on our 3rd day of our stay.4) We were directed to the Sky Lounge to print our our boarding passes, but the lounge was keycard access only and there was no doorbell. We had to wait outside for someone else to leave in order to get in.5) While having an Illy coffee maker w/ espresso pods in the room was nice, the machine did not consistently put out warm coffee.6) Wifi was spotty. 7) We had to ask a couple of times for the vouchers for breakfast that came with our room. First we were told that they would be delivered to our room, but when they didn't materialize, we had to go downstairs to ask again.8) Double beds are more like large singles, too small to accommodate 2 regular sized adults. To be fair, Linda warned ust this might be an issue when we made our reservation. We ended up having our son sleep on the ottoman and our daughter on the sofa-bed so our in-laws could have their own beds in their room.Not sure we'd stay here again on future trips to Manhattan, mainly because of the refrigerator issue but also because of all the many little problems we encountered.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Excellent hotel in Manhattan, great location, clean, friendly, safe, nice rooms with access to complimentary breakfast and afternoon drinks and snacks at the Sky Lounge included (ask for this at time of booking). Clearly a recommendation, but watch out: When the UN are in session, it gets excessively expensive, outside this time period it is not.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Worst hotel in all my travel. Does not live up to its name at name at all. The stay was on June 23rd 2018, I had no plans to write review at all until 3 days ago when they charged me again for no reason. The hotel boasts itself as 4 / 5stars, horrible service, attitude and everything. My wife and I arrived after a long flight from London, waited some 12-13minutes outside, nobody came out and there was NOBODY to greet. It was EMPTY and dark, we even thought hotel was closed but then, come one, hotel closed? So, we decided to go in with our luggages. Saw the doorman and front desk lady happily chitchatting away. I walked up, still no face contact or a "hi". Stood for 2 minutes, said hi to them and asked if they are OPEN. Proceeded for check-in, once done, again no door service to the room. Mind you, we had 5 bags including 1 carry on. And their excuse for no one at the door was because it was late and they were busy with another guest, I laughed out loud (sure I was there for some 15minutes to notice if any). After checking out, I ran into one of their managers and told him about the incident. I was surprised he acted "oh, I don't care" attitude and said we are short staffed. I am not diamond level but the least gold status and they failed a big time. Shame on the Hilton 1 UN plaza and entire Hilton brand, they sure have incompetence and junkies working for them. Perhaps they are too big of a name to care for service.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Try and pick a high floor with a view of the new york skyline, unreal view! Stayed here for a special occasion and would definitely return again If possible, very good location in new york with main attractions just a walking distance away.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This is a very comfortable well run hotel. The rooms were extremely well equipped and furnished in a modern style. The bed was luxurious. It was in an excellent position for visiting the sites of New York and in walking distance of the Empire State, Central Station and Time Square!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: When my husband booked this hotel, he had no idea that the UN delegates would be there at this particular time. Yes, we probably should’ve seen it on the news and figured it out, but I would have informed guest that they would have been required to be scanned and possibly searched every time they entered the building. The hotel receptionist was at least kind enough to give us free breakfast for the time that we were there, but I still feel that we should have been notified that we would be searched. I was a little disappointed! The views however were spectacular, the hotel room was great but to add on to our annoyance the last night that we were there, the fire alarms were going off for no reason what so ever! Really?!?!?

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days earlier this month. On arrival, the staff presented our young son with a treat bag and 4th of July goodies, with which he was really delighted. I had requested a city view and we were given a room on the penultimate floor which looked out over the East river and across to Queens. It was absolutely beautiful in the day and night and made our stay.The room itself was large and comfortable, with a very generously sized bathroom and walk in wardrobe. The only downside was the size of the beds. Being unaccustomed to US sizing, I’d assumed that our ‘quadruple room’ would have two UK sized double beds when in fact they were far smaller double beds and would not fit two average sized adults comfortably.The hotel was very clean and the staff were professional and friendly. The location was great too - far enough away from the melee of Times Square etc to have a slightly calmer atmosphere but still close enough for an easy walk to many of the main tourist attractions. I would happily recommend this hotel to holidaymakers and business travellers alike.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I went for the youth summit at UN it is right outside a major plus!! at check in the lady was not so welcoming " did not get acknowledge as a gold member". But LIAM!!! the night auditor was AMAZING!!! so friendly and helpful, since we did not get our water at check-in he sent it up. The hotel is BEAUTIFUL, super clean. And the breakfast for the club member was nice with the beautiful view of the city and the staff was amazing and helpful kazi and another guy (short indian man) the morning of july 5th sorry forgot to take his name were awesome. Will definitely stay again!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Hotel was just as described. Super clean and comfortable. Staff was super attentive to our every needs. Room had a view that was amazing! We would definitely stay here again when we go to NYC! We loved it!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: AMAZING property with BEAUTIFUL views of the city. Superior suites with upgraded amenities that make every guest feel like a dignitary.Shoutout of GRATITUDE to HHonors Front Desk Team Member, Nicole for her kindness & hospitality checking in at The Millenium. Coming off of a 12 hour international flight & barely able to sign my name she quickly got me in to a BEAUTIFUL suite with a gift of refreshing & much needed bottled water. Her help in extending my stay one more day allowed me to spend my first & most memorable 4th of July in NYC. An event I will forever cherish. Special thanks to Mohomed in the Sky Club who took care if us for breakfast overlooking the UN & East River. His advice & help in securing UN Tour tickets ahead of time saved me from some very long que lines. It was a pleasure to start my NY mornings dining on the 30th Floor because of his EXCELLENT Customer Service.Many THANKS Millenium UN for a WONDERFUL homecoming & stay. GOD BLESS!!!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great location right beside the UN BuildingFantastic view over the East RiverFantastic quality of service thanks to Barry at the reception and Franck who make sure that your journey will be unforgettable. The only thing missing is a swimming pool but the gym is great.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I have recently been attending meetings at the Millenium related to activities at the UN and UNESCO. I have not stayed in the hotel but used the cafe and facilities . I strongly recommend this hotel if you are doing international business in the midtown NYC area or doing business at UN and agencies.
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
Geoffrey A
New York, New York, United States

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Loved this Hotel, it is within walking distance to Times Square and many other places of interest, especially if you like walking a lot. Our room was fabulous, the view from our bedroom window was magnificent.. We didn't eat in the hotel at night so can't say how the food was. there is a little coffee dock which had nice coffee and cakes. :) the only minus for us was that there was no Wi-fi in the bedroom, Wi-fi should be mandatory in this day and age. Overall I would recommend this hotel and would use it again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We paid a bit extra for the package to watch the 4july fireworks. Indeed the view of these and looking downtown including Chrysler and Empire State over to the west were fabulous, we were given access to the lounge in the other tower, which was underwhelming with a poor breakfast, horrible coffee and early evening alcoholic drinks that are charged. Service at reception is businesslike- impersonal. I suppose this hotel mainly services the guests of the UN rather than tourists. Good location in aa quiet part of midtown Manhattan. The gym is average for a city hotel; there is no pool. We needed to leave early on our last morning and were told they couldn’t provide any breakfast parcel for us, despite this being included in the package rate, which we thought rather poor.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The property is nice, and a great location over-looking the harbor. However there are no ice machines, the internet connectivity was poor, and the TV did not work at all. Also the room was not ready at 4 . Overall it was an acceptable hotel, but several things that could be improved. The employees were friendly and helpful, so that helped.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Mom n Me week to Manhattan. Being my mom safety was her very first reason for booking the most uppity hotel that was way out of our league. And next to the United Nations Building put her at ease, yet in the world we are living in, seemed to me to be furthest away from this place? I was way wrong and Mother’s are always right, super safe feeling with all the different security measures that this hotel had in place. I swear my Under Armour back pack from the plane ride did leave me looking strange, very high class guest, maybe dress up to stay here, at all times:) Guest Services and door man were so helpful, they knew their city and their hotel like a studied student, the best customer service I’ve ever seen at a hotel. Being a hotel manager in the past, this towering beauty of a hotel must be ran by the greatest GM of all time. The room was spotless. I’ve raved about other clean rooms but our room was cleaner than anything I could have asked. The attention to fine detail is what I look for, there were too many to list. The mini- bar can get super costly so pay attention to this..water bottles are the worst. We were lazy so yeah we owed a ton. SHOPPING SHOPPING SHOPPING,you couldn’t imagine the locations of my favorite stores we could get to by walking, best trip ever for shopping. The pool was empty, apparently the rich politicians must not want to get their hair wet. Worked for me, swam in a massive pool on the highest level I imagine at night with a perfect view of the nyc lights..from the pool. The view was all you needed to see to simply enjoy the biggest city in the world! And from our hotel room I felt like Carrie Bradshaw in her pent house suite...just with my mom not Mr Big? Still perfection highly recommended hotel

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Came up for a 1 night stay - location by the United Nations was perfect - minimal issues getting to/from the hotel with typical NYC traffic delays.
