Executive lounge was nice, not crowded and staff was awesome. Received an upgraded room with a view looking south across lower Manhattan... amazing... just amazing. One negative is that the front desk can get VERY busy in the mornings handling check-ins/outs... so plan on a few extra minutes as the staff works with the customers. Overall - excellent stay!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel was nice. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. The elevators were slow and the carpet could use a shampoo however, my overall experience was excellent. The view from my room also very nice.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Prime check in time , two staff. Took 20 minutes. Requested feather free room on reservation...they did not read before hand. Check in on line was of no use..no help with speed of checkin or accuracy. Came back from dinner they threw four extra pillows in room, two of which were feather AND DID NOT REMOVE THE ORIGINAL down pillows. Unreal. And I am a three year Diamond member..No place to get soft drink after 8pm.Heated toilet seats with 4 button gizmo by tissue holder. High tech toilets. Wowser!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed one night here in transit, and were glad we did; the staff was super helpful, including accomomdating a late checkout so we could get some more sleep (we arrived very late); they also gave us a very nice room on a high floor, with a view to the south, with both the Empire State and Chrysler buildings in view to the right.The room was also nicely sized, especially for NYC.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: If you are traveling to New York and want to stay in an excellent hotel mext to the United Nations then the Millennium Hilton at One UN Plaza is the perfect hotel. In additional to a subperb locations, staff is extremely helpful, the Ambassador Grill has a varied menu and excellent wine list. If you are able to stay on the upper floors the views are ones you will never forget. The hotel looks over the United Nations and the East River.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We had a room on the 29th floor. The views were simply stunning. We could see the river, empire state building , Chrysler building and all the way to Brooklyn. Just as good as the view from the top of the Empire State Building. Room was large had a setter and chairs great after a day sightseeing. Wonderful shower and bathroom plus separate room for clothes shoes and cases which meant it was lovely and spacious. The staff could not be more helpful..cant do enough for you. Excellent custo.er service whoever runs the training does an excellent job and staff seem very happy to work there. Would recommend such a good place to get around from and not too noisy etc as some areas are

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The location is prime. Midtown Manhatten but not crowded with tourists. The room is clean and bed is comfortable. Although there's no complementary wifi, which is almost unbelievable considering this is HIlton, also the wall is not very sound proof.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed here while on a college visit with my son to Fordham University. I chose it because it was a short walk to Grand Central. Plenty of places to eat within walking distance. 20 minutes without traffic to LGA. It’s only a 15-20 minutes walk to Times Square too. Hotel is clean and staff is friendly. Restaurant in hotel had good food but needs more choices for dinner.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: No restaurant open between 11am and 5pm. Including Sunday brunch! Coffee drunk in room not replaced, broken toilet flusher, no drinking glasses in bathroom, $100+ deposit held 4 days with no reason. Horrid stay in this hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Our hotel stay helped to put our trip over the TOP! Great location, wonderful accommodations and excellent service. We plan to visit again & have already recommended the hotel to others. We felt very safe.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed for two nights on the 15 and 16th of June 2018. Our room was on the 30th floor and the view was amazing. Almost as good as the Empire State Building. We had a great view of the river and the buildings. The staff was very attentive and helpful. They have a little market for coffee and other items. A little pricey but you are in NYC.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: After a 2 day meeting at the Millenium hotel I feel compelled to write this review, to recognise the excellent conferencing services of the hotel. Mr Flood, Director of the Banquet Operations and his exceptional team of conferencing staff provided the most professional and attentive service to the meeting, ensuring we could focus on the work and acheive our meeting objectives. I really recommend this hotel for meetings and conferences, and congratulate Mr Flood on his excellent work.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel is old and dirty. The carpet is filthy and sticky. The bed sheet makes my entire body itchy. The room has a disappointing small window to view the bueatiful Manhattan sky lines. Find a newer Hilton.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Very nice comfortable inside, a okay location, not very close to subway. But a good spot to stay if you plan to visit UN. Most of service people are nice with some you can tell that they has been tired with too many people every day. Would you think I would stay again if I am in the area?

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: A few points about this hotel-Good bits- Location is really good- Rooms are smart, light and modern- Great beds- Rooms are high, we were on floor 37, great viewsBad Bits-- No free wifi, only in reception, they wanted an extra 10 dollars a day !!- Reception area was a little dated- Good staff- Nice reception coffee shop

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Best thing about this hotel was the amazing views. We had a room on 38th floor and another on 39th and were amazed by the views. Our first trips to NYC didn't know which side of Manhattan to stay in, this side was perfect for us, quieter at night, close to grand central and 10 minutes to Times Square. The rooms were OK, super comfy beds and pillows, nice en suite. Some staff really friendly, others not so much. Rooms cleaned and fresh towels daily. We didn't have the breakfast as other reviewers had commented that it was poor value and quality.Now for the down side........no fridge or water in the rooms, a coffee machine was provided with two coffee pods per day, but no water to fill the coffee machine, so we resorted to buying a few bottles from a local shop. There was a mini bar fridge, but for some ridiculous reason it was not plugged in so I couldn't even keep any fresh milk for the coffee, and none was provided.We weren't given the code for the free wifi initially so asked at reception the following day and were then given the code.All in all I'd rate 4/5 because of the drinks situation. 1 black coffee per day, per person, is really not good enough when considering the daily rates charged for the hotel, and it's a real shame that they let themselves down by being stingy with coffee and water.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: First and foremost this is a great hotel, as soon as we arrived the building was impressive, it’s situated in a really smart area, quiet yet close to Grand Central and Times Square. Security is top notch with sniffer dogs by the door, this because it’s next to the UN building, saying that everywhere I visited in NYC felt safe day or night.Most hotel staff I met were friendly and very polite, that goes for all the people that I met in New York. The room was quite basic but very clean, beds were super comfortable and I slept really well every night. The view of the City was mind blowing, Chrysler Building and the Empire State, look left and you can see the WTC. If I have any complaint it would be that there was no fridge in the room, disappointing as not all people like espresso and some need milk in their coffee. Also two coffees per day for two people is not enough, maybe put milk sachets with the coffee. There was a mini bar fridge but it wasn’t plugged in and had a sign saying not to put anything in it. Oh and being charged €7 for a bottle of water.. Come on Hilton this is just not on, shouldn’t have to go down 38 floors in the middle of the night to get get water from a shop around the corner for $1.I recommend Johns cafe just up road for breakfast. Service and food were fantastic great prices too. If I’m NYC again I would consider staying here again. I’ve given 4 stars because of the fridge situation, the lack of coffee and the price of water at the bar. It was 35 degrees while we were there and I felt that chilled water in the room was a necessity. Overall great

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed here for 7 nights from June 8th. We had mixed feelings in what to expect due to quite a few negative comments regarding staff. Don’t read the negative comments, every member of staff we got to meet was so friendly, very welcoming and could not do anymore for us. We contacted the hotel after booking and they gave us exactly what we required. The hotel is situated approx 15-20 minutes walk from Times Square. Grand Central 10 minutes. Supermarkets and restaurants 2-5 minutes. Perfect if you want a quiet location. We was given a room on the 36th floor in the west tower (city facing) and the views were unbelievable. The rooms are big, clean and the beds are very very comfortable. Our 3 year old has cried wanting to go back “to his hotel room” since we landed at Manchester, England. We entered our room to welcome cakes and birthday cards for our son. An extra special touch they didn’t need to do. I can’t recommend this hotel enough. This was our 5th visit to NYC and by far the best views of the city I’ve ever seen from any hotel. To be able to see the WTC, Hudson River, part of Liberty island, the Empire State Building, the Chrysler, the Met Life, the Con Edison and the lights from Times Square was worth the expense. Keep up the good work, thank you very much for a fantastic stay and we will definitely see you all again in the future.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I had a great time at the UN Millenium hotel, particularly as it was at a fantastic location, the rooms were big and spacious, and it also has all the amenities and facilities you need for a family vacay! Loved it. Will be my go-to hotel in New York next time ....

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: A great place to stay if one is willing to pay $$$. Convenient, great view and overall great staff. I love the ease of check out and the perks of being a Hilton Honors member. I wish we were allowed to check in early given how much we have to pay for an overnight stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: At the Millenium Hilton UN you will live in the lap of luxury! Entering the impressive mirrored lobby, you immediately feel at home. The bountiful breakfast buffet brings you all you could wish for. As a Hilton Honors member, I visited the Skyline Lounge for free appetizers and sip an evening cocktail while drinking in the most wonderful views of the East River. Every room boasts wonderful views. Attentive staff, luxury accommodations at a very fair price for NYC. Enjoy!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great room and grew view. Very friendly staff and excellent service. Great location and very convenient to get anywhere in the city. Complimentary Internet access is very good. Premium internet is even better. Start with complimentary access as it will work well for most stuff.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I stayed here for business in June. The spotless rooms are modern and offer stunning views of the Manhattan Skyline. I particularly liked the fact I could open my window on the 32nd floor to enjoy the breeze and noise of the cityscape below.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Comfortable, quiet stay with amazing views on the 36th floor. Cozy, clean, newly decorated room made our weekend stay enjoyable. Great location also, friendly and helpful hotel staff. Will definitely stay here again when in NYC.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Check in was smooth and so was the overall stay. I do believe that the rooms itself could use a bit of renovation. Nonetheless, I was offered a gorgeous view of the city, the UN building, & the Empire state building so it was worth it. Sylvia was very kind and assisted with my issues during my stay. The canine who sits at the front (Frank) was my favorite part. He was such a sweet dog!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I had originally booked a hotel 0.4 km away, and only moved to be with colleagues and for convenience of location. However, although convenient for meetings at the UN, this hotel was disappointing, overpriced and the rooms need a major renovation. Bar fridge empty, breakast started too late for a business traveller, only one bar, whch was not open all day. It was 4 times more expensive that the new hotel I had originally booked, so I'll be going to that one next time. Disappointingly, I was not advised, even as a Hilton Honors member, of the free wifi code available to me, so ended up paying for it the first three days! On a positive note, the staff were, almost without exception, excellent.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This is not a 4 star hotel by any stretch of the imagination. I had an awful stay and will not recommend. First as you enter you are sniffed throughout by a dog- with no explanation. I had to ask why. I was then sniffed twice; the other guard did not realize I had already been sniffed. First time ever. and it 's not that I have never been in a hotel near the UN. The staff at the entrance was rude and unfriendly. The room: I don't know where to start, see pictures. Run down is an understatement. Chipped walls, dirty carpet to enter the room, old and dirty counter top, and to top it all a bundle of hair on the bathtub. Tiniest closet ever. As a friend told me, please do yourself a favor: walk five blocks out of there and you will find plenty of good options for the same price. I left the next day.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The rooms felt very dated. And one was full of weird angles. The Concierge level was also in need to updating but Igor who worked up there was awesome. The breakfast could have used some extra type of protein. The cleaning staff were very nice. The elevators took forever and often took you the wrong way. Live and learn.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great hotel, loved the views. But remember, it is still in Manhattan so rooms are small. Great views from gym, hope they had similar windows in the rooms. Just walking from UNHQ but little away from all other main attractions or where tours start. We managed to go around with cabs, Lyft etc. Free wifi with HHonors.Early check in no problem.Friendly staff.Not give 5* only because one day maid replenished coffee, tea etc; but second day, she didn't clean coffee cups or didn't replenish either coffee or tea. Have no idea, but somehow felt she was angry. I had just told her that we will be going out in 30 mins and she can clean the room after that.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Nice rooms and stuff. Rooms are fresh renoveted and large. Very good value for money for the hotel (not for drinks and food there). Safe neighboorhoud. There is always a lot of police in front of the hotel. Small minuses: Food and drinks are very expensive there (coke 4,80 plus tax in self service cafe). Wifi is not the best, because it was interrupt at times everyday. 5 stars because of the good value for the money.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: First time in Midtown, usually I stay in other parts of the City, but it was a great choice.The rooms are very nice with wonderful views and the breakfast @30th floor is something unique. We enjoied also a late check out!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I stayed at the Millennium Hilton at 1 UN Plaza for 6 days while my brother had surgery at Sloan Kettering one mile away. While there are closer hotels to the hospital, this Hilton is a “green” hotel. What does that mean? You get a room free of strong chemical aromas and a choice of pillows and bedding to help anyone with allergies. I traveled with my SIL who has many. Not only that, we were highly stressed and we didn’t know how long our stay was going to be. We had to coordinate our departure with when the doctor said my brother could leave. We increased our stay by one day increments and not only did the hotel staff accommodate us, they did it with a smile and they did not make us change rooms. They also facilitated everything that we asked for in order to make this stay as easy as possible. Now I hope if you are reading this, you aren’t needing a hospital stay as well but if you are looking for a good clean hotel in this area, I can highly recommend this one.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed for a few days at this hotel. I had nothing but a great time during my stay. The doormen were very friendly, attentive and were always available to offer me assistance. Hannah from the lobby concerige desk was extremely knowledgeable, very friendly, and always offered me assistance with activities in the city. Will definitely stay here again!
user_name:
wakaf2018
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Planned our dream trip to new york and my wife's 40th ,so wanted a hotel that was downtown Manhattan. The hotel is very nice and our room was clean and modern, employees were very accomodating ( just remember you have to tip in America, us Brits are used to this lol).On the whole the hotel is situated near close subway stations and also sights and attractions can be walked within a reasonable time,just invest in a good pair of trainers.Our room overlooked the 911 memorial and the area the towers were once situated ,this was a very emotional sight when we looked out as this was a major influence on the city and the rest of the world,but gave us great insight to the actual scale of devastation and made us appreciate the holiday a little bit more.Stay at this hotel ....we weren't disappointed.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This was our second year staying at the hotel and we were not disappointed. From the staff to the accommodations, this is a first class hotel! And it’s only a short walk from Grand Central Station and subways. Would stay here again in a heartbeat

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The service was friendly, the room was clean, so if you don‘t expect much, it‘s all fine. We had a corner room with view on east river and to Empire State, so the view was gorgeous. But the windows in the room were small even though we had a corner room with a long window front, and the roof was low, so the room appeared to be small and dark. Bathroom was clean and newly renovated.The location is great, you can walk to most of the sightseeing places.Just 2 stars because of the dark and small room, but also because of the executive lounge. It was a smaller space with not much than 2 cans of coke, few more cans of sprite and some bottled water. It was also our breakfast room, and the breakfast was nothing what I was used to from good quality hotels.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Although we had no complaints with this Hilton, there was nothing special about it either and we weren’t really impressed. The staff were all friendly, helpful, and professional and did a great job. Our room had a great view of the East River and Queens. Although small, the room was very clean and comfortable, as you would expect. The hotel is much smaller than the building it is located in, occupying only about the 30th - 37th floor. The decor in the public spaces consisted of dark colored surfaces with chrome and glass trim and overall, everything is very dark. The executive lounge was very disappointing. The walls were sided in old paneling, the windows were dirty, and it was very small and dated. The evening snacks were very limited and there was a fee for drinks. The breakfast there was pitiful. The small room was very crowded and seating was limited. There were the usual breads, cereals, yogurt and fruits, but the only hot option was scrambled eggs. Hampton Inns put out a better breakfast.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed last week to celebrate my husbands 60th birthday, we loved the hotel, rooms large and very clean bed was really comfortable. Very modern, just a shame the coffee was not open after 8pm. Good selection at breakfast. Friendly staff. We stayed on the 34th floor lift was was very quick, no waiting around.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Excellent employes, excellent rooms, excellent service. For the best view choose a room on the south side. The employes do their best to help you. Bed is very comfortable. AC in the room. View was fantastic!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I was in town celebrating my 50th birthday and I really enjoyed my stay. The staff was friendly and the service was amazing. The hotel is steps away from the united nations and we really enjoyed walking the neighborhood at night. I will be definitely going back

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My overall experience was absolutely amazing. The staff gave phenomenal service and very friendly. My stay lasted 1 full week and I was pleased. I will definitely return. Amazing service and overall experience!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: As a hhonor gold, Hilton UN plaza offers probably the worst breakfast option to elite members compare to other nyc Hiltons (midtown, London, renwick..) Sky lounge breakfast has only one hot item (scrambled egg during my stay), and no option to upgrade to downstairs restaurant breakfast. Maybe this hotel is only targeting business travelers who have breakfast bill covered? Our room has a nice view tho.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Got there a little after 2PM, room wasn't ready. I was told check in is at 4PM (a little late I think). Left the bags with the bellboy. Came back later, easy check in.The view from the room was amazing. We had a room with 2 beds, beds were really small.On our 2nd day they forgot to give us towels. Had to call Housekeeping to ask for 4 clean towels, they only brought 2 so I had to call again... Friendly staff. Wifi worked fine.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel itself is perfectly adequate and offers excellent views across NYC. We stayed in a room with two beds. They are not doubles as advertised however. The room was well furnished and clean. The view from the window was stunning. The lobby area of the hotel is very odd. It looks scruffy and they have music blasting at a volume that is not relaxing. However the biggest problem with this hotel is the staff. They all need to go on a customer service training course. Rude, unhelpful and miserable are the accurate adjectives for the hotel staff. If you want a hotel with a view and do not mind terrible customer service, choose this hotel. Otherwise look elsewhere.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The location of the hotel is excellent. Close to the Grand Central Station. Walking few minutes from Times Square. Rooms at the hotel start on the 29th floor and Up.. each room has an amazing view or to the city or to the east river. Staff at the hotel are charming and serviced. Large rooms !!! We were there for 9 nights and we enjoyed the every minute we were in it

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The best part of the stay is the view, if you get a corner room facing the UN building. It is mesmerizing! The executive lounge is just about ok so don’t have high expectations from the breakfast or evening snacks. It can get expensive at times, especially when there is something going on at the UN. The security can get very tight and it feels like going through airport security with the x-ray machine and the sniffer dog trying to sniff your baggage and yours truly in all places :)

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We had great time in this hotel, which is very nice and comfortable. From our room and the sky lounge we had a wonderful view. His staff was nice and professional. It is close to the United Nation and not far from the metro - rail.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Visited this hotel recently. Was found to be very overpriced and not up to the standard of a 4* hotel. The facilities in the room was very limited. The coffee machine did not work properly and didn't contain the ingredients to make a coffee which other hotels do. Breakfast was the most overpriced I have ever seen at $80 for a small buffet. Other 5* hotels charge 10-20$...also when we arrived we tried to pay half cash , half credit card which could not be done by the hotel for some unknown reason which caused a major inconvenience. Their machine also wouldn't accept the credit card due to it unable to recognise the expiry date.Would recommend the hotel to display the full price including tax on all your advertisements as well.Would not recommend.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Incredibly courteous staff. Andrew was great at assisting with our accommodations. Great location, central to all areas we wanted to see. Great accommodations for the family. We plan on staying here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was perfect with a great view of the river and bridge. The location is a bit removed from the heart of Manhattan, but it did not take long to get where we wanted to be. Will definitely do this one again when we return to NYC.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: After the last hotel this was a welcome relief. First we were able to drive up to front and unload all of our luggage. We had our toddler grandson with us so you can imagine the amount of luggage. We were brought to the front desk and promptly greeted. The staff was friendly and when they saw our baggage we were ungraded to a suite, free internet, and free breakfast. The one issue with this hotel is that the lowest floor is the thirtieth. I like lower floors but we figured we would take it. Well we got to the suite and it WAS a two bedroom, real suite. It had two baths , two fully enclosed bedrooms and a real living room. The view was spectacular from every vantage point. My grandson ran around for hours and had the time of his life. The breakfast was truly free. The room was spotless. There was a restaurant on site but we didn’t try it. There is plenty of garage parking nearby and the hotel is on 44th so very convenient for me. I highly recommend this hotel. In addition there are two great restaurants on 44th and 43rd. One steak and one Italian within two blocks. So stay for the view and nearby food. You won’t regret it.
user_name:
truthintravel60763
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel at least twice a year, but this past visit in May 2018 was not good. They didn’t have an accurate reservation even though I made it through their website. I had requested the West tower, which I didn’t get! The room was smaller, bathtub slippery, dirty towels, refrigerator was dirty, and internet kept going off and on. Requested to have refrigerator cleaned twice, but no one did it!!! Time to look for a new hotel!!!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I have stayed in many hilton hotel but this one lets the side down. Rude, grumpy, very unhelpful reception staff. The room was clean but could do with being repainted. We we’re in room 3013 on floor 33, from the minute we walked into our room, we had this very loud knocking noise in the bathroom, phoned reception which they said it was building work above us and will stop soon. Come back in the evening the noise is still there, phone again still no help. Phoned the next morning after being kept awake all night with the noise, still no help from reception staff. Finally on Monday something was done about it and we moved rooms.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel is located close to Central Station and even walking distance to Rockefeller Plaza. The room I had was clean, with the exception of a stain on the carpet. View of the river was very nice. The disappointing part was the $43 (with tax and a hotel added tip) for breakfast buffet. For 1 person! I realize this is NY, but let’s not get ridiculous. Because of such extreme charges I would never stay here on a personal trip.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed in this hotel for 9 nights. The hotel was so beautiful and we had a great view from our corner room. When we checked in they asked for a 350 dollar deposit and we paid it from credit card. It's been now 3 weeks since we left the hotel and we still haven't get our money back. I've sent many e-mails but all they say is that it will be tacking care of. Very dissapointed and because of that, even though our stay in the hotel was great, we would never stay there again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Elegant, quiet and sophisticated hotel. The rooms are modern and elegant with seating and great views. Ozzie and Frank in the lobby are the best. Everyone made me feel very special and I will stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I moved from the Midtown hotel to this hotel and it was worlds apart! The room was roughly the same with the exception that the TV was a smart TV so I could stream Netflix when in the room. My view was also exceptional with the Chrysler building and the Empire State well in view.The breakfast was standard (exec lounge) but the lounge is on a high floor with panoramic views so it was a perfect way to start your day overlooking Manhattan and the River.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel has larger rooms than we have seen in most NYC hotels- and was perhaps more recently refurbished, because the floor we were on had almost no scratched up walls and everything looked pretty new - something that is extremely rare for NYC hotels. The beds are very comfortable with mattresses on the softer side. The King room we had also had a wide sofa which was a more firm cushion and could easily be used as a second bed if needed. The bathrooms in this hotel are very spacious as well, and the 'fun' toilets make you think more of overseas establishments. The rooms, as pointed by others, gather an incredible amount of dust, and it is unclear why. So our room was dust-free in the AM, but by evening, a visible layer of dust had covered all surfaces, such that we could draw out distinct artwork in the dust. I actually think they do an exceptional job at housekeeping, to remove that dust every morning. I found the hotel exceptionally clean.The view from the room we had was amazing and I was told all the rooms had a similar view.The soundproofing is odd. We could hear nothing from the hallway, but when we stepped in bathroom we could hear every word from a room above. This could have been a fluke for our particular room - it is unclear. But the sound was magnified as if broadcast into our bathroom.The only issue we had with the hotel was check-in, where there are lines and only one person working (while you hear everyone else laughing in the back). Furthermore, forget about any Hilton Honors benefits. Your gruff and unfriendly check in person cannot be bothered to care. Want a room with two beds and you booked a King - no matter that the hotel is half empty, you must PAY UP and substantially (without having any extra people). Its crazy that hotels cannot figure out how much goodwill they can create by doing free upgrades when its so easy to do. This was all minor and we would be happy to stay here again.
user_name:
Matars_Z
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: made reservations with specific request upon arrival when arrived @ room not meeting request called and reached Linda who i had made reservation with she rectified the situation almost immediately and seemed to be available any time we needed something many thanks for a most pleasant stay was in ny to ge an award @ Ciprianis thanks again

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed here for a couple of nights. We had a room on the 33rd floor, and the view of NY was brilliant. We could see the Empire state, the Chrysler building etc. I think all rooms in the hotel are on the 29th floor or higher, so all rooms should have pretty decent views. The room itself was lovely - modern, clean, spacious, great TV (not that we were watching it much!).We had access to the Sky lounge, which has even better views, of both sides of the building. It serves a really nice and varied breakfast in the morning. It also serves food and drink in the evening. I thought the food was pretty awful and the drink is not complimentary so I wouldn't book the hotel for the lounge, if that is a sole deciding factor.I found the service at the hotel to be disappointing. It was not all bad - the man in the lounge was friendly, and we were checked out by a lovely guy at front desk. However we found many of the staff at the front desk to be quite unfriendly (I think sour and unsmiling would fit the bill). For example just after checkout my partner asked for a key to access the lobby restrooms and was wordlessly thrown a box of keys. We at one point asked for a spare shower gel and were told quite rudely that we should have 'dialled 6' but that they could sort it. No shower gel came. So all in all, an enjoyable stay. Stunning views and a nice modern hotel. But the worst service I've had in all the hotels I've stayed as part of this trip.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My husband and I have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. Everything was more than perfect. The lovely friendly staff all atound the hotel including the coffee shop. We had a deluxe double room ( which I believe is standard) on the 36 floor facing the city. The room was gorgeous, comfortable bed and a fantastic shower! The views from this room was absolotley incredible ( see photo)I frequently found myself just sat by the window taking it all in. Check in and out was very efficient. The location is fantastic, we walked everywhere. You can get to shops/ cafes and coffee shops in a matter of minuites, grand central station in about 5 minuites, empire state in about 15, we even walked back from central park which took us around 40 minuites. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and we will 100% stay here again when we come back to NYC. Thanks Millennium Hilton.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: First time in New York and couldn’t have chosen a better hotel. Perfect location, friendly staff, clean rooms, good food and WiFi and no noise! Amazing hotels from hotel room and great recommendations from hotel concierge

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel is a 38 storey building and most rooms are on the top floors with spectacular views over central Manhattan, just opposite the Chrysler and the Empire State Building. The location is also fantastic, 5 minutes walk (3 blocks) from the Grand Central station and subway terminal.By booking in advance we were also lucky to benefit a great discounts and fantastic value for money. Highly highly recommended!!!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I had not stayed at this hotel before. I went because of the views. They did not disappoint. A King corner room in the East Tower with glorious views of the East River and if I stood behjind the sofa right on the corner side I could see the Chrysler Building. The room was clean and spacious. I didn’t use the coffee machine..which I understand Imwould have had to pay for. I joined Hilton Honours which gave me free WiFi. It was my 5th trip to New York. I have friends in the city. I am very comfortable to wander around in my own. I love walking in Manhattan. If you want a big fuss made of you then this may not be the place for you. If you want to be left alon, have great views, easy access to the East Side. Good rooms. Then it could well be. The hotel starts on 30th floor so views guaranteed.It will be my choice next trip.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I just spent two nights at this hotel and it was one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had. Being a frequent visitor to NYC, I usually stay at the Westin Grand Central or Intercontinental and this time I decided to try this Hilton, having just acquired the Diamond Status. I had to switch rooms after the first night, given how dusty I found my first room and the light woke me up at 7am, despite what is supposed to be a blackout blind. The hotel switched my room and to much dismay, the air conditioning did not work in this room, as was confirmed by the hotel and technician, at which point all they offered to do was send a fan to my room. I also notice that the hotel is not kept tidy and there was a paper bag of food left outside one of my neighbouring rooms, which was there for 15 hours without anyone cleaning it up. Do yourself a favour and stay elsewhere. I question how Priceline could qualify the hotel as 4.5 stars.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: sneeky sleezy ways they try to make money. no water. $10 for internet. in breakfast, they dont explicitly say coffee is extra, but they serve you orange juice and coffee and then reveal it is extra. how cheap. everyone who works there seems to be interested in just making tips. so obviously management doesnt pay them well.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I had a wonderful experience at this property! Barry at the front desk was very helpful and made sure he made my first time in NYC amazing with a room on a high floor with a view I've only seen in movies. The bellman, Frank was super friendly and offered great suggestions on things to do in the area and places for good eats. Room was lovely and clean! I can't wait to come back!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great hotel and location. Rooms clean and spacious. Fantastic services highly recommend. Room service. Restaurant on site. Indoor tennis court.Great food places and deli near by.They have a coffee shop in the Lobby.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great stay here, close to transport hub, in a quiet part of.the city. We stayed in a corner room which was large by New York standards. The WiFi was slow. It had a fridge the bed was comfy and the view pretty good. The toilet was spectacular, the bathroom storage and room great. If.you staying here walk up to Smith and Wolenski, or Wolenski's grill for a fantastic meal well priced.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This was our first stay at this property, but we’d return for sure...nice staff that were attentive to our Hilton Honors benefits. Elevators were fast. Easy to get cab/Lyft/Uber. Walking distance to lots of food variety. Easy enough to get over to the Broadway area, too, which was our purpose this weekend. Overall a great Hilton property.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This was our first time in New York and I am so glad that we chose to stay at the Millennium Hilton. I'll start with the one negative...I was not pleased with was the $50 charge to check in early. Whilst I appreciate the check in time is 4pm, if the room is ready, is there a need to charge? However, that aside, everything else was fantastic. We were greeted from our taxi by a very friendly gentleman, who took our cases into the lobby whilst we waited to check in. We were on the 39th floor and the views across the city were amazing! The room was perfect for what we needed. I requested an extra fridge and a kettle and they were delivered promptly. There is a coffee machine in the room but it wasn't to my liking, it is an espresso machine which I knew prior to our visit so I took my own coffee and bought some milk ( hence the request for a fridge) The bed was really comfy, just what we needed after a long day. The shower was great too! We had clean towels daily...the complimentary toiletries were a nice touch. There was a hair dryer and an iron in the room, and a safe which came in handy for locking away valuables.I cannot comment on the restaurant as we didn't use it during our visit. I would highly recommend Johns Cafe on the corner if you're looking for somewhere nearby to have a yummy breakfast at a reasonable price.The hotel is close to grand central station if you're looking to use the subway to get around, though it's within walking distance of Central Park and Times Square.I would definitely return to the millennium Hilton should I be lucky enough to visit this wonderful city for a second time.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I was in NY to attend a UN event, and this hotel's location was perfect. I was also in a room on the 38th floor with incredible views. However, this stay was otherwise disappointing. Despite lots of staff standing around at the entrance to this hotel, no one greeted me or tried to help me out of the cab when I arrived. Throughout my stay, this did not change. There appeared to be lots of employees hanging around, but none of them ever addressed me in any way or offered me any help of any kind. At checkout, it took them forever to print out a copy of my bill. There were very apologetic, and I kept offering to have them email it to me, but they kept saying that the printer would be fixed any minute. Sigh.In the room, the desk area was mainly taken up by the TV, and there was no real room to do any work, which was an issue as I was on a work trip. There is an Illy coffee machine in the room, but I noticed that one of the coffee cups at the station was still dirty and there were coffee stains on the counter, so I went to Starbucks instead. The room's style was also not to my liking - it was trying to be very modern, but in a manner that was just inconvenient. For example, there was no shower door – just an opening at the end of the glass, which was weird. There was terrible lighting throughout the room, and I couldn't figure out how to turn on some of the lamps. One lamp was completely unplugged. I will definitely not be staying here again - there are just too many great hotels in NY to spend money on this one.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Overall a very good stay. The location was good, the skyline views were awesome and my NW corner room views (sunrise and sunset skies) on the 34th floor of the West Tower were the best I ever had in Manhattan. The housekeeping attention to detail was subpar. There was a used bandaid under the ottoman (I threw away) and other debris. I brought this to the attention of the front desk however it was not cleaned up during my 4 night stay. The breakfast was great, especially the berries and pain de chocolate. Didn’t care for the happy hour reception food choices and only went one evening. I’d stay here again.
user_name:
adamWDC
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I hate hotels that charge you $50 to check in at 13:00 "because check-in is after 16:00" and then add $10 for WiFi access. This hotel belongs in the last century. Other than that, it's an ok business hotel but I won't be coming back.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: First time in new york, my friend and I stayed in the 2 bedrooms suites, PERFECT! got 2 bathrooms, spacious living room with the most amazing view!!!!!!!!!!!! if you guys seen suits, thats pretty much like that. Left side with the Manhattan river, right side can view empire + Chrysler. Location is not bad as it is quiet at night, took sometime to walk to timesquare or by taxi. In room service end at 12 which is unexpected thought it is 24 hours so we end up just buy our own food for supper, there's a 24 hours mini supermarket 5 min walk which solved the problem. One of door man or security (night shift) on 31 March super nice he went to extend help to book a steak house just 5 min walk away at 10:30pm he ask them to look after us which they did and super friendly. AMAZING steak best so far I have tasted in USA.There is always tiny flaw somewhere for every hotel but gosh the VIEW too awesome for me to notice anything else, why would you anyway! I would want to stay here again if I come back to NY, which I think soon : )

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Big rooms witth king beds but rooms but with plenty of dust . Very unpleasant personnel at the reception often quite rude ...WI Fi is free everywhere in NY and this hotel charges about 10 dollars per day for wi fi ...crazy . Not only , after a week staying at the Hilton Millenium we were asked 75 dollars for postponing the check out of ONE hour and our room was free after our department Bad experience not to be repeated!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel was in a good location, room was clean, spacious and quiet. Watch out for the bathtub, no slip guards on the floor of the tub, and no hand rails. I had a bad fall, onto the bathroom floor landing on my tailbone. Front desk said they were sorry and I emailed the manager to make him aware of incident. No reply from the manager, and still recovering, very slowly, a week later.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Located in Midtown East, across from the UN, this modern, comfortable hotel has remarkable views of Manhattan. As it turned out, the cold Spring weather (0 to 8 degrees C) had us doing most of our sightseeing from the room. As is true of most NY hotels, the higher, the better. Clear views of most of Midtown, but we could also see from the George Washington Bridge up North to the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge and the harbor. We had a two bedroom suite that was in the shape of a wedge, with floor-length windows all around.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I don't normally stay at hotels in New York City, but this hotel is an exception for me. This hotel is in a great neighborhood And it's actually right next to the United Nations headquarters. My room had a great view of the nearby East river, Chrysler building and the Empire state building! The staff were warm and welcoming as well.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Arrived on Easter Sunday.....Very little staff (as per norm).Asked to change room and basically told double beds are like single....”Cause this is New York !!’.Booked into 31st Floor.Nice view.In all, Great location and Super Professionl Staff (except booking for booking in).Would recommend

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel is absolutely beautiful. Our view from the 34th floor was magnificent. We could lay in bed and watch the colors change on the Empire State Building and the Chrysler building. Our bed however was horrible. Dips on each side of the king bed where people had slept. Felt like we were sleeping in a hole. Which was disappointing for the quality of hotel and room. I can only hope that not all rooms are like this. We will definitely stay here again it is a beautiful hotel. If we get a room with a bad bed however the next time we will have to do something about it.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We had a great experience at this hotel. On arrival we were welcomed by Racquell and were given a room on the 34th Floor with a great view. The Chrysler Building, Empire State Building and One World Trade Center were all visible from our window, making for a great sight, especially at night. The Room was quite large by New York standards and was kept very clean throughout our stay. The location of the hotel was very good, within walking distance of Times Square and the theaters on Broadway. The nearest Subway stop is Grand Central, about 4 blocks away.The wifi in the lobby is free, in room wifi is not, unless you are a Hilton Honors member.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed here about 6 years ago and this is the first time we have been back since the refurbishment and we absolutely loved the stay. Our room had a brilliant view of the city and Empire State Building.The hotel and rooms are modern, beautifully finished and very clean.Our room was huge! Lovely big comfy bed, lots of space for all of our possessions. Coffee machine with fresh coffee pods was a nice touch, $9 for two teas in the hotel cafe so would advise one of the deli’s at the too of the street.Great location for exploring the city, we tended to venture out for breakfast for value for money. Brilliant bathroom with great lighting and tons of space. Plenty of fresh towels and a large bath to soak in! Hairdryer provided which was better than my british dryer in the plug adapter. Only small gripe was the guest directory, ours was missing pages relating to the visitors centre. We needed to check in online for our flight so asked at reception and we were told we would just need to come and get the pass key. We wait until 11pm when we could check in, went to get the key only to be told the room was closed until the next morning, this information would have been helpful earlier as we had planned our night around coming back to check in. Otherwise brilliant stay! Would stay again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We ready did enjoy our 5 night stay at UN Hilton. Special mention to the security staff at the front doors with the sniffer dogs. They made my step daughter’s day each time, very friendly and accommodating. Rooms were large by NYC standards. Room staff were really lovely and again accommodating to our needs. I absolutely would stay here again. Executive club staff are lovely though I don’t see the point of the $5 honor bar for wine and beer. I paid though many do not and that’s not right. The reception staff are welcoming, though we had no problems at all. A great sign! A great Hilton. Thank you Josua Hernandez for helping arrange our visit. Shame we didn’t get to thank you personally. See you again soon!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: As a Hilton Honors Diamond Elite member, I chose this hotel prior to a family trip to Croatia because of its convenient East Midtown location and I used to live in the neighborhood so was very comfortable staying here. I arrived super early (before 10 am) from a long flight with little sleep the night before. Luckily, Dorica at the front desk greeted me with a warm welcome and told me she had a room available for me. Amazing corner king room on 30th floor with spectacular views. The bathroom has my new favorite “toy”lette, the Duravit. You’ll have to experience it yourself. Perfect for a cold New York day!Did I mention Dorica is amazing? My sister and brother in law arrived after me and she arranged to have them stay in the mirror room next door. She made our stay a memorable trip and we felt right at home. The Skyline room on the 30th floor offer a delicious continental breakfast with a huge selection of pastries, fresh fruit and eggs! The evening hors d’heurves are great for a pre-theatre snack if you are pressed for time as we were. While I work in NYC, this is my new lodging choice when staying in the City. Again kudos to Dorica and the staff at this gem of a HILTON property.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Just returned from this hotel and although it isn't in Times Square the location is good and Grand Central just 5 mins walk away.Our room was very spacious and the dog sniffing all bags on arrival really helped you feel safe.The bathroom and built in wardrobe were large and the hair dryer was very powerful and although we didn't have a river view the Empire State Building looked amazing from our roomWhilst we were there there was scaffolding in the lobby but this didn't distract from the hotel. lifts were plentiful and the hotel was spotlessWhilst there I suffered an injury whilst out on my out and about. When I returned to the hotel I asked at the bar if I could have some ice to put on my hand, the barman kindly gave me some in a cup and some wrapped in cling film that I could use immediately.There was a coffee shop where danish pastries and muffins could be bought with coffee for breakfast. They were expensive but only what I would from a Hilton HotelThe only complaint I had was with the lack of toiletries provided as when we arrived there was only shower gel and no shampoo or conditioner. Also coffee was restocked daily but breakfast tea was often not restocked on Green tea and coming from the UK breakfast is out preferred teaWould definately recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I was there last September when i went with my fianceé and it was such a great surprise to find out it was a great hotel since we booked it through booking.com website.When we got there there was a guard with a dog smelling everybodys luggage as a daily action because this hotel is located near the UN Headquarters so it makes you feel safe, Front desk was very fast and easygoing,and our room was just great i paid around $171 dlls and the view we had from east river was excellent!Didn´t had the chance to try their restaurant but everything went pretty smooth despite of the fact the minibar was not supplied.I'm attaching a couple of photos so you can better appreciate the space.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Just back from an amazing trip to NYC for my sisters 50th and would 100% recommend this hotel. Our room in the 38th floor was spotless, beds amazing and with the most magnificent views if the river, Empire State and Chrysler Building.  Matthew Flood went out of his way to help me surprise my sister with a lovely cake and room decorated for her 50th birthday. 1st class hotel Thank youAnne Marie Boner room 3818

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed here for a family visit to New York for site seeing. The location was a quick taxi ride from LGA, only about a $35 ride.We arrived late and received a warm welcome from Ticia at the front desk- a very nice greeting after a long and late travel day. Ainsley was also a great help as we arrived. We were in a king suite, which was beautifully appointed and very spacious, with 1 and half baths- perfect for our family of four. Tiffany and Jenny cleaned our room each day and we're meticulous in taking care of our requests. We had a great view overlooking the river, which was perfect. The in-room technology was well thought out, with smart TVs and a central control panel for both lighting temperature. The Honors lounge has spectacular views of the city and serves both a daily breakfast and snacks/beverages in the evening for Honors guests. The location is only two blocks from Grand Central and surrounded by plenty of local restaurants and shops. Traveling as a family, we felt very comfortable and safe in the area walking late in the evening. The staff was simply delightful and really made us feel at home. Monique, at the front desk was a great help and took great care of our family. I would highly recommend this Hotel as a perfect location for enjoying the city whether you're traveling with your family or on your own.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Unfortunately, since changing to a Hilton hotel since last summer, this hotel seems to have gone downhill in terms of service and experience.We had a 20 minute wait for check-in, there were only two people on the desk and no-one else anywhere to be seen. No acknowledgment was given at the time, a curt apology was given when we reached the desk but didn't feel sincere. Despite asking for a room away from the elevators, I was given the room directly in front of them. There was no WiFi in the room, despite this being part of the corporate package we paid for, and no explanation of how to connect. After calling the front desk, an explanation of how to connect for free was given, along with a room upgrade when I commented on the dissapointment of being given a room by the elevators. This was appreciated. I was also instantly signed up to the Honors programe which gave me WiFi access. However, other colleagues staying at the hotel still had issues with WiFi and could still not send emails from their room, despite finally getting a connection. Most hotels give you free, unrestricted WiFi now, as do coffee shops, restaurants and bars, so to find this in a Hilton in NYC seems very antiquated.I am allergic to feathers and so asked for 3 of the 4 pillows to be changed to foam filled ones instead. This took two attempts to get right as the first time they brought me more feather ones. It would be nice if this could be specified at the time of booking or if there was an option in the Hilton Honors programe to set this preference.The room cleaning left a little to be desired, with dirty coffee cups left behind and no refresh of toiletries on one of the days. The hotel bar is lovely but very expensive and closes at 11pm. Check-out was simple and quick and all of the staff were pleasant and helpful, bar the receptionist on check-in.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: If you want an amazing view of Manhattan, pick this hotel. You can save the money from not having to go up Empire State Building or Rockefeller center, because you have the view from your room.Perfectly located next to the UN building and a 5 minute walk to Grand Central.Rooms are spacious, beds are comfortable and as I said view is amazing.The rooms need a bit of a face lift soon though.Service is not ok though. Have had several bad experiences in the reception. The Bell boys are super nice though.The breakfast is the most expensive in NYC. The waiters are not at all service minded... And still want tips. Go 100 meters to 2nd ave and get a better breakfast for half the price with better service at one of the diners.Still I will stay here again, because of the view.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The location in midtown is not bad being close to the U.N., but the hotel itself is not good. The lobby/sitting area downstairs is typically packed with people that seem to not have anything to do. The rooms are in need of maintenance and are not very clean. The room I was put in had a lot of noise constantly from the floor above which I later learned was an athletic area in the hotel. I had to change rooms as a result. I will not go back to this hotel and suggest that no one comes here unless there is no other option.
user_name:
D_W_10017
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: As a Hilton Gold I was told that I did not have access to the executive lounge in the evening (which is fine) but that I did have access for the morning continental breakfast. Oh boy Honestly I wish that I did not access to the lounge for breakfast. I made the mistake of going around 9:30 am and it was a mess. It was packed, the staff was overwhelmed and most of the food was gone. If you like a nice breakfast I recommend the Hilton Grand Central. I was able to use the Hilton app to get a room on the top floor and the view was impressive. However I had to stand to enjoy the view and after a few minutes one has to sit down and the view is gone. I did like that I was able to get a late check-out. This hotel is a little too far from the Subway for me however there was a line of taxis outside the hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Perfect location, close to UN and few minutes from Grand Central. Got an upgrade to a King room on 30th floor. Very spacious and with comfortable bed. Magnificent views over the river and South Manhattan. Internet is free when you join the Hilton Honors program.
user_name:
Ada v
Berkel en Rodenrijs, The Netherlands

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I stay here often, and the rooms are wonderful; large, quiet, and with great views. Since Hilton took over, the service is even better, with smooth check out and handling of emailed receipts. The bar is charming and the executive lounge is very nice too.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Found this hotel to be pretty good. They were reticent to provide me with my Hilton benefits as it was booked through a third party, normally this has not been a problem though and has been granted by various other Hilton properties without hesitation. Nevertheless the helpful desk clerk relented and granted access to the lounge and internet code, this was all I asked so from this point of view I was satisfied that eventually the customer service lived up to other Hilton properties.The room was nice and large although it had not been cleaned fully upon our arrival, used cups and toiletries had not been removed from the room. The bath is a joke though unless you're sub 5ft tall. I did not eat in the restaurant or bar so can't comment. Location wise it is great for the UN obviously and is a 10 minute walk from Grand Central where everything is reachable through the subway. I would recommend for a shorter stay but for any duration this walk can become tiresome especially after a long day of sight-seeing.All in all, very good and I would stay again but this was heavily aided by the helpful desk clerk at check-in. Would have been a very different story otherwise.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I come to NYC for 30 days every year.last year in October I had the pleasure to stay at the Hilton One Millennium.the staff are impeccable, from the minute you step out of the car and are greeted by the friendly Concierge, the wonderful front desk staff, the amazing room attendants you stay at this hotel is Sublime.Being in a Wheelchair presented absolutely not one problem for me.I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt the InterContinental hotels, this Hilton is far superior.From the General Manager , Stefan to the person taking out the rubbish these people set the bar for a wonderful experience.I have once again reserved this hotel for my stay in August

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Loved the ambiance and luxury. From the moment we walked in we knew we were in a very special place. Also found the location to one of the best for finding places to eat, drink, shop. Would stay there again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We were Upgraded to a 2 Bedroom suite. Made my stay here completely worth it. I would come back 100%. Located more off the main streets, so it is quite and Less busy. Highly recommended hotel to stay at.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Had a great time! Gerry (Food and beverage manager was extremely helpful and went out of his way making sure our night was perfect! We had a 2BR suite and 2 regular rooms with sky lounge access. Very clean. Views amazing! Right across the street from The UNited Nations. We were a bit loud being a large crowd but hotel staff was nice about it.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Excellent hotel in a perfect quiet location across from the UN and three blocks to Grand Central to get you anywhere in Manhattan and NY easily. Illy coffee, great restaurant, nice friendly people. I’m looking forward to returning soon!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I stayed here and had a magnificent view from my 1 bedroom loft! The front desk was accommodating and friendly. There is a small coffee shop downstairs that serves sandwiches and coffee. The bellman were attentive and helpful. My top floor suite had 2 bathrooms and was much larger than most NYC hotels. I would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I had an overnight stay. Rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. Shower was amazing. The views were nice. Make sure to put your dnd sign on the door. Housekeeping comes very early in the morning. The location is conveniently across the street from the UN, a 5 minute walk from grand central station and about a 20 minute walk to times square.
user_name:
kimberlybZ4802KY
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Comfortable hotel with an amazing staff. Restaurant a bit overpriced but the food was excellent. Convenient location to the UN, Times Square and Midtown The lobby lounge while small was very relaxing. Yes, I would return.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Spent only 1 night here traveling on business but staff was very accommodating & helpful. Guestroom was a beautiful corner room, very spacious & pretty, with gorgeous views. Executive lounge was large & breakfast had just what I wanted - eggs, yogurt, fruit & coffee

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Absolutely breathtaking. I stayed at this hotel once in the past, and I was not entirely thrilled with it. This weekend changed everything. Ms. Monique Cole-Gonzalez from the front office made sure I had the perfect weekend, a complimentary upgrade to a huge suite, service with a smile. The views from this hotel are amazing, no matter which way you look, the view is just stunning. The hotel starts at the 28th floor, so you’re always going to have a high floor, which is something I prefer. The food at the Ambassador Grille is really good too. - try the burgers. As Hilton Gold I had access to the executive lounge at this hotel, and the Skyline Club was definitely a nice place to relax in the evening, snacks and cold drinks made a nice start before we hit the city & the bars. Continental breakfast in the morning was a nice touch too.All in all, Hilton delivered just as they always do. There’s a reason this brand is my favorite.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: It was a trip of a lifetime for a young irish boy! His first visit to New York with his da and the Hilton did not disappoint us. Raqqel allocated us a fabulous room with a great view - a room in which we were very comfortable in. We had breakfast once in the downstairs grill and Matt and his staff were the most sincere and friendliest folk possible!Mohammed was fab in the executive room and it was obvious that he had a great pride in his job and the lounge in general. His breakfast was a cut above most lounges for sure and the view was amazing.The Hotel is well placed in the city. We walked to Grand Central station and the Chrysler building with ease. Times square was a short hop in an uber and I did notice that uber drivers and lyft drivers were outside the hotel within a few minutes of calling. I like the gym on the east wing on the 27th floor, it had two parts to it which was quite clever, the first part was virtually right outside the lift with the Cardio machines and then a few metres further on were a few machines and an ample amount of weights to do upper body etc.I loved the Illy coffee machine in the room which I thought was a classy touch and the remote operated lighting via the air con panel!All in all the hotel had a good "feel" about it and I wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else when we return. A big thanks to all!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My staff and I stayed at this hotel for New York Fashion Week. We arrived very early (around 8am) and were immediately accommodated to our rooms! The hotel is located walking distance of everything important. Front desk agents are all so very friendly. Barry made sure we knew of all the hot spots in the city and created a very welcoming & warm atmosphere for myself and my staff. There were, however, a few minor issues we had. Housekeeping took quite some time to respond to our requests. Restaurant was extremely overpriced for quality of food/menu options. Bellmen were pretty rude. Upon check in the first bellman wouldn’t even accept a tip and was very friendly. However, Upon check out another bellman rudely demanded a tip for doing little to nothing. Also, there was an issue with my billing that front desk manager Monique was supposed to follow up with me about. I called 4 times since I’ve checked out and have yet to receive an update/response from her. Kind of upset about that. All in all, those minor glitches couldn’t take away from the experience we had! Great hotel, stunning views, clean room, and we’ll be back in September!!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Just come back from staying at the Millennium Hilton at UN Plaza for a week and would recommend the hotel. Rooms were clean and comfortable and had nothing but pleasant interactions with the staff. We stayed on the 37th floor with great views into mid-town.The hotel is quite a way from public transport (Grand Central station is the closest subway station, which is ~6/7 blocks away) so you do have to walk a bit to get onto the subway. Also there is no free-wifi in the rooms, which I'd really expect these days, but a charge of $10/day for this. Only free wifi is in the lobby and very limited places to sit down and do very much.Overall though would recommend the hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I have always stayed at this hotel for the last 10 years since it is in front of the UN. However, the service has deteriorated incredible since the Hilton assumed the management of itI stayed there 3 times since August (when the Hilton started managing it). This time I had the worst experience.I stayed for two nights. The second night at 1 am, my phone at the room was ringing and ringing. At some point I was so confused since I was completely slept. It was the reception who wanted to know if I am staying that night and if I can pay. I told them that it was not the right time to call. They said that they were trying to locate me the whole day. I responded that when I stayed at that hotel is because I had all day meetings at the UN.The next morning at 8:00, I went to speak to the manager to complain about the call.She said it is standard practice since we do not have a credit card for you. I told her that I have been a guess of that hotel for several years. She looked at it and said not I can not see you. Of course, I said I have never registered as a Hilton Honors. This is the first time since the hotel wanted to charge $ 14 dollars per night for internet connection if you are not a Hilton Honors client. I mentioned that to her and she said: "I was in Punta Cana and they charge me that". She does not have a sense of the tourism service sector. Hotels for business around the world offer free internet to attract clients. Punta Cana is a holiday destination.She was rude and she wanted me to pay since there was not credit card to guarantee my stay. I told her that I went to complain about the phone call by the reception desk at 1:00 am. And I was going to check out in 10 minutes since I was leaving to my meetings. I went to my room and went down again to checked out immediately and the bill was $255. I felt completely discriminated, treated as a criminal and offended since we have held several events in that hotel (now under Hilton) before. I am an old client of that hotel. There was no apologies for the call at 1:00 am. Only, I will talk to the person.This situation has never happened before. Hilton takes advantage charging your credit card for the whole amount prior to your stay plus $100 for anything else. The service is really bad: last time the room had dust in the tables,They do not change towels or put any toiletriesThe service at the restaurant is nice, And they were very accommodative to my food allergies. They were very careful and prepared my food to avoid any reactions.The concierges (the ones who take care of your luggage) are incredible as usual. These concierges have worked there for a long time. They even recognized me since I stay there so frequently. They are always very courteous, nice and provide the best client service.The staff at the reception needs training in client service and learn that not all the clients are criminals, They have to learn that clients will pay for the hotel room when they see that there is a corporate account who made the reservation. It was my worst experience in this hotel. I did not recommend it unless you have to be close to the UN for a meeting,
user_name:
BusinessSep
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I Stayed in this hotel for 6 nights, it is placed in a quiet neighbourhood , near UN headquarter. Rooms are clean and with a nice view. Beds were very very comfortable.Also it is placed near underground station (7-8 minutes by walk). We had to wait on arrival (at 10 pm) because the room was not clean and to apologize, the receptionist offered us breakfast for the day after. Very appreciated.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: As we walked in, we knew we made the right choice. We were greeted as we entered and treated as a special guest when we checked in. This was Hilton standards at its best. The room was perfect, the view was great and we were offered umbrella as we started to leave the Hotel. (it was raining)

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I stayed here with my mom. It was her second time in NYC and I was happy to make it memorable. We had an awesome room for the weekend with beautiful views. The staff was kind, especially in the Coffee shop. Gym needs some upgrading but served the purpose. Good location to everywhere.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel is a great location for UN meetings; just across the street. The rooms are standard, fitness room sparse, room service quick but the food not great (but food is easy to get ordered in or to walk to) . I found housekeeping did not replace shampoo etc each day which was a pain though the staff were very friendly. The front desk clerks were helpful and quick, the concierge the same. Don't use the sundry shop unless you are okay pay $5.50 for a can of soda,

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We pulled up to the front of the hotel and the bellman welcomed and helped us with valeting our carl. Since we only had one suitcase we brought it in ourselves to the check in desk. The following experience wasn't up to their normal standards. We weren't welcomed as Hilton Diamond members, we were handed 2 bottles of water, and weren't offered an upgrade. We asked about an upgrade and at first were told we were given a nice King room. This is what we booked. After a while of searching on her computer the staff member was able to secure us a corner room. Room 3240 offers a hallway closet, coffee bar with safe, a King Bed, a couple of chairs, large desk, large bathroom, and 2 very nice views. The downsides to this room can be easily rectified by the hotel. The first is the rug is shredding a bit right in the middle of the room and should be trimmed. The second issue is that the wall behind the bathroom sink is quite stained and could use a fresh coat of paint. Otherwise we were very happy with the selection.We agree we would return for another stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Overall the stay was ok. View on Empire State was fantastic. 40th floor west tower. Room on the noisy and drafty side. Gym had no towels and cardio machines outdated and in a sad state. Exec lounge had a very nice breakfast.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I have been to this hotel before when it was not under Hilton Brand and I think it was better that time. As a diamond member of hilton honors program I have been really dissappointed. You dont see almost any benefit. Especially the executive lounge food variety is terrible. They even charge for beer and wine 5 $ per glass.I have been many hilton hotels throughout the world and none of them charges for drinks in the executive lounge.Breakfast was also poor needs improvement.The best part of the hotel are the bellboys they extremely worked well and were helpful.I think a hilton is easily selling its hotels around nyc they just dont care about the service.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I really enjoyed my stay at the Millennium. I was able to book a room the morning of my stay for an extremely reasonable price. (136.00 for the night as a Hilton Honors Member) I was there on a Saturday so the neighborhood is extremely quiet, which I loved. My room was on the 30th floor with amazing views of the river and UN. The room was a generous size by NYC standards. Nicely appointed with a mini-fridge and expresso maker. The bathroom was lovely. It had a heated toilet seat which is wonderful in January. The room was quiet and I slept well.Although 1st Ave. was quite on a Saturday night 2nd offered many places to eat, shop, get a drink or coffee. I felt safe in the area as a woman walking alone in the evening.The staff was extremely friendly. Check-in was quick and the woman at the desk was able to look up my Hilton Honors number since I had forgotten my card and booked last minute. There is a lovely store that sells food, coffee, wine, etc. The gentleman in the store could not have been nicer. After dinner my brother and I went back to the Millennium for a night cap and dessert. Once again we were treated very well.For the price you cannot go wrong.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
