review_body: I love the midtown location with easy access to the things I need plus an easy trip out to LGA upon departure. Rooms are comfortable and bathrooms are modern and well equipped. I was lightly shocked by room service prices - primarily because of the plus-plus nature of the pricing and the outrageous compulsory gratuities. The club lounge is elegant and the breakfast was great - really impressive and a great improvement on many comparable properties. Big let down by way of the front desk staff. Upon arrival at approx 9:30pm I was greeted with no hello, or warm friendly smile instead the front desk agent simply snapped "I'll need ID". Upon checkout, it didn't get much better with the staff seemingly incapable of understanding that I wished to use a different card to the one I had provided at check-in to settle my account. Despite the fact I was leaving the hotel, surrendering my room key and leaving the property they proceeded to authorise my card to cover incidentals again and I'm still waiting over a week later for the balance to be refunded. Left a sour taste in the mouth.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Staying at this hotel was one of my best experiences among the hotels in NYC. I arrived here during a very busy time as the UN General Assembly was just starting. Despite the business and long lines, the Front Desk lady remained so friendly and warm. The room I was in was so nice and clean. I had the best night's sleep and a great time working from my room when not in conference. I would highly recommend staying here if you're in NYC!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The welcome I received when I arrived from the Front Desk staff was fantastic! The Front Office Managers, Erika and Monique, did a wonderful job taking care of a situation that came up during my stay. They were truly a pleasure to meet and work with. Every member of the housekeeping team that I encountered was very polite, made sure to greet me and ask if I needed anything. The room I had was gorgeous, very spacious (especially for a NYC hotel room), had a wonderful view of the city and the bed was like sleeping on a cloud. The rain shower fixture was a nice touch in the bathroom also. It made for a very relaxing shower after spending long days sitting in a classroom. I would definitely recommend this property to anyone visiting NYC. Keep up the amazing work!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Unfriendly service and the room was not clean. Asked management to fix the issue and took hours for a response. I decided to check out of My hotel early and will not be returning to this Hilton hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I wanted to give 5 stars but the walls are so paper thin that it makes it impossibly to sleep! Both nights there was so much noise coming from the next room it was horrible. First night until 12am next night started at 3am and lasted until 7am. I am a Gold member and they did offer continental breakfast, however, we decided since we didn't sleep (and we were going to be doing quite a bit of activity that day) that we would just order room service, food was good but come on $100 for breakfast, we ordered french toast, waffles and a pot of coffee nothing special about the meal. I have stayed at 5 star resorts and didn't have to spend that much on breakfast! Service was great, all employees were personable with the exception of one which we just ignored. We got back to the hotel after the little cafe closed and they were nice enough to send some bottled water up instead of having to go down. We had a corner king room with beautiful views of the city and the river which was great! All in all I would stay again but they need to do something about the noise level!
user_name:
Michelle R
Lake George, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Had a wonderful stay recently at the One UN hotel. The rooms are spacious, clean and have great views of the city. Liam at the front desk went above and beyond for us and ensured that our vacation was nothing short of amazing. Thanks again for all your help Liam -- looking forward to staying with you all again very soon!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Good stay and quality service. Nice people and the coffee in the room is just great and free. Everything is clean and the view of New York from my room was breathless. Dealing with the UN, the Hilton Millenium hotel is the place to stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great location for meetings at UNICEF or closely located organizations. Size of room was excellent for NYC. Staff are efficient and very friendly. You can easily walk to restaurants and a grocery store. In-room kettle and small fridge are an added bonus. Room was quiet and comfortable. Good security as well.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I really enjoyed my stay in this hotel. Hotel staff were kind. The location is ideal because it is central but a little off the busy thoroughfares. And the room itself was well-designed and had a lovely view of upper Manhattan and Brooklyn. All of this made a work trip with my toddler and husband doable and enjoyable. As other reviewers have noted, the hotel has not been remodeled recently, and the services can be a bit slow, but these didn't detract from the novel experience of being able to relax and work and take care of a toddler in the heart of a busy city.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great hotel, great views. Just fantastic. Really enjoyed my time here. The rooms are all located on a high floor so your view of the city will be fantastic and it's just a short five minute walk to Times Square

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed here for a week during thanksgiving and had no problems whatsoever,,the room was clean and tidy and the view from the 35 th floor overlooking the Empire State Building was stunning,a twenty minute walk takes you into Times Square and other attractions,,enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel has awful guest services. Booking at this hotel was a nightmare, i was lied to about the price for the night, i was even told i had to book through a third party and was unable to book at front desk. when i brought this to the attention to the managers they continued to lie and cover their tracks. Will not be staying at this hotel again!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Service is everything and it couldn’t have been nicer. All the staff were pleasant, knowledgeable, and ready to help. There’s a extra charge for late checkout but aside from that you feel completely at home there. Location is great!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Upon our arrival the booking was not on their system. Once we cheked in we tealized that the room was totally different from the one the photos online was showing. The answer from reception was “ you need to talk to booking.com sir, we are not responsible”.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Very nice hotel with good access to west-side mid-town locations. Clean, quiet rooms. Clean welcome lobby. Very close to UN and mid-town locations. I'd highly recommend this hotel. Plenty of services available.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Have stayed at this hotel many times, and for a Hilton in NYC it has very large rooms. The Executive lounge is great and the food presentation is quite good. Parking is a little pricey. Staff is very very friendly. The workout room is very large and well equipped.
user_name:
VirginiaFB
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Excellent room with a spectacular view of NYC. Room to spread out and have family over to watch the playoffs. Good location for midtown access. Very helpful and friendly staff. Good security. Will stay here again.
user_name:
David A K
West Hartford, United States

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I love this hotel! The room was beautiful and very clean. The view was spectacular! The staff was friendly. The only negatives were the elevators were slow (just a little annoying). The hotel food was over priced (for what I’m used to anyway). I ordered food through Uber Eats and it was fine. I would definitely recommend!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights a few days after Christmas. It was a great stay - very clean, fairly modern, large room, super comfortable bed, great views of the river and central location! We asked for an early check in around 10am and the hotel was able to accomodate the request. It's a no frills hotel but the room was good, so that's all you need, especially when in Manhattan. It's a short walk to the nearest train station (Grand Central) and also really close to crosstown/downtown busses. It felt like a fairly unique part of town - embassies and UN etc, so that was also interesting. The sniffer dogs in the lobby was definitely a first! The cafe in the lobby has coffee, fruit, snacks and there a lots of convenience stores close by for basic needs. We went out for our meals/drinks as it didn't seem that there were many decent restaurants or bars close by, but again, that's the whole point of NYC! Great stay, especially for the price. We'd go back again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel is absolutely fantastic, the staff are very helpful, friendly and always at your service! They left us an adorable hand written anniversary card, which we were so grateful for. Our view was spectacular, and the room itself was gorgeous, large bed, large space and all new furniture. Gym is great and has a fab view! It was missing a coffee machine so on our way down to dinner we told them, by the time we got back there was one there! You have to ask for the free wifi code otherwise you are charged, however they are more than happy to give it to you at the front desk! Could not fault, we have already recommended for our family going in sept and will definitely stay again!FYI - the lobby is not dated! Thanks so much!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I stayed at the hotel for business, it was my second time and I loved it. The lobby is dated but the rooms are renovated and quite big compared to the average rooms in NY. I love the hotel because is very quiet and used by people for business ( it very close to the UN). They have a little café in the lobby that has everything you need for breakfast!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My daughter and I waited over twelve hours to get checked in, only to be told the hotel was completely booked and sold out. We were offered hot cocoa and two bar drinks as a token. Not the way to treat an honors member

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: If you like staying in tiny rooms with very cheap carpets and fittings then this is for you. This hotel has no character or personality. I had a view over the East River and the tip of Roosevelt Island.....not very exciting, you would need to be on the other side to get a view of NY's skyscrapers. I never saw a bellhop the whole time I was there which surprised me. The concierge was very helpful but he provided me with duff information and sent me to the wrong cinema altogether to see 'The Post'. So overall the stay was just OK. Would I consider staying there again ? Absolutely not ! There are far more interesting hotels to be found in NY

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We had an excellent stay. The views are incredible from the rooms and from the executive lounge. We felt really relaxed and looked after. The lifts are a bit slow but for those views it is definitely worth the wait! Great hotel, great staff. Would recommend.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I checked out previous reviews and asked for a good view....well I was treated to panoramic view or Manhattan skyline -- the Chrysler Building right outside my window. The room was clean, spacious and bed comfortable. I appreciate the friendly staff --even the security dog outside the front door.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My wife and I stayed there for 3 days at the beginning of January. Our corner room had beautiful views of the NYC skyline and Hudson River. Room was much larger than most of the NYC rooms I've stayed at in the past. Before booking, I was worried about distance to key areas since its Midtown East, but found I could get to either Subway stops or the Broadway Shows near Times Square with a 10 minute walk. Only downside is that room showed some signs of dating (carpet was worn in parts) but in better condition than other Hilton/Marriott NYC hotels I've stayed at. Would highly recommend and will be staying again when I'm in NYC.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed here on our trip to NYC in September 2017.We were close to the top floor of the building and had a fantastic view from our window across the city looking south. The room was also nice and spacious and clean (bar the coffee cups - see below). Location wise, it's within walking distance to Grand Central Station which gets you to most places, but also out of the way enough to be a fairly quiet part of town and not too busy. We really liked the location. For breakfast, there are plenty of little shops nearby to pick up coffee/breads, or there's a coffee shop in the lobby (which wasn't too expensive compared to outside and good for the first morning!). You also get coffee pods and a machine in your room, but these got a bit frustrating as they weren't replaced every day, nor were the coffee cups. We had to complain a couple of times about this before it became a daily replacement. Apparently these are serviced separately to the housekeeping for cleaning the room - we had no complaints about the housekeeping in terms of cleaning the rest of the room.Our biggest frustration with the hotel was the fire alarm "test" at 7.45am on a weekday. We got the impression that the fire alarm had malfunctioned as it blipped once and then they were testing it after to see if it worked. But then the "test" and apology for the initial blip which came through the speakers was excruciatingly loud and continued for about 15 minutes after this (following an equally loud annoucement), then repeated again about half an hour later. I understand the need for fire alarm tests but this particular one seemed ridiculous given the time it was carried out and the duration!Other minor niggles - the Wifi wasn't great (but can be expected in a big city with lots of tall buildings) and the air con was quite loud. Overall it was a good stay, bar the fire alarm and coffee cups! We'd probably stay here again as the room itself was lovely.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Amazing view in a nice location. The room was spacious equipped with excellent bed. Not very helpful receptionist and bell boys. The receptionist was not very willing to service us and instead she answered to the requested information on a rather typical way. The bell boy was never appeared and thus (after more than thirty minutes of waiting) I carry all the suitcases by myself.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We managed to compare this hotel with another two in the city due to delays we had and I must admit when you see the other side you realise the 4 stars in this hotel are well suited! Yes you have to walk ten mins to the subway but for the service and the quiet at night it really is worth it! When you stay in time square all you hear is sirens so after walking around for 14 hours what you really need is decent sleep and this allows it! Plus most open top tours are outside the UN which is across the road! We also stayed in the intercontinental at Times Square and would say the Hilton beats this due to the views from the hotel on the upper story -city side. Thank you for having us! Ps anyone under 18 stays free if sharing the room with the adults and the beds are huge with a sofa so will easily fit a small family without the huge cost!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We were greeted by some very polite members of staff who assisted us with our luggage and helped us to our room. We booked one of the cheaper rooms so it was not huge, nor was the view amazing but we were extremely happy with what we got for our money. The rest of the hotel was pristine and has a convenient coffee shop downstairs. We found it very easy to get about the city from this hotel either by walking or getting a taxi. Times Square was around a 20 minute walk away and Grand central station is also within walking distance so we were able to get the subway to the further out parts of the city, such as the Statue of Liberty. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful when giving advice on how to get around. I would definitely return here upon my next stay to NYC.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Room was spacious with great views! We arrived late but check in was a breeze. Staff was super helpful and kind. We were able to enjoy a family breakfast with our two year old being entertained by the waiter!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: One incident killed this stay for us. An employee decided to barge into our room without permission or announcement while my wife and I were getting dressed. The room was fantastic, the hotel was top-notch, but that incident really shook us up.They have bomb sniffing dogs at the entrance and yet have employees that feel it’s OK to enter a occupied room without permission or announcement. Our sense of security and our expectations of privacy we’re completely thrown out the window. Very unfortunate

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Opened the door of the room late at night to a wonderful night view of manhattan. The room was also very big for NYC and well maintained. The beds were also very comfortable. Only problem we had with the room was very little sound proofing and we could hear the adjoining rooms.The only other issue with this hotel is the public transport links are not great with no subway line close by. Some good bus links but can be very slow at times. The tourist buses also stop close by but take ages to get anywhere.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Adina: This person was a god send to getting some flight information arranged for myself. With out a printer, and only a I-phone she was able to get my wife's flight information/ticketing all completed. This person's abilities far exceed the levels of her current duties and I believe she should be considered for a much important and higher capacity within the hotel. Move this person into a managerial position.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed here between Christmas and new years. The first room was nice. Not to sure about the housekeeping team though. The fridge had half a leaking bottle of sprite in it. I guess this could happen to anyone. The views are amazing as is the great lounge on the 30 floor. Our penultimate day was ruined by neighbours from hell. They were two guys one of which just had to shout louder and louder each time he spoke. We heard all about how he worked for Richard Brandon and how he now lives in Florida, then he decided to sing loudly. I felt for his partner. Shocking behavior. Fortunately reception dealt swiftly with my request to be moved. Second room on top floor was nice and made up for the inconvenience. Staff were helpful. Staff in Skylight Room were very pleasant and kind. Overall a good hotel. Would revisit, but only if I was away from noisy area.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Booked 2 rooms both had luke-warm water, complained several times- never fixed. Blood on sheets, urine on toilet seat when we arrived,NO POOL (under renovation) NO FRIDGE AS ADVERTISED (JUST A MINI SHELF IN A STORAGE CABINET). View was OK not really a NY City View VIEW! PARKING IS 99.00 a night with no in out privileges. I made the reservation directly with the hotel and they lied about all this! I was told parking was 55.00 per night, said they had a pool and free ...NO FREE WIFI. There was no ice maker on any floor had to call for ice every day and then they expected a tip! LOBBY ---WHAT LOBBY?

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This is not even an exaggeration. I stayed at this hotel over New Years and experienced a room that was not cleaned. Dried feces on a towel, urine on the toilet (with hair), and more. Do not stay here

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: It was a great stay. The room, the staff, the cleanliness, all of it.The front office manager Erica, did her best and succeeded in making our stay memorable. We ended up taking an upgrade for the room, and was so worth it!Next visit to NY, will be with accommodation at Millennium Hilton Hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I would preface this review by stating that I have been a loyal Hilton member for well over a decade and this year alone have had 34 stays. I booked the dream holiday vacation for my family in NYC and exhausted my points balance to stay at your hotel. Upon arrival one of my two rooms was not ready. When we entered the one room that was, I found feces inside the toilet, trash in the basket in the bedroom and remnants of hair as well as stains on the pillow case. I immediately asked for the room to be re-done. After exploring the city for several hours, we returned to find our second room ready. In this room I found towels with both black marks as well as a yellow stain on them. I brought them down to the manager Stanley and he apologized. Based on my Hilton status we had access to the executive lounge where I went up to get water and was able to enter. About an hour later I still had not received replacement towels. I personally went and spoke with Stanley again. Towels were delivered several hours later. The next evening we went to the executive lounge to sit as a family and plan our evening in the city and our key did not work but the gentleman working it let us in. He called the front desk to verify and was told we did not have access. He approached us in front of others and said we had to leave as we did not have access. I was livid and was on my way down to speak to whoever gave this incorrect information and actually ended up in the elevator with a manager named Nancy and explained my experience. She apologized and I later received a note from her with a credit for 10,000 points (which is really nothing as my stay was 900,000 between the 2 rooms) along with old fruit that came from the executive lounge. We were also given incorrect information regarding where the Honors breakfast was to be had. The waiter in the restaurant the next morning barely spoke English. I explained we had breakfast vouchers through Hilton Honors but he clearly did not understand. I had to bring this to the attention of the clerk who checked us in the day before who happened to be working the front desk and she admitted to giving us the wrong information. At that time a manager named Monique corrected the situation and supposedly also verified that we had executive level access which is where we were supposed to eat breakfast. I have never experienced more disconnect among management and customer service representatives. The amount of mistakes, inconvenien

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: As Diamond Hilton members we see quite a few Hilton hotels ranging from the Conrad end to the Hampton Inns in different parts of the world. All in all the Hilton One UN Plaza is an upper mid range to good hotel in my view and is a good choice for a stay in NYC. Real positives of the place is undoubtedly the views. What could you not like about waking up and looking out of your window at the Empire State and Chrysler Buildings. House keeping in terms of cleaning was very good although it doesn’t seem to be standard practice to provide replenishments each day of toiletries or the other nice Hilton standard we have found in Asia Pacific of the Hilton robes and slippers. Staff in the Skyline Lounge were excellent and are an asset to Their employer. The Lounge itself is a strange one to rate. Breakfast is good whilst the happy hour options were terribly repetitive. Over our extended stay at Christmas and New Year their were chicken wings EVERY night. I think some more variety could be accommodated without too much trouble. The decor in the lounge is reminiscent of an old male smoking lounge and really does need an update from its 1984 look. The room we had was lovely modern and large. Something which I understand is not the norm in NYC. Check-in and reception generally were good. Efficient but perhaps could be more engaging with guests. It seemed very much strictly business. Of all the Hilton’s we have stayed in we were quite happy with One UN and would be happy to stay again. The hotel we found was in a good location and we quite often walked to 5th Ave, Times Square etc which is about a 25minute walk.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel must have the biggest rooms in New York! We stayed in a corner room overlooking the UN HQ's and it was huge by NY standards. We absolutely loved this hotel and found it to be the best value hotel we have stayed in in NY. Will never stay anywhere else now.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Best Hilton I have been tp (except Hilton Hawaiian Village). Great service. Great choices. Concierge was the best ever. Beds were good. Views were spectacular. Great location. Easy walk, even in the cold to many of the City’s greatest venues.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed on the 31st floor & what a view! Very comfortable room, clean, good shower, very spacious room. Friendly, helpful staff. Good location - it's a little walk out of the main tourist areas but also quite nice to be away from the crazy rush. A few minutes walk to Grand Central Station.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I am a Hilton Diamond member and was thrilled to hear that this hotel was taken over by Hilton. The reason is because my home office is located just a couple of blocks awayMy wife and I tried the hotel the first time in September. It was our anniversary and we were spending the weekend in the cityI booked this hotel and called when I saw online the had me next to the elevators. The person I spoke with at the front desk was OUTSTANDING. She put me into a corner room that had the UN/bridge view along with a view downtown. The room was very large and we were both impressed. Raved about it until 1:00 in the morning and the fire alarm went off. It was a false alarm which we were informed of within 5 minutes but the alarms didn't go off for a least 1/2 hour. Being startled out of bed by a fire alarm and then having the loud piercing noise go on for 1/2 hour and not being able to get back to sleep destroyed all the great things we were saying about the hotel. When we checked out there was not even an apology. Was very disappointed. We decided to stay again this past weekCheckin was just OK. Front desk was quiet. We arrived earlier than check in time. Was just looking to check my bag and would have waited for a room. Front desk person did not verbally acknowledge my Diamond membership. I asked if there was any upgrades available. She said she did upgrade me. We got to the room and while a corner room, it was a handicap room. The view was uptown (not much to see) a blocked view of the UN and bridges. The handicap room has a very large bathroom and a large open shower that allows water to overflow onto the bathroom floor. No doors separating the shower from the rest of the bathroom. Water is lukewarm and because it's only large bathroom, you get the chill from the room. It will not get a warm bathroom because of the lack of very hot water and the size of the bathroom. So much for a nice hot shower. Not a great way to start your day in the morning. Hotel is beautiful and very large rooms, but have missed out twice with me. Again it's a place that I really want to like because of convenienceWould be open to speaking with a manager. My Hilton number is 412978174

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We’d been to New York before and had stayed in midtown Manhattan but this time we opted to stay on the east side of town at One UN (a Hilton hotel in UN Plaza)The hotel starts on the 29th floor of this huge skyscraper and we had a room on the 32nd floorWe’d spoken via email to the hotel before arriving and had enquired about the Skyline Lounge on the 30th floor as an extra on Christmas Day...Check in at the hotel was very friendly and efficient, even to the extent that the young lady checking us in called me to one side to quietly talk about our reservation in the Skyline Lounge in case it was a surprise to the rest of our party.I very much appreciated the thought, in this instance it was unnecessary but a nice touch nevertheless Our corner rooms were lovely and we unpacked and settled in for an enjoyable trip. What a smashing view of the sun rising from room 3240!The next day we realised that we were lucky enough to have been given a free upgrade to a suite! Thanks very much Thom! You certainly made our trip memorable!The suite we were able to use was room 3131 and had an utterly amazing view of both the Hudson on one side and Manhattan on the other!The suite was absolutely lovely and had everything you could have imagined or needed.A large living area that was really well laid out and furnished, small kitchen area including fridge and microwave, lovely bathroom and a huge and incredibly comfortable bedThe bedroom had a brilliant view of both The Chrysler Building and Empire State and we very much enjoyed seeing them basking in the sunshine each day then lit up each eveningI couldn’t fault the room in any way.... it was utterly lovelyThe hotel wasn’t full and on Christmas Day we used the Skyline Lounge... this was a rather odd place although breakfast there was ample.. for $25 each though, I’m not sure it was great value.Drinks in the evening here were also a little odd and relied upon an ‘honesty box’ where you helped yourself to drinks then filled in a chit and placed it into a box..We duly did, but it had no realAtmosphere (no music playing) and so we reverted to the suite we had so much enjoyed.One other quite random thing was that on one of the evenings we were enjoying drinks and relaxing in the bar on the ground floor and without warning it just closed.I’d have expected a little warning of its closure or indeed an opportunity to purchase another drink, it was after all only about 11:30pm? Not that late in the city that purports to never sleep...It somewhat put a dampener on the evening, especially as there aren’t very many other places to visit in this part of town. It’s a little too quiet an area for us really although you certainly couldn’t fault the rooms or views...

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The best view ever from the room. The suite is well worth it but buying new mattresses is a Must! We asked them to replace our mattress as it needed to go in garbage and the one they replaced it w was better but also is on its last days. A hotel of this caliber should not have 2 star beds. The second room in suite is one bed rather than 2. Then no pull out sofa only a stylish couch. Refrigerator needs upgrade that’s for sure. All else was good. The Hilton lounge has limited hours but a good place. Nice housekeepers. Buy new mattresses and I’ll b back!!!!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I normally go away for Christmas as you will see from my reviews. This year we flew into new York on 15th, then went to Toronto on 17th and back down to new York on 23rd before coming back to the UK on 28th.This is the first time I have stopped at this hotel and chose it specifically due to not making it over to that side of the island in all the times I have been. From walking through the door on 23rd I can safely say this is one of the best hotels I have stayed in! There was great security, the staff were amazingly helpful and friendly and the Wi-Fi is some of the fastest I have had in the US.We checked into our room and can say I was shocked! I though that they had given me the wrong room for the price I was paying as I get the room for about 115 a night (even at Christmas!). The room was 2 stories with its own winding staircase, 2 good sized bathrooms, 2 fridge's, safes, walk-in wardrobes and coffee machines!.My mum instantly hit me and asked how much did I pay :) - she was more shocked when she say the low price.I must stay and will be visiting again!!!!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Positives: Great views from the room. Cleaned everyday and nice interior in the room. Location ok for walking to main attractions and reasonable taxi prices. Staff seemed friendly and helpful. Tv is great and allows you to access Netflix. Negatives: We found a half drank bottle of coke and half eaten box of food in our fridge which had clearly been in there a while. WiFi is an issue! They try to charge you 9.99 a day per person however it states that wifi is free in the manual in the room. Recommend asking different people or becoming honors member. WiFi should be always be free for guests! We had a loud plumbing noise which disturbed us for 2/3 nights. Throughout the night, every ten minutes, the water system would start to make a noise as if it had been flushed but it hadn’t been touched. This was fixed for our final night but before then we had rather broken sleep.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: When arrived check in lasted for all of 5 minutes which was great when arriving at 10pm after a long flight. 29th floor room with panoramic views of east river, One World Trade Centre, Empire State and Chrysler Building. Handy cafe in the lobby although cafe 2 mins around corner is a cheaper alternative. Room was clean and spacious with a huge TV and plenty of seating. A brisk 15 min walk and you are in the heart of Times Square. A few reviews say there is a lack of eating and drinking in the area but we did not find this the case. There are plenty of restaurants right on the doorstep of the hotel on 2nd Avenue from something as simple as Subway to full sit down waiter service. Plenty of nice bars make the walk back to the hotel a pleasant stroll. Especially when it is sub zero conditions as we were in!Taxi stand right outside door of the hotel so never an issue for transport.Already looking to stay again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great hotel and location, recently renovated, but don't expect a new hotel if you pay attention to minor details. Not everything was renovated. Housekeeping on 32nd floor was amazing. Great staff on the lobby cafe. Great service. Little noise from the building at quiet nights may disturb light sleepers.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Excelllent place to stay when visiting NYC. Close to so much, and an easy place to hail a cab if it is needed! Feel very safe here. Always someone at the door and a friendly dog to sniff out bags....:)

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed in this hotel when we went in NY for holidays. Room was clean, spacious and has a nice view. Breakfast was good, team were friendly and helpful. A good 10 to 15 minutes walk from the central station which is the downside especially when you are travelling with kids.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: While not in the middle of Manhattan, it was perfect for our needs in visiting the UN HQ, which is 3 minutes walk away.Rooms are modern with great views of the river and we found walking to Times Square only 15 minutes away. Not sure if it would suit a leisure traveler, but definitely the place to stay if visiting the UN or the various embassies

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Five night stay over the Christmas period. We were upgraded to a corner room on a high floor with sweeping views of Manhattan and beyond -- fantastic. Staff at reception and on the floor were all very welcoming and friendly. So, the stay started well. As we were visiting family during the holidays, our schedule was late evenings out and sleep-in mornings at the hotel. Forget a quiet lie-in: we were surrounded by the constant loud slamming of doors around us and along the hall, either by guests leaving or by housekeeping staff going in and out of neighbouring rooms. Most entertaining was the minibar checker who, every morning around 9:00am, went down the hall using his key to knock on doors, announcing his visit, slamming the door going in and slamming the door going out. Clickety-click, "room service", slam, slam. Then on to every single room on the floor.We didn't use other hotel facilities as the whole place was on slow holiday mode. For instance, we tried the Ambassador Grill on arrival but it was closed for dinner. In summary, great room, but stay affected by the constantly slamming doors. Silent door closing mechanisms would really be welcome!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: What can i say but..WOW..1st impressions when we arrived thinking we've picked the right hotel..Rebbekah at reception checked us in with a friendly smile chatted to us for a while..Good to see security was high there with the dog there as it's right by the United nations building..Thankyou hilton you didn't disappoint us our room was amazing.we were on the 33rd floor corner king rooms..the views I will never forget 1 side over looking the east river and the other was looking directly opposite the CHRYSLER BUILDING and empire state..Room facilities were 2nd to none massive comfy bed great shower..Hotel location was great as it isn't in the centre of new york and it was great to come back away from the hustle and bustle of the city away from the beeping of vehicles..I will be highly recommended the hilton millennium one un..once again thankyou all for a lovely stay..this photo was taken from our hotel room..

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel itself is nice and my room was lovely, a good size and a perfect view of the Empire state building, impressive. The pain at the check in was that the receptionist told us she needed a credit card to hold for the room, I understand this and gave it to her. She then took the card and took 150 dollars straight out of my account as a holding amount for the room. I was shocked and told her this was not normal practice and that taking a card as a deposit was enough in itself. It took 10 days for the money to be deposited back into my account. Not good practice!You have to pay a daily fee for internet use also.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This was our first visit back to this property since Hilton took over and we were impressed with every aspect. I was happy to learn that the beautiful, glitzy lobby and adjacent Ambassador Grill recently achieved New York landmark status so they will now remain unchanged. Check-in was cheerful, quick and informative. Not sure if it was because of Hilton Honors status, but we were delighted to be upgraded to a gorgeous corner one bedroom suite with stunning views of the East River and also looking South to lower Manhattan. The sparkling, spacious bathroom was another highlight. Everything here is immaculately maintained. While some may think the location is inconvenient, we find it quiet and just right for out needs. We do see a lot of Broadway theatre when in the city. It's a 10 minute walk to Grand Central where you can jump on the subway shuttle 1 stop to Times Square/The Theatre District. Quick and easy! An exceptional hotel stay! We look forward to enjoying this experienced hospitality again in the Spring.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We came to stay in this hotel from the UK, where the Hilton hotels that we've stayed in before have all been fantastic. However, I'd say that this place has definitely been below standard in most aspects. I'll start off with the good points:- Easy to find- Well positioned for Grand Central Terminal and midtown- Lobby is stunning- Bellhops were very pleasant- Small coffee and light bites shopA few other bits, like the view was alright, but not every room can have a stunning view over mid/downtown.When we arrived, we'd been travelling for near enough 12 hours. We went to check in and instantly felt unwelcome. It seemed as though the lady behind the desk just wanted rid of us. There was no "Welcome to" or anything. She just looked at us until we spoke to her. We checked in with no idea where anything was and had to ask one of the bellhops where we needed to go. We had no idea where the restaurant, bar, or any other facilities were.There's nothing more welcoming than a stony glare.We got up to the room and went to make a coffee, but found that the machine hadn't been cleaned or emptied. On top of that, there are only 2 regular coffee pods and 2 sugar packets in the room.After our room had been cleaned one day, one of our toothbrushes was absolutely disgusting. I have no proof, so will not make any allegations, but a toothbrush that has been out of the packet for 4 days does not end up looking like that by itself. Take from that what you will. For 2 days on the trot there were fire alarm tests that started an hour before they were due to. We were only notified of this by letter the day before the second set of tests. Whilst I understand the importance of these tests it's not really acceptable to say that they'll be at a certain time and then start them an hour earlier. Again we went to the desk to enquire about leaving our bags for a few hours after we check out, but before we leave. We were met with the same stony coldness as before, but from a different attendant this time. As I said, we've previously stayed at Hilton hotels elsewhere, and had nicer experiences mainly in terms of staffing. I personally wouldn't stay here again, unless the deal was unmissable.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel block is super controlled due to the presence of the UN palace and many buildings dedicated to Embassies and the US government. The hotel itself is beyond cement barriers and police dogs check guests’ baggages. We felt safe in the neighborhood and it wasn’t a problem. The room size was good, especially taking into account the NYC average size, I loved the awesome view of the Chrysler literally from bed, our Chinese housekeeper (sorry I can’t remember her name) was very friendly and the room was clean. I also must thank the front office manager for giving me instructions to get a package delivered before arrival. Yet for the future I don’t know if I would go back for a couple reasons: the elevators were too slow and could not serve all the guests causing long waits especially at peak hours, the facilities weren’t clearly displayed (gym floor, lounge hours) and on the last morning we had to clean a table ourselves to have breakfast, the hotel doesn’t have a spa area and during the freezing days there it would have been useful, but above all some people of the staff have a bad attitude towards customers who are just visitors. To me this is unacceptable, my money is not less worth because I’m a tourist instead of a UN member, ex. I approached the reception two days before checkout to ask for a late check-out and the lady (Dianne) quickly got rid of me saying I should ask on the day of check out, she then started a call on the phone even though I was still standing there because I had to ask something else. Useless to say the I found her at check out on the morning of check out and without knowing the room number or whatever info she quickly got rid of me saying it was not possible to have a late check out because it is on an availability basis. When I made her notice the room number and that I was a gold member, again quickly, she said I could arrive at 12 instead of 11 but over I would have to pay an extra, so this was a confirmation that the hotel was not full but she simply would not take into consideration my request. What really left me speechless was her attitude, I know it used to be a Millennium hotel yet I must say I didn’t feel the Hilton atmosphere in the hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This is a hotel with one of the best NYC views. And on weekends is often extremely reasonably priced. Rooms are a good size... a great spot for a romantic getaway. Highly recommend. During weekdays it’s really busy with UN types and will run you $300-400 a night (I worked at the UN previously) but a great unkown steal on weekends.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We had 10 days in the amazing city that is NYC! First time visitors and we fell in love with it. Magical and busy! The hotel couldn’t do enough to help us plan our days out,places to eat and taxis for us. Rooms are outstanding! Always clean and the views are wow! Staff everywhere are so pleasant and helpful. Particularly Barry and Sylvia on the desks. They helped us no end of times. Would recommend always.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great hotel. Our room was on floor 25. Right across from the new World Trade Centerand the path building. Beautiful view. Restaurant was ok for breakfast. Wasn't in the room much. The staff was very welcoming front desk, concierge and the man who parked the cars. Room comfortable and warm.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This was the first hotel I stayed at in NYC with a friend. The place was super clean, staff was super friendly, and the room was spacious with fun designs and textiles. The front desk was very helpful in figuring out what to do, when to do it and how to get the most 'bang for our buck' deals in town. They handed us a pamphlet and a map and told us how to navigate the city, being our first time we needed all the help we could get. We booked a double Queen room and the beds were super comfy, especially the pillows! The views were great too - At night looking out the window, beautiful. The complimentary soaps, shampoo and conditioner smelled amazing as well. I know that is an odd thing to note, but it is true. The only downfall to this stay was the location of the hotel. It was a good distance away from some of the more popular main attractions. But that was on us, not the hotel. We booked the hotel based on price and not knowing what we wanted to exactly do in the city. We ended up taking a taxi to different parts of the city which was not a problem at all. The location is great if you want to stay a little bit out of the way from the hustle and bustle.Pros: Price point, staff (**especially the concierge, one of the friendliest and funniest guys I've ever met), room size and cleanliness, good smelling soapsCons: location

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We just visited this hotel and stayed for 3 days. The whole staff is so friendly and accommodating but George and Ozzy were the best to us. They went out of their way to be sure we enjoyed our room, our view, our stay and helped make us leaving effortless an quick. Very nice guys! We stayed in the 34th floor in a 2 bedroom suite and it was incredible. You could see the Empire State Building and Chrysler building on one side and the water on the other. Will definitely stay here again and thank you to George and Ozzy for being amazing!!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel has very friendly staff that are very accommodating. We stayed for a week and loved every minute. We had a room on one of the upper floors overlooking the east river and it was amazing! The views are great.The hotel itself is in a brilliant location within walking distance of most key tourist points, and is within 10 minutes of grand central for the subway to all other locations. This hotel was great and I would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I spent 3 days in this great Hotel at the beginning of december..Every thing was great, the room had an amazing view, from the 38 floor I could see: on the right the Chrisler Building and the Empire State Building and on the left the ONU Building..The room was very comfortable, spacious, and there was a magic Christmas atmosphere all around, with Xmas songs, beautiful decoration and a great Xmas tree.Personnel kind and professional!! Just a great stay!In doubt book!!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This was the first actual room-sized room, not a New York City closet-sized room, I’ve stayed in in New York City. On top of that it was super clean and very convenient. It’s definitely not a budget hotel, but you get what you pay for.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Everything about my stay was excellent. Based on this experience I would stay at this hotel again. I was impressed with the UN area. First time staying in this section of town. Quiet, yet plenty of restaurants and stores nearby.
user_name:
Wayne H
Silver Spring, Maryland, United States

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Upon our arrival and this being my husbands first visit to NYC, we were helped out of our cab and greeted by the doorman. The front desk, located in a beautiful lobby decked out for the holidays was friendly, efficient and accommodating. Oddly, the only thing that wasn't 5 star rated out of our entire experience was the concierge desk, when we asked for a recommended dinner restaurant within walking distance. Not only were they unable recommend a restaurant, but when they finally did, the restuarant was no longer in business...so we found our own. The location is great, walking distance to many places of interest, catch a cab, a bus or find the subway. The views from the room were outstanding and gorgeous! The small market on the ground level of the hotel had a great variety of snacks and drinks with cheery staff members. All in all, this was a memorable experience and made us feel very special!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We like this hotel very much. It was crowded because of United Nations General Assembly. The room was in 32th floor, big, clean and comfortable. There was security check by Secret Service at hotel entrance. You will like view from room. You can see river or empire States building.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel was rated as 4 star on several applications I was using. Upon my arrival there was nobody greeting anybody outside, no help with my luggage at all. The hallways in the hotel were run down and had plastic curtains covering a room, on the way to mine. It was difficult to gain access to the wifi and also got no attention from the staff. It felt like I had an apartment and I had access to a room and that was it. The cleaningness of my room was great but that’s about it. I felt like I could have got more value elsewhere for the same amount of money. I never felt welcomed, and never got greeted or assisted with my luggage. I will definately never reccommend to stay at this hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: What a lovely place to stay. Ours was a girl's getaway in order to introduce one of our friends to the beauty of NY at Christmas. I felt very safe (the pipe bombing was the day after we left the city), location was excellent...not too busy but close enough for walking to and from events/sights. Every step of the way the hotel staff was excellent from Brian in reservations to Eddie our doorman! I felt welcomed and valued throughout our stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel is centrally located in midtown, just a few blocks (10 min. walking distance) from Grand Central Station which makes it perfect to get ANYWHERE in and out of Manhattan. It is built wall to wall with the Mission of the United States to the UN and across the street from the UN. Good restaurants nearby are a minimum of 10-15 min. walking distance as the area where the hotel is (44th St and 1st Ave) is sorrow see by consulates and not restaurants. Times Square is a brisk 25 min walk away, and you’ll find decent restaurants on 3rd Ave and 9th Ave. The room was very spacious and comfortable with a great window view. I stayed in a Queen entry level room and it felt like a small apartment instead of a room! The housekeeping wasn’t the best but the place was clean and the staff is friendly... although they all seem to be after a tip. A cab ride to or from JFK is $60-65 plus tip which can be paid by credit card in the cab. I recommend flying into Newark or La Guardia for a closer drive to and from. Overall great place to stay. Quiet, safe, comfortable and free Wi-Fi! I recommend booking thru Hilton Honors website (its free to be a member) as you will find better deals this way.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great location, not crowded like Times Square. In sneakers, you can walk to most of the major landmarks. If you are not open to meeting people of other ethnic groups or nationalities, this is not the place for you. This hotel is a social UN. It's fun, friendly, and CLEAN.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We spent only one night but it was an amazing stay. Jonathan Hernandez was beyond helpful in finding us the perfect rooms for my sons/daughters-inlaw and myself. It was a great place to go back to after walking around Rockerfeller Center. The hotel has beautiful views and helpful staff. Rooms and bath are gorgeous! It is a big place, and they only had one or two check in staff whenever I went downstairs, so reaching the front desk is really hard. Past that, the door men, concierge and honors club staff were terrific.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I have been staying at the One UN Millennium hotel for several years now. I keep coming back and have always had a great experience. The rooms are 5 star and comparable to a Four Seasons - modern, big, clean and sophisticated. It is a great location to access all of NYC. The staff and management go out of their way to make you happy. Easy to walk out the door and grab a bite or coffee. Great gym with beautiful views of the city. Rarely do I write a review, The One UN deserves it. Heading back again for my third trip this year!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel is beautiful. Great size rooms. Exquisitely clean!! I can't say that enough. Friendly and helpful staff. Alittle off the beaten track for all the touristy places in NY, but a great place to get away from the hustle and bustle.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Went during peak holiday season to NYC and was able to nab a room here as a frequent Hilton traveler. Front desk staff noted it is a recent add to the Hilton family (fall 2017?). Also saw an armed officer with his K-9 in what appeared to be a routine perimeter check outside the lobby along the sidewalk. Nothing unexpected considering proximity to UN. Pleasantly upgraded to a suite up on the 37th floor with a view of the East River. Very spacious. Separate room with bed and bathroom/shower from main suite. Suite has separate washroom, wet bar, TV, round dining table, seating area and large work desk. Had a fridge in the suite with the wet bar, not sure if the fridge comes in the standard room. Room décor was modern, dressed in light colors. The lights were all automatic operable from several wall switches and a wall mounted touch pad near the desk. Heard some room noise from the floor above but otherwise a quiet stay. Decent black-out curtains worked well. As a HH member, standard WiFi is free. Not sure if you have to pay if not a HH member.Executive Lounge on the 30th floor had the typical Hilton breakfast spread in the morning, room was a little small but is wraps around to the south of the building creating separate spaces which was nice if you like to seclude yourself. I was in and out and didn't have time to explore other amenities or check out the bar or restaurant. Couldn't be closer to the UN plaza. An easy walk (about 15 minutes) over to my business meetings due west on Ave of the Americas/ Bryant Park. Wanted to try a steak and a cocktail around the corner at The Palm Too but will have to wait until next time.If you are traveling in/out of JFK or LGA airports, it helps that the hotel is on the east side and near the Queens Midtown tunnel therefore virtually eliminating the hassle of crosstown traffic and that nightmare.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Be very careful with this hotel. I just had a fraud issue with them where someone apparently used my credit card to book a room there for an upcoming stay and when I found out I called the hotel asking them to cancel the reservation and their response was basically too bad our bookings are nonrefundable. Apparently the booking was made through priceline and when I told them that, their response was take it up with priceline we aren't giving you your money back. When I pointed out what terrible customer service it was his response was every other hotel in New York does it too.
user_name:
tripadvisotraveler15
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Our stay here was fantastic! Our room was spotless! The view from our room was amazing of the empire state building and the Chrysler building couldn't have asked for better! The hotel was in the ideal place for everything! Staff were friendly and helpful and we made full use of the deli of an evening for some cheese cake! If we visit New York again we will definitely be staying here! Keep up the good work guys!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Wasn’t helpful, dirty toilet, lady hanging out in my room when I checked in. terrible service with checkout! Only good thing was location of hotel! Just for that price I had higher expectations! Definitely would choose another hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Me and my friend stayed here last week and I have to say it was quite disappointing. The staff does not care and is only focused on doing there hours and making tip. Do not expect a smile or greeting when you’re not wearing a suit but just jeans and a shirt. The rooms are nice, views are pretty good when you’re lucky. Rooms could be cleanerz

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. I checked in on 19th November which was my 50th birthday with my husband, yes we are a same sex couple...the check in lady seemed to have difficulty with this. We arrived in the evening after a flight from Heathrow. She initially tried to book us into separate rooms, after I showed her the booking confirmation, that we had only bought a deluxe double room, she then proceeded to send us to a room with separate beds. 3rd time lucky and we were given a room with a double bed. Her response to me when I said I only wanted the room that we had paid for was that she needed extra staff to deal with difficult guests like myself.The photos on the website seem to have been photoshopped as the rooms were basic and not as luxurious as they look online. The hotel definitely requires upgrading.Her attitude put me off ever staying here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Best of the 3 hotels I have stayed in whilst on holiday in New York over the past 10 years. The location was great as once you walked along the avenues, you were pretty much central to most things and grand central station was easily accessed to travel further afield.Very friendly and helpful staff. Eager to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. The room itself was clean, if a little dusty on the shelves and in the drawers inside the wardrobe. We did encounter an issue with our shower leaking, but this was quickly rectified by hotel maintenance. I would suggest you purchase milk if you take your tea or coffee white as this wasn’t actually provided alongside the coffee making facilities.All-in-all I would recommend and return to this hotel for future holidays in the city.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Room was awful, reception looks cheap, customer service is very poor there’s no even a welcome drink or approach. Hotel is a bit dated. The noise of the aircon in the room really disturb us it was a constant noise. Cigarette burnt in the carpet just awful and discussing.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Another great stay at this beautiful hotel! The service is wonderful from the minute you pull up through check out. Our room was comfortable & clean and the hotel is located near so much of what Manhattan has to offer.
user_name:
Mark S
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: great hotel for exploring new York, based on 44th st between 1st & 2nd ave. Easy 5/10 min walk to grand central station. Rooms spotlessly clean and well maintained. Lovely view of the east river. Staff friendly.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel staff was welcoming! We felt safe at all times and were even greeted by a gentlemen who had a drug/bomb detecting dog. The room was very clean and we had an exceptional view of the city! We would definitely recommend this hotel and will be back!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I throughly enjoyed our stay at the Millennium Hilton and would gladly return in the future. The room was clean and the service was excellent. Topped off with free WiFi through the hotel, it was overall a great experience.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Just returned from 3 night stay here. Great hotel, which got even better when we checked in as because we were there celebrating my birthday the kind lady upgraded us to a suite! We probably could of stayed in a cheaper hotel if we wanted to save money but glad we didn't.Hotel is about 10mins (quickish) walk to times square, but your are pretty central to Manhattan and all of the attractions.Very clean and modern hotel. Free good wifi.Would recommend to anyone.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed here over thanksgiving weekend for my wife’s birthday, arriving late Wednesday evening to a very smooth check in was given a deluxe corner room on 31 floor with fantastic views from both windows looking over city with views of as far as world trade centre and east river out of one window to the Empire State Building out the other window. Nothing was to much trouble,from a great front desk team to good polite room service .check out time is 11am but was allowed late checkout of 5.30 which was a great thing as our flight was late evening. When our ba flight got cancelled from jfk before leaving the hotel they sorted out a room for extra night stay (at a cost but will claim back from ba) the hotel is within walking distance to most mid town sights ,central station,Empire State building,Times Square,central park and so on ,would stay here again if ever in New York.,

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Our room was very clean. Staff was very friendly. The store inside was overpriced. The only issue we had was our fridge. It wasn't working but when we called down for a new one, they immediately came upstairs with a new bigger one.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Just back from staying a week at this hotel, can’t fault it. Our room had an amazing view of Hudson River, staff were friendly, room cleaned every day...would definitely stay here again20 min walk to Times sq and 10 min walk to grand central

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This is a great hotel with impeccable service and comfort. The value offered for a weekend break (when the UN is not active) is unbeatable. This may not appear to be central but it is excellent for walking tours of NYC.The Skyline Club is a tremendous value offering superb views and service. Well worth the extra !

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Having stayed at this hotel on many occasions I cannot fault the service, cleanliness, efficiency and comfort. The Skyline Club on Floor 30 is a great way to start the day (for a fee) and to relax in after a long day in the city. Rooms have amazing views (we had 3334) and the security is superb. The staff are always pleasant and efficient.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I went here for my daughters 22st. Asked for a specific room with a view and it was just amazing didn't need to go top of the rock as the view was amazing ! Fantastic hotel for everything fantastic service , beautiful decorated

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The service here was impeccable ! From Robert on the door to the room service ! Great location too. 30 min walk to Rockefeller and around the same to Times Square. I would say the food was not great though. $50 for eggs benedict in my room. Crazy money ! And it was like warm! Also paying for WiFi in a high class hotel is very back dated, I’ve stayed in lower rated hotels with just as nice facilities but had better WiFi for free. The room was spacious and clean, a few marks and damaged carpet etc but all minor details. All in all would stay again due to the service and location but with so many to pick from in NYC it does make me intrigued to look for better perks if you’re paying a lot.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Hotel was very clean & comfortable. Staff very accommodating and happy to help. Not quite central to everything but it is very quiet as a result. Had lovely restaurant but we did not eat there so unable to judge.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Fantastic hotel...big rooms for New York great staff great location easy walk to Times Square. Thanks to Stanley the hotel manager for sorting out a problem with 1 of the rooms will definitely be back...

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: visited new york with my husband for thanks giving& stayed in this hotel. was not disapointed. wow what a hotel. the staff were friendly& helpful when we checked in. we were on the 36 floor& our room was amazing. the view over looking the chrystler building& empire state was amazing. cudnt stop looking out of the window. the room was spotless& cleaned every day of our stay. can not fault one moment of our stay at this hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Right next to the UN, this hotel has amazing views and is just a quick 8 minute walk from Grand Central Station. I was able to take the bus from JFK directly to Grand Central and walk here within minutes. Great restaurants right nearby (Mona Kitchen for breakfast, Ali Baba for lunch, and Alcala for an amazing dinner). Shout out to Avery who was able to help me fix a room problem between work and personal, making my stay so easy!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We travelled to New York with some friends. They booked the hotel. It is in an idea place to see all the sights in the city. It was very clean. Service was great. 5 minutes from grand central station.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I had to ask for the amenities that came with being a Hilton Honors member (2 water bottles, instructions for free Wi-Fi in the room). The hotel was SUPPOSED to have an indoor pool, that was the entire reason we picked this location. Otherwise we would have stayed in Times Square. Priceline is advertising there is an indoor pool with windows all around to give a view of the city, but the concierge advised the pool had been closed for THREE YEARS for renovations. The hotel was a little out of the way of locations we were visiting, but we chose it solely for the pool, so we were very disappointed. It was my nephew's first time in NYC, we were celebrating his 13th birthday; I really wanted to make it fun for him. The concierge did comp us breakfast for this inconvenience, however, I am really glad we did not pay $30 apiece for that breakfast as is normally charged. The food was cold, flavorless (like hospital food), and no food was present to warrant charging that much per person, especially a child. We also had numerous issues with the elevators going up to the 37th floor. We got stuck and had to call for help TWICE, and the elevators dropped us off on the wrong floor twice. Each time we got on the elevator, it was mild anxiety, but it wasn't really possible with me being 6 months pregnant to walk up 37 floors to our room. The room was nice, for the price I would have expected some nicer toiletries. I've stayed in a beautiful Best Western (believe it or not) in Cortez Colorado that was a quarter of the price, but the amenities were top notch. I understand it is New York City, but it is also a Hilton, it would not hurt to put a little more time and attention into the details. The bellmen were very gracious and helpful, as were the restaurant wait staff and two out of three concierges we interacted with. Overall, very nice hotel, but more attention can be given to details, and please get that pool finished.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Good hotel, nice location, nice rooms with a good bed. Get the ‘’cornerroom”, great views and worth the little extra. Don’t book the breakfast, the little coffeeshop in the lobby is more than fine with good coffeeThe rooms are a little noisy, we could hear the people next door talk. We had bad luck with a big very noisy group one night, security had to come 3 times and it still did not work. That was very irritating because it was the night before the New York Marathon.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My wife and I booked this hotel for our 5 day trip to New York after seeing the reviews about the views this hotel offers and wow they did not disappoint. The woman on reception at check in was rude and there was no bellboy to take our bags. Be aware they take $50 per night damages deposit off your card at check in which was not explained to us. Only realised when checking my online banking app. Once we got to our room the view was amazing. We were on the 36th floor with a city view of the Chrysler Building and Empire State. We slept with the blinds open as it was rude to shut out such a view. The hotel corridors were a little dated but the room itself was modern and spacious with touch screen panel on the wall to control lights and heating. Coffee machine and fridge in the room. The hotel is a little out of the way of everything but we were prepared to walk. Less than 10 minutes walk to grand central for subway and 20 minute walk to Times Square. Yellow cab to Times Square less than $10 if you catch a clear run. The rest of the staff at the hotel were polite and helpful. It was disappointing to find out the pool was closed during our stay.Over all very happy with our trip and the hotel. New York is an amazing place and worth every penny we paid to visit.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I was initially nervous when booking this hotel due to some not so kind reviews. However, we could not fault this hotel!! We booked a corner suite for our honeymoon and requested if we could be put up high and how they looked after us!! We were a couple floors below the top and the view was absolutely stunning we had a view of both the Chrysler and the Empire State Building. The staff were keen to look after us and both men working on reception that day were brilliant. Also a special shout out to a key member of staff Alexa the security dog working on the door and keeping everyone safe!!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Excellent stay at this hotel felt safe and secure spotlessly clean can’t fault staff or accommodation highly recommend, good central location . Close to bars and restaurants. Short walk to all shopping areas , theatre district and grand central station

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My wife and I loved the views from our window southwards across Manhattan, especially on sunny afternoons. (We did have good luck with the weather.) They were spectacular views of the area - especially good for tourists who didn't know New York well. Our room was spacious and comfortable, and the staff were friendly and helpful throughout our 4-night stay. The food in the restaurant was very good, but we found it expensive. We made use of convenient local cafes and restaurants for 2 of our breakfasts and one dinner - there are plenty of places nearby where you can eat and drink. Overall it worked well for a short break in New York. Most of all we'll remember what we saw from this hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We arrived at 1.30 am the check in process was efficient and quick, the room was clean although the carpet could have done with a good clean. The staff were friendly, the hotel is nice but a little out of the way and it took 30 to 40 minutes to walk to Times Square.
user_name:
Sharon B
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I first stayed at this property, with my late wife, back in the 80's when it was owned by the city of New York and managed by Hyatt. At that time, the "pool in the sky" on the 27th floor was a major draw with spectacular views. Unfortunately, it has been closed for a while now. In those days, the Ambassador Grill offered one of the best Sunday brunches in Manhattan, offering champagne and fresh oysters. Now to the present. I love the location. It's quiet, safe and there are many dining options on 2nd or 3rd Avenues that will satisfy any budget. I can walk to Grand Central Station in under 15 minutes, Times Square in 20 minutes, Central Park in 25 minutes and Union Square in 45 minutes. The rooms are commodious, especially by New York standards. I like the design and use of space that they offer. Of course, the views are spectacular. In the west wing, where I usually stay, odd numbered rooms face the city and even numbered rooms face the East River. I really don't think there's a bad room in the hotel, in terms of the view, as it starts on the 28th floor and goes up to the 40th. No looking into adjacent buildings or inner courtyards, as is so often the case with properties downtown. The rooms are quiet, comfortable and the floor to ceiling windows afford an elevated sense of space.Now that the property is managed by Hilton, elite members can look forward to the usual benefits, such as late check-out, lounge access and/or breakfast, among others. The Skylounge on the 30th floor, offers a limited, but good quality continental breakfast, and a nice selection of hot and cold hors d'oeuvres, snacks and beverages in the evening. Wine and beer is available at a reasonable cost of $5. The views to the Chrysler Building are especially lovely during breakfast, when the sun bathes the spire in gold. I've been visiting New York for 45 years on my own, and up until April, 36 with my late wife. This hotel has always offered a reliable product, in terms of service and accommodation, and I would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone visiting NYC, be it for business or pleasure. Of the 30 hotels in Manhattan we visited, this was, and still is, amongst our favourites.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: It is so expensive for us to use the indoor wifi！Undoubtedly, the fee seems irrational for any hotels in China. In other words, WIFI should be included. If it cannot be cancelled, hotel should lower the fee or provide some other options, such as the fee for one hour. In this way, customers could be able to reduce some unnecessary expense. Absolutely, it will be a huge improvement about the hotel experience.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Definitely opt for a city view room. It’s absolutely stunning. It’s one of the best hotels views I’ve had in the city (aside from a park view). The room was very nice and comfortable. Slightly bigger than NY standards. Access to the executive lounge was appreciated for breakfast and coffee. The location was convenient for my needs but probably not where I would choose to stay on a holiday with the family. There are more convenient locations. A great experience at this hotel. Nice bartenders too!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We chose this hotel because of its proximity to the UN. We had a reservations to dine at the Culinart, UN Delegates’ Dining Room.The hotel’s internet was difficult to access even as an Honors Member. I was too tired to complain about it. There is nothing in the fridge so you can’t buy anything from it. Not even an ice bucket.One burnt bagel costs $8.00. In-room coffee is only espresso.Warm reception of staff, bed and pillows made up for the negatives.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: What can I say. For all the times I have visited USA several times and this was the worst. As we queued at reception to book in, the receptionist rudely stated the queue was over in a straight line? Who knew. When we approached there was no niceties or welcome to the hotel. We went to our room and as soon as we got there I was on the phone as there was no way two adults can share the bed they provide, Jess and myself had to sleep top and tail for the first nigh. We did get moved to another room the next evening(after asking about what was happening 3 times). The beds were a bit bigger so I could at least sleep with husband and not top and tail it with daughter. He's got locked in the bathroom as the door handle did not open fron inside and the wardrobe door did not close properly so the light stayed on all the time. Never again will I stay in a Hilton Hotel if this is what you get.
