hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We spent 6 nights at this high rise hotel next to the UN. We had a great view of the river and city. The room was very comfortable with two double beds. There was a refrigerator and great coffee maker European style . We found the location convenient. Staff was nice and felt safe. This hotel is very quiet for New York City. I will stay there again when I return.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This is an excellent choice to stay at.I’ve never been disappointed whenever I stay at the Hilton.The location is next to the UN and not far away from the Grand Central Station.My room had a nice view, super clean, and relaxing.Staff showed great hospitality, I respect them for that.The gym is acceptable, but limited number of machines.I would definitely stay at the Hilton.
user_name:
MoShehabz
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This was a lovely hotel. The rooms were nice and big and the bedding was wonderful. The hotel staff was always helpful. It is in an out of the beaten path neighborhood but is right on the Hudson River and across from the UN building. We did manage to find some fun neighborhood bars at night, and good breakfast diners.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Except for location, there is nothing really worthwhile in this hotel. The type of welcoming tone I heard on the phone were not there on arrival. My bags were promised to be brought up to the room. After waiting for sometime I had to come down to get them. Not a single bottle of water in the room. No mini bar. Coffee-maker didn't work. They have a strange internet set up, which didn't quite work up to expectation.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: All in once a very nice, clean Hotel, nice rooms, good service ( there could be more people behind the desk for check in and check out though) but everybody is very friendly and helpful. It is a little bit off the the center, still the theatre district about half an hour walking distance, Central Park ca 20 Minutes...

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We were so fortunate to host a beautiful wedding at the Millennium UN's gorgeous Landmark Room, which boasts the BEST 360 degree views of NYC. Despite the short notice (3 wks!) the staff worked so hard to ensure every detail was perfectly planned, and were extremely gracious and kind to us and to each of our guests, all of whom came from different states and countries (making the incredible views from the Landmark Room and their own rooms even more special). The team at Millennium UN made the happiest day of our lives the most perfect day of our lives, and we plan on revisiting the hotel to celebrate special anniversaries throughout the year. Cheers to this gorgeous hotel (with rooms about 3x the size of an average NYC hotel room), which caters to diplomats etc but goes above and beyond to make all of their guests feel like royalty, and cheers to their staff - from the sales team, concierge, room service (and the very patient housekeeping team!), porters, management, and cafe staff - for redefining hospitality and hosting our beautiful wedding (THANK YOU!).

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Overall it was a spacious hotel room. Service was good. Uber was the best way to get around as it is a ways from shopping and everything. Don't plan on eating in hotel. Two eggs alone were priced at $28. Crazy high. Plan to do some walking around to get breakfast.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The view from our room was spectacular. It was just as pictured. And the location is perfect. The bellman on our first day was extremely helpful, as he gave us a map and circled areas we could walk to. We had a great stay

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed here one week for the NYC marathon. The hotel is in a very good position, the bed is very comfortable, the view is amazing and staff are nice. The only thing the breakfast to be improved (looking at the hight price) but you can choose different bakeries around (if breakfast is not included).

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Had a lovely stay here at the start of the month with my partner and family. Having stayed in other NY hotels which boast small and tired rooms, this was quite a change. Bright and newly refurbished it had good sized rooms, very good soundproofing and although not personal, very efficient and pleasant service.Would definitely stay here again, a little out of the way of the neighbourhood areas, but a nice quiet location all the same!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Had trouble walking from Port Authority do there but I made it. My room had a gorgeous view of the river and New York City. The room was spacious and the breakfast was good as well. Best I have had in New York. Recommended for all who have business in and around the UN.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Recently, I stayed for two nights at the Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza Hotel. The staff is amazing. They go above and beyond to make you feel welcome. From the moment you are greeted curbside and through the check-in process you know your stay is going to be exceptional. The rooms are very clean and spacious. In your bathroom you will find Peter Thomas Roth products and an abundance of fresh towels. The hotel has amazing views, walking distance to subway, Grand Central Terminal, Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, Rockefeller Center, etc.The reason for my stay at this hotel was for a wedding. I had the pleasure of working with Esther Song, Assistant Director of Sales to coordinate a wedding in a short period of time. Three weeks to be exact. To say she was incredible would be an understatement, she addressed all our concerns, recommended and coordinated, flowers, cake, etc. On the day of the event, I also had the pleasure of working with Matthew Flood, Director of Banquets and his team who oversaw all the food service for the evening. Both Esther and Matthew were present during the entire event to ensure that all went according to plan. When they were given a last-minute request, they handled it like true professionals and accommodated the family. The wedding was held in the Landmark Room which was spectacular with a skyline view of various New York City Landmarks. Should you ever be looking for a venue for an event whether large or small you should definitely consider the Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza Hotel. And if you are fortunate enough to have Esther Song and Mathew Flood and their teams taking care of you not only will your event be a success, it will be a beautiful memory that everyone will remember for a lifetime.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We were lucky to attend a family member's wedding and stayed here due to the reputation of the great views and service. Not only were we impressed by the Landmark Room's ambiance and views...clearly there was a lot of attention to detail that the Banquet Director, Matthew, and his team provided the guests. Wow is all I can say and great experience all the way around!
user_name:
Siggi Jeff R
Walnut Creek, California

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I booked this hotel on booking.com and the pictures looked amazing for the price so I booked it and hoped for the best. ( You don’t always get the hotel room in the pictures so was a bit skeptic). When we arrived everything looked very fancy and we had a doorman open the door for us and took our luggage of us until we had checked in at reception.The only bad part about the hotel: (nothing too major as still gave the hotel 5*) - when we went to reception we were asked to pay all up front including a $200 deposit, we wasn’t given a receipt until we checked out. We arrived around 11:30/12:00 however reception was advising we couldn’t have the room until 16:00. I was told when I booked I could check in at 15:00, but reception wasn’t budging and we was very jet lagged so couldn’t be bothered to argue. Reception staff were quite rude and not very polite however the Bell men and concierge men were very helpful and lovely and we tipped them quite often. You can get taxis from outside the hotel also, just ask and they will stop a yellow cab for you. However, this isn’t needed much as you are close to everything, you can easily get to Times Square, central station, madison square garden and Central Park and all other places in the area. We went out roaming until 16:00 when we could finally check in. We was put on the 34th floor in a corner room. The elevator took us up there which took 45 seconds most.The room was the most amazing thing I have ever stayed in. This is due to the view we had of the whole city.. Being a corner room we have one view of the river and one of the city, both day and night this is a view I will never forget and definitely didn’t want to leave. The windows were squeaky clean so could see everything and the room in general was extremely clean. The bed was queen size and big enough for 3 people, memory foams pillows also. Bathroom had bath and shower, all toiletries were there and plenty of towels. Maids came in everyday and made our bed so the room was always clean. They have a small variety of tea and coffee available and a small fridge (not stocked with anything) TV in the room is humongous and you can sign in to Netflix etc. WiFi not great any where in the hotel so struggled to use internet, some days was brilliant but over the whole trip more days off than on. They also have a small cafe / Tour desk open in the hotel which is handy.Very good for the value we paid especially being in New York City. All in all this is one of the best hotels I have stayed in and would highly recommend to anyone thinking of spending that little bit extra on their hotel as it did make our trip!If I return to NYC I will definitely be staying here.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We all know New York is a wonderful time and this is a wonderful hotel to match. It’s in a great location, well maintained and impeccably polite staff. The views are breathtaking of downtown Manhattan, we were on the 37th floor and couldn’t have had a better room. The bed was so comfortable we had really good nights’ sleep the whole stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I would recommend this hotel. It has a good location. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Do not take the shuttle from the hotel to the airport unless you are traveling alone. It’s cheaper if you take a uber. The gym has a beautiful view.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The room (3208) had a great wives of East river and Queensboro brigde. The bed was comfortable and the cleanness of the room was great.On the downside was a noisy air-conditioner, a Wi-fi that occasionally did not work. The room also had a complete lack of drawers and shelves for storage. One last ting was that the bathtub did not hold the water without putting the foot on the drain.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This was my first time in NYC and I couldn’t have asked for a better hotel. Incredible views of Manhattan from our 38th floor room, friendly staff, great location, clean spacious room. The only slight issues were that the double beds in the deluxe double double rooms were too small and more like large singles, certainly not big enough for 2 adults. Also, the food and drink in the restaurant and coffee shop were over priced. $17 for a glass of red wine seems pretty expensive to me. Thankfully the prices encourages you to get out and explore the restaurants of Manhattan instead. Never a bad thing.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Established hotel but relatively new to the Hilton family at time of writing.- Very good value for a NYC hotel.- Rooms are spacious and clean, modern and with excellent attention to detail. This is not the typical annoying NYC sardine can hotel.- Location means generally a higher class of guest (business + political travellers, less worry that you will have noisy neighbours keeping you up at night).- Quiet rooms (based on my 2 stays thus far.). Seems like good sound-proofing between rooms.- Restaurant / room service quality is great. Pricey, but not relative to other offerings in similar class of hotel. It's what one would expect.- Internet: higher speed than the typical offering these days in Hilton NYC properties. Not always perfect, but decent enough for serious work / VPN etc. Sometimes the upload quality was slower than ideal (difficult for modern day working with automatic uploading, Dropbox, etc...).- For Hilton Diamond members: executive lounge is wonderful. There is usually one hot offering in the morning (eggs or some such), but if you're like me and need a proper bit of protein after a morning workout, you'll need to go to the buffet / restaurant on in the lobby and pay the full price, which can be quite pricey if you want a proper balanced breakfast to fuel your NY work day madness. A suggestion to the hotel would be to provide some more options other than "Free with very limited choice in the executive lounge" or what ends up being "$50 for going hog-wild at a huge buffet". Typical business travellers need something in between, such as a few more protein choices in the executive lounge, or a $10 charge or some such for access to the main breakfast area. Notwithstanding the above, the staff themselves are however very understanding and accommodating.- Transportation: not the most convenient options for subways, but you can still get where you need to go if you're willing to do a bit of walking first.SERVICE- Apart from being a top-class property where you will not find fault with any of the rooms or have any lack of comfort, the service by the staff certainly sets this property a cut above.- They staff go absolutely above and beyond to make you feel welcome, appreciated, and important. They will bend over backwards to help you, and are clearly hospitality professionals. This makes a very noticeable and positive difference to business travellers who are weary of being on the road all the time. The extra care and attentiveness is very welcome.- Particular mentions: Erika and Avery (simply because I have not interacted with many others yet) - they are absolutely WONDERFUL and are for sure a big part of why this is now one of two Hilton properties that will be my default choices when in NYC. Thank you both for the AMAZING service.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I do recommend the hotel. Amazing view from the eastern wing. Nice staff. Delicious breakfasts in the business lounge but... no alcohol for Hilton honors. Spacious rooms with extremely comfortable beds

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed here four nights on a reasonably affordable rate. I had one of the most beautiful hotel rooms I have ever stayed in. (West tower, 31st floor) Stylish, spacious, comfortable. Large bathroom, too. A beautiful view of the Chrysler building and the Empire State Building. Delicious coffee (free of charge) from the coffee maker in the room. Wifi is free and fast, which is essential. The safe was quite large. Now, if I have to think of something that wasn't perfect: I did not manage to make the large overhead shower work, so I relied on the hand shower. Unfortunately no bathtub, but the shower cabin is very nice. I don't think there was a bath robe, which would be a nice addition. Maybe they would have brought one if I had asked. There were times when getting an elevator was painstakingly slow - I think I waited close to three minutes on one occasion, which is not great when you are in a hurry to go to a meeting. Front desk staff are very friendly, but you may have to wait a bit to get someone's attention during busy periods of the day. The location is within walking distance from Grand Central, although you do have to walk a few blocks to get to the busier part of the city for a choice of bars, restaurants and shops.
user_name:
Olli H
The Hague, The Netherlands

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This will be a 5 star at some point when they get it together. My TV didn't work and they said somebody would come by to fix it while I was out for a business dinner. That never happened so I called again when I returned but engineer had left for the night. TV is not everything. Some other quirky things like how the shower sprays into the bathroom since there is no door or curtain - very European. This place has potential.
user_name:
worldtravelerT1820IO
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I first stayed at this hotel 3 years ago and recently returned for a 5 night stay. Check in and out were efficient and friendly. Rooms start on about the 30th floor and with no close taller buildings (apart from the hotel's other tower) you are assured of a good view. We chose a corner room which had stunning views down the East River towards lower Manhattan, as well as across to the Empire State. The hotel has had a great refurb since I was last there. The room was an excellent size with a huge (larger than king size) bed, long desk/dressing table, desk chair, easy chair and sofa. Plenty of hanging space and shelving for clothes. Bathroom was a very good size with a powerful shower over a low rise bath (which could get a bit slippy and could benefit from a hand rail.) The room had a safe, a coffee machine, and a fridge (not a stocked mini-bar - but handy for keeping water and juice). The hotel's location is good - about 10 minutes walk from Grand Central Station which is useful for the subway, but also walkable to the Empire State building, Rockefeller Centre, 5th Avenue and Times Square. There were 2 issues that prevented me giving this hotel an "excellent" rating: 1) We decided to eat in the hotel on the Sunday. I phoned the Ambassador Grill and was told we didn't need a reservation. When we arrived the restaurant was closed (that hadn't been mentioned on the phone) but food was being served in the Bar. That was fine, there was a table available - but the service was appalling. There was one poor member of staff who was rushed off his feet being both barman and waiter. We waited over an hour for just two main courses. Something had clearly gone wrong in the kitchen as we were asked after about 30 minutes what our order had been and then had to remind them a second time before the food arrived. We received a brief apology but no offer of any reduction in the bill or a complementary drink (that did happen after we complained but we shouldn't have had to). 2) On our last day we were woken by housekeeping at 08.30 a.m. trying to enter our room and asking what time we were checking out. Luckily we had the security lock on. We had forgotten to put the Do Not Disturb sign on but even so, we thought that was aggressive and unnecessary as they knew we would have to have checked out by 11. Overall I do recommend this hotel - but they do need to have a look at these two service issues.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Staff were nice and helpful. I arrived early and they kept my luggage so I could wonder around the area without heavy bags. View from the room and sky lounge were AWESOME. Food quality at the longe was the best among I've ever stayed (I travel at least once a week for business).

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We had stayed here many, many years ago (before it became a Hilton) and were anticipating our return. We were not disappointed. Check in was a snap; room was large; bathroom was huge (passed the throne test with flying colors) for NYC. We made the reservation on the Hilton web site and the price was the same as the aggregators like Expedia and very competitive with other lower rated hotels. In addition, there were no hidden fees, unlike our last experience on Price Line - Name your own price. In that case, my bid was accepted by WestHouse in NYC and only after it was accepted did I learn that there were mandatory fees. So much for Name Your Own Price!A couple of minor gripes: The bath tub was slippery - it did not have a no skid surface nor a rubber mat. Honestly, I thought anti-skid bath tub surfaces where legally required. Second, and this is real easy to fix, the tissues and toilet paper could have been more absorbent and softer.We used valet parking and at $55.00/day was a NYC bargain (although no in/out).It is located across from the UN. Virtually anything you do in Manhattan will require a walk or cab.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Hotel has a luxurious feel. Check in process was good. Corner room was amazing - huge bed, great views in both directions (towards Times Sq/Empire State/Chrysler & East River). Staff were friendly and helpful. We stayed there for one night on our last night in hotel. Small issue was that we had difficulty getting in touch with reception from our room by phone (we tried 3 times in evening and morning but it rang through each time with no pick up).

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: It was our first time visiting NY, we stayed at this hotel for 5 days. I would like to thank Stanley for the great service we received. We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel, close to everything Grand Central, Time Square....The view is great, even better on a suite room.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Very disappointed in the whole experience even though it really could have been a lot better. It has potential but Hilton obviously don’t care enough to change their habits.Booked for 5 nights through our British Airways holidays and the second half of our autumn trip to the US with our teenage son.The room on first impressions was great - spacious and super views, although it did take ages to check in as reception didn’t have a clear note of the booking through BA - it felt like they don’t rate a BA booking.However, could not sleep at all that night as when in one of the double beds with my wife, we literally couldn’t move! And we are ‘standard’ size people.I asked reception the next day if they had spare beds, which they do not, but did admit that the ‘doubles’ in a room with two beds are in fact smaller! When I measured the bed, it was about 110cm wide!! For two people! Sadly, this was not mentioned to me when making the booking, so I just assumed a ‘deluxe double double’ would be quite a nice room for the three of us!Eventually, I had to ask for two more duvets so I could sleep on the floor - no other offer was made.And then the additional kick in the teeth was to be told by Hilton Honours that my booking didn’t count for their rewards program! What a surprise! Very quickly I have given up on Hilton for good.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Only 8 blocks to Timesquare - we chose this hotel for the views and being high up. Room was comfy, bed was excellent. With Canadian exchange rate, was a little on the expensive side. Concierge (Maria) was most helpful.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We have been going to the UN Millennium for years. It was sold to Hilton about a month ago. Bummer. Rooms have been renovated but now they have no bureaus, the table is taken up almost entirely by the huge TV (which we never watched), the coffee maker doesn’t fit the cups they leave next to it, the furniture looks like Wayfair, the toilets are awkward and uncomfortable, the pool is gone, breakfast too. Do any Hilton designers actually stay in the rooms they design? On the positive side: beds are comfortable, view is spectacular and neighborhood is quiet. Still, we will be finding another hotel for future trips.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Arrived at hotel after travelling for 16 hours. Doorman busy chatting to another staff member so got ourselves into foyer. Stood at desk waiting while receptionist finished typing something before she even looked at us and the other just ignored us. Eventually checked in. We were on the 28th floor facing south (great view of ESB and Chrysler Building). Room booked as double deluxe. Definitely not double beds (but they were very comfortable) and not sure what was deluxe about it, but on holiday and couldn't be bothered to spoil the mood by braving the female receptionists again (we decided it must have been end of their shift, as neither were friendly or welcoming).Coffee machine and fridge, safe in wardrobe. Large TV.Easy walk to Grand Central 10-15 minutes away for nearest subway, Times Square 25-30 minutes.We only used the hotel to sleep in as out enjoying the city but we were not given any tips or recommendations by reception. The hotel layout or facilities were not explained. And certainly had no idea they had a tourist desk until I just read on a review on this website!Were sent to the Sky Lounge to print our boarding passes for flight home but the ink had run out on the printer. Really nice staff member apologised as had asked day before for a replacement but it had not arrived. Went back to main desk and was told "nothing" they could do.....end of conversation!Went back to Sky Lounge and another guest helped by shaking toner which made the printer work for a few more prints.Am sure not all the staff were as unhelpful and disinterested as the ones we encountered, but it was a sad reminder that we were staying in a large chain hotel and just another number.Would I recommend the hotel.... location yes I would, but don't expect too much of a welcome.
user_name:
AlisonK970
Royal Tunbridge Wells, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: ... that I’ve ever encountered at a place calling itself a hotel. But first things first- DIRTY. There was literally crap/poop/feces stuck to the upper inner part of the toilet. And the toilet didn’t flush properly. That picture is of the toilet paper still floating after flushing it 3 times. You can see the feces on the back corner. And there are spiders in the bathroom. **NYC’s RUDEST STAFF CONGREGATE AT ONE UN MILLENIUM HILTON**AVERY at the front desk should be called out by name for his determination to be unhelpful and incompetent. From the moment we checked in, he was condescending on the simplest questions. He repeatedly told us the guaranteed check in time was 3pm so could not be any earlier. We came back on time for him to tell us the hotel changed the check in time to 4pm and he didn’t know. It’s fine if someone makes a mistake. But how do you give a long explanation of how he was away on holiday last week and he didn’t know the check in time had been changed WITHOUT ONCE APOLOGIZING for his mistake. So blatant is his rudeness that you have to applaud his skills for not taking any ownership over a clear oversight in his part. When we asked him for the bathroom key, he once again gave us the wrong key so we had to by this time stand in line already 3 times at the front desk. And let me tell you, that line is not short or fast given who’s operating it. (BTW, what sort of hotel needs a key from the staff to use the lobby bathroom! This is not a dingy, back-alley restaurant!) But this is just a simple problem with one person, Avery. The bigger problem with this hotel is that it’s not a hotel. Nobody has been trained in customer service to help you with issues you may encounter while travelling. Misinformation among staff is rampant. (Ex. We called front desk to make sure the food delivery person could come up to the room to deliver, we were assured that wouldn’t be a problem by a female staff, just to find out that they weren’t allowed in when they arrived and we had to change out of our pajamas to go downstairs to get the food) The bellhop who keeps luggage by the door is efficient but will make you carry your bags in and out of the closet and pull them down the shelf yourself. We saw the other guest in front of us holding a couple of dollars to tip and after being asked to do the work himself he put the tip back in his pocket. We did the same. Seriously, we don’t ask to be spoiled or for a 5-star service. We know what we payed for. But just common, human decency now and then would be nice. Don’t put condescending jerks like Avery at the front desk to be the first person we meet at your “”hotel”” (double quote marks for this as you don’t deserve to be called a hotel)

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed for a couple of nights, and found the room to be comfortable and quiet. Great views over the East River. Breakfast in the hotels Ambassador restaurant was good but pricey. A few blocks from Grand Central, the subway system, and the main tourist areas.The United Nations is across the road, along with many other related organisations.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I really can't fault this hotel. It's located just across the road from the UN building, very quiet but metres away from all the action. Grand Central Station is a 10 minute walk with Times Square only five minutes further - perfect. We walked to Central Park, Empire State and the Rockefeller Centre. The hotel itself has recently become part of the Hilton family and the staff are friendly, helpful and really do want you to 'have a nice day.' Sylvia on reception is an absolute gem and a real credit to the hotel. She went out of her way to help us when our eldest son went down with tonsillitis meaning our other son, who was sharing a room with him,couldn't sleep because of the loud snoring brought on by the sore throat! Sylvia arranged another room for us with an extra bedroom for our youngest - she really saved our holiday as everyone ended up getting a good night's sleep! Thank you Sylvia The rooms themselves are very large by New York standards and have the most amazing views of either the river of the Empire State Building and the Chrysler building. The bathrooms are newly renovated and the beds are fabulously comfy. Thumbs up to house keeping, everything was spotless. Didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on the food, but there is a coffee shop in the lobby and the lattes were great.I would definitely return and have no hesitation recommending it

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: It wasn't mind blowing amazing and it wasn't terrible. Beds and pillows are INCREDIBLY comfortable. Best sleep away from home. Felt like the hotel could liaise more with their guest as reception desk is isolated to entrance/exit. Didn't know there was a tourist help desk until leaving the airport quite literally. Do use as it is fantastic!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed here for my 30th birthday recently, yes the hotel was nice but none of the staff were very friendly at all but what is most frustrating is that they put an authorisation on our American Card for $150 in case we charged anything to the room. We didn’t. Upon checkout we were told that everything was paid and the $150 would be credit back to the card within 4 working days. Upon getting to the airport we went to buy some goods at duty free and our card was declined, we knew there was additional funds in the account but as it turns out instead of refunding the $150 they have actually taken it and all the rest of the money we had in the account! They know owe us $250 which they have taken with no reason and they have ignored our countless requests to refund it by just promising someone will be in touch but nearly 3 weeks later and no one is dealing with it. We are now taking it up with the card company but this hotel has actually stolen from us and looking at the reviews, we are not the only ones this has happened to. Avoid!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Arrived to be given a room with an amazing view (38th floor). Then we saw the beds. Two tiny beds, not much wider than singles, which were meant to fit 4 adults! We asked reception to fix this but they could only offer an upgrade for 3 out of 4 nights at a cost of an additional $300 (despite being Hilton honours members). We were also told that we should have booked a room for 4 adults. Eh, we did! We declined as we had spent enough, and made do with what we had. The room was large and could have accommodated roll away beds, but they didn't have any apparently. The windows were filthy on the inside, and the bathroom floor was not clean. Apart from this, we enjoyed our stay. We didn't use any other hotel facilities.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We did think that this was a good hotel, with good rooms with excellent views, in a nice location. The area is less densely populated and it was lovely to feel some open space. Transport worked well for us too, it being 10 mins or so from Grand Central and we also used the ferries a couple of times, to make a pleasant change and for the lovely views. The ferries were a 15 minute walk.We got the sky train from JFK and the metro and then a taxi for the final leg - all perfectly doable in the early afternoon. On return, we got a taxi which was slightly cheaper than the airport bus for the 3 of us.There were no shortage of eateries in the vicinity and we ate at Patsys, Le Pain Quotodien and Pershing Square diner. Le Pain Quotodien was a particular favourite.The hotel staff were all exceptionally pleasant. We did need to change rooms however. We had booked a double, double room as we were accompanied by our 12 year old. However, the room was not as described, and as my husband had an existing shoulder injury, he had to sleep with my 12 year old to stand any chance of getting any sleep. The beds looked scarcely larger (if at all) than singles. The staff did move us the next night without any fuss, however, that room contained beds only marginally larger (not doubles) and the room was not as nice in other respects; there was no bath as the bathroom was less than half the size and the view, whilst great, was not as amazing. The rooms really should not be advertised as suitable for sleeping 3, unless they are small children; my husband still had to sleep with our son and we were relieved to get home to our double bed! To add insult to injury, we had to attend A&E on our return as his shoulder had got much worse and he is now on even more heavy duty painkillers! The aircon was good, but noisy, in both the rooms that we had.The rooms had good coffee machines, although we had to ask daily for refills and we also had to ask for supplies of shampoo/conditioner etc in our second room - I have to say though, that when asked, the hotel staff appear like lightening! It would be good if the hotel were able to supply a 'courtesy room' so we could have freshened up prior to our late night flight back to the UK.The hotel was much nicer than our stay in a midtown 4 star previously and I would have rated this 5 stars if the room description had been accurate.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Our stay was good. We did have a little trouble with payment for our booking but Staff were very professional and accommodating in this instance.Our room was big and the bathroom was spacious.We had booked a two x double bed room but the beds did feel small compared to other hotels we've stayed at.Great location and facilities and the hotel only a short 10min walk to Grand Central (subway). There were lots of dining options close by.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Recently returned from 6 night stay at this hotel. Good location and helpful staff. A special thanks to the concierge, al lovely lady called Agnes who was a great help to us when we were planning our day. She gave us excellent advice on what subways we needed and anything else we needed to know. We stayed on the 30th floor and the room was large with good facilities and fantastic views.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Another solo trip to NY, all in all hotel bearable but this was mainly due to the great price booked when it was a millennium hotel.Check-in staff very friendly , and check out very simple - however concierge was very vague about options for transfer for return flight to Newark.Elevators slow and in need of refurbishment. Room itself was ok, large by NY standards... however decor very old and dirty, no opportunity for bath (only shower) , empty minibar, and no sign of a room service menu.Was told at check in room had great view of east river.. in actual fact was only partial visible. Also room tends to be noisy and creaky if high winds outside.Overall nothing to say that would put travellers off staying here, but not much to encourage them to stay either! Not up to usual Hilton standards but I guess with proximity to UN building they will always have good occupancy rates and little incentive to improve

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We made our way over to the Millennium Hilton One UN Plaza our home away from home for the night. For future reference the hotel address is 1 United Nations Plaza, New York, NY 10017 however the valet and hotel entrance is on E 44th St. We had stayed at this property a few years ago when it was just the One UN Hotel and were happy that it's now a part of the Hilton family. Once we parked we had a good time joking around with the Bell Service staff! We discussed my car and who has or hasn't been to Italy. Very humorous conversation. We headed inside to the check in desk and our room wasn't ready yet but we did get upgraded to a suite (yay Hilton Honors). We dropped off our luggage and decided to go to lunch.We checked in again later in the day and our keys were ready and waiting for us. We were in room 3343 a one bedroom suite. The room was bright, large and clean. The room was almost perfect except for a few large tears in the carpet in the living area. At this point we decided to cool down and relax in our room for a little while. Around 6 we went to the 30th floor to the Sky Lounge for the cocktail hours. The snacks weren't to our liking (and not dairy free) so we opted to spend $10 on two glasses of red wine. The next morning the staff called for our car, helped check us out, and wished us a safe drive home. Every staff member we came across was very friendly and professional. We would definitely stay at this property again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: After a long flight, we arrived at the hotel and had to wait around 45 minutes as the booking couldn't be found - not a promising start! The staff were very good though and went off to sort it out and although we had paid for a corner room, we were upgraded to a suite free of charge which was a nice touch.Once sorted, we went up to the 31st floor and sadly the view was of the river but mostly blocked by another building so not the view we were hoping for. The room was excellent. Several large wardrobes with a safe. Reasonable kitchen with a sink, fridge and coffee machine. Very large lounge with a dining table, work table, large TV and sofa/bed. The large bedroom also had a TV and a huge bed and finally a decent sized bathroom. The room controls had hot/cold and worked very well, there was also free Wi-Fi in the room, but was patchy in some places but worked fine once connected.The staff were very good and pleasant and professional at all times, we had asked for a cake to be delivered to the room which had constant email communication and was delivered on time. However, on check out we were billed for the room (having already paid in advance!) this is in the process of being sorted out, but it was only noticed when we got back home - to be fair the hotel staff were quickly on the case when we called and I've no real concerns about it being resolved.The location is a little out of the way, but it's less than a ten minute walk to Grand Central (which is the nearest subway) and there are plenty of places to grab a drink or snack from and also a few sit down restaurants. It's very quiet and I found a good base to explore from overall.The rooms are excellent and the service is very good - I'd look at coming back to the Millennium again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed here with my girlfriend for 4 nights last week and overall we were very impressed. The room was spacious with good facilities and the view over the river was beautiful. There is a fair amount of security around the hotel given it's location, so always felt very safe.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Nice location, great people to help, very convenient. Close to Times Square, few blocks to Grand Central to move around the city. The area is very quiet and there are many options to dine out, so you can have great experiences every day

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: From curbside to the front desk to the room shone with grace and hospitality. Barry was very kind to us. He checked us into a lovely room with an awesome memorable view. Housekeeping was top notch in cleanliness. Very cheerful staff. Will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Huge disappointment will not stay again internet listed indoor pool BUT it has been under repair for months. Subpar service to club members. Amateurish dealing with the problem. Cheap for charging me for two coffees after I seriously complained.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: From walking into the hotel to leaving we found the staff friendly and helpful.Room was great two double beds and bath with a shower over it. Room was spotless and coffee and tea was topped up daily.Our view was great we could see the Chrysler building, Empire State Building and United Nations, could have looked at the view all night.Can't fault this hotel , great location, great food and great staff.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: A wonderful hotel. Very comfortable and quiet room, nicely appointed. Spectacular view of East River and beyond. Received a personable greeting from front desk clerk, Barry, who was pleasant, welcoming, and very accommodating. Also a thank you to Erica, front desk manager, for her assistance and our friendly interaction with her.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel is in a great location and the room we had was fantastic. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Would definitely stay again. We had a view of the East River. Our room was kept really clean.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel was spotless, the room was large and well appointed. Everything about this facility was first class. They provided a desk, sofa and a comfortable lounging chair. The view of the East River and Roosevelt Island was fantastic.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Located at 2nd Avenue and 44th Street, the hotel is located just blocks from Grand Central Terminal and is an easy walk to 5th Avenue and Mid-Town attractions. Lots of restaurants within walking distance, including fresh bagels and a nice artisan coffee shop just up the street. Clean, spacious guest rooms with great views of the East River and the Chrysler Building. Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Tripp was very nice. Hotel clean overall my family had very good experience. Hotel steff was very helpful and customer service very good. Beds could have been bigger thou. I had hard time sleeping o twin size two People not enough room

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Large comfortable room with good amenities and amazing views. All staff friendly and efficient. 2 double beds would be a little small if 4 adults were sharing. Excellent location- walking distance to many attractions and 5 min walk to Grand Central. I would recommend this hotel highly.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed here October weekend (sat-monday) pricelined it and got 2 rooms for $170/night. Hotel is on East 44th street but right on 1st Avenue across from UN. solid 6 block walk to times square. arrived at 1pm and room not ready as check in was 3. Even though very tall building it appeared the hotel rooms available to public don't start until the 25th floor or so. so you will get nice views it appears no matter what room you get. We were on 37th of 39 floors looking out to east river, Roosevelt island and the Queensborough bridge. Check our bags with porter and headed out for the day. Didn't arrive back until 7:30pm and were quickly given our room keys. Rooms are spacious and unique (to me) as when you walk in the door there was a hallway to the right that led to bathroom and to the left was the bedroom. Kind of nice as you have some privacy if in bathroom. King bed, very soft, as were the pillows. Not my preference but my wife had no problems. Flat screen HDTV that worked well. Bathroom was spacious but could have used a light in the shower as the toilet was separated from rest of room and had a half wall separating it from the vanity. There was light over toilet and one over vanity but not in shower. Customary toilietries, hair dryer were offered as well as a magnifying/lighted mirror attached to wall. Shower had both a fixed shower head and another flexible one which was nice. Water pressure was OK, nice and hot. Room had a good size closet that had a complimentary safe in it. Dry cleaning was offered with the bags/tickets in the closet. There was a iron/ironing board also in closet. There was a mini fridge/empty for your use that kept stuff good and cold. also a coffee maker that my wife tried that was not good. Big picture window overlooking the UN and the river. there were plenty of lighting options but bulbs were all dim. so if like me you are farsighted makes it tough for reading without holding it right up to light. was a nice flexible arm reading light on each side of bed. ihome clock radio that you could dock your iphone on to charge/play music. however not enough outlets in this technology age around the bed. 2 outlets on my side both take by a lamp and said ihome clock radio. Desk on opposite side of bed had couple outlets and usb ports for your electronics. room was very clean and made service was good. Check out was 12 noon which was nice/later than accustomed. There was a coffee/breakfast/convenience store in lobby. Coffee was pretty good also pretty pricey. 2 blocks away on 3rd ave there was a D&D. Lobby also had the Ambassador restaurant which we did not go in. Would definitely stay here again if price was right. is a bit of a walk to time square, grand central. and being this far from times square less dining options that hotels closer to the action. real easy exit (by car) to FDR and out of the city heading north to Boston.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Very practical hotel for the UN with wonderful views over the New York skyline. The rooms are of a good size and very comfortable and quiet. The complimentary WiFi is reasonable for routine business tasks.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The Hilton Millennium at the United Nations is a terrific hotel, just steps away from the United Nations. The rooms themselves were surprisingly spacious, with desk and sitting space in each room. Surprising for NYC. The view from the 33rd floor was wonderful. Could see the Chrysler Building from my window! Hotel staff was very accommodating and friendly. I had a couple of packages delivered to the hotel ahead of my stay. They were aware of the deliveries when I checked in. I didn't even have to ask about them, as they already had a record of those deliveries. Nice!
user_name:
Hana S
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stunning views, room, service and check in/ out. Apart from the wifi being difficult to connect to this hotel was faultlessThe views were stunning.Will stay here again for sure next year when we return

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Convenient to everything, but quiet, comfortable and nicer than being in times square. Rooms have great views, comfy beds, staff is very friendly. You can walk to grand central and get anywhere. Plus very secure. Being across fro. UN is cool too.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: stayed here for 4 nights staff very friendly and helpful, room was on 37th floor overlooking the east river, the empire state building and Chrysler building with world trade center in distance, didn't hear any noise, very quiet room except the sirens in the street below but didn't stop us sleeping, wonderfully comfortable beds and pillows which mine at home were the same! would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Spent a lot of time looking at hotels in New York. We were told not to stay in Times Square because of the noise. When this Hilton came up we jumped at the chance, I also use Hilton in the UK for work purposes. Being only 15-20 minute walk to Times Square was ideal for us. Always one to check reviews and was more than happy about all aspects. We arrived after a long flight and was greeted by a friendly receptionist. We were on the 38th floor and had fantastic views, see pictures. Each day the room was cleaned. There was a small fridge in the room which allowed us to stock up, a little money saver! I found the whole experience friendly and extremely relaxing. Thank you all.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: All the workers were very helpful and accommodating. I would love to visit this hotel again. The location enabled us to walk to restaurants and easy access to Citi bikes less than a block away. The views from our room was stunning and the bell desk personnel were enjoyable to laugh with.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Good Quality hotel in a quiet location about 15mins walk from Times Square. Rooms with double beds are cramped and beds are actually quite small for two people. Bar prices are extortionate! Staff are friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Beautiful hotel with great views over the East River, nice location quitter area but within walking distance to the attractions. Spotlessly clean beautifully decorated hotel. Staff could be nicer, not overly friendly - very matter of fact mannerisms

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We have been to New York for 5 days for my daughters 40th birthday and stayed at this hotel. It is very plush and the rooms are luxurious we asked for an upgrade and was put on 34th floor. The views are amazing. King size bed the room clean and air conditioned. The reception is very impressive and staff really friendly and helpful. It's between 1st and 2nd Avenue on East 44th street so a little bit of a walk to time square but well worth it. Restaurant available but we didn't eat there.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We arrived on Tuesday afternoon and were very pleasantly greeted by the reception staff, quickly through check in and off up to our room which was a corner king. The view was fantastic, as expected from what I'd seen in the photos when booking. We were surprised though that there was no drinks in the mini-bar and it wasn't stocked during our stay (though we didn't request for it to be). The windows in the room and especially the Skyline bar really do need a clean! I found a number of hairs in the bathroom and around the toilet when we first got to our room, and throughout our stay it was obvious that the cleaner didn't bother at all to hoover the bathroom up. One major annoyance was the soundproofing, or lack of in the rooms. There was a door into the room next door which must be paper-thin, we could literally hear every word the guests next door were saying to each other, which then made myself and my partner very aware of our conversations and thus had to whisper to each other. On one occasion they were playing music at 5am, which was probably not of a very loud volume if the walls were solid, but because of the door into next door it woke us up straight away. The breakfast was rather basic, the only hot food on offer was scrambled eggs, but were of a good quality. There were plenty of pastries which were very tasty too. The other options were selection boxes of cereals, toast, and some fruit. It was always pretty quiet at breakfast and again the views were great with it being on the corner of the building. Checkout was as swift as check in, and again very polite staff.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Have just returned from a stay at Millenium Hilton No 1 UN Plaza, booked in February for a special birthday for my husband. Stayed on 36th floor, supposedly in a deluxe King room, absolutely nothing deluxe about it apart from the view. Hotel asked if we had any special requirements at time of booking then promptly ignored it and said they didn't see my request. Reception most unhelpful. Had to ask for beverages in room and then arrived back one day to dirty cups and rubbish still in room. Very disappointing. Would certainly not recommend.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Top notch service coupled with an amazing hotel room and topped with a breathtaking view made this stay one of my most favorite. I enjoyed the amazing service I received as a Hilton HHonors Gold member as though that was clearly not needed for this hotel’s staff to impress. I highly recommend this hotel when in New York!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed in August when the city is less busy. The hotel upgraded my kids room to a suite on the 40th floor with views over the Hudson and into the heart of Manhattan. They were delighted and still show everyone the photos. Our room was also fab but not really in the same league. I think most of the rooms in the hotel probably have very interesting views and from reviews you get a bit more space which is important for more than a quick overnight. The hotel has a great exercise area overlooking the river which was very quiet with a couple of cool and also traditional places for breakfast within minutes walk. Foyer the ideal place for people watching as the world comes through. Children (19&15) set on coming back and won't consider staying anywhere else!Many thanks to the hotel for this - it really was very kind and hugely appreciated.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel staff was fabulous.  The Concierge was fabulous The only problem we had was:The coffee machine in our room did not work. When I asked for help they told me how I could fix it. It’s still never worked.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This midtown gem is one block from the entrance to the UN, a great looking building, close to many restaurants and Grand Central Station, with great views of the East River and the midtown Manhattan skyline from room; it was our best stay in a hotel in NYC in many years
user_name:
brian k
Lake Placid, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We are staying on the 36th floor with amazing views. Rooms spacious and clean. Hairdryer iron and coffee machine in room. Hilton honours bonus of complimentary breakfast in skyline lounge as well as o'dearves and soft drinks served between 5pm til 8pm. Taxis usually ready and waiting outside hotel or very short walk at the end of the street. Staff friendly. Location ideal 10 minute walk from times square loe taxi fare to central park and soho etc.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Had lunch here with an old chef friend still one of Dublin's finest dining rooms.Bread was superb and nice selection, lobster and foie gras to start stunning, I had turbot for mains and it was Cooked to perfection and tasted as beautifully as it was presented, service was impeccable familiar and warm.Over all One Pico is downing it how it should be done

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Slow ish check in process. But worth the wait to a spacious room with great views. Huge bed. Well kept. Coffee machine. Totally recommended and worth being that extra 10 min walk from the hustle. Excellent pillow selection. Gym small but functional.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Good location especially for its proximity to the UN Headquarters office, excellent view of the UN office on 1st street, the Roosevelt Island and sunrise over NY city, excellent breakfast complementary with the room. The hotel is renovated recently and furnished well. I was traveling on business during the UN General Assembly and security was tight with Police and Secrect Service agents all around. However, the in and out movement from the hotel on foot seem flawless. In general had a wonderful experience.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This property is on the east side of Manhattan, parking is a little high but thats new york. The staff is wonderful, and the property is very pretty. I feel like it is a great value for the money. I would recommend the property.
user_name:
Kiedra T
Jersey City, United States

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The was an excellent hotel to stay in and everything was pleasant with no complains. I will stay here again and everything was close to get to. I also go to Juniors Restaurant alot when I am in New York.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Wonderful stay at Millennium Hilton not only the establishment was impeccable but most was the reception we had from our front desk Mr. Barry, he was knowledgeable, warm and welcoming and that alone started our week long cruise at its best pace. From comfortable room to great amenities and fantastic hospitality I like to give my 5 star plus as a season and frequent traveler. Thank you millennium Hilton for making our stay a pleasure and I'm looking forward to staying with you again and spreading the word with my frequent new york visiting Florida friends.
user_name:
Rachael F
West Palm Beach, Florida

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I have some mixed feelings about this place. The rooms are large and I had a little walk-in closet and you can store your luggage, so you don't have to see it. The bathroom is fairly large and the room overall is huge although awkwardly designed. There was a large sofa against the wall with a round table and a large chair but no place to work. The TV in the room is HUGE, must have been 46 inches and it is a smart TV, so you can log into your Netflix account but remember to log out before you leave. The hotel is a little dingy and could use an update. The windows were filthy and I could not see outside very well. This seem to be a problem around the whole hotel as the executive lounge also had filthy windows. This is really too bad, since the hotel offers some excellent views of Manhattan.I think overall the place was decent but could use an update and cleaning. Now for the executive lounge; as a gold member you are given access to their happy hour and continental breakfast. What a mess that place is! Of the 4 days I was there, I visited once and left immediately. No utensils, no cups, half the food had already been consumed and under staffed. Almost all the tables had dirty dishes, so many of us were standing around trying to find a place to sit. There was some fruit and bread to toast and that's it. It was quite depressing and really too bad not a full breakfast is offered. I did visit the restaurant on the ground floor for breakfast one day but expect a 42$ bill pp. Outrageous! As for the area, there is practically nowhere to eat. The choices are limited and because you are from everything you have to walk several blocks to catch a subway, nearest place is grand central. Now it is not at negative, I prefer to stay in more central areas and this place didn't work for me. I walked to my office 1.5 miles a day each way. The area is safe and mostly residential. You'll just have to walk a little to get to the action. The plus side is that it is very quiet and Manhattan can be quite noisy.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I would reccomend this hotel to anyone traveling to NYC but for more experienced NYC go-ers. The rooms were clean and the staff was nice however; we had an unpleasent experience our first night. A hotel wide alarm went off a little after midnight, it was blasting through our room's intercom and went on for over a half hour. We were not given any sort of apology for the inconvenience and when we tried calling the front desk no answer. It was awful- I could not fall asleep until 3 a.m. and our entire next day was thrown off. I am not one to complain but if we had at least been given an explanation or apology I would have more tolorance for the problem. I'm just glad I wasnt a family with a small child staying there that night because that could have turned into an absolute nightmare for parents with a baby that was woken up!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I spent most of stay at the Millennium trying to get Wifi access and I am still playing catchup. They did not have a qualified IT technician available on site and the telephone numbers they provided were to a service that had ceased.
user_name:
Michael B
Blackborough End, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I have stayed at the hotel three times now, and it is a pleasure - the rooms are more than comfortable and clean, and offer fantastic views of the East River, and to the architecture fans a beautiful view of the surrounding iconic skyscrapers all lit up at night. The bathroom is delightful, with all amenities. The concierge desk, particularly Cammerron and Jackie, who helped with all my touristic requests. From the concierge desk I booked theatre tickets and got some better food suggestions. Dennis and Robert the doormen were incredibly helpful and accommodating of additional requests. In terms of location, it's on the East side, so but I enjoyed this and could easily walk to wherever I wanted to visit and it's a great way to see the city. The location is great for business people and those visiting the UN. It is a bit farther out of the way from most tourist attractions - but it does allow a quieter and peaceful stay, and you can always walk or take public transport anywhere you want to go.The hotel offers a shuttle service to Newark which was perfect for me. However, you can also get a yellow cab or a private hire taxi which I had done in previous times. Also, I visited Boston during my stay in city, and the hotel was conveniently located near to the Boston coach stop.So tourists staying for an extended period of time could do a day trip or night over in Boston with ease.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The staff was absolutely amazing - arrived at 10 am, not expecting to have our room until later, but they went out of their way and 10 minutes later I was taking the elevator to our room. Very clean and great views. Central to everything, if you don't mind walking a little. Awesome bagel shop half a block away. Will definitely stay there in my next trip. Although we weren't one of the high dignitaries staying there as well, we definitely were treated as such. :-)

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great location and service. This was booked by the company but I was very pleased with the organization and service. There was high security with many diplomats coming and going but this only heightened the experience and did not detract.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Fantastic view of the East River -- Roosevelt Island, 59th Street Bridge, Triboro Bridge and Whitestone and Throgs Neck bridges. Once I found where they stashed the bath towels -- on a shelf above the toilet -- everything was just fine. Very comfortable bed. The nwegatives: Unless you've got business at the UN, this Hilton is a bit out of the way. Wi-Fi refused to stay connected. The hot water wasn't very hot.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We booked a corner room on the 40th floor and it was, without doubt, the best view of any hotel we've ever stayed in! Bed was very comfortable and shower was good. We stayed the week of a UN conference so security was incredible - airport-style security to get through the front door - at least we felt safe! We chose to eat breakfast at a local deli - far better value.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed in a different area for the first 2 nights in NYC. We were due to check in on the Saturday, however we had a close family bereavement back in Ireland Friday evening and had to get emergency flights home. We explained this to the manager and she cancelled our reservation at no cost to us. This was not expected but we sincerely thank you. Not all hotels would have done this. Especially during change of ownership.Next time we go to nyc I will definitely stay there.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel has nice views on the skylines of New York (city and river depending on the side on which you are), large rooms with good beds and adequate bathroom facilities. The carpet floor is not well kept. A major disappointment was the staff of the hotel. The reason is that yes they will assist if requested and awaiting a tip but they do not put the customers’ welfare at the core of their service. We stayed 10 days in the hotel, which is ratherand had therefore sufficient time to get a feeling about the service. The reasons for our criticism is based on the following: 1) A whole day the Wi-Fi Internet was down. Nobody of the staff proactively explained what was going on and only a day later after repeatedly asking what was done about it we got an explanation how to circumvent the matter. 2) More frustrating was our experience at the end of the stay. The stay apparently coincided with the UN General Assembly meeting in New York and although knowing that around this time of year such a meeting takes place we also not had the exact dates in mind (they change also along the years). However in essence the hotel was taken over by delegations. We understand that security matters need to be made and appreciate that work undertaken. However no hotel personnel informed us about the consequences for visitors not being a delegate. Also no effort was undertaken to ease the discomfort. A complaint made was met with a condescending reaction of the hotel manager. After underlining our point she eventually said she would take note…

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Me and my girlfriend stayed at this hotel for 15 nights in September. The hotel was fabulous, very modern and good architecture on the outside. The hotel has floors between 27 and 38 on one UN plaza, adjacent to the UN building across the street. When we first walked in to the hotel area we were stopped by security as they had search dogs looking for drugs. This was ok as we had nothing to hide. The receptionists were reasonable not the fastest and were a bit confused about this whole Hilton Honor scheme which you need to get the free wifi, in the end we spent about 20 minutes wasting our time so that I could give them the Honors code.The lifts are a bit annoying as you need your keycard to go up to any of the floors from the lobby, which is ok I guess as it means the homeless population of New York cannot access your floor and try to rob you.We chose the Deluxe King size room, this came with a big king size bed, fridge and coffee maker machine. However, the coffee maker machine made horrible coffee I nearly threw up drinking it.There is a good size bathroom with a shower with two heads. Overall I was pleased with the room as it came with a reasonable size TV allowing me to watch some good shows when we stayed in. The room service was excellent, cleaning the room to a good standard. However, they woke us up in the morning if you did not put the sign on the door. Saying that, even when we did have the sign on the door they still knocked on the door asking if we would like coffee.The hotel location is ok, it is about 25 minuets walk from times square and 10 minutes walk from Grand Central Station. What let this room down was the fact that my wireless Bluetooth 60$ headphones were stolen by the cleaning staff. I was very upset, I left the headphones on the table and I could not find them. I believe they were stolen as they looked quite expensive. As a result, I will never ever stay in this hotel again as they made me feel vulnerable with leaving my belongings in the hotel. I am not sure why the cleaning staff would feel that is it ok to steal from the guests when they are effectively paying their wages.I would like Hilton management in this hotel to make the cleaning staff aware that stealing is a crime in the USA and is not acceptable in such a upmarket hotel.Also note that you will face heightened security entering this hotel if there is an event going on at the UN. Luckily, we left the day the UN General Assembly was going to take place. I however, feel for the UN people as their possessions are not safe and would not advise anyone to take expensive belongings to this hotel unless you store them in the safe or chain them somewhere somehow. The pool was out of action when we went to this hotel so I cannot comment on this.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My wife and I stayed at this hotel whilst in New York. We stayed in room 4036 which provided breathtaking views of the city, including the Chrysler and Empire State buildings. The room was spacious and clean whilst the staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is well located, away from Times Square but only a ten minute walk from Grand Central Station. There were a couple of good local places for breakfast e.g. Johns restaurant and the comfort diner within a few minutes walk. We thoroughly recommend this hotel and try to get city views on a high floor!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Very clean hotel with nice personnel. The coffee downstairs is amazing and has the most delicious cinnamon buns in NY! And the guard dogs are very friendly! I enjoyed my stay both times. But the view is amazing!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: One UN was clean and beautiful, located just across the street from the UN. Our 34th floor room was clean and well-appointed, and we had a great view of the city and the river.The staff was courteous and attentive. This is a really great hotel

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel is very clean and the room was large and comfortable. The front desk staff are excellent but my main problem was with the Bell Desk staff. They refused to get me a taxi each day of my visit and instead sent me to the corner of the street to hail a cab. I didn't understand at first until I witnessed them only send guests who were headed to an airport. Also, I was promised free internet access as a Hilton Honors member, but only after I left did I realize that I was charged. Very poor service.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Hotel Millennium, now in Hilton group, is around the corner from the UN and not too far from the theater district. The room was very comfortable with a great view of the Empire State Building, especially nice lit up at night. The dinner I ate in the restaurant was excellent.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: New York was great however hotel experience was sadly a big disappointment . Day 1 - Checked in at 10pm after a long flight, went to room and it had a very horrible smell. Needless to say there were no alternative room available and I certainly wasn't going to pay for an upgrade ! The smell was so strong we could not sleep , breathing was just difficult . To top of the 'great experience' the shower was broken ... so we couldn't even have a shower (classy washing yourself in a sink !! ) The view from the 34th floor was amazing - nothing else was !! We were forced to leave the room at 7.30am feeling grumpy and tired ... it was that bad! Day 2 - offered the same room 3 floors down but offered no compensation for First night! The rooms are very spacious , we had two double beds BUT the overall service poor ! The front desk couldn't care less if you complain! They are just plain rude but thankfully the lovely guys on the Concierge are just happy and helpful! A word for the manager, who incidentally wasn't available to speak to me ...Consider how you compensate a customer for your error with a malfunctioning room - I have still paid the full price and not even a cup of coffee offered as a gesture of good will ! A customer shouldn't have to call down to reception to ask for toilet rolls in their room , it should be part of the daily cleaning routine . Then again none of the toiletries in the bathroom were replaced for 5 nights Please get the basics right you will then have happy customers! Your hotel is lovely , the position is great and the concierge excellent as for the rest .... the rest of the service is just terrible !! .... and your team don't seem to care! Pictures available but not posted .

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Well this was a jewel of a find!!Located just over the road from the UN and not far from Grand Central this was a great base for our city break. Friendly staff and decent size room (for a NY hotel) with good facilities onsite. When we stayed it was transitioning to the Hilton Group & despite a small issue with the wifi we didn't have any reason to gripe. Look out for a great rate and choose this place to stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I've stayed here before, and really enjoyed the stay, but now when I went back is just good, the rooms need some update, the pool was not working, cos of that I just give a good.The location is nice if you want to walk in Manhattan is close for everywhere and convenient, the shops nearby helps a lot.There some really good options for breakfast nearby, I did go for a Korean just off 2º Avenue ans 45th st, is open all day long and has always great options.A taxi ride from the hotel to the airport is 80 Dollars but Uber is cheaper.It takes about 1 hour from JFK.The staff is polite and has great customer service, the rooms are clean and tidy, all good.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Looking for a good hotel while attending the US OPEN 2017 to watch my favorite players in the men's quarter final. Friendly/professional Staff. Quite/Great room with a view. Spa like bathroom with walking shower. Very close to Grand Central Station. Good Security. Variety of delis and restaurant around

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel has high turnover just for being a service pad for the UN. Location and view is amazing. However, apart from the bellmen, front desk clerks weren't the best. On check in I was told it is free wifi on check-out, just after spending one night the desk clerk printed an invoice showing internet charges. On my inquiry she said "We changed management and we now charge." While she waived the fees when I contested, it was a bit weird to see how they are just trying to make money. When she presented the paid receipt, like any other hotel, I asked for an envelope. The answer was "No, we don't have these"! Really! I would go again but with much less expectations.
user_name:
rnaggar
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Cammerron ( The Concierge) assisted us this morning with an excellent breakfast recommendation. His desk was crowded with many guests, and he was efficient, and attentive, to all guests, and in a matter of minutes had assisted all of us. we had a nice conversation about being up all night, having just evacuated Florida and he listened sincerely, and was very helpful with all of our questions. we felt very welcome and are excited to have chosen this Hotel do to his service this morning.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Well. Started off a little rocky. Property recently changed to Hilton ownership and our reservation was a bit screwed up. After about 15 minutes it was all resolved. The staff was exemplary at fixing the issue and went above and beyond. Room is beautiful: Sleek modern well appointed and clean. Again the staff just wonderfully accommodating and gracious. It's a little out of the downtown hustle and bustle but well worth the little extra cab fare.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Nice hotel but with a wonderful view!!! The room was big and the hotel very chic. Our room offered a double panoramic window view. Pity that hotel is not in a more lively neighborhood (United Nations)For that reason, not sure to come back in this hotel when we'll be in NYC again

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed here for the US Open. Great location although some might think it's a bit out of the way. The tradeoff? larger than average size rooms for Manhattan, river views (not all rooms), friendly staff, clean, pool, tennis court, quiet residential street with convenient access in/out of city to/from airport

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The UN One hotel was in a nice quiet area. It was an easy walk to the subway station and even easier if you caught a bus! It was only a 15-20min walk (easy) to Times Square. The hotel has a great café in the lobby which was a god send for us! It was the first real/decent coffee in over a week! Our room was fairly large for NYC. We had plenty of room for our luggage and still able to move about freely. The only fault was I had requested a room with a view of the Chrysler building and this was not fulfilled. Other than that we did not experience any issues while staying here.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
