review_body: Views from the 33rd floor over the East River are spectacular. You can skip gym workouts and take in the great views. The pricey restaurant provides inspiration to visit many nearby eateries. A pity about the lack of drawers - living out s suitecase doesn't make for a great trip.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Overall, the hotel was ok. Good points: the view and location. Bad points: service was inconsistent throughout. Apparently there is a reason to have an employee dedicated to restocking the coffee bar. On the second day I had to leave a note requesting that housekeeping please remove the prior day's dirty coffee cups. The note was thrown away and the dirty cups were placed back on the coffee bar. And, of course, coffee pods were not restocked. It became a daily routine of requesting service, not once was it serviced properly...it became a running joke. No drawer spaces provided in the room (one of my pet peeves) and the closet was VERY small. Luckily, we were in a 1 bedroom suite and there was another larger closet off the living room. I like that we also had 2 full bathrooms to allow us to get ready simultaneously. The bomb-sniffing dogs were fun to watch in action. We were able to pet one of them (Barbara) with the handler's permission but the rest of them were off limits! When taking taxi's make sure to give the address as One UN Plaza, instead of just the hotel name, or you will be taken to the other Millennium hotels! Happened twice to our party.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!! We stayed here with another couple in August 2017 and chose this hotel due to a great deal we found online. We encountered several unacceptable issues during our stay:1. When we first checked into our room, the toilet wasn't working properly and the sink was clogged with dark floating particles inside. We called the front desk and asked to switch rooms and they quickly switched us to a different room.2. Right before we were about to check out from our room, the cleaning staff knocked on our door only once, and proceeded to walk in on me while I was in the midst of changing, causing an incredibly embarrassing and uncomfortable situation for me. The cleaning attendant should have waited for a response to check if anyone was inside the room. Completely unacceptable! 3. At check out, we let the front desk know about the embarrassing encounter with the cleaning attendant, and they told us they would compensate us for the preventable mishap. The next day we noticed my credit card, which was provided at check-in, was not charged, and the hotel double charged my friend's card instead. Trying to correct this, we called the hotel and let them know about the billing error. - The hotel told us that they were going through a "Name Change" and could not resolve the issue for at least 3-4 business days, as their entire staff was in a super important meeting and very busy for the next little while. Being patient, we waited 4 days and, after no follow-up from the hotel as promised, we called back and they assured us they would credit my friend's card and charge mine instead. - What should have been a 5 minute process, did not end up happening for an ENTIRE MONTH! The manager said he would fix the billing error and follow-up with us, however he did not follow through on his promise. We had to play phone tag for an entire month to have our issue resolved and our concerns listened to! This is by FAR, the WORST hotel experience I have ever been through. Management at this hotel clearly DO NOT care about their customers and their concerns. We had countless e-mails and phone calls ignored by staff. The One UN Hotel did not even ATTEMPT to rectify and compensate for the many mistakes made. I will never ever ever step foot inside this hotel again!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The refurbished rooms are good value for money. This is one of the few hotels where Wi-fi is complimentary with a very decent speed. Staff is extremely friendly and location very convenient. Elevators are a bit slow and the waiting time can be quite long especially at peak hours. Buffet breakfast at 40$ exc. service is a bit over the top even for NY!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed here as a couple who are in their 20's in May 2017. As we have been to New York on a few occasions we wanted to stay in a hotel that wasn't in the middle of Times Square. This hotel was a lovely location for us and just a short walk to some of the main attractions of New York.We arrived late evening around 11pm and the concierge was very friendly and got us checked in quickly. We were given a room in the new renovated part of the hotel and the room was very clean with a nice view over the river. I can highly recommend the hotel bar, we only had a few drinks here one evening but it definitely felt special as cocktails were freshly made with no pre-mix. It's not too far from the airport if you wish to use the train/subway which we did. The walk from the subway which has the line to the airport to the hotel is about 15 minutes.Plenty of nice restaurants around and it was a pleasant stay!My only comment would be is that the cleaners did try to enter our room a couple of times even though we had the do not disturb sign on.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: To whom it may concern I would have loved to have taken this opportunity to write and tell you about the wonderful experience that I had at the millennium one UN Hotel. Instead I am going to take this opportunity and give you a more accurate depiction of my time at this hotel. Before the summer was over I decided to take nine days and stay at this beautiful hotel. It has been one year since my father passed away and it's a place where he always loved to come. The hotel offers great views of New York City skyscrapers, as well as the East River. The room was excellent and clean when I got there with the exception of an empty bottle of KY jelly under the bed that all in all did not ruin that beautiful room for me. The Big screen television was nice I used it to watch a few movies as well as do some work off of my laptop. The bathroom was carefully stock with towels, soap, bath gel and an excellent shower head with excellent pressure. One of the best part about staying here was I felt that in the beginning especially the first two days the people who work at the hotel were very courteous. This hotel is near the United Nations so of course security is priority at the entrance of the hotel there is a dog trained to sniff out any unwanted materials that may be in anyone's luggage or possession. Taxis lined up by the entrance of the hotel for anyone that needs to make a speedy trip anywhere around the city. Like in most other hotels every morning you get the option of having your room serviced or the option of more privacy. On the sixth day of the trip I had to make a few trips around New York very early in the morning and I had left my laptop computer, my DSLR camera, my iPad Pro, my towel and the iPad Pro pencil. Because all of these things were on the bed and I did not have a chance to lock it up in the safe that every room has what's the reason why I requested no service this day I did not want anyone to be going through my things. When I got back to the room that night I saw that the room had been serviced because the laptop was moved to the small table and my iPad and camera were also moved. I noticed that my iPad Pro pencil was missing something that I paid $100 for. I went to the front desk and they said that housekeeping and the manager was gone for the day and that I would have to get in contact with them in the morning. The following day I called housekeeping and told him what happened, they apologized and said that I'm sure it was not stolen but they are pretty sure that it was a mistake. They also asked what they could due to correct the situation. I told the housekeeping manager that I would be happy with the replacement of the product that was lost/stolen. She then said that she would be up to the room. She never came, instead this day but I stayed outside for hours waiting for someone to turn to me instead housekeeping came and said if I needed my room serviced? I told her not until I get to speak with a manager or security that I have been waiting for for more than three hours. And hour later security arrived started his preliminary investigation and eventually the manager would arrive and I told them exactly what happened and what the housekeeping about it we said about replacing the product and all they had to say was that they will continue their investigation and promised that they would call me back. It's been more than two weeks since I checked out of this hotel I was given four different numbers to call and not one of them has called me back I have a notebook full of names and numbers but yet no one has even bothered to respect any of the things that you said and promised. While I was checking out the hotel attendant all he said was this usually doesn't happen here. When I explain to him what happened he says don't worry someone will call you back. Like most people I like to go to good places I spend my money of places that have some kind of value and reputation many times you don't know the value of a place until you actually are faced with a situation where they have to show their character. I am not sure if they will fail you but they have definitely felt me and I will think twice before recommending this place to anyone before I recommend another place. I'm sorry I was not someone that Deserved to be treated as a guest and perhaps security measures will be improved for other guests I'm sorry for the long message, but this have really left a very disappointing feeling inside of me.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Me and my husband stayed here for 5 nights. The hotel is lovely from the lobby to the rooms! All really smart and clean.We was checked in nice and quickly the sooner we arrived no queue which was great after a long day of travelling.The room was gorgeous and spacious, the bed was huge and very comfortable with pillows your head sinks into.We was very lucky to have a room with a view of the Empire State Building too which was an added bonus! We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant so can't comment on the food. Will defiantly stay here again when we return to NYC!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Spectacular views, very friendly staff, good quality free wifi, clean well-specced rooms, 10/15 minutes walk to the heart of the action in Manhattan, no wait for the lifts, good (but noisy) air con.No criticism of the hotel itself other than...My only comment would be that I travelled with my 3 teenagers and booked a room with 2 double beds. The beds are not double beds however! I am not sure if beds are a different size in the US, but they were between a single and a double. I knew it would be tight with the 4 of us sharing a room but the beds were just too small. I rang down to reception and was offered an upgrade to a 2 bedroom suite for an extra 150 dollars a night, or some duvets and pillows to make up a bed on the floor. I discussed it with the kids and we decided to make do, and whilst it wasn't a massive problem because we didn't spend a lot of time in the room, it did grieve me that I had travelled all that way and spent all that money for one of my kids to sleep on the floor. I had done my research very thoroughly before I went, but had never seen it mentioned anywhere that the beds were small. I may have had the same issue at any NY hotel, I don't really know, but it is worth being aware of if you intend to share a double bed!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great historic setting with multiple views, ideal for getting quickly in and out of Manhattan, easy access to all major attractions, fast elevator, good amenities and services, great cleaning staff, indoor roof tennis court !

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Once we arrived after a 8 hour flight, we were able to check in straight away, however we were abit early so couldn't access our room until 3pm. They held our luggage and we went off exploring the sites. When we returned and received our room keys, we were directed to which floor we were on, being surprised we were put on 37th floor! When we got to our room, we were facing the east river but being so high you could see for miles. I cannot comment on the food at the hotel as we ate out every evening, but the house keeping was impeccable; would come back from a day of adventures to a clean room and nicely made beds. The staff were always polite and always there if there was a problem.If I returned to this part of the world, I would definitely return back to this hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Beyond the beautiful hotel, room, elevators and lobby, the hotel staff was amazing! We stayed on the 38rh floor, and an elevator was always waiting in the lobby for us which was helpful! The staff were all soo nice, helpful and a pleasure to talk to! From bellman, to front desk, housekeeping and room service! I can't gave enough about our stay!!!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: After waiting in line to be checked in, Nicole Williams greeted me with a big smile, welcomed me and thanked me for my patience. Nicole went out of her way to make sure i was satisfied with the stay and that I was happy with my rooms view. She provided guidance and directions when needed, she was always available with a big smile on her face. Definitely made me feel welcomed and LOVED MY ROOM location and view. First time in NYC and it couldn't have been any better than this experience.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This is a great hotel located centrally and with easy access to all parts of the city. The reception staff can be frosty but the rooms are large, clean and comfortable, with added extras like a coffee maker and bathrobe. The views are undoubtably the best part of staying at this hotel. Having the Chrysler building as your nightlight is an experience not to be missed.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel is amazing because of the night few from my room. But the most important is near from UN HQ. So, if you plant for meeting in UN HQ. Would be better if you stay here because you just need to take 5 minutes to go there

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I had not previously stayed here but was scheduled here for a summer meeting. The city was hot, crowded and well..NYC.....The hotel was a great retreat at the end of the day. Nice views from the higher floor room and clean room with quality furnishings. Quiet, peaceful and the staff was very friendly. Efficient check-in and check-out.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel is in an excellent location and the staff were friendly. That's the only positive feedback I can provide. I requested a room by others in my party and received a complementary upgrade to accommodate my request. While this was appreciated, the room was a disaster. There was a huge stain on the carpet and stains all over the curtains. They were also ripped at the top. There were nasty gouge marks in the shower, too. There was also a mild vibration in the room. It couldn't be felt from the bed, but could while standing up. (It was enough to shake the TV on the wall.) I'm assuming it was from the air conditioning from the room above or below me. I should have requested a new room, but didn't. I did mention all of this during checkout and received a wince and an apology. I hope other rooms in this hotel are not as awful as this one was. I, however, won't be staying here again. By the way, neither me nor others in my party could figure out how to make the regular shower work. We could only get water to come out of the hand-held shower head. If multiple people in multiple rooms had this same problem, the showers either don't work or are overly complicated. Housekeeping also entered my room even with the do not disturb sign on the door. I had moved the box of tissues from the bathroom to beside the bed. I eventually noticed a new box had been placed in the bathroom.
user_name:
KTMVA
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The doorman on this hotel was extremely welcoming and helpful! This hotel felt like a treat away from the hustle and bustle of New York City. The location, though a little outside of the main city, was still walking distance towards most amenities. I loved the view from the room and the bathroom / bed was extremely well kept and comfortable. Check out was at 12pm and I noticed cleaning staff knocking three times before this, which is my only complaint.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Excellent location. Great Views.Generous, clean and classy rooms. Comfy beds. Friendly and accommodating bell staff and doormen. Somehow, an inflexible front desk staff.Poor internet connectivity. Very disappointing.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The front desk staff are very friendly and try by all means to make the stay as pleasant as possible! Lovely room with lovely views. The room service staff was great as well. Unfortunately housekeeping ruined it all. After two days of having to contend with a dirty bathtub I eventually had to complain. The next day housekeeping just decided not to touch my room at all - Customer Service maturity of a half a star hotel I see. Well, message received, will not be staying here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel is great in appearance, location and service. Everyone was very nice. The hotel is well kept with an amazing view of the East River and a skyline view! I love the aesthetic of this hotel with all the mirrors! Walking distance to Grand Central/subway.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We drove up late Virginia that Friday night at the hotel, and was really tired. The reception at the front desk, Justin check usIn very quickly as he probably figure we were very tired and wanted to go to bed. He let my husband and I know a quick run down on everything, and wish my husband a happy birthday and a gave us a reallyNice and beautiful room. OMG The VIEW. We were sold, thank you so much Justin. My husband was so happy and we will be back again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Excellent hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Staying for work trip but staff couldn't have been friendlier. Location is okay but amenities nearby have improved over my last stay 2 years ago. Good food emporium opposite which is good for coffee and snacks.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We had a pleasant stay here, the hotel staff are very friendly and the rooms are very new, modern and clean! The location is ok we had to walk and get the subway to most places as it isn't very central but that was fine there's a few diners and restaurants within walking distance. The only negative we have is that they didn't put a note on our account that we had pre paid with Expedia and I was charged random amounts of about 100-200 dollars on my credit card every day and when I called to ask about it all I got was some vague response from the woman on reception saying "hopefully it will go back on our system is kinda crazy"

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed here for one night. It is in a great location. We walked everywhere. We stayed in room 3641 and had a spectacular view of Long Island and Roosevelt island. The room was very clean and modern. I would have gave it five stars, but instead of paying $55 for parking, they charged me $79 and said my car was oversized. I drive a 2016 minivan, it fits in any spot that a Camry fits in. It's not a big truck or a suburban that is hard to park. That was really my only complaint.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Room was amazing with superb views of Manhattan, Very quiet and peaceful so very easy to sleep on a comfortable bed. Useful coffee shop in the Lobby with great service and friendly staff. Location was directly opposite UN building - we walked most of the time but was easy to get a taxi from here. My only negative is about the the gentleman whose job is was to sell tickets to Broadway shows (located in the lobby). He was very rude and dismissive towards us when we said we wanted to look at tickets. No eye contact or anything. Wasn't interested in us at all which made us feel pretty bad. So in the end we got tickets online so he lost our sale - he didn't even bother to suggest anything!Other negative is a female member of the reception team giggling at the pronunciation of my wife's name - it's south american. This came across as unprofessional and patronizing.But apart from this we enjoyed our stay at the hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Booked as part of a BA flights and hotel deal so didn't expect much as it was at a really good price. However this is probably one of the nicest hotels I've stayed in in NY. Nice location in the East side with fantastic views across the river. Well appointed rooms with fridges and coffee makers. Really nice bathroom with spacious closet. Then bed was super comfortable and the coffee shop downstairs had all you needed really from a light breakfast/snack requirement. Always felt safe and secure at all times due to the police presence outside the hotel (it is connected to the UN I believe)By tact we were in central manhattan for all of our meetings within 12 minutes via taxi or Uber.The staff were super friendly and gave us an extension in check out (2pm) free of charge. The Ambassador Bar and Grill do a nice breakfast if a little pricey @ $32 per head and the Margarita's are really tasty.Overall very happy and hope to return

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I have stayed in this hotel on a number of occasions now, my list list in 2015 really was not a nice experience as my review at the time showed.However now since the East tower has been refurbished i highly recommend this hotel. It is for me in a secure are being so close to UN. The room decor was just perfect and the a/c etc has all been updated. I will be back.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed here for two nights, what at an amazing view of East river and skyline of NY, whether at night or sunrise. Service is good and the room clean. Lots of place nearby to get breakfast and in the lobby you can get Illy coffee.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We had really bad experience in the One UN New York. The rooms are not very clean, there was mites in the floor. My children got really itching after they stayed on the floor.The parking service is terrible. It's very expensive $79 a night. When we checked out in the morning, the staff took long to get the car, and if it is passed the exact time, for example just 1 hours over, they will just charge you for two nights 2 x $79. I will never stay in the hotel again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Bought hotel stay on Priceline, didn't know what I was getting when bought , turned out to be a great deal, quiet area, a couple blocks to Grand Central station. Would stay here again. Walked to Empire State Building, and took subway to to other sights.We had a double room that was fine for 2 adults and 1 teenager, bathroom large.Exercise room large with lots of different equipment. Staff friendly and accommodating .

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I recently book an ADA accessible room with a roll-in shower and One UN Plaza did not deliver despite every reassurance given upon booking. On top of this the concierge staff was rude and offered no help and did not understand the difference between a shower and a tub. The unfortunate thing was that I paid for the room in advance. Couldn't shower for 5 days! Needless to say I will not be staying here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We arrived and there was a minor problem, the hotel had one night while the booking company that we prepaid had two nights. I had the prepaid reservation on my phone but the booking company, HotelsTonight was already on the phone with the hotel and immediately corrected the minor mixup. Both the hotel and HotelsTonight were fantastic!!!!! The hotel upgraded me without me even asking from a standard room to a suite. The rooms, the view, the location the staff were amazing. The stay was the best I ever had. I highly recommend One UN!!!!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Attended International conference earlier this year, that confined us to hotel catering all week. I can honestly say this was the worst food ever experienced in a reasonably priced 4 star hotel. "Shocking" would be inadequate, "memorable" would be appropriate but for all the wrong reasons.Other than that, a typical bland hotel, well located but never again if I had the choice !

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great location. Facing The UN headquarters. All Diplomatic Missions surround the hotel. Very fancy, has large areas for ballrooms. Great security but not bothering. Near Grand Central Station. I love this.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We didn't get to spend too much time in our hotel while in New York, but I'm glad we stayed at the One UN! The room was beautiful! We stayed on the 35th floor overlooking the East River. We had views of the river and even the Empire State Building!It wasn't the largest hotel room we ever stayed in, but it was very well thought out. The closet was a small walk in with a safe. There was a roomy chaise style couch by the window. It was a nice room to just relax in. They provided a small but fancy coffee maker with Illy Coffee pods. I'm a bit of a coffee snob, but for a pod the coffee was quite nice. I was able to get my first caffeine fix in the room before heading out to get more. Room service and linen service were both quick and responsive. When I called front desk about checking out, they gave me the option of getting my bill emailed so I didn't have to stop by the front office. They were also quick - she must have hit the send button before I even hung up. The hotel is close to a couple of great eateries we went to (Chelsea's Bagel Shop and The Smith). I highly recommend them both. Grand Central station is about a 10 minute walk away. I would love to stay there again when in New York.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I have contacted this hotel 3 times now and had Priceline contact them on my behalf. We booked this trip and now need to cancel for medical reasons. The hotel told Priceline they MIGHT consider canceling if we provide medical documents. Absolutely ridiculous. Those are private and during a difficult time you would think management would have some understanding. Our emails have been ignored and now we are paying for a hotel we can't stay at.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: An excellent hotel, very comfortable and clean with spacious rooms and superb views of Manhattan. It's about a 10 minute walk to Grand Central Station and there are always taxi's outside the hotel. Would highly recommend this hotel, it's great location is ideal for exploring the city.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Rooms are spacious with breathtaking views over Manhattan and the East River. Service is efficient and discreet. Only weakness: limited choice for breakfast (no cheese, no gluten-free bread, etc.). Also, for a hotel of this category, strange to have no swimming pool or even a jacuzzi.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: It's a great hotel. We upgraded our regular room to a 2 bedroom suite for only 170$.The view was fantastic and room very comfortable and very clean , beds are good .Suite had 2/2, and a living room.The front desk and bell desk are very nice too . They have little coffee place downstairs .

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: It is a good hotel but it is realy expensive. We've found a dicount and the hotel is pretty comfortable. Beds move a lot and pillows are not very good. Room is nice and has a beautiful view. Service is gentle and fast and is aisolated from the noise of the city.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed here for a week as part of a business trip. The hotel rooms were a good size, especially for NYC. The hotel gym was small but perfectly suitable. The coffee shop in the lobby is really good, perfect for a coffee before work!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed for one overnight recently. We were up on the 36th floor with a wonderful view of the UN and East River. Our room was nicely appointed, very clean and quite comfortable and quiet. It was fun to walk around the neighborhood and see the various embassies and even an African diplomat with his staff. Quite a departure from the Time Square area of town. We were fortunate to get a great rate which made our stay even more pleasant.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I was hesitant to stay at this hotel because in the past I had some issues with dirty rooms and air conditioner.The hotel went through some renovations.The room was really small and it was hard to walk in the small area, however the view of the river was fantastic. We just needed to walk one block from the hotel to take the bus.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel is decent but not what I expected from a 4 1/2 star rated hotel. The issue is that if you book through a 3rd party website, you won't be treated the same as other guests. They will give you the smallest and least updated rooms they have. I was given a tiny room with a very odd layout and a full/queen size bed, even though I very nicely requested at least a king size. The gentleman at the front desk was not friendly or helpful unfortunately. From the looks of it, the hotel could definitely use some updating.I will say that the other staff (bellman, doorman, etc.) were very kind and friendly.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Recently returned home from an amazing stay at this hotel. I booked this hotel mainly because of the reviews on the room views. I love NYC but i never stayed in a hotel before, always would stay by family.. however this time, my fiance and I pampered ourselves to a 4 night night stay and we have absolutely no regrets!We booked a corner suite and landed ourselves decently on the 31st floor.. from the time I walked in i was staring directly at the chrysler building and the empire state. to my left was another view of the hudson river and the world trade centre was in the distance :) ...i was so happy to go to sleep and rise to these fantastic picturesque view of the amazing concrete jungle of New York City! oh yeah! can't forget to mention the cool remote controlled toilets lolIn terms of service, we were fairly self sufficient..but the little we made use of was great. Sorry I did not record the names of the employees that stood out to me, but the gentleman that checked me in on arrival was efficient and chill, two of your bellmen i came in contact with were very helpful; one was jamaican I believe and being from the caribbean we connected lol. I also felt really secure at this hotel..there was a police dog just chilling by the entrance lol...i always wanted them to come check my bags just so i could try to pet them. cool dogs!amidst this great experience, we did have two minor complaints; 1. housekeeping kind of half cleaned our room each day; we came back on evenings to left over food containers (i was wondering if they didn't remove it as it wasn't bought from the hotel and maybe they weren't sure if they were full containers) 2. we received a call from a telemarketing company (not from ONE UN) on our last day trying to sell us some product/service - not the place to be sold stuff when on vacation, especially when it had nothing to do with the property we stayed it. all in all...great location! entire property felt nice and new and modern. thanks ONE UN!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed at ONE UN for a week in June, the location is great and next to the East River. Near all attractions and Grand Central Terminal. Our room was located on the 37th floor with a fab view of the Queensborough Bridge, Roosevelt Island and the East River. We did not eat in the hotel as the prices were quite high but lots of restaurants/bars/cafes are close by. Our room was a deluxe king and was a lovely size and well kept. The bathroom was beautifully tiled and well stocked with towels and soap etc. My only negative comment would be that I found the communal areas of the hotel quite dark in decor.Our only interaction with the hotel staff was at check-in and check-out and we found them to be friendly, helpful and courteous.Recommended and would stay again :)

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Arrived late at night June 27due to airlines delays (what's new about it), got quickly checked in and even upgraded . Received great costumer service by the reception (as well on check out) , security and all the staff. Room was cleaned very good and promptly. We'll come back.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I highly recommend this hotel if you stay in New York. It is in a very safe area and all the staff is very friendly, helpful and polite such as Justin at the front desk. The hotel rooms are very clean, modern and spacious. Everyone that I recommended to this hotel loves it.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I choose this hotel because of the proximity to the UN offices where most of my business meetings took place. I stayed in what I think was a renovated King Corner Room. The views were fantastic and the new Japanese toilet with remote control a very interesting and hygienic experience. Amenities were great: free wifi, complimentary coffee/tea facilities (illy coffee), laptop safe, mini fridge and big flatscreen tv with sufficient channels. Room was very clean and the bed slept wonderful. Housekeeping came to ask if I had everything what I needed, which is a rare service in most other hotels I have stayed in all over the world. Breakfast buffet is good with plenty of choices although expensive. You better go to one of the diners or take out places around 2nd Avenue. There is plenty of choice starting right opposite of hotel. What is nice though, the hotel has an illy coffee bar with simple sandwiches, bagels and the like for take out if you are in a rush. The room prices vary depending on the season and events that take place at the time of booking. This time was over 300$ a night while I have paid a bit over 200$ for a same room on another occasion. All in all, a very satisfactory stay and I would go back without hesitation.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I reserved two rooms for the weekend with the hotel, When I first got there the hotel was very nice the employees there very friendly. When I checked out my card was charged 250.00 for incidental which I was ok with its normal practice. I was told it will fall off in a few days. I waited three business days and still nothing. I called the hotel and was transferred to Mercedes I spoke with her and she told me to contact my bank because the refunded the money, I told her no they didn't and I was told she will look into it and call me back. A few days go by I call and speak to her again and she sounded like this was new to her. I kept calling for three and half weeks and was told the same thing to contact my bank. At this point I already told her I work for the bank and you haven't sent it. So I call and ask to speak to a manager I was put through to the voicemail and a day goes by no call back I call again ask for the manager I was put through to the voicemail with no call back. I sent emails I've been calling the hotel everyday for almost four weeks and today I finally got answer after staying on hold for 30 mins that they refunded the wrong card they funded another customers card. So now there will be another issue with another guest

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I had a booked a room with 2 double beds, as I was supposed to be visiting with a few friends for NYC Pride. Unfortunately, they bailed and it ended up being just me going down. The front desk was able to switch me to a Queen Room on the 33rd floor. The room was spacious and so clean and updated! The view was incredible. There was a huge screen tv. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've slept on. The bathroom was huge and so nice. The price was reasonable, and the location was very good, with no problem walking to most places I wanted to go. I definitely recommend this hotel, as I plan to stay here again the next time I'm in the city. Thank you One UN for a wonderful experience!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Overall, the hotel room was totally and clean for a quick work trip to NYC. That said, I do have a question for the hotel-- do you have policies about how people sit in the lobby chairs while waiting for their room to be ready? I arrived early and, as a result, had to wait about ~3 hours for my room to be ready. That's fine-- I was early and the hotel seemed busy with other people in a similar situation. I found an open chair across from an older gentleman who was happy to share the table. I proceeded to work on my laptop and take a few brief work calls. As the hours rolled on, I became increasing uncomfortable in the chair and slowly slouched over to the side. Out of nowhere, a male hotel employee approached me in a very harsh tone and told me I needed to sit a different way. I did not have my feet on the furniture and nothing was showing-- I was SHOCKED by the comment and by the frank disdain in his voice. He spoke to me like he would to a child. The man across from me was even shocked and voiced that I wasn't doing anything wrong. I firmly believe that he wouldn't have made a comment like that if I were a man. I don't like be spoken to like a child-- I'm an adult, professional woman who was a paying guest at the hotel waiting for my room to be ready. Frankly, it was offensive and no different from a guy on the street leering at me to give him a smile. Please have your employees do better.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I usually "shoot from the hip" in my reviews mainly because a review is supposed to give an accurate assessment of your experience and to help others to form there own dicision. I had done a lot of reading up on dozens of hotels in NYC and many had very mixed reviews and for me that would be a gamble I wasnt willing to take with a once in a lifetime holiday.That was the main reason I chose One UN, it seemed safe. And I'm so glad I did, in short, everything was not great, it was more than great. From the welcome by Racquelle at reception to the ever so helpful and friendly bell man Aisley. What a guy he is, you cannot help be like him instantlyThe room was large in comparison to many other New York hotels and was well equipped and clean. The view south was simply amazing, taking in the Empire State building, the Chrysler Tower, the New Trade centre tower and a few more besides. Just stunning.It's a few avenues from Grand Central Station and will take you about 15 minute to walk to. Loads of little bars and restaurants close by for breakfast, lunch and dinner.Would I stay there again? Absolutely and without question!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Went to New York for my wife's 50th birthday.we stayed in the one UN and what a lovely hotel , lovely room , spotlessly clean , very comfortable bed , big tv and said free wifi. Good size bathroom.Really good hotel

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I booked this place because of its location and on arriving I wasn't sure if the place had just opened as it was rough around the edges, to say the least.Positives:It's within minutes' walking distance to midtown/Grand Central.I had excellent customer service prior to visiting, and had received very polite correspondent by a gentleman in reservations. Concierge/other staff were very pleasantNegatives/Comedy of errors I'd requested a room with a bathtub, so when we arrived, we were told our room wasn't ready yet because of our "special request". We checked in two hours later and were given a room with a shower. We called down and they told us to come back to reception, with our luggage. We were then moved to a different room in a separate tower. We were told by the man escorting us to our room that this tower was better as it had the gym, spa and swimming pool on the roof.The new room had a bathtub, but no sheets on the bed(?) We were heading out for dinner, so just asked them to change the sheets on the way out. We also noticed that the wifi wasn't working.Getting back at 1am, they hadn't. So I tried to call down again to ask, but the phone didn't connect so I had to go down to ask and then waited about 45 minutes.I had a little bit of work to do the following day, but the internet still wasn't working. I asked at reception, and it appeared that the internet wasn't working anywhere but the foyer which was packed with guests and laptops.We decided to go for a swim, so went up to the pool. On walking in, I was hit in the head by a bare wire that was dangling from the ceiling. Having a quick look around, the pool was void of water but pretty full of debris. Clearly there was some construction work going on that was neither signed nor apparent to the staff. This 'spa area' was a claim waiting to happen. I wouldn't stay here again, as it wasn't exactly what we were looking for in a hotel, but the comedy value alone made our stay pretty enjoyable.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great hotel near grand central station end UN. I have been twice and I had the chance to get the first time a room with views to the Chrysler building. It was magical. Last time I got a room overlooking Long Island. Not as nice. So ask when booking to get your preferred view.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Not exactly at the center but not far either. All rooms have nice views of NYC (west) and Brooklyn (east). The strange thing is that the windows are relatively small for the views that this hotel has. Rooms are more spacious than we expected. In the same room category some of the rooms have walk in closets and a couch, while some have smaller windows and others top-down.We prefered west views through large windows sacrificing the extra space. Floor is not a great matter since all rooms are high enough. We had rooms on 34th and 40th floor and could not tell the difference.Their current condition is ok except from the old rooms doors and windows, that do not provide isolation. So you might have a problem with rooms near the elevators. Bathroom is nice and modern, with amenities. Wi-fi effective as anything in the room. Mattress is acceptable but could be better. Illy coffee machine and a fridge for own use was more than welcomed. (As iron and board)Staff is helpful and the reception did everything to please us.Breakfast is ridiculously expensive (50$ per person). Instead we had breakfast at the excellent nearby "Comfort Food" for a fraction of that.So One Un is about clean, functional and safe rooms with NYC views at a reasonable price. If you are looking for impressive receptions, restaurants, halls and upscale service look somewhere else.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Particular compliments to DINA at the Front Desk and to Stanley the Front Office Manager! Dina always greeted me in the evening and was really pleasant and eager to help! Both Dina and Stanley made my stay so easy and effortless also reservations was excellent in adding a third night to my stay... my room was immaculate with a view of NYC that was unparalleled....the Chrysler Building the Empire State building and all the magic that is NYC...cant wait to go back!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed for 5 days this week. Hard working staff to clean the rooms who were also very friendly & helpful. The desk staff were ok but not particularly helpful. Couldn't fault the guy who looked after our case after we checked out. He also got us a taxi to the airport quickly. The guys with the sniffer dogs were fab & the dogs were gorgeous! The room had great views. It was very comfortable with lovely bathroom facilities. Our tea & coffee was topped up daily apart from our 2nd day. Fresh towels daily too.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I have stayed at One UN several times work work travel over the last 3 months. Each stay has been better than the last. The hotel has gone out of its way to accommodate requests and give me a great stay, upgrade my room or make me a VIP. Every room has a great view and the hotel is quiet and comfortable and spacious - huge for NYC. The front desk staff have consistently been great. Very happy!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My boyfriend & I spent 7 nights at this hotel and had no problems with our stay.We originally had a double room on the west side facing the river, however we called reception to see if we could get a city view instead but no normal doubles on that side were available so instead we were given a corner room at the end of the west side without any problems...the views from the hotel were great!Both rooms were nice though the newly renovated west facing rooms are a little nicer as you'd expect!The hotel staff were quick to address any issues, such as the room change, requests for extra towels, etc however they're not very smiley at reception. The housekeeping staff we encountered were lovely and friendly though!No water in the rooms but there's a fridge in the room so you can just put drinks in there. Wifi worked fine for me except for the last day when I had poor connection for some reason.In terms of location, unlike some other reviewers we didn't think it was too far out from the tourist attractions at all. Grand central is about a 7 minute walk from the hotel and from there you can get a really short shuttle to times square or get a subway anywhere. If you want to walk to Times Square it takes about 20-25 mins.For breakfast, definitely visit Cafe Olympia on 2nd avenue, just a 2 minute walk from the hotel. Great selection of freshly made food & drinks!We agree with other reviewers that the hotel lacks character/doesn't have much liveliness but I suppose it's more of a business hotel and that wasn't an issue for us as we were always out anyway.Aircon was greatly appreciated in the boiling weather! Though the aircon was quite noisy so we couldn't sleep too well with it on.As at most hotels they ask for a card at check in to open an account on for any expenses to be charged to during your stay, what they didn't make clear which I only found out after enquiring/noticing a drop in my account is that they took a hold of £1,400 which is then supposedly returned on check out...though I am yet to get this money back to my account. I'm surprised they didn't mention this amount would be taken as a hold, because whilst it wasn't an issue for me, for others this could be an issue potentially putting some guests in their overdrafts for example.Overall we had a pleasant stay and would probably stay again if in the city.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed at the One UN because most of the proximity to the UN but I wasn't expecting it to be such a luxurious treat. My room was in the 32nd floor with views of mid town Manhattan and every day with the changing conditions showed a different side of this fabulous city. The service was excellent throughout my stay. Spacious room with fresh neutral decor and everything one would expect from a high quality hotel. Wifi was great, plenty of power points for devices, huge bed, good shower, expresso machine in room.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel has undertaken a huge refurbishment since my last visit and I can now say that I was truly delighted with our room. Tasteful, spacious and very comfortable. I would even sleep in the corridor!! Staff were courteous and very helpful. Also sleep quality good as its very quiet at night. Fabulous view from window.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Spent 2 night here in Nov. during the NYC marathon. We were upgraded to a junior suite and it was just lovely. The view was out over the harbor and the UN facility, we had an beautiful sitting room with a kitchenette. The bathroom was top notch as well. WE would highly recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again when we return for the marathon this Nov.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The room was very spacious and the views are amazing. Good quality hotel for business and couples. However, the service could be better. The hotel staff was generally rude and the room service menu had limited choices of vegetarian meals.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: As our first trip to New York we wanted somewhere special to stay and this hotel certainly didn't disappoint. Just 2 blocks from Grand Central station and 15 minutes stroll to Times Square it was handy for everything, but just slightly away from the main hubbub. Friendly local bars and near great retail for the ladies. Above all we were lucky enough to have a top floor room facing west to have all the iconic views - perfect. The staff were very friendly and helpful and facilities were top notch. The only item that kept us from giving a 5 star was the coffee/tea making machine, it was a nightmare and please milk with tea for the Brits, not creamer!!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I was looking to stay for a weekend at a hotel with a pool and ONE UN New York was at the top of the list with hotels with pools, so I booked two hotel rooms. We knew we had a hot weekend ahead of us and it was my son's 7th birthday and our first time staying in a hotel room together. When we arrived the receptionist was very bland to say the least, not as friendly as I would have hoped. Leading up to the day of I called twice two confirm my reservation as well as mentioned it was my son's birthday and it was his first stay in the city. When we arrived and asked for the rating of the hotel they told us they were once 3 stars but SINCE THEY GOT RID OF THE POOL!!!!- they were now 4 stars. I explained that the only reason I even booked the room was because of how it was advertised WITH THE POOL! She went on to tell me that they have nothing to do with how they were advertised on booking.com 1.No apology2.Horrible Attitude3.Said I could cancel ( I had my son and guest and luggage for two rooms, yeah ok??!)4.You do not get what you see in the images of the room, the rooms are not as spacious, but they are comfortable, but for the price they charge with no complimentary breakfast and false advertisement you are better of staying at a Marriott.5. Check in is at 3PM and you have to be out by 12, they conveniently store your luggage until your room is ready or after you have checked out for additional hours of luggage free traveling. This was the nicest thing about the hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Came here for work, at the UN. Got a really nice corner room with amazing views. Had great service at reception from just one person- a gentleman with great white glasses (sadly did not get his name). However all the other receptionists and porters were unhelpful and sometimes even rude. One porter asked me for a tip, when I had to bring by bag to him for storage. There needs to be either better training or better incentives for staff to actually be nice to the guests.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We booked a Deluxe King Corner bedroom, the view was beautiful. Out of one window Times Square, the Chrysler building and the Empire State Building, out the other Roosevelt island. The room was cleaned everyday. The hotel and cleaning staff were very friendly and approachable. Lovely stay, would definitely use again if I'm lucky enough to be able to visit the big Apple again!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Loved this hotel, centrally located in NYC not overly priced. Rooms were offered with a view of the city, beds were incredibly comfortable, and a nice shower as well. The coffee docks did not work at all. Staff on site was friendly, but concierge did not seem to be available at most times which was frustrating. Within walking distance to most locations in NYC. Loved it want to go back!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I spent a week at this hotel as I was attending a UN conference. The hotel is well known for its convenience to the UN, and many colleagues and associates frequent this hotel. It was my first time staying there, and I was shocked to discover upon coming back one evening that a few items had disappeared from my bedside table: a Mac laptop charger, my Kindle, and a book. The hotel staff have opened an enquiry and I do not for the moment know the outcome of that. This is the first time I have encountered theft from a hotel room on international travel, and it is extremely unpleasant and inconvenient, especially as I need to charge my laptop in order to do my work. I can say that while the hotel was fine in every other aspect - I do not intend to stay here again given the disconnect between the cost of the room and the hotel's inability to protect me against such theft.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I searched high and low for a reasonably priced hotel for our 5 night stay in NYC. One UN was perfect. The rooms were a great size, nice bathroom, views from most rooms, comfortable bed. I would highly recommend this hotel, pretty much walking distance to everything.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Comfortable, clean and - for its location in NY - not outrageously expensive. The beds are very comfortable and access to the hotel pool comes with the room rate. A great coffee dock near the lobby. Breakfast can be found any where in the neighbourhood on 2nd Avenue or on the adjoining streets. Very convenient for Grand Central

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We had the best room ever on the 38th floor, and the view was so awsome! The rooms were huge, with two double queen beds. The staff was also so helpful and kind. We would be happy to recommend this hotel to anyone! And tanks to Justin at the reseption, nice guy!:) Also this hotel, as the only one in NYC, offers an indoor tennis court! It also has a good fitness room.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great location and room with an incredible view. My husband and I stayed in a king corner room so we had a view over the water on one side and a view of the city (including the Empire State and Chrysler Buildings). We arrived to the property via public transport which was also quite easy. We were a little disappointed the hotel didn't acknowledge we had chosen to stay with them on our honeymoon at all, despite providing them with this information when we booked months in advance.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Hotel is fine. View is great. Location is good. But .... but.So, VERY IMPORTANT, Deluxe Double Room with Two Double Beds - means 2 beds that are ok for 2 kids, but not 2 adults. I went there to complain 5 minutes after I was in, and the lady at the reception didn't even wait for me, and she said those are the standard sizes. I asked how she knew I was going to ask that, and she said thats what everyone complains about. My wife and I had to share the beds with the kids. Every night on the 28 floor there's some strange noise for a few seconds with the pipes in the middle of the night, something like a pump getting recharged. I complained but all i was offered was "let us know when it happens", but by the time it happened it would be gone. I am not sure those beds are right for 2 adults.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel is located in mid town with great access to all the attractions with good public transport links and walking distance to most areas.The rooms are a large with all the facilities you would expect from a recent refurbished 4star. With magnificent views from the rooms.The staff are prompt in dealing with any needs.with a good on site restaurant and room service offer.I would return without hesitation.My only criticism would be a better pricing offer for breakfast as this is currently priced per item.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We were booked for two double rooms for Memorial weekend but at check-in it showed that for some days our rooms weren't available so they upgraded us to a King suite-- which had its pros and cons.Pros: Large space -- has living room and small dining area, 1.5 bathrooms, nice view of the East River (38th floor). King bed was very comfortable, rooms look like they were newly redecorated. Cons: we had 3 people in each room, so 2 people stayed on the king bed and the other in the sofa bed (which housekeeping comes and fixes for you). The sofa bed was not comfortable at all as you can feel the springs. It would be a better idea to just keep it as a couch. Also, there is only one king suite in each floor, so our group was separated floor wise.Location was not bad if you don't mind walking much, it's a ~15-20 min walk to Times Square and a 10 min walk to the closest subway station (Grand Central). UberX to Times Square cost $6-10, depending on time of day.Overall, it's a good place to stay (clean, quiet) but if you have more than 2 people in one room, avoid the sofa bed situation at all costs or you'll be left restless for your trip.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Part of the Millenium Group of hotels, ONE UN is convenietly located near the United Nations and various embassies. It's a good hotel if you have business in this area. As a tourist I'd recommend somewhere a bit closer to the action though.The room is perfectly fine for a 4 star hotel. It’s spacious, clean with a nice bathroom and all the amenities are there. They did, however, forget to refill the coffee capsules in my room on the second day. But this is a minor complaint. I particularly enjoyed the fact that the rooms are quiet – not always a given with NYC hotels. Apart from the last morning of my stay - where they decided to start drilling at 7AM somewhere nearby, which completely ruined the only day I could have a bit of a sleep in. I find this unacceptable for a hotel of such standard and after bringing it up with a receptionist later on, there was nothing they could do apart from giving me the Front Office Manager’s business card. I believed they could have handled this issue differently. Considering this and the high nightly rate paid, I can only give it 3 stars.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed for 2017 New Years, very much walkable to time square, great rooms, we had 2, a corner double aspect view and a standard double, very clean Nd comfortable. By New York standards a really good size and value.We used the coffee guy parked on the street for our morning coffee and pastries, lovely guy and great value.Easy to use metro and taxis to get to anywhere in Manhantten.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Booked two double rooms paid same rate and one was quite obviously better than the other, had a long flight and unpacked and were only there for 4 nights so could not be bothered to complain and then have to move. Our daughters room was lovely, much bigger than ours and quite obviously the deluxe double we'd paid for, ours was a standard double, much smaller and a bit tatty, bed sloped down on my side and was a bit weird to sleep in, ironing board stood up in corner of room was attractive!!! I think it depends what you are staying for on what your view of this hotel would be, business and sightseeing up around midtown area is fine but if most of what you want to see and do is downtown or Brooklyn way - not the best. View of Empire State and Chrysler Building is lovely especially at night. Unlike other guests we had no problem with the Wifi. Security good, sniffer dog stationed at doors at all times, desk staff friendly and rooms cleaned really well. Lobby a bit dated. Did not like being ushered out of the way of of the hotel entrance one morning as they were expecting 'VIP's'!!!! Quite rude!!! There are polite ways of doing these things!!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Good location,clean room,Nice staff,Dog sitting near the entrance, Beautiful views,The window does not open,I was there in august in 2016, I recomend this hotel ,I spend a good time there and would like to come back

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I read a lot of disappointed reviews regarding the hotel , HOWEVER my experience is different... fast check in , helpful stuff , the room is big .. Yeah there no complementary water but it not a big deal ...

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I got this place through a Priceline deal and was very pleased with it. It's on a quieter street, but within a couple blocks of the hustle and bustle of East Midtown and lots of restaurants/shopping. The hotel rooms start on floor 28, so every one has a great view. The lobby is gorgeous, and was also quiet and relaxing. The room was clean, very large, and had a great bathroom, coffee machine, and fridge. Couldn't have asked for more.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great stay. Rooms were very good, housekeeping was excellent. Our rooms (34th floor) had a great view. When we booked the hotel, the rate was lower than other hotels in the area, making us apprehensive about the quality. We have stayed in other hotels in this same neighborhood before. This hotel was much better than others we have stayed in, at a better rate. Would definitely recommend it. Rooms were spacious compared to others in the area. Only negative is that the "free" wifi is terrible, so you really have to pay for it if you want wifi, but the rate is relatively low.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I booked this hotel through Priceline so you really never know what you are going to get until you arrive. The staff was friendly. We checked in around 8 pm on a Saturday night and had room 3514. The view of the East River was amazing!! The room was very large compared to most that I have stayed at in the New York City area. Bed and pillows were comfortable and everything was really clean. The only downfall of the room was that the tub drained slowly. Everything else was great! Definitely will stay here again!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We have stayed at this hotel 3 times now, great hotel and positioned perfectly for us! Close walk to everything you need. They have just done up the bar and Resturant, whilst it's all very nice we thought the pricing for drinks was very expensive! Again the 1 meal we had was lovely, but again over priced. Such a shame as we stayed when the old bar was open and it wasn't anywhere as much to drink in the bar. Shame as I think if it was priced a bit more competitive then it would be full.One other complaint was when claire went to "vape" outside the hotel, but bell boy insisted she crossed the road! Bearing in mind we saw people smoking outside all of 30 minutes beforehand this seemed ridiculous and I didn't like the fact the staff were happy for her to wander off to vape!! So I went and joined.Must stress this was an isolated issue, we have never had a problem here and really like the hotel in the whole! Try get a room up high the views are amazing!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Highest Floor Facing the Chrysler Building and Empire State Building and amazing views of the city! Great hotel and service! Lovely waking and drinking my coffee with this view! Views were Epic! Nice Large room with large bathroom!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Amazing hotel with nice view of the city (Chrysler tower and Empire State are the main buildings to be seen). I was in 31the floor whereas all rooms are between 29th and 40th floor. The rooms are very nicely made, enough space for enjoying the view.:)

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This is my first stay here and I'm quite impressed. My number one criterion is quiet and a good night's sleep and One UN fits the bill. The rooms are on the large size for New York and well appointed. There are plenty of dining options within walking distance as well as the market at Grand Central. All in all, very pleasant.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This is a quiet, comfortable hotel in an elegant location. The rooms are good sized, clean, nicely furnished and most have great views. It is basically across the street from the United Nations. Although the neighborhood itself is not very lively, it is a short walk to some good restaurants on second avenue and an easy walk to the Museum of Modern Art. Lots of interesting well dressed people (presumably diplomats) speaking a variety of languages. I very much enjoyed the experience.The dining room is still a work in progress; nice ambience, elegant settings but the food is unimaginative and often cold. The lobby is small, quiet and frequently empty. The WiFi in my room was sluggish but the TV was good.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed here for our anniversary and I have to say, it was very clean, room was pretty big, nice lobby. Only complaint was we only had one towel(no biggie) and when I booked I saw a pic of a pool.....pool unfortunately doesn't exist anymore:(

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We were promptly greeted by the registration staff upon our arrival in the lobby. Avery upgraded our room to a two-bedroom, two bath suite on the 37th floor. The suite was spacious and the view was spectacular. The beds were very comfortable and the bathrooms were large. I wished we had time to stay more than one night. The area around the UN was very quiet on the weekend we stayed. We will be back at One UN again. Thanks again Avery!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Expecting Manhattan hotel rooms to be pokey sized, i was so pleasantly surprised by the big and comfy size of the rooms in this hotel. A big sized bed, nice big bathroom, separate seating area, roomy wardrobe. And located in a very nice part if town, just opposite the UN building with most rooms overlooking the water expanse of the Hudson river. For most of my stay there was just me and my wife, but later we were also joined for 2 nights by our son (an adult 22 years). The room was big enough to accomadate him, but when we mentioned this to the front desk they went out of their way to shift us to another room on the same floor, which had an additional sofa and they gave us enough extra pillows and blankets to make him very comfy. Well done.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Just returned from a 4 night break staying at Hotel One UN in New York with my husband, it was my first time to the States and this hotel made our stay incredible!!The hotel is situated on East 44th Street between 1st and 2nd Avenue and close to Grand Central Station, a good location for walking to the famous sights such as Empire State, Chrysler Building, Central Park, The Rockefeller, Times Square and the famous 5th Avenue and all the wonderful shopping to be had there! 9/11 Memorial museum and The Freedom Tower is a must, extremely poignant, but from the hotel quite a walk so take the subway.So with all this walking what better to come back to than a fantastically comfortable hotel room for a rest and exquisite views of NYC from our bedroom window!We stayed on the 32nd floor, the room was a deluxe room so it was big as was the bed with the most comfortable pillows. 2 chaise lounges, desk and large leather armchair, plenty of storage/hangers for clothes/shoes. There is also a safe in the room. Ironing board and iron too.Bathroom was gorgeous, lovely and clean, with really big walk in shower (no bath) hairdryer, robe and magnifying mirror (which I mention as not all bathrooms have them so I always take my own.)Fridge and coffee machine but sadly no kettle.Room service daily, even if we didn't request it which I really liked. So now the best bit of all, the views, the best bit about New York is obviously the views and we had panoramic views from our bedroom, it was breath taking! On our first night we crashed out only to wake at midnight and see the skyline lit up, it was incredible.The hotel staff were friendly and helpful from thereceptionists to the bellboys. Security are present at the main entrance with their sniffer dogs and check your luggage which gave me a sense of security. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to the city.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Just stayed at One UN for the first time. We went to NY for a theatre weekend with friends from the west coast. Enjoyed being on the east side, away from the madness of Times Sq but within a short walk to a Grand Central or a longer walk to the theatres. Also lots of great restaurants nearby. We had great views of the city and East River. Room was clean, modern and spacious by NY standards.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Visited here with my wife for a long weekend. Got a corner room, fantastic views.Luxurious room, great bar downstairs, friendly staff and a great location about 10 minutes walk from Grand Central.Highly recommend for romantic or business stay

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: So I would of loved to have given this a 5 rating at excellent, however a few things have let this down, and some factors disappointed me .The hotel itself was lovely, and the room was modern, clean, big ( had a deluxe corner) and the bed was amazing, so comfortable . I was impressed with the room, couldn't ask for anymore . However this hotel has very poor customer service, and rude staff at the desk. My husband and I stayed in New York for our 1st Wedding anniversary and this was special for us , I emailed the Hotel explaining this and asking for a wine menu in advance so I could order a bottle of champagne , no reply, I also had a query ref the online booking as something wasn't right, so I ended up sending two emails, contacting them on Facebook- no reply, so had to call in the end to solve the query I had about the room, When we got there there was no acknowledgement that it was our anniversary , I also found out that my sister wanted to plan something special for us, and she tried to contact the hotel with no success and no replies either very disappointing . The male on the desk when we checked in was helpful, but the women were rude, mostly on there personal mobile phones and when I asked a question they were not interested. there were no robes or slippers in our room on arrival which they should have been so I had to request these, the coffee facility was not replenished with new coffee etc The room had a fridge , and safe which I liked, and great views, the bellman, people that handle luggage where very helpful, polite and welcoming . The Hotel is to the east of Manhattan, we walked to most places, and this was fine, I liked the location as it was quite and out of the hustle and bustle . Needs to improve customer service ...

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The ONE New York Hotel was great. The rooms were clean, the staff were friendly. The view was amazing. I believe we had the top most part of the hotel. I would say if any cons is that the beds were kindof small to be considered a double room but made the best out of it. If you are planning to see major things such as Times Square or the Empire State Building the walk is a little far but I still enjoyed the city experience. I would definitely book with them again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: So many cons!! First of all I booked this hotel at the end of March. Something went wrong with the hotel reservation and 2 rooms were booked. I called to see what was going on. The receptionist made changed to one instead of two rooms. I was told I won't get charge for two. I got charged for two rooms on my card. And I called almost everyday for 3 weeks. Left messages and no return calls and when I did speak to someone, no one can help me besides accounting. I keep leaving messages and no return call. Now it's aprol 20th, time to check in and the reservation manager said she solved the situation and it's going to get fixed. She was nice but it's been 5 days after my stay and no refund yet. It's my birthday weekend and I just want to enjoy my trip. On my last day I got charge $150 on my card.Of course I am already upset. I called the hotel; they said it's a deposit but why am I getting charged on my last day of stay. He said i would get refunded once everything clears. When I checked in they did not tell me I would get charged. I was only told my card would be on file if any damages or services occurs. With my stay the room was nice but I found some trash under my bathroom sink and my room service did not restock my coffee or tea supply. Another con was that I didn't know how go use the Wi-Fi.I do not recommend this hotel go anyone. I did not appreciate the search dog (though I understand the reason).

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This is a great hotel and quite well placed in the city. Its right next to the UN building and has a diplomatic feel as a result. The room I was in, 3527 was huge. Well appointed and stylish. The view was perfect of lower Manhattan.Free WIFI with a $10 charge for faster wifi?? Didn't really see the point in that but the access I had was suitable for my needs. The lobby is stunning and has sniffer dog security. Given the location I wasn't surprised by this and it was nice to see a retriever working every morning! Staff at the front and bell desk were excellent and couldn't do enough.Free coffee in the rooms and a large widescreen tv. The bathroom is well appointed although the shower is in the bath which I thought was strange for a hotel at this level. Iron and board, large laptop digital safe and wardrobe area. Blackout blinds and nets around whole room. AIRCON/Heating in every room.All the usual services are available and there is a coffee/pastry type shop in the lobby. Al in all a great hotel. WE had our room serviced and on one of the occasions our coffee cups weren't replaced or the coffee pods and on arrival our bathroom had no robes and few towels. On the booking the receipt stated the room was for a one person occupancy and I have seen various reports of this when people book for couples. This is common and will not cause you an issue when you turn up as a couple. It just seems to be the way they book the rooms out.I would absolutely stay here again. Just a few tweaks required on the servicing team for the rooms. All in all a great hotel and worth consideration if you are visiting.PS the current taxi fare from JFK is $70ish. Uber is cheaper by about ten dollars but if you can, share an uber from the airport with someone else going to Manhattan. They will drop off on route to the final destination. May charge slightly more for this but will be cheaper individually. Get the app!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We recently stayed at the One UN New York and we definitely enjoyed our time there. The view is amazing and the staff is very friendly. At the check in we were informed that no payment online was made although when I made the payment on the website the summary said that the payment was made. We highly recommend to the hotel to review its reservation system because I have read other review and It has happened before and it is very uncomfortable when you get there and it turns out that the payment was not made. I couldn't choose to pay for the breakfast at the website, and we thought it was included. So if you reserved this hotel be aware that there is an extra fee for breakfast even if the site doesn't get you the option. The room was very good and clean with and spectacular view although the mini bar wasn't connected to the outlet and didn't work :)

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed here for our anniversary and from the first minute we arrived were treated like royalty. Gave us an upgrade to a corner room which had the most amazing view. Also on arrival bottle of wine and chocolates delivered welcoming us. Rooms were cleaned amazingly every day (apart from used cups being taken away) I would highly recommend this hotel just for the views alone. Location was Good 5 min walk to Grand central for the subway and 2min walk to bars and shops on 2nd Ave. Really great hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: 10 Emails, no response in 5 month! Unaccebtable behaviour from a hotel in that category! None existing customer care! The permitted credit voucher over 600€ never reached us! We would absolutly not recommend that hotel! Unfortunately very disappointed!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I booked the hotel based on all the comments about the view so I arrived with big expectations and wasn't disappointed at all, it was just amazing, I didn't want to sleep just keep starring at my window. I was traveling by myself so I looked for a safe location, being next to the UN gives it a lot of surveillance but that side doesn't have a lot of traffic at night so I wouldn't recommend walking late.
