My only comment is that the lobby looks a little bit outdated, kind of 90's. Other than that was perfect staff, room space, view and cleanliness.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I stayed here for four nights as part of a conference, and was quite underwhelmed. Although the rooms in the East tower are recently renovated to a high standard, the rest of the hotel is outdated and gloomy. This hotel does not compete well as a business hotel: the wifi was hopeless (you have to log back in every time that you have gone out of range), the conference food was very average, my TV was faulty, the minibar was empty, and unless you are visiting the agencies around the UN, which is right next door, it is not a very interesting part of New York. The main attraction of this hotel is the competitive room price. But $39 for breakfast? Please.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed here for three nights and then returned later in the week for a further 2. I travelled with my 8 year old son. We arrived from the airport to the hotel and was greeted by security and sniffer dog to check out luggage. Very friendly staff. We were too early to check in and left our bags for free and went for a short walk to grab a bite to eat before we could check in at 3pm. When we got to our room on the 38th floor.... WOW! Our view was the city and clear view of Chrysler Building and Emoire State! This was even better at night!Room overall was great, very clean and beds made everyday. Would recommend staying here.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Very comfortable room, helpful and friendly staff, excellent location for sightseeing, fantastic views from superior room.Bar was dreary and pricey - breakfast was also expensive - we didn't eat or drink in at all.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Been a while since last here as the rooms were tired and generally a bit sad. Nice to report much better new decor refitted bathrooms. Decent coffee in the cafe. The guys on the concierge desk v helpful.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We drove in at 1am and even late at night, the service was flawless. The valet appeared immediately to take the car, the woman at reception quickly gave us a room (and an upgrade) and we were happy to be within a block of the U.N. for a meeting later that morning. Loved the shower, the toiletries and the view of the water from the gym. We checked out at 10am, but left our luggage with the bellhop and the car parked until 11pm. The staff made everything easy for us.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This is a nice hotel on the east side but really, it's all about the views. To the south, you have bridges and river, to the west, the Chrysler and Empire State. Ask for a room on a high floor and you won't be disappointed. The view was what made the trip special. Room was a nice size and staff especially Eric was helpful.
user_name:
MaxxSteele
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Had a great stay here for 6 nights. We stayed in a deluxe king room and the bed was huge! The room was also big which is a big plus for NYC. The view of manhattan was unbelievable! (we were on the 37th floor). We didn't need to visit the Empire State. All in all a great hotel. Great service by staff. Only drawback is that it lacks a bit of ambiance as it is probably all business travellers for the UN.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great Location, Great Bell Service - Not so polite at the front desk reception. Our room had a great view - East Rive Skyline and Lower Manhattan are very picturesque.Room was smaller than I remember, they have made them look crowed with furniture that does not appear to be a good fit. Elevators were hard to come by when they were busy. We were on the 38th floorCoffee shop/ take out food in the lobby was adequate for a snack, the gentlemen was very polite and helpful. If it is all about location, this is a great spot.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This is a lovely hotel, with excellent service, but really, it's all about the views. To the south, you have bridges and river, to the west, the Chrysler and Empire State. Ask for a room on a high floor and you won't be disappointed.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Wonderful location, beautiful view, only 10 min walk to Grand Central to catch the subway to any where. Helpful staff and always had a smile on their face. Coffee shop was a life saver and inexpensive for NY. The maid service was wonderful! The room very neat and clean. Will stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This was our first time visiting the One Un Plaza in New York and I can say that first impressions were good. The staff at reception were reasonably helpful and the bell desk couldn't have been friendlier and took our bags until our 3pm check in. The room was of an acceptable standard, it was clean but basic. The views however were great. There were slight issues with the room, such as there was only one robe between two of us and the robe got taken away half during our stay and not replaced along with our bathroom glasses and also the bathroom accessories (cotton wool, cotton buds etc) which were stored in a little glass jar. The windows could have had a good clean too. When we left the hotel we were advised by the reception desk that no charges were made during our stay, only to find out on our way home that $40 has been charged, with no communication as to what this payment is for, no prior warning just the hotel deciding to take payment for something that hasn't been advised, which I find very disconcerting and unacceptable. All in all, it was a very mediocre hotel to stay in and definitely not worthy of the money you pay over, especially when the hotel decides to take additional payments that haven't been communicated to you beforehand.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Good location, very easy to walk into the centre of NY. Fantastic views. Very clean. Helpful staff; though check-in was a bit slow, I needed to asked for a few items that were missing in the room and they sent them up immediately. One thing: double beds are a bit on the small side so the family room option was not great for a family of four with slightly older kids.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Me and my family with young kids just spent 4 night and we were very pleased about the hotel, the service, location and view. The price was a fantastic one as we booked far in advance. The view from the windows was astonishing, from One Freedom Tower through the Empire till the Chrysler. Just 10m walk from Central Station. Definitely recommended

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My 4th time here....and i have always written such glowing reviews of this hotel. But this time something fell flat. First of all, we booked the studio room with two queen beds as i travelled with my 2 children both above 10. For the first time since the renovations we stayed in the east tower, i guess i wasnt as impressed with this side of the hotel. The room was way too small for us, they were much smaller than the west rooms in my opinion. The beds were not 2 double beds, more like 31/2 beds. Breakfast is overpriced at $32 per person plux tax and service charge. On the other hand, the newly renovated rooms were very beautiful and clean; the concierge very friendly and eager to help. The fitness center is just a couple of machines that is obviously too small for this size of hotel, but if you go early enough, you can beat the traffic.Overall very good hotel, great views, good area and the security is as great as always. Remains our first choice in NYC but wont be booking the studio room when traveling with the kids

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Beautiful hotel, right in the heart of Manhattan - with great views of the city to boot. That said, attention to small details lacking and annoyingly an attempt to cut corners price-wise - i.e. No bottled water in the rooms, no actual milk for the very nice coffee brewer available (powdered creamer anyone?) and no refilling of shampoo/conditioner/body wash when empty. Also, coffee mugs were never taken away and cleaned after the initial morning of "dear lord, please let that white powder be chalk not creamer" ordeal. If this sounds like camping to you, find somewhere else, if not, then a perfectly acceptable spot to spend a few days exploring a city that rightfully throngs with energy, vibrancy and edge.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This was our first time in New York and found the hotel to be everything we needed. We were given a room on the 38th floor and the views were amazing over the Hudson river. The hotel is around a 10 minute walk to Grand Central station which is handy for the subway lines. Another 10-15 walk will take you to times square. We found the hotel good value for money - our room looked newly decorated and was clean.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed on the 39th floor in a very spacious suite with window views of the East River. From the moment I stepped into our room I was pleased. It was beautiful and clean with an open concept shower (also containing both both a handheld and fixed shower-head, and bath robes). The bed was large and extremely comfortable with very soft pillows (which didn't go flat) making for a comfortable night's rest or simply just lounging around.We didn't make use of the tennis court (also located on the 39th floor) or the cafe.This hotel is away from the hustle and bustle of the city. A 10 minute walk should get you to Grand Central. Add an extra 10 minutes for Times Square and Fifth Ave. While this area is more business focused there are small restaurants and buffets, a Duane Reade, Dunkin Donuts, Five Guys, Shake Shack (which I recommend for fast food) etc. and of course the United Nations headquarters, which you can tour, in the vicinity.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Second time in New York but first time in this hotel. The hotel was lovely with excellent views and a pretty good location. We didn't mind it not being right in the centre of Manhattan as we like walking around when we go away. The concierges were really friendly and helpful. Front desk staff were nice enough. Housekeeping was so-so. The room was clean but we stayed for 4 nights and the cups and coffee making facilities were only replenished once after the first night. A bit disappointing given the hotel's rating and the price of the rooms. Unfortunately, our stay ended on a very bitter note due to a truly unpleasant member of staff. As we were collecting our luggage to head to the airport, a dog sniffed at my leg and, being dog owners and thinking nothing of it, my partner and I stroked its head. The man - in plain clothes- stood with this dog then snarled 'you should have asked'. We then after some confusion and somebody else explaining it to us realised that it was a working dog trained to sniff out explosives. The dog nor the handler were wearing anything that identified him as security or the dog as a working dog, as we normally would in the UK so it was clear to see it was an honest mistake and we apologised immediately for not having realised. Where we're from its not unusual for dogs to be in pubs and hotels. However, this was not sufficient for this member of staff. This member of staff decided not to accept our apology and started shaking his head and verbally abusing us by loudly and aggressively snapping (swear words omitted to get past filtering) 'are you ------- kidding me?' 'Are you ------- serious?' and 'jesus ------- christ'. We were so embarrassed. I know that security, particularly in the US, is taken very seriously but this man was disgusting. It was an honest and not at all serious mistake in the scheme of things but this man treated us with utter contempt. A simple explanation was all that was required but we instead received abuse. Had we not had a plane to catch I'd have taken this up with somebody there and then, but instead I wrote an email from the taxi. This was 4 weeks ago and the hotel has not responded. As a result I think we would feel uncomfortable returning.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My organization's travel manager managed to book me in here while I was due to attend meeting in the UN building, which is right across the street, so for me it was a very convenient location. I had at first booked a cheaper place on 51st, but a deal came up for ONE at $185 a night, which was great value, especially as it included breakfast. It's part of the Rennaissance/Marriott group, so the rooms are big and well equipped- coffee maker, bath-robe, iron etc. The hotel rooms are on the high floors,which gives you a great view, well worth the slightly longer elevator ride for me. There's a lounge which serves a contintental breakfast on the 30th floor, but this seems to be Club members access only, the regular breakfast is in the dining room on the ground floor, no view but a bigger breakfast. The 10minute walk to Grand Central, and 20-30 to Times Square and the theatre district was no problem forme, I need to stretch my legs after a day of meetings.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel was tucked away in a quieter part of Manhattan, near the UN. However, it was still provided easy access to multiple subway lines. The lobby was small, but nice. At the time, there was some remodeling work done in parts of the lobby, so not everything was accessible. The room was good sized, clean, and comfortable. The restroom was decent sized, as well. Overall a solid choice for either business or leisure travel!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: After a very poor check in experience with a sour-faced receptionist (opening phrase "I'll need to see your ID and take your credit card", no smile and literally no conversation beyond functional check in information - could be an off day, or it could be as they are more used to business travellers), our room and all other staff we encountered more than made up for this lack of customer service, indeed, lack of basic human communication skills. By contrast, all other staff were very friendly and funny, and housekeeping were prompt when we needed to borrow a kettle. Our room (west tower 30th floor) was a great size and had fantastic views, although the air con was a little noisy and hard to use at times. The location isn't super central but we knew this when we booked and so didn't mind the 10 minute walk to Grand Central. Overall, a great stay, but if the hotel is trying to market itself for leisure as well as business travel (which its prominence on Expedia tends to suggest), staff need to be trained accordingly.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This is a nice hotel. Rooms have great beds, refrigerator, hand held shower and great views of the river. Downside: Location. A good walk from the theater district, Times Square and Central Park. One other BIG pain: There are no ice or vending machines. You have to call room service every time you want ice- and for me, that's at least twice per day.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed on very high floor and had wonderful views of NYC. Rooms were large, but everything is VERY expensive, and parking is absolutely outrageously expensive. For some reason, despite being a very large hotel, they had only one person on duty during both check in and check out, which made what should have been a 60-second task take more than 10 minutes.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I've stayed in a lot of hotels in NY, and this one is without doubt the best one yet. We were on 37th floor with a spectacular view of the river. The staff were great and the room was spacious and really well appointed. Good amenities, even had English Breakfast tea with the coffee selection.Only downside, we had a room with an adjoining door and it was a little noisy when the next door guests got up early.Location was good, a short walk of a couple of blocks and we were at Grand Central Station with a lovely view of the Chrysler Building on the way. We even managed to fathom the buses and from 2nd Street managed to get a bus all the way to south to the Financial District.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed in the city on a Saturday night after seeing a show on Broadway. Rooms were very clean. Try and get a room high up (we were on the 35th floor) the view is great. Disapointed after waiting for the consigner for 15 minutes and no one could tell me when they would be back. And we arrived before check-in and waited 15 more minutes for the man to check our bags and waited another 10 minutes for him to retrieve them after we returned for them. But all in all it was clean, nice, close enough to the attractions we needed. We would return and recommend

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: One UN New York is a good hotel. The location is a bit far away from tourist attractions, which is good if you're in New York on business. Rooms are nice and clean, but nothing special. I didn't use the restaurant, so can't comment. There's a cafe downstairs, which serves very good coffee. I'd use One UN New York again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel was clean, classy, great location, renovated rooms, and AWESOME shower head- wanted to stay in the shower forever. The elevators were prompt, front desk staff very friendly, and didn't mind the sniffing canines for security :). There were only two issues I had, first, I booked the room through Priceline who charged my credit card immediately (as they always do). Upon checking in, standard procedure of obtaining my credit card was done by front desk staff, however now that I am home, the hotel has charged me for the room as well. This is strange to me because the front desk staff specifically asked me what website I booked the room through and I said Priceline. Not sure why I have been charged twice for one room, and nobody is really giving me a response. Any help would be appreciated if there is a manager who can contact me. Secondly, we dealt with a very sweet Bell man for most of our trip, however the day we checked out someone we had not seen before who insisted before he could check our bags he needed a tip. He repeated himself 3-4 times before we understood that he would not take our bags until we gave him money. We would have tipped regardless for his services but it was discouraging how he would not take our bags until we gave him money. Not sure if the management team knows about this.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Justin at the Front Desk, took very good care of us. Excellent Customer Service, just went above and beyond with helping us out. The hotel had an excellent view of Queens. Will always stay at this hotel when I visit New York.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This is a wonderful hotel to stay at. Rooms are a great size, clean and have quite a bit of amenities. Beautiful city view, friendly and helpful staff. We have found our home away from home in New York. We ate at the Ambassador Grill for lunch in the hotel and Amado and Gordon gave us supreme service, we felt like royalty. It was so good that we are going back for breakfast !!!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Great location within 15 min walk of grand central station but quiet location with great views of the east river, downtown NY, Empire State and Chrysler buildings. Room very comfortable and service good and unobtrusive. Coffee shop a great place for s morning coffee - staff friendly, good service. Service and food at the Ambassador grill was superb.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Beautiful room with fantastic view of the river behind the United Nations. The Hotel was great for us as attendees of the United Nations, it was a quick two minute walk across the street to the United Nations. The Staff were very helpful and kept us calm during the winter storm.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Recently spent one night at this hotel. In spite of a few issues, I would still classify this hotel as very good. When we arrived, there were about six people waiting to check in, and nobody behind the desk. It took about fifteen minutes before someone appeared. Complimentary wifi did not work at all. The room was large and clean, and the hotel is on a nice, quiet street. Location is convenient for all NY attractions. The bar is attractive and comfortable, with typically high New York hotel prices.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We were greeted by Justin at the front desk who could not have been more accommodating and gracious. Opposite of everyone else in NYC. Rooms were modern, clean and spacious. Price was so reasonable for NYC. Would recommend the hotel to anyone!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I got such a good deal on this hotel that I couldn't pass it up. It's on 1st ave and 44 street so a little out of the way from midtown but better than staying in the wall street area. Room was small but it fit two pp fine. Bathroom looks like it was renovated and very nice. Carpet needs to be replaced. Nice service and hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Hotel close if on business at the UN. Room on 38th floor - great view of River, Roosevelt Island and looking out onto Long Island concierge team extremely helpful. Room facilities disappointing. Housekeeping slow and unresponsive. Range of toiletries very basic. Clean. Provides coffee maker in room but not good for tea or hot water. Asked for a kettle (or team-maker) which was eventually provided the following day once reminded. No cream/milk pots provided. Clean mugs not provided for 2 day. Close to local restaurants. Hotel restaurant not suited to vegetarians or those who need gluten free options.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The room was well furnished with a large closet and nice bathroom. The beds were comfortable enough. There was little noise insulation from the corridors and the cleaning staff were very noisy, you won't be getting a lie in past 8am. The cleaning also seemed erratic - sometimes they made the bed, other times not; they might replace the cups and coffee supplies or they might not. Strange. When we arrived in the room we had to call down to have someone come up and finish the cleaning job - we had dirty mugs and an unemptied bin. In terms of location, its out of the way from major tourist attractions and for a leisure break you'd do better to go further uptown.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I recommend this hotel. 5 stars!!!Everything was amazing at this place! Especially the Manager Ms. Melvita and Kazi in the Sky Lounge. Their service was excellent, they went above and beyond. Our room was amazing, we loved the view. The security was great! Definitely will stay many more times in the future.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Clean airy room and is Well kept in all comments omunal areas. Has good restaurant facilities and lounge area with indoor cafeteria and snack facilities. Within walking distance from some of the central sites. Staff very helpful and available for advice and social information.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: stayed here for a few nights over NYE, was my first trip ever to NYC and was amazing.After going through a particularly bad relationship and horrible break up in the fall I was excited to finally see the city that never sleeps. Had issues w my Canadian credit card at c/i, but was my banks faults not FD. The agents and I had a good laugh about it and even when I switched payment 24 hours later and got back my$200 usd cash deposit they were very friendly about it as I was apologizing profusely as the typical Canadian. NYPD at front doors at all times which made me feel very safe and K9 unit w adorable GS dog which they let me pet each time I went by. All staff and NYC'ers very helpful as I was extremely scared about wandering around by myself in a huge city. The view of the financial district from my room was incredible, and the bed and huge shower were great to rest in after a day of sight seeing.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I stayed with my friends at this hotel for about 4 days. We had came for the UN CSW61 conference. The close proximity to the UN was the reason I chose this hotel. The price was reasonable. The hotel rooms and service were better than I expected. The rooms were very clean. The space was large. The staff was great. They were always helpful.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Since I was attending the UN on business this hotel couldn’t have been more convenient as it is quite literally right across the street. I enjoyed my stay and will more than likely return to the hotel in the future. What stood out most to me was the courtesy and professionalism of the staff. People seemed genuinely interested in making sure guests needs and questions were taken care of and, for the most part, with a genuine smile. My room (a corner room on the 37th floor of the “West Tower”) was clean and comfortable and appeared to have recently been renovated. The large bathroom was well equipped and mostly functional. The amenities were of high quality. In the hallway there were a couple of closets and a small refrigerator. Although there was a warning sign on the fridge noting that it was meant for mini-bar use and placement of personal items in the fridge would incur a $50 charge, it was apparent that there hadn’t been an automated mini-bar system in use for some time so I took the risk and placed my own items in the fridge – and there was no charge when I checked out.The work desk was large and functional. I brought my own internet cable so I can’t speak to the quality of the wireless connection. The hard-wired internet speed was great throughout my stay.The bed was comfortable but, for some reason, the sheets didn’t fit and stopped a couple of inches short of the end of the mattress. It was a minor annoyance but it did bug me so I essentially remade the bed each day to adjust the sheet depth… I’m just strange like that.The view from the room was great, with the UN building in the foreground, the East River and Brooklyn in the distance.There were two issues I had with the room that others may find are no big deal but… Firstly the noise from the room next door. The corner room I was in seemed to be able to be a connecting room to the room next door. The connecting door was not sound proofed at all and I could pretty much hear every conversation the guest next door had, which made me aware that they could hear any conversation I had as well. I found this distracting to say the least. I don’t know that the guest next door was particularly loud but that didn’t seem to matter. This may only be the case in regards to connecting rooms (because of the door) and may not be an issue for other rooms in the hotel so it shouldn’t necessarily be a deal breaker.Secondly, the heating/cooling system in the room did not function too well for me. There is a touch screen panel on the wall with a pleasant display that provides a series of buttons to control the temperature for cooling and for heating as well as a means of controlling the fan speed. I went through all sorts of combinations to try and get a sensible setting for the room (it was reasonably cold in the city during my stay with intermittent snow and rain). I found that, when I tried to set a given heating temperature and fan speed the system would simply stare back at me for several minutes until I walked away from it. It’s possible it was shy or simply slow to respond but it was frustrating. Also, the “Current Temperature display setting for the room never varied from 73 degrees Fahrenheit, despite the room being obviously either much warmer or colder that than. I managed to get it to either get very warm by setting the Heat way up (77 degrees) or very cold by switching to “Cold” and setting the temp way down (69 degrees) but it was a challenge. Finally, I really want to find a place where I can set the fan on low or medium continuously when I am in the room for some background noise and also set the temperature for the room. It seems you can have one or the other, but rarely both.I had breakfast and dinner at the Ambassador Grille restaurant and enjoyed all meals there as well as the excellent service from the staff. I can heartily recommend a meal there whenever the restaurant is open. I also used the “Grab and Go” café many times for various coffees, fresh fruit and other small items. The staff there were also great and I have nothing but praise for the service and the food/drink there as well.The issues I experienced were minor and wouldn’t stop me from trying the hotel again but if they persisted it might put me off in time.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Thank you so much to the front desk staff for the upgrade . It was my kids first trip to NYC and the first room we booked was a complete dump. This hotel not only met our expectations, it exceeded them. I have stayed all over the city and this hotel absolutely has one of the the best views of the city !! Our room had panoramic views of the city on one side and the east river on the other . My only issue was the length of time for the valet to retrieve my vehicle .

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Everything about this hotel was great. The price was reasonable (found a deal on the website). The staff was wonderful. I had to change the room type and the front desk was happy to help. We had a beautiful view of the river. Room was very nice and a good size. Location was good. We ended up walking to the theater district and found some great restaurants and bars nearby. Easy access to grand central. I will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Lovely stay in a big, big town. We found the location of this hotel near the UN headquarter just perfect. You can walk to many interesting places and the wiew from our room was outstanding... and you can also play tennis or take a swim high up in the hotel, very nice...

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Onthe wseekend the UN area is pretty quiet. We stayed here overnight and then went to Brooklyn to watch the half marathon. The rooms were fairly spartan but the service and price were exceptonal. There was a weekend rate that made a lot of sense. The convenience of the midtown location also made sense.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I asked for a Tower room w/a great view, and it exceeded my request. Phenomenal view, top floor, and the amenities in room were state of the art. Auto heated bathroom, upon entry, control panels for the entire suite, in each room. Immaculately kept, & maintained.Staff was excellent, very professional, and made our stay outstanding.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: It was a vacation to NYC for two nights Friday and Saturday but since it wasn't a school night the next morning we spent another night here.This hotel is older but the loony is veary nice and we did not know what we were getting for a room we asked if we could at least have the rooms on the stem floor you could tell the guy had a frown on his face I feeel bad that you won't be together so I will make a deal with you I'll put you in this 800 dollar 2 bedroom suite for 600 dollars we accepted and when we walk through the door we thought it would just be a rage but know it a veary fancy room with tech awesome views of water and sky scraps a king size bed and a queen size bed and both bedrooms had bathrooms but if wasn't so darn expensive I come here every time to stay

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Recently visited NYC for the first time this past February and had the great pleasure of staying at the suburb One UN New York hotel on East 44th Street. Conveniently located in Midtown East, across from the United Nations Headquarters, One UN is great choice for those looking for an affordable and first class hotel without sacrificing many of the amenities found with high end five-star hotels. The rooms are well appointed and cozy with very comfortable beds and nice furnishings. The bathroom, while on the small side is well equipped and modern. Although I had requested a high floor room with a view of the city, the room that I eventually received instead wasn't that bad of alternate choice (a room on the 30th floor facing the East River and Long Island). Room Service was a bit pricey but the food was tasty and wonderful especially the New York style Cheese Cake. There is a small mini fridge in the room but with no drinks or food inside. A safe is provided for secure placement of personal items and money. Staff were incredible friendly, gracious and helpful. Maid service was especially good and responsive. Catching cabs from the hotel was very easy as they were generally parked in front of the hotel waiting. Walking to Times Square took only 25 minutes by foot with the surrounding area full of restaurants, cafes and other shops. I would highly and enthusiastically recommend One UN New York to anyone visiting or staying in Manhattan. It is a decent hotel with great amenities and excellent customer service. Won't hesitate to stay there again next time I'm in NYC!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This was my second stay at the One UN New York, and it was just as nice as the first time. The first time I booked the room using Priceline's "Name Your Own Price" feature, and so did not know what hotel I was getting until my offer was accepted. This time I booked directly through the hotel's own website, because I knew I wanted to stay here again.The first time I stayed, I had a room on the top floor with an astonishing view of the East River and Long Island City. This time I stayed two floors below, with a similar fantastic view. The first time I stayed, the room was tranquility itself, and I didn't hear a sound from outside the room. I am very happy to say that two floors down, the same peace and quiet prevailed.After I caught my breath from looking at the fabulous view, I began to notice other features of the room. First of all, the room size is large, and easily accommodates a king sized bed with bedside tables on either side, two chaise lounges piled with pillows which flank the large window, a caramel colored leather wingback chair, a sleek desk with an office chair, a pole lamp, and a small round table. The furnishings are sleek and there is no art on the walls, but with the view of the river, art would have been superfluous. The room color is a calming taupe but the accent wall is a deep cinnamon, which gives the room warmth. The room is well lit, and each person has their own reading light. All lights can be controlled by a small panel set into the wall which also controls the room temperature. The TV is wall mounted over the desk and offers Netflix.The room had plenty of closet space with both shelves and hangers. A small room safe is also provided. Opposite the closets is a small coffee bar area with an empty mini fridge below it. Although (thankfully) empty, the interior of the fridge is still cool enough to store snacks. There is a coffee maker, with a supply of Illy Café and two nice sized mugs. Tea is also supplied, however to my dismay, there is no electric kettle. However, the tea provided is from the Parisian firm of Dammann Freres, which makes wonderful teas.The bathroom is a dream. The walls and floors are covered in a travertine inspired tile. The quartz vanity offers plenty of space to work. The water glasses are beautifully decorated with a swirl pattern, and are definitely not your standard hotel drinking glass. Underneath the counter is a shelf that is great for storing personal items, thus clearing the counter above. The modern toilet is by Duralit. The faucets in the walk-in shower are by Grohe, and include both a hand-held shower and a rain shower. The drain on the side works perfectly and is out of the way so you don't have to step on it. Also provided were two comfortable bath robes.As noted by other reviewers, the hotel is very close to the U.N., and is quiet. However, it is only about a six minute walk from Grand Central Station, and so convenient to the subway. About 2 blocks up from the hotel at 3rd. Ave. and E44th Street is a Pain Quotidian, one of my favorite chain restaurants, serving organic and very delicious food.All of the staff at the hotel were very friendly and gracious from the moment when I arrived until the day I left. I did have one small problem with housekeeping, which was quickly remedied when I notified the night manager of it. All in all, the staff were smiling, friendly, cheerful and accommodating.The next time I come to New York, I will definitely want to return to the One UN New York.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The United Nations Plaza hotel is a bit special. The grand entrance with its marble, stainless steel and glass interior appears dark when walking in from the street but when your eyes become accustomed to the myriad reflections and skilful lighting you feel like you are permanently in a Rolls Royce interior. The staff are polite and efficient, even the housekeeping teams keep a discreet distance and there are no unsightly trolleys abandoned in corridors for hours at an end. All employees said good morning and the internal coffee outlet barristers were a delight. Plenty of waiting space in the lounge although the bar was a bit on the pricey side.The corner room we occupied on the 31st floor was amazing with dual aspect views over the East River and the United Nations Building. Leaving the drapes open we woke to New York waking up and lazy river traffic ploughing through the still grey water. The bed was amongst the most comfortable I have ever spent a night in and the bathroom beautifully appointed. The floor at our corner of the building was very quiet and once the corridor door was closed we were totally isolated from the world outside. We felt pampered and spoilt and stress free. Well done guys.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This is a handy hotel if you come to meetings in the UN. Its also comfortable and the prices can go from reasonable to very expensive. I got one of the corner rooms which have a weird shape. I suggest you ask not to get one of those and stick to the rectangular standard configuration. There is a practical coffee place at the reception (an independent business) which is really handy for a grab and take. Definitively NOT a romantic hotel. Its pure business.
user_name:
afranco
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The hotel is directly besides the United Nations Building. The area is relatively quiet, which also means that there are not so many restaurants and bars as in other areas of Manhattan. The hotel is not new, but the rooms are relatively modern. The bathrooms are great and the rooms are very well equipped. All the rooms are above the 30th floor, therefore you have great views from the rooms either over Midtown or over the East River. I would recommend to take a Corner King Size Room, as this provides you great views over both.I can highly recommend the hotel and would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: One UN has a very nice location where one can move to many places in New York city on foot. The rooms facing the East River have a great view and that is what I enjoyed the most during my stay. Rooms are nice and comfortable and room service is quite efficient. Too bad the package arranged by my company with the hotel didn't include a complementary breakfast.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We just went to explore the city for one night. When we got to the hotel the check in people were very nice and we got in our room. I could tell my husband was upset about the view. He wanted to be on the other side of the building overlooking the Empire state building. He thought he would call and see if we could possibly move. I heard him on the phone say specifically "we would like to see if there is a same priced room on the other side of the building" They were very accommodating and said that we could come down and exchange keys. When we got to the new room we were surprised because it was bigger and had the awesome view we wanted. When we got back and checked our bank account we saw there was another charge from this hotel for $50!! There was no mention of an upcharge and we clearly stated we wanted the same price room over the phone. We just thought it was really great customer service for giving us this upgrade and we wouldn't have moved had we known there was an extra charge. I'm sorry but that is just wrong to charge someone without consent. The room was nice and the bed was very comfortable. I really liked it other than that, which is in my book a reason not to come here again. Being honest with the customer is more important.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This was my first stay here and it won't be my last.Everything was great, from the reception staff, to the housekeeping and the friendly guy replenishing the coffee.The room was quite big and comfortable.The location is great, a short walk to Great Central Station and a nice walk to Broadway or even Central Park.I will stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: So didn't know what to expect but was very pleasantly surprised. Stayed for two nights and had a very nicely renovated room with nice views of the water. The bathroom was a little tight but it worked. The beds are super comfortable. One note, they do not like people congregating in the lobby and asked us to be quieter. If you have questions about the city, check with the doorman, he was awesome with directions. Restaurants close by as well. The UN was not in session so my rate was very low for New York.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We had a magical weekend at the One UN Plaza Hotel. The first night we arrived late, so we stayed in the East Tower, despite being promised a West Tower room. But we totally understood, because we arrived at nearly 10:00 pm on a Friday night. The staff was super pleasant and said they try and find us a West Tower room for Saturday night. We pitched this to our son saying "this way you get to see BOTH views -- East Tower river view tonight and West Tower city view tomorrow. Both rooms were great. The West Tower with the renovated rooms and city views are incredible! Our room had a main control panel for heat and lights (and much more I believe). Our son had a blast "controlling" the lights from switches all over the room. Huge bathroom. Three reach in closets! And the view of the Empire State Building - wow! So we stayed in two rooms. The East Tower has river views. Both rooms were quiet. The staff was exceptionally courteous. Everyone we encountered was very nice, so gracious. We had a great time.
user_name:
DGK_2012
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: A friend was having a birthday in Manhattan and even though my boyfriend and I work in the city and live in Jersey, we decided to stay in the city to have a mini staycation after the birthday dinner. We checked in at around midnight and Justin who checked us in was very funny and engaging. He got us checked in quickly and upgraded us to a duplex suite! It was so fabulous and truly made our stay amazing! The room was really cool and it was so convenient having two floors since I'm an early bird and my significant other wanted to sleep in. I had fun in the living room while he stayed in bed. The other great thing was that the suite had two full bathrooms, one on each floor. So I was able to shower and hang out without disturbing my partner. The only negative was that we had to go home! What an amazing experience! Thank you to Justin for helping to curate such an amazing stay! We hope to see you again and that the hotel understands how your warm and cheery demeanor (even with a late night check in) made our stay so inviting and memorable! 5 Stars!!!!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: What can I say.....I read the reviews and they were mixed before we went, which made me a little nervous; But I have to say this was honestly an awesome hotel.The staff were incredibly courteous and they even upgraded us to a corner room on the 39th floor. Views of both the city skyline and the river. Guys you did us proud. It was a special occasion for the wife and I and the staff really looked after us.Rooms are big and beds very comfortable. Bathroom is huge and all the facilities you would hope for.I Would highly recommend this hotel and if you can, ask for a city view.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The best feature of this hotel is the view you will enjoy from your room. Room was ûber clean and staff very friendly. Beds are confortable and room is spacious. Hotel is located a short walk away from Central Station, as well as other attractions. Located in a quiet neighborhood, but still close enough to catch the great vibe (and a show) at Time square! Would stay here again!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed here from 28/12/16-04/01/17. We had a great time. Reception were great and helped us with any questions we had. Very modern. Our room was not what we had requested and paid for but it was fine. The bathroom was a little unclean with dried in shower gel which was a bit off putting but didn't let these things ruin our trip. The room came with a hairdryer which I was pleased with as my hairdryer didn't work when I was over there. Room also came with a fridge and a safe which you got for free so that was great. The hotel had arranged their private car to take us to the airport when we left which was helpful and only cost a little bit more than what you would have paid for a taxi.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed a few days during a business trip, the room was clean and spacious, and had wonderful views of NYC, the bed was comfortable too. The service was friendly and courteous at the entrance and lobby.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I had attempted to post a review of the One UN in early November, but it looks like it didn't go through. So will try again. We found this hotel to be a terrific East Side option (we had to be on the upper East Side for an event and were then flying out of LaGuardia, so the location for us was excellent). We had a completely renovated room on a high floor with an amazing view of the East RIver.There is a Starbucks-like coffee stand in the lobby, which is super convenient in the mornings.The gym is serviceable, but could use an update. A special shout out to the doormen at this hotel,they are awesome.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I was a bit hesitant, having booked the room via an internet special, but wow, the room and especially the view was exactly what I'd want in an upscale New York City hotel, but at a reasonable price.Big, comfy room, big shower, pretty quiet. Really quite pleased, it's not close to where I normally stay, but my sister was in town for a meeting at the UN and I was in town for something else, but I'd consider making the hike next time just to have such a classy room.The only thing I would fault them for is listing "Pool" on their website, but the pool's been closed for 5 years.
user_name:
Tacman1123
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Went to Check in sept 17 . Had already paid in july for me and my husband's 10 year wedding anniversary. ...... long line to check in then when finally greeted by sumg unhelpful staff that litterly gave me the middle finger when I asked to speak to a manger! A manger named erica came just awful customer service skills horrible manger, (I would name her supervisor but she gave me a middle funger from the back office and refused to speak w me or give a name!!!). She informed me (keep in mind its 345 pm check in is 300pm) that somone was still in our room and wouldn't leave!! they told me and my husband that they would have to get the police, to eject him! Now this was told to me after a friece complant from me at the front desk to speak to the highest manger because they would not tell us what was going on and we had to be somewhere at 7pm !!! When the higher manger wouldn't come out from the back I said you have horrable customer service skills and are just plain bad with ppl. I then was comfroted with secerty over 30 minutes after this while still waiting for them to get our room ready*( because they didn't know a man wouldnt leave our room* security men apporcaed me with erica a mean horrable manger who because I told her and supior who wouldn't comne out to speak to me but fliped me off from the back!!! I was being told they would kbow throw me out of a hotel I had been waiting over 2 hours to get my room on a ten year wedding anniversary** after my husband took over with that the security men said they were sorry then helped us 2 our room... the room had great view but that was it we didnt get in till 6 pm!!!!.. for the price 500 dollars a night was no worth it. On top of it I get a town car from the hotle and it dosent picck us up that night and I paid 75 bucks cash thar they are sending in a check when I had cab recite and recite from the purchase! !! Horrable just horrable I cried because of this hotel and I stay all over nyc . No place has ever been so awful. With customer service snd rooms and just knowing what rooms have checked out and whats going on in ur hotel. Pool closed gym dirty no restraunt hardly a bar.. so they advertise lies!!!! & to top it alloff the money put down on security for the 2 nights over 500 dollars four daus after check out ot went in my bank and thwn they took it from my bank agian 4 days after check out. They blew me off when I called... so I had to call my bank to dispute this horrable theft of money!!!!! Awful just awful outdated and expensive snd they cant even run their hotel. Awful . They runied my 10 annversary . Made me cry and then agrued with me and tried to blame me horrable ppl! Horrable place liars and theifts!! Stay away go to london hotel or the strand or the Gotham!!!! I give this place a negitive 100
user_name:
Megan T
Long Beach, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We recently stayed at the One UN and had a great experience. We are a family of 4 and had requested a room with 2 beds. I guess they didn't have any left when we arrived so they upgraded us to a suite. The room was huge. ! Very clean, beds were comfortable, everything was great.The staff were friendly, and attentive. Location was good, a bit tucked away but within a short walking distance to Grand Central, Empire State building, etc.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: It was a pleasure to stay here. Whenever I come back to NY I will stay here. The food was amazing, the rooms were more comfortable than imaginable. The security of three bomb sniffing dogs made my mind at peace constantly. The staff treated us like family, and were most sincere. I love this hotel. Thank you so much for upholding the highest of standards for me and my family.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The room was a little small, but had a nice view of the East River. My neighbors had some loud moments, but I didn't complain. Also, we found a dirty coffee mug with lipstick stain in the room, but it was quickly replaced by housekeeping. Lastly, I felt like the shower wasn't hot enough. I know it sounds crazy, but after a long day and being in the cold, a nice hot shower would feel good. However, overall I would stay again. It's not far from Grand Central Terminal, taxis are usually immediately available, and the concierge and staff are VERY helpful. I didn't get a chance to eat at the restaurants, but the coffee shop was good (a little pricey) and the baristas were very nice. The hotel is also near a few restaurants and convenience stores. The decor in the lobby looks great also.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My husband and I have been staying at this hotel since it was a Park Hyatt run property. Checking in at different intervals in a 25 year span. We recently stayed from December 26-29, 2016. We got a terriffic special. The hotel has recently been refurbished and they did a wonderful job of it. I have never gotten a room with a bad view. Of course my favorite rooms are the corner rooms which offer even more spectacular panoramas. The pool is being redone as well as the steam rooms. This is probably the only Manhattan hotel with tennis courts. The service is wonderful, rooms are spacious and clean. Baths are tastefully refurbished and practical.Added security which kind of threw me back is that before you even enter the hotel there is a security dog that sniffs your bags. A great idea as the hotel is across the street from the UN and several lower floors are leased to long term diplomats. Very safe, quiet hotel in a lovely neighborhood. Walking distance to 5th Ave shopping and Grand Central station. This is not one of those impersonal convention mega hotels, it feels more like a boutique hotel without the added price tag. Will continue to stay here. Staff is friendly. The cleaning staff can sometimes be a bit noisy in the mornings. This was the only negative. Guess since we were not on business we would sleep in and the staff would bang doors or would speak in a loud voice amongst co workers. That never happened when it was a Park Hyatt, this I noticed when Hilton took over.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Excellent rooms with incredible views! Both the river views and street views are breathtaking. The location is also convenient. The prices are reasonable and they even provide special sales in January. Absolutely love it and will come back again!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We had a great time at this hotel me and My partner! We booked this hotel because of the view and the panoramic view But we got just a normal window so It was not like the pictures where showing but the rooms where big and Nice so No complain about that! We stayed for 5 nights and it was awesome, the rooms are really clean and people at the reception was very nice! We want to give Barry (the guy in the reception) a big star! He was really nice, funny and helped us out every time we needed something! But.. the girls in the reception was not that friendly and seemed like they where in bad Mood all the time and every day so please girls be a little more happy some times! But we are werry pleasant with our stay at the One UN and the staff at the hotel are extremly friendly!!Thank you everyone you made our first trip to America great!Best wishes from the cupple who did not have any lugage our whole visit!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: i still can't believe how much i got this room for last minute on nye. such a great deal! though my boyfriend and i didn't do really anything exciting, the property was really nice. right by the water and the UN. great for a late night stroll to get some fresh air. the room was a bit on the smaller side, but the bed was TO DIE for. so comfortable, we wanted to take it home if we could lol. the front desk staff was average. nothing special, but not bad either. the doormen and concierge that stand around in the front lobby were great and friendly though. there's also a K-9 unit at all times it seems. they let you pet the dog!was able to get an early check-in (around 11am?) which took less than 2 minutes probably. check out took about 5 seconds, which was great. overall, we weren't looking for a crazy nye night like most other people would have wanted. it was perfect was a relaxing night with just the two of us ringing in the new year :)
user_name:
breakfastf00d
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Spectacular location right across from UN. View of East River, Flags at UN HQ and NY bridges at night awesome. Great for family or business. Good for access to all the bustle of Times Square then great retreat when you need peaceful vibe Wife and 2 daughters loved it. Staff was very helpful even took the time to help me order in pizza from great local spot for my 5 year old daughter. Thanks Linda. Stayed one night. Will be back.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed in the West Tower, had a lovely quiet room, facing west so i could see the city lights. The staff were all wonderful except the one bellman (the foodie guy) who everyone recommends to ask about 'where to eat'. He is a bit of a bully to other staff and maybe you- watch out! Stick with the internet for food recommendations and not him- he will send you to places that pay him, and demand a tip for everything ( i know better... but he really pushed to go to his resto versus the one i was asking about). The gym has a lovely view of the river- except all the cardio equipment was 'out of service' except one bike the entire week (which is fine, as one can run to central park if you leave early enough) but the lack of working machines seems to be normal when i asked around.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The week between Christmas and New Year has become a time for tourists to descend on New York City. One UN is the place to escape the holiday crowds yet stay close to the pulse beat of the city that never sleeps. Outstanding accommodations comfortable beds and even heated toilet seats make this little known jewel of a hotel a wonderful choice. An excellent coffee shop and full service dining in the Ambassador Grill make you want to extend your stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We were a little concerned about the location being far away from Times Square but we could not have been more wrong. The hotel is just far enough to get away from all the business and noise but you can walk to Grand Central and Times Square or take a short cab ride. You can have a view of the river or the city it's right across from the United Nations and the security is awesome. Fantastic spacious room with a huge bathroom and awesome view of the Empire State Building, The Chrysler building and the New World Trade Tower. We have not stayed in a nicer hotel in NYC most even the 4-5 star hotels have small rooms and the ones in Times Square can be very noisy. The staff are wonderful and extremely accommodating and friendly. 5 stars all around. We will definitely go back. Thanks to Racquell for helping us with a wonderful room, the concierge for helping us choose a sightseeing trip, the night manager for helping us with beverages etc, and the front desk staff for all of their help.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed here after Christmas as our family Christmas gift. We booked a room with two double beds for the two of us and our adult Son. Be warned, these double beds are actually about the size of a twin. Was tough sleeping two in one bed. Tip 2, this place shows a beautiful pool on the 28th floor overlooking the skyline, NO POOL!!! When we asked about it after going up and seeing an empty pool with construction debris scattered everywhere, we were practically laughed at by two separate staff who told us they haven't opened the pool in two years. Rude and condescending. Barry at the front desk was especially rude to our adult Son and felt the need to lecture him about the qualities of being humble.... unacceptable.Tip 3, DO NOT pay extra to access the skyline lounge. What a joke, canned beer, cheap wine and a cheese plate. We have definitely had better experiences for this price in NYC. Ask questions before you book here and don't forget to be humble....what a joke

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We recently spent the weekend here while visiting the city. We took our car and had a little bit of a struggle to identify the area to pull over to check in. Once we found it, we were quickly checked in and escorted to our room on the 40th floor. Million dollar view of the Queensboro bridge and Brooklyn. Staff was great, doormen, bellmen, concierge and the front desk staff. Nice midtown location, walking distance to Grand central station, and lots of nearby dining options. Square toilet was a first for us in my days. Nice clean comfortable room, away from the noise and nicely updated! Nice work here folks. Well done!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: When I found this hotel online, I was just looking for something in midtown with a decent price for a night. I came across One UN and wasn't exactly sure it was a hotel there from the looks of the building. Looks completely like an office building and threw me off when I was going there. There are two towers with different views. I recommend trying to stay in the West tower with views of the City. After I arrived, we walked in the door and it was odd to have a dog sniff my lady's bag but we thought it was funny. I was immediately greeted by Justin who was ultra helpful. My lady had reserved a room for two others who was accompanying us. While my lady went to another person to help, Justin asked me about our reservations and wanted to help get us on the same floor in the same tower. I requested a high floor in the West tower and was initially going to go to the 38th floor. My lady returned with our guests room number and it was in the East Tower on the 19th floor. So Justin sprang into action to help us out after my lady realized the difference. We upgraded to a 2 story/2 room suite on the 29th floor that was amazing. We had 180degree views of Midtown, Lower Manhattan, and Brooklyn. The room was modern and cozy and one of the best rooms I've ever stayed in. Justin was just as awesome with recommending things to do in the area and being there if we needed anything. I also stopped by just to chat with him while he worked overnight. The crew I was with totally enjoyed our visit and our stay and my lady now says that she don't want to stay anywhere else in NYC after staying at One UN NY! I totally recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The room was spacious, well appointed, and very comfortable. I got a corner room with a nice city view. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. I bought the room as a four (4) star hotel. In my opinion, and based on my experience in New York, this should be a 4.5 star hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Arrived at the hotel and check into room very quickly and easy with friendly staff,Our room was on the 38th Floor (3816) Absolutely stunning huge rooms, modern and beautifully decorated with a fantastic corner view of the East River and lower Manhattan, The bed as very comfortable, the hotel gym is on the 27th Floor which is very good and if you like tennis the court is on the 39th Floor. The hotel is located in Midtown East and is very close to all the attractions only about 15 minute walk from Time Square.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: 25 years of traveling to NYC, first time I have stayed at 1 UN. This was a very nice updated hotel. Very comfortable and good size rooms with décor similar to a W but better. Very quiet and out of the way for NYC. The big downside of this hotel was that at both check in and check out only 1 person was working the desk and there were considerable delays on both ends. That needs to be worked on.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Absolutely stunning huge rooms, modern and beautifully decorated. However, was concerned about the air circulation. Could not find a switch to monitor heat, cooling or air flow. When I asked at the reception desk the following morning, I was told I could open the window up to an inch. This shocked me, as my room was located on the 35th floor. What about air pressure and safety issues? The owners of this hotel need to invest some serious money in renovating or installing an air supply system to filter, cool or heat the air all the guests are breathing in.
user_name:
Linda D
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: From the moment we walked in the door this hotel has the WOW factor. Check in was quick and efficient, staff very helpful and nice to see good security procedures in place. The rooms were amazing and the bed the most comfortable I have ever slept in. I could live in this bedroom forever!The views were spectacular, you could never tire of gazing out of the window. It was very central to all amenities and places of interest. The noise level was also good considering we were in the heart of midtown Manhatten. Wouldn't hesitate to come back to this hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Just got back from this hotel, excellent location, service was excellent. Room was spacious and comfortable. When i had a WIFI problem they changed my room immediately. Would definately go back to this hotel.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I was not here on business, we were the typical tourist so for us (me and 14 year old daughter) the hotel was a little our of the way. However the hotel itself was superb - Comfy beds, nice pillows, good shower etc.. A lovely coffee bar in reception. Our first room was on the 35th floor with amazing views and large bed with additional sofa, but the room had not been cleaned well, and the previous guest had left dirty used razor, tooth brush and other bits in the bathroom, clearly housekeeping in this room was not good. The reception staff moved us immediately however to the 30th floor, smaller room and the view was partially limited so we was a little disappointed with the room change. The last night of our stay the heating made terrible noises all night and the bathroom sink blocked. I did tell reception upon check out who were a little "unfriendly" - That's why I have only given it 4 stars. The Reception staff upon arrival were much better, and very welcoming to us (Barry I think his name was). on the whole this was a great hotel and if I got a good deal I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Its a pricey place and really not that accessible if you are doing the regular touristy stuff in NYC ... but you must stay in this place just for the views from the window. I guess it is an obvious choice if you are visiting the UN. If you are visiting for other reasons, know that you will be taking the cab almost always. The hotel is well designed with modern amenities and without having to go through the usual NYC choice of having to "open your bathroom door or your closet door; you cannot do both" I wish the front office staff were trained to be a little more friendly, I could swear that the front desk person was disappointed that we were not some hot shot and could barely make eye contact.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel for business but this time I was here primarily to get Married ! We booked a corner room which was on the 31st floor and the City views are breathtaking day & night when you are in the room. The rooms are spacious and the beds are perfect for deep sleep under comfy down comforters. The staff & service are very friendly & professional every time I have stayed here but on this trip they went above & beyond the standard of Excellence . The front office manager Monique arranged for us to book the Presidential Suite at a reasonable rate for 2 hours for our Wedding Ceremony which is an incredible room of elegance & views of the City from all angles . We truly felt on top of the world as we got Married with dynamic views of the City in the backdrop. Another manager helped with wedding prep of the Bride which was platinum service and we are so thankful for the good people of this hotel. From the bellman to the room maids everyone on staff was so gracious and helpful which makes the hotel guests very happy as well. We met people from London and a French couple while in the hotel and there is a great vibe of international chic while staying here. The hotel is in a quiet part of NYC so there is not a lot of traffic when you venture out to the streets. There are great neighborhoods close by for walking & when you need to wind down after 5pm the skyline room has complimentary sushi, hors d'oeuvres beer/wine/sodas with TVs and great city views for happy hour. Our stay here was truly magical and we will never forget it !

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Quite good location..hotel very worn and rather depressing in colours..reception area nice enough. Comfortable beds and overall pretty clean. Asked to change rooms as ended up visiting with a friend so wanted a twin bedded room this request was met but was placed in an room that was adjoining and had extremely noisy neighbours..asked to be moved again which was fine and done immediately although with great disdain from the young receptionist. Downsides of this place was extremely unfriendly staff..with the exception of a couple of the concierges and one reception member the rest were downright rude not even responding to us when we said good morning to them as we left or returned at night..we deliberately went out of our way after noticing this saying good morning good evening just to try and get responses and were continally ignored. We checked out early as had early flight next morning so decided to stay near airport...the same receptionist didnt question why we were leaving early..didnt ask if everything had been good during our stay not even a goodbye just checked everything was paid for said you owe nothing and that was it...New york was amazing and it didnt spoil our stay in this great city but my next visit i will choose somewhere else a bit more welcoming and friendly.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We stayed for 4 nights from 3rd Dec and had a wonderful stay. I cannot recommend this place anymore highly. We have not been to New York before but can't imagine anywhere nicer to stay. We had a beautiful corner room on the 39th floor with the most stunning panoramic views of both the city and Hudson River. One window looking directly out to the Empire State Building and the Chrysler building.. breathtaking views! The staff arranged a cheeseboard and bottle of wine in the room for our anniversary.. which was a lovely & unexpected gesture- thank you! Everything was wonderful.. the staff so friendly and helpful, rooms were clean, modern and spacious. The breakfast was delicious. I thought it was very reasonably priced too. Thank you for a wonderful stay! And to anyone considering booking this hotel - do, you won't be disappointed!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Yes, as the previous reviewers pointed out there were a few shortcomings with this hotel. I was really worried as to how my 3-night staying would be like when I could not find anybody who could help me to bring 5 suitcases from the taxi into the narrow entrance door under pouring rain. The elevators looked a bit antiquated and the corridor to the room reminded me of a university dorm's. Entering the room, all the worries were instantly wiped out. The room was large, quiet, functional and comfortable with a stunning view over East River. After all, the hotel staff were friendly, professional and very caring. It turned out to be a memorable and pleasant stay. The hotel is definitely one of the best options in NYC if you want to have a large quiet room with a view.
user_name:
Garagan_MJ
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Looked long and hard for a good hotel for a two day visit to New York with another couple. We ho often but wanted something special for a friend's birthday.We booked online straight from the hotel about two months in advance and got a good rate for New York. Upon entry, the lobby is terrific -- modern and beautiful and the check in was easy, well-managed and smooth.At the last minute we had an additional person join us, and they accommodated us easily with a change-- two queens instead of a king.The room is lovely-- Cityview, modern, up-to-date, lovely furniture nice bath, gorgeous shower, bathrobes, flatscreen TV and desk area, leather chairs, comfortable beds. This is a very secure location because it's close to the UN. You can feel comfortable and safe at this hotel. It is on the east side near 44th so it's a bit of a walk to time square or uptown to Rockefeller Center.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This was the second leg of a long business trip. I was exhausted when I arrived at the One UN. I had searched a lot of hotels and found a good price for the 6 nights I would be in New York. I reserved a king corner room in the east building. When I opened the door to my room on the 34th floor all the travel dust and previous business headaches disappeared. The sun was setting and I had windows on two sides of the room. It was a jaw dropping view. The river the Empire State building and the Chrysler Building were right there lit up and beautiful against a beautiful sunset kissed sky. I never closed the curtains during my stay.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: I checked into the ONE UN late on a Thursday evening and found the check-in process and lobby to be functional and satisfactory. They have bomb sniffing dogs there to check each bag (due to the UN across the street) but the dogs were cute and non-threatening so I didn't mind it at all. The views are certainly spectacular as advertised. Easily the best views I've had in my many trips to New York City. I just wish the windows were larger so you could really enjoy the views. The hotel has been updated but the structure is dated with short skimpy windows that restrict your ability to really take in what is a breathtaking view. Similarly the ceiling heights are on the short side too. Bed was comfortable and the room was lit well enough. I really think the hotel overall was good for the price I paid (by NYC standards). Certainly nothing special. The hotel is about a 7 minute walk to Grand Central, which is the closest Subway station. But from there you can get anywhere in the 5 boroughs.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed in a great room with an awesome view. Was very easy to check-in after a day at the office and leave early the next morning. Everyone was helpful and friendly, and the hotel itself was very safe. Highly recommended and would absolutely stay here again!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: My partner and I stayed here 17-21 Nov and wow what can I say! Such a wonderful hotel with amazing staff who were always happy to help in anyway they could!Justin on the front desk was especially helpful upgrading us to what was the best room I have stayed in with an amazing view of both the Empire State and Chrysler buildings coming back to this room each night after a jam packed day was just the icing on the cake so Justin thank you!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel is great for Business trips to New York. Erica, the Manager is great at customer service and really makes me and the team feel valued as returning visitors!Location is within easy reach of midtowm and grand central. Rooms are clean, spacious and comfortable.The staff are great, especially Frank at the bell desk. Such a lovely guy!!

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Justin at the front desk was patient and helpful with a reservation mix-up, and was also gracious in allowing late check -out. The bell staff were excellent with directions and advice. The hotel is clean, convenient and quiet. I have been to NYC many times and this is the first time I got any sleep! Most are extremely noisy. I have stayed at much more expensive hotels, but the location right beside the UN is quiet, offering an easy walk to everything, including subways. The views are amazing! The lobby is a bit dated, and the decor needs a bit of updating but the room was spotless. Would stay again for sure.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Stayed here for one night on a business trip. I had a room on floor 38 and had a view of both the Hudson River and the Empire State Building. This was the best view at a NYC hotel that I've stayed in. I love that it's in a less busy neighborhood and also very easy to leave the hotel and get to LaGuardia. I would absolutely stay here again.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: This hotel is very nice, the room I received is like a spa. The room is spacious, the bathroom is huge (that spa feeling) and it's very quiet. O and I had a perfect view of the Hudson River (it's really beautiful at night). This hotel is one of the safest hotel because it"s actually linked to the UN Embassy which is highly full of security so I had no problem staying here at all. If you like to walk it's about a 20 min walk to Times Square (also depend on how fast of a walker you are). The employees there are great too, they'll help you any way they can.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: Good value for NYC , and a good spot for getting around this city a few block from Grand Central but not in the centre of the crowds , good size rooms , tv, safe , ironing board and wifi . Staff helpful at all times ask for a river view

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: The room was awesome with great views. This also has to be one of the safest hotels in the city which was very reassuring. would definitely stay here again when we come back. Close walk to everything and we booked last minute and the price was super reasonable compared to much smaller rooms we have stayed in in the past. The first night the room next to us was very loud and inconsiderate, they had security at their door in a matter of minutes which was very much appreciated. Parking was also very reasonable.

hotel_name: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
review_body: We traveled there to participate in the annual Rotary-UN Day. This hotel is located one block from the entrance to the UN, so was quite convenient. It is also within walking distance of Union Station, and several good restaurants. The staff was very friendly, and the room was quite spacious, especially for NYC standards. From our window we could see the Chrysler building, the Empire State building, and the new World Trade Center.
